review_content: A faint vetiver and marigold which I don’t fancy opened the scent up. Then an even fainter tea note appeared before the entire scent disappeared from my skin completely. Then an even scent didn’t last ten minutes on my skin but remained faintly woody on clothing after twenty four hours. The vetiver was nice as a note but anything beyond marigold was just gone before any feeling could be felt. This coming from two sprays which is the norm I set for testing was just pathetic. A real shame coming from a luxury line from the house that created my favorite amber scent.

burberry summer
(why are there years missing?

summer going into autumn so cooling off.
about 5 sprays to inner elbow - the tester was a bit stuffed but i got a reasonable amount out.

lovely green floral
gently zingy - not sour, not sharp, but a little angular and crisp.
one thought came to mind as Oscar de la Renta Flor seems and feels like its similar to this - that one is much zingier in a limey bright zing way, burberry summer is toned down.

i prefer this to my burberry blush which i have tried recently (that one was a bit too similar to others i either have at the time or have tried, not a bad scent tho)

ok sillage - its not loud, ive had a good three hours with it and it lingers on fabric well.

Fan of all things Burberry. This one is a light, green floral I ❤ for daytime casual wear. Perhaps a better spring/summer scent, it is a floral fragrance I'd wear year round, due to the abundance of woody aromas. It doesn't' last very long and can really spray the stuff on without offending. It is a beautiful blend of green, white flowers, wood and musk, with a slight punch of juicy pomegranate.
I'm not a fan of this. Anyone want to swap or buy this from me?
A citrusy rose musky fragrance and I agree about the skittles note. I don’t think it’s brilliant and it’s nothing that stands out but I wear it occasionally. Staying power isn’t great.
This smells like sweet lemon Skittles or Starburst. Not my cup of tea, but I can see the appeal

This is a soapy powdery smell on me. Nice enough.
Clean.
This smells exactly like pomelo. At first it starts with fruity floral then develops to pomelo and orange peel. I'm not impressed.

A nice, spicy floriental! A friend gave this to me because she wasn't a fan, but I really quite like the subtle sweetness behind this, and the added woody notes. I find that although Burberry are not always at the top of my list of favourite perfumes, I always find their fragrances strange and compelling. The combination of orange and musk in this is pleasant, alongside the pomegranate. I don't find it as distinctive as a lot of other perfumes though, and as genny17 said it's a 'safe' scent that is nice but not overly memorable. It also doesn't last too long, but the scent itself is an interesting warm-floral fragrance.

Mainly I get pomegranate from this.
To me it is sweet, fresh fragrance. Good for warm weather.

To me it smells like fresh, sweet plastic. But i still like it.
My male friends say it smells like straight up rasberries, and they seem to love it so... not a favorite for summer but i'll wear it. :)

I must admit I like it although I was a bit sceptical because the idea of flankers annoys me a little. This has absolutely nothing to do with the original Burberry except the bottle. It's bursting with cheerful floral freshness and is a great, light and safe choice for the hot summer days. The bottle is in perfect harmony with its content - the smell of pink, definitely. It is also a good one for very young girls.

Lots of freesia. There was also a hint of LOTV but that was gone in a few minutes. Sort of watery vibe that dries down to soapy musk. Longevity - so-so.

EDIT: Wanted to add that there's also a detectable unisex/masculine note in it, possibly the cedar.
More rose than anything!
I have a love for Burberry perfumes but unfortunately not for this one. It's nothing special, the scent is barrely there and wears of really fast. It's just boring.
A lovely blend of roses and musk...very very feminine. This is for all floral lovers bt others can have a go with it.
Nice but no longevtiy on my skin :-(

This one is so not worth the money! It smells to simple, more like just lemon juice and disappears in short time. My first choice of fragrances usually is Burberry, but this one, really not worth the name.

@tropic sugar, I think you did a great review. I have dry skin as well and the notes come off the same as you've stated on my skin as well. The original Burberry was too strong for me, so I ended up getting rid of it. However, I think this a great scent that I can actually wear.
Yuck, this is a mash of different citrusy scents that don't work for me.
I really wanted to like this one, but the lilly of the valley note would overpower the citrus for me, and id rather have the citrus stand out. Perfect, im sure for someone else.

I have to say that I love this fragrance!I was shopping one day at Younkers department store and saw this at the fragrance counter so I sprayed this on and went on my way.This is so pretty.I usually like more heavy amber and tropical fragrances but lately I have been craving fresh and airy scents and have been looking for a more natural fragrance to add to my collection.This is very natural smelling for a summer scent no strong alcohol smell at all.On my skin I smell pomegranate, lily of the valley,freesia and a soft woody base.If I could pick one word to describe this scent I would say fruit sorbet.It is cool and airy and the citrus smell stays all the way through the drydown.The woodsy notes are soft but noticable.I have dry skin and the 2 squirts I sprayed on my wrist lasted a good 6 hours.This is not going to be a silliage monster but if you did 4 squirts on the neck and a couple squirts on the inside of the arms people would smell you as you walked by.This will be fabulous for humid hot days and nights as there is something romantic and elegant about it as well.I think soft flowers,italian fruity ice or fruit sorbet with a touch of green and soft woods.The bottle is so pretty as pink is one of my favourite colors.This will not make you feel sick as it is very natural smelling.If you had to pick one fragrance for summer I would say this is the best summer fragrance I've smelled so far.Men will love this as well as they tend to like soft clean smells on a women.Pair this with a cute floral sundress and some gladiator sandals and you will get admiring glances and you wont kill everyone with a strong overbearing fragrance on a hot summer day.This is fruit sherbet in a bottle!LOVE IT!

This has the word “garden” written all over it. Smelling it straight out of the bottle it smells like the tomato plants in my garden, very green with a hint of bitterness. After it’s sprayed I get a strong hit of Lily of the Valley -a transport back to my grandmother’s garden. I thought maybe the floral would be too strong for my liking, but then after about half an hour, it really lightened up; almost too much. I keep pressing my nose to my wrist to drink in my summer garden. The lasting power is not good on me, so I don’t think I’ll purchase, but I think it’s really nice. They really managed to bottle nature with this one!

Very aptly named as it is a perfect scent for summer.

It's light, it has a lovely freshness and ever so sweet and faintly floral. It is really pretty while being a wee little bit woodsy. It has a watery freshness to it that I really like.

It is perfect for an inoffensive scent. It doesn't project much at all.

Longevity is 3 hours - if that. Great summertime scent you can wear for anything. Spraying clothes and using an unscented lotion helps it last longer. I still have to bathe in it quite a bit because it just doesn't last. It will be perfect for HOT months when you want something refreshing, lightly sweet and floral.


I will have to buy multiple bottles as it is a limited ed only.


If you like Eclat d'Arpege -- you will like this!! If you like Issey Miyake Eau d'Issey -- you will like this!!

I was able to get a sniff of this Friday when I went to Dillards. I was expecting a sweet fragrance for teens, but was pleasantly surprised by the tart citrus/woodsy scent. It's very earthy, musky, and crisp at first and then drys down to a powdery/woody scent. It reminds me of a hot summer day down here in the South; the name fits it perfectly.

Too bad it's only a limited edition, I could see myself wearing this year around.

This is nice, I tried it today, it is vibrant, not too fruity, but honestly I can hardly remember the smell, other than it smells pleasant. A safe scent,, nice, would make a pretty gift for the summer, I detected soft floral notes , and a warmer base.
sounds amasing! :D i love burberry fragances
i've had this one for a long while, but it never really grew on me. to me it always had a drying wall paint smell to it. i think it has some nice notes to it, but i decided to get rid of the bottle.
I am really loving this scent now, after having it for four years! BS Summer 2010 is a great warm weather fragrance.
by far the best male cologne out there i have ever smelled it wa unique i so miss it

Here's another one of my weekend, workout, and early morning errand running fragrances. The smell of Burberry Summer (2010 edition) is synonymous with freshness.

Overall Rating: 5 stars

I received a spray sample of this from Lana Lool (Thanks friend!) and though I love the 2009 version of Burberry Men Summer, this one is VERY similar. The only thing I can see (sniff) that is different about it is that it has no apple, and has dyer's greenweed added, which gives it a sharp slightly green vegetal edge.

This (on the first spray) is amazingly citric with the mandarin's slight sweetness and yuzu's bright juicy sparkliness. As the top notes evaporate, there is still a "citrusy" feel there; but it DOES get more green with mint, juniper and the greenweed. There is an odd sweetness lingering just behind the light (white) woodiness. The drydown "sounds" somewhat oriental, but to me it is just ever so slightly warm and smooth, and accents the top and heart in a clean and refreshing way, while not overpowering them . This is an excellent scent for hot and humid days, and would make any citrus and green lover very happy; and it is done in typical Burberry style. This scent is the olfactive equivalent of swimtrunks and a cool crisp white tank-top. Like a warm green summer wind, the sun on your face and your toes in the sand. Citrusy, aromatic and quite well-done, but I did not (and am not going to) run out and buy a bottle. I WILL, however, enjoy the sprayer sent to me this summer...and should I happen to see it in a discount store for a great price would buy it, as I love the whole Burberry line of perfumes.

Sillage: good
Longevity: average
Overall: 3.5/5

I think Burberry is thinking along the lines of "if it isn't broken, then don't fix it" and this is very nice and only slightly different (less fruity/more citric) than the last year's version. It is a lighter fresher alternative to Burberry Men: brighter and more "summery"; but at the risk of sounding like a "snob"...there are better summer scents out there. It does the "job" by keeping things fun and light though, while still managing to say SUMMER, and projects rather well! The longevity of citrus is often a problem, but the greens and aromatics keep the "fun in the sun" vibe going.

1. Mixture of little bitter and sweet citrus.
2. Non-Offencive
3. Make you feel your surroundings refreshing.
4. Good for office wear.
5. Day time wearing is best.
22-Apr-2011

I have got plenty of good comments plus I have gotta loving this refreshing smell. Can't say about other occasions but its perfect for office wear and in summer ofcourse.
02-Jun-2011

I got a sample of Burberry Summer for Men 2010, and was really impressed with the scent. It has a really fresh, laid back, almost "lime" scent to me. I know lime isn't in the notes, but that's what I seem to get. It's not a bitter citrus scent, but more of a sweet, and greenish fresh scent. I found a 100 ml. bottle for a good price at a discounter while in NYC recently and picked it up for about $30. Overall, I am still enjoying it, but my one complaint is longevity. This is a VERY short lived fragrance. (even more so than most fresh/summer scents). It's literally gone after about 30 min. to an hour. I would recommend spraying this one on your clothes to extend the scent, as it goes away quickly on the skin. Other than needing to reapply very often, it's a really nice, light summer scent.

I tried this one in the store yesterday. Well, very nice and clean. Much better than many modern aquatics. Nevertheless, it does not stand out very much and I am not persuaded to buy it, unless I find it for a really good price. If you need something really fresh for casual / office use, consider this one.

I had an opportunity to pick up an unopened mini bottle of this recently. I very much enjoy the 1995 Burberry for Men and thought I'd give this a shot. There's definitely some continuity between the two versions. I don't get the mint nearly as strongly in this 1981 version (hard to say whether it would have smelled differently 40-odd years ago), and the lavender, musk, and amber hit me much more heavily in this 1981 release than in the 1995, but the resemblance is there.

To me, this smells like a man in the 80s who spends his time wearing a suit (sans jacket, much of the time) sitting in a well broken-in oxblood leather executive chair at a solidly constructed, dark-stained black walnut or mahogany desk in an office with vertical wood paneling. He might be an executive type. He might be a crime boss. The office, chair, and desk may or may not be his - I won't ask questions, he smells like he probably belongs there, one way or another.

I find the 1995 release light, fresh, versatile, and well suited to daytime use in both casual and formal settings - very work appropriate, but just as easily worn with a t-shirt and nice jeans. This 1981 release is, by comparison, much darker, heavier, and, if you're not in the 1980s and the kind of person who sits in the office I describe above, probably best suited to nighttime use, or use in non-work contexts - perhaps a classy cigar lounge, or maybe a not-so-classy strip club (to give two extreme examples).

I like this a lot, but I can't really think of how or where I'd wear it in my life / with my lifestyle. I'll hold onto it anyway, just in case I happen to find myself headed somewhere this would make sense to wear.

For nostalgia's sake and a rare treat of this sort: I recently scored a full bottle of this, which appeared to be in good shape - even including the box and insert that describes the whole line of products.

It smells almost like I remember, but not quite exactly. That's okay given how much time has passed.

It DOES however, smell like a close cousin of my bottle of Gres Homme (1996). The Gres is greener and being an EDT, is stronger. But the two could be flankers smelling them side by side, with some slight divergence in the later drydown.

About the strength. This is an EDC but it's an EDC like Aramis. It packs a wallop!

Burberrys is absolutely worth searching for if you're a fan of this kind of scent. If no success, Gres Homme (1996) would be a great alternative.

Was it Keat's "soft-dying day" or Yeat's "October twilight" that was preferred by this man in his walks in the Autumn sunset? Did he wear an Ivy cap to really warm his head or to appear well-read? Is he always cultural and clean or secretly damaged and sometimes mean? So many questions, so few answers at the "other end of the telescope" as Elvis Costello sang.

He wore Burberrys for Men, redolent with marjoram, that one herb that is the question mark among exclamation points. Mild and sweet, much like his demeanor, like spearmint-scented oak wood, more intensified when the herb is dry, much like his sense of humor. Its smell reminds me of a walk in the Vermont woods, when you can almost smell the fauna among the flora, the smell of warm sheep's pelt, and then tang of juniper berries can be made out among the lash of mugwort bushes.

It simmers down to a soft round patchouli awash in musk, firmly planted in the twilight comfort of a leather base. It is a welcome relief from the strain of dialectics, as this man takes off his cap and undoes a couple buttons of his Oxford shirt to just feel comfortable in his own human vulnerability for a while.

This gem was only on the market for about ten years, subsequently replaced by an entirely different Burberrys for Men in 1991. Sadly, it's become quite scarce and is therefore a treasure in my collection. For those who may want to seek a similar sensibility, there is also the lovely original (not new) version of Perry Ellis for Men cologne, which lies in the same vicinity.

An Executive´s scent of the early 80s. Sitting long office autumn days as a fairly succesful head of a top management organization in the construction business while dreaming of scenic golf rounds in Spain with fellow business collegues requires a scent that goes with a dynamic but mature international aspiring personality. Only a few perfumes can impersonate such an 80s character but this Burberrys for Men is one of a few. A top choice.

I concur with ismellfine -- this one's closest cousin is (the original) Perry Ellis For Men.

Pine and artemisia -- two of my favorite notes!

Bracingly masculine yet exceptionally elegant

For the price the vintage stuff fetches nowadays, maybe I should just stick to (the original) Perry Ellis For Men.

I was fortunate to score a NIB mini bottle. This stuff is amazing. Old school 80s: rich, dark and mossy. Performance is excellent. Scent reminds me of V.S.O.P. and Brownstone by Paul Sebastian (both almost as hard to find as this original Burberrys). Honestly, if you already have one of those two PS fragrances, you should be all set. UPDATE: just found and purchased a 2 ounce EDC bottle!!

So I'm writing this review because I find myself gravitating towards vintage men's fragrance. I find the 70s and 80s men's fragrances to be the most well-blended and having a depth that has been missing in men's colognes for a long time now. Burberry the original 1981 version I was able to acquire and I must say the first thing that caught my attention was the true seamless, masterful blending and superior ingredients. This cologne starts off as one might expect with that dated Macho old man smell. I don't mean in a grandpa sort of way but definitely vintage. However within 30 minutes it settles in to a warm rich smooth sent that indeed is all man. I find it very sexy yet calming. I would think this performs best in cooler climate and vintage or gated or whatever you want to call it there is no mistaking that it is a masterpiece. If you've ever had the pleasure of smelling Perry Ellis signature from 1985 you might think these two were cut from the same cloth. The similarity between the two is really interchangeable between the apapa max in Perry Ellis and the murderer in Burberry. Make no mistake although it might be an investment to acquire a bottle of Burberry the original it is so worth it. Is it something I will wear everyday know. Is it something I will wear frequently? Absolutely! It's very hard to come across these days but even if you can only score a miniature version I say go for it because these vintage fragrances like this are we coming harder and harder if not impossible to find these days and it is well worth having in a collection and certainly a true pleasure to wear as well.

I had been on a quest for this classic. Back in the 80s, someone gave me a gift pack that included stick deo; shower gel, and generous-sized bottle (probably after shave; I wasn't paying that much attention back then). But OMG, I never forgot the rustic, yet sophisticated/animal-magnetic sense from the original Burberrys. I just got my hands on 2 oz. of EDT from Ebay. It was in a plastic bottle, authentic to how this classic was packaged over 35 years ago. It is the fragrance that I remember, although there has probably been some "shifting in transit", given all the time that has past (not claiming an expert schnazzola). It did take my sense of scent back in time, nonetheless. I wonder if there is anything else really close to this fragrance, being that I'll tear through 2 oz. pretty fast, and I ponied up for what I have.

Impression: conifer, but not pine, fir, or spruce; dry and just a little sweet, with a peppery hint, and good staying power.
Finally got a bottle and what do you know, it’s actually a chypre!!! Full review coming soon on the front page under the First Fragrances category ;-)

I remember when I was about 11 years old, walking in the department store with my folks after church on a Sunday afternoon in the winter. A pretty lady asked me if I wanted a sample of this new cologne. It was the best smelling men's cologne I had ever experienced up to that point and to this day I remember how good it was. I held on to that little towelette sample as long as I could, careful to fold the pouch it came in to tuck in all the fragrance. That thing lasted about a year or more, stashed away in the upper drawer of my dresser.

I never forgot it.

I have owned and smelled lots of amazing fragrances since then (including a couple from Burberry), but very few made an impression on me like Burberrys did. I am sure nostalgia and the pretty lady made an impact, as well ... but this was just a great symphony of notes, period. My young nose knew it then and my old-ish nose knows it now.

Thankyou perfumecritic for making sense of this confusion. I knew the bottle in the main picture wasn't the one I was looking for. The Burberrys for Men that I wore and loved from the early 1980s was the vertical oblong bottle (as per the picture on the right). I haven't seen it for a long time. It was very popular and is yet another much lamented absentee (Ted Lapidus PH and Charles Jourdan un Homme).

Update 9th May 2015.
If like me you came to this site looking for information on the much loved 1981 original, then check out M Generation by Mauboussin. Some resemblance unless my memory is playing tricks on me.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
All im getting right now is a very dry 80's leather vibe. I hope it does something soon or else its just like a lot of other masculines from the past. Good in a sense but not my style.
I had this back in the 80'. I like to use a masculine scent now and then and this was one of my favorites. I actually got a lot of compliments from men when I wore this scent!

I had this fragrance way back in 90s and believe me i loved it. I was so fond of it that i sprayed 100 ml within few months due to tons of compliments each time i wore. It was a compliment getter, a genuine masculin aroma which use to entice every sniffer around you. Unfortunately dont find it anymore, think it is discontinued.
I had this fragrance long time back before its one of the best Burberry perfume. Whis to find 100ml .

In 1981 there was a fragrance called Burberry's for men. In 1991 Burberry's launched Society for women and a companion fragrance also titled Burberry's for Men which was not the same composition as the original 1981 version, nor was it the product shown on the Society for men page, a fragrance which was launched by a different company using the same name once Society for women was no longer in production.

And if all of this wasn't confusing enough, in 1995 after the apparent failure of Society for women and the 1981 & 1991 versions of Burberry's for men, the company launched another set of fragrances with the exact same name, "Burberry's", however this time the word London appeared underneath the company's moniker. Of the three versions from 1981, 1991 and 1995, the 1995 product is the only one still in production. This is now sometimes referred to as Burberry's London for men, which is even more crazily misleading because Burberry's did indeed launch a Burberry's London for men just a few years back. These two fragrances have totally different bottles and totally different compositions.

When fragrance licenses expire and change hands we consumers witness all of this confusing naming business. Both Versace and Dior have suffered from the same problem with numerous fragrances launched at different times with slightly different compositions, or even wildly different compositions, but quite similar or exactly the same names.

This review is for the bottle pictured above. I can see the comparison to Tiffany for Men, though not as much to Chanel pour Homme Concentree. Here the myrrh/vanillic quality is obvious, as is the vanilla in the Tiffany, but the patchouli is much less obvious. Perhaps it is closest to Caron's Third Man, though (that one is a bit more cloying than the Burberry, which is more herbal than Third Man). What I think I like most about this one is how there is great contrast between the aromatic elements and the sweet, syrupy oriental one. Spice seems to connect the two and prevent an irritating clash from occurring. There is also a kind of woody background hum which supplies some "structure." This is the kind of scent that recent designer attempts seem to fail miserably at, and my guess is that lack of ingredient quality is the key problem (though in some cases there is another issue, such as being overly sweet). Of course some don't perceive the "synthetic" qualities of them, but that also means they probably can't appreciate the richness and depth of scents like this one. This is really well balanced and should be ranked very highly, IMO, even when compared against other vintage greats !

UPDATE: If you can't afford this one or just can't find it, I suggest trying Mesmerize for men by Avon. No, I don't think it's exactly the same or that the ingredient quality or blending is as good but it may be close enough for you, all things considered. Heritage is another in the same general range as this one.

UPDATE #2: I have now tried the "original," from 1981. Apparently, the bottle (and formulation) pictured above is from around 1991/1992. In any case, the 1981 formulation smells a great deal like Vetiver de Puig, though perhaps just a bit smoother. I'll just copy and paste the notes for Vetiver de Puig below and that will give you an idea of what to expect (it's dry, with strong lavender, sandalwood, and vetiver):


TOP:
galbanum
bergamot
aldehydes
lemon
artemesia
rosemary

MIDDLE:
lavender
carnation
cedar
patchouli
vetiver
cumin

BASE:
labdanum
moss
musk
tonka bean
very special, either you love it or hate it, had it in the 90´s.

This is a masterpiece.
One of those that makes you take another deep sniff.
Airy & deep at the same time,
sweet without being too sweet.
There is nothing like it.

Ought to be relaunched.

This is for EDT
Turns green egg scenty on me

A very clean, fresh, light, and effervescent fragrance. It has a very slightly soapy type of clean scent, but in a good way. It would be a great choice for at the office because it’s an inoffensive scent. It’s also a nice casual fragrance, so it’s great for daytime wear and anytime that you just want to smell/feel fresh and clean.

Burberry Britt Sheer reminds me somewhat of Clean Reserve Skin and Phlur Missing Person. They’re not the same, but they have a similar clean feel to them.

I tend to get really good longevity with my fragrances, and this is no exception… it lasts throughout the day on me. The projection is nice, it radiates out about an arm’s length from me.
citrus is very strong on me, floral a little more than i wouldve liked, but thats my own feeling on florals. really enjoy wearing it so far. VERY light. fresh. love it.
Sweet, slightly musky/cozy, subtle. Dare I say, sheer? Or perhaps a light, sheer, organza top with a light cashmere wrap for cool nights.

yuzu and pineapple, so fun! super fresh and lovely for springtime and summer. i'll be bringing this with me on vacation, it's just so uplifting and pretty. i definitely smell the peony in the dry down, which i love (i love peony). it's definitely not a perfume that'll last all day. wishing i got a little more of the lychee as that is one of my favorite scents, but on the whole, very satisfied with my blind buy from ross!

Fruity, fresh shampoo, but not to the extent of Marc Jacobs' Sorbet. It's a lot more clean and less offensive than that one.
I've been inadvertently complimented wearing this - my friends said they smelt something really nice, like someone had just showered. In fact, I did not take a shower, just wore this perfume. Was somewhat surprised they could even smell it, considering how quick this one fades. In the end, I didn't tell them I was the one wearing perfume (or had just showered), but I think they would've figured it out on their own anyways considering that people move to places.

I love clean bathroom, but a lot of perfumes actually turn slightly bitter on my skin. That makes this perfume smell slightly more mature and less 'generic shampoo/nice bathroom' on me :D
I just wish this had more lychee. I've been on a lychee hunt in perfume for a long time, but today's still not the day.

This perfume is very near and dear to my heart. It was my wedding scent. Fresh, feminine, and sweet. This was my signature scent when I was in my 20’s, and it started my love for perfumery. I still wear it on occasion, and I always get a compliment from my hubby.

This skews more fresh-watery on me, not quite shampoo or soapy. It's sort of a strange powdery/aquatic - but I love it! And I'm not a fan of powdery - it's maybe like they liquified elements of powdery plus the freshness of an indistinct ...hmm...sweetness. But overall, it's. very, very fresh, light, and clean smelling. Great work/every day perfrume. I just got myself a little rollerball and I'm going to get the full bottle so I can do larger spritzes. Lovely after a bath/shower. I feel refreshed wearing it.

I like all the notes listed, but I do not like this fragrance at all! I barely get any of the fruit, but instead there is some harsh, chemical smell. Maybe it's the citrus being a bit off. I am not sure. Very disappointed because I am looking for a nice lychee fragrance.
A great blind buy. Its soft, sweet, and sensual. Its always at a great price at tjmaxx or Ross.
Smells like soapy fresh laundry. So that’s what it is now. A perfume for my clothes and linens, not my skin. 4/10 :(

I am starting to question my ability to smell fruit notes after reading the reviews for this and realizing it's not my first time missing out on fruit scents that others notice. The comparison to shampoo is accurate. I would say this is bright, floral, and a little chemical. It's not for me, and also not unpleasant or overpowering. So there's that.

I'm learning there's more than one kind of soapy scent.

There's fragrances that smell like bar soap, vintage, French-milled, gentle. There's laundry detergent/freshener/softener smells. There's nondescript bathroom air freshener aromas. There's shampoo, which can be divided into further categories: men's, women's, children's, and dog shampoo. And then there's liquid hand soap, the kind that comes in the cheapy transparent pump bottle with the picture of the clownfish on the inside.

This one is smack between children's shampoo and clownfish hand soap. It's the sickly-fruity-sweet shampoo the popular girl in 5th grade wears, which her mother sometimes sneaks pumps of to remind herself of her own days as 5th grade popular girl. It's the generic fruity clean scent of their bathroom, with its Glade air freshener. And it's the smell of the unscented clear liquid Softsoap hand soap standing at their sink.

I've never smelled a more distinctly shampoo-like fragrance in my life, with more liquid-hand-soap nuances. I can practically taste the glycerin. The edible arrangement of nondescript tropical fruit notes is bang-on. The hint of quintessential early 2000s floral musk lingers in the air like a familiar old acquaintance taking up all the space in your bathroom with her five hundred bottles of hair products. If this came out today from some smaller niche house as a self-aware nostalgic scent with a name like "2007 Bathroom", I think people would buy it.

I don't understand why someone would want to smell this much like shampoo, but it's genuinely a cute, very clean, and inoffensive tropical fruity smell. The fruits and florals are all well-blended and pleasant. If you're unafraid of soapy scents and you like the notes and the clean bathroom vibe I've described, go for it.

Peony, Musk, and no vanilla (it makes it different from most of BBW peony compositions). For me to work it has to be mixed with some woody perfumes to make it last a bit longer. In my experience it very well layers with an old school vtg white musk from the body shop (some oak moss has them anchored) together. My advise is to only get it if it is extremely discounted since back than in 2007 it was produced under Interparfum well known for fleeting creations.

Starts off with a burst of sweet fruitiness - akin to a waft of your favourite shampoo.
Dry down is sickening, like a musty citrus deodorant...not for me.

As one could guess from the top notes, Burberry Brit Sheer opens sweet, bright, and juicy. However, its fruity notes don't dominate for long, and BBS soon transitions into a slightly dampened floral fragrance with bright, fruity supporting notes.

The peony and peach blossom have a pollen-heavy muskiness to them, that, when combined with the tropical top notes, give BBS a somewhat humid, rainforest vibe. However, as BBS’s fruity top notes fade, they take most of that tropical element with them, and BBS slowly morphs from tropical-fruity-floral-fresh to musky-soapy-floral-fresh.

BBS is feminine, generally youthful (but not immature), and fine for pretty much any girl or woman and any spring/summer occasion, barring very fancy formal events where it might feel a bit breezy and indifferent.

It's certainly nothing to sneer at, but in the end it feels a bit middling and average to me. But then I've never been one for "easy" fragrances, so YMMV.

Yes! Happy! Fresh! Feminine! Sunshine! Floral! Peonies everywhere! Just a few words that come to mind! This is my go-to Fresh Floral fragrance! It smells so fresh and clean and not overwhelming! This is definitely a signature scent of mine along with a similar choice, Chloe's Love Story Eau De Toilette. These fresh happy scents just make my mouth water! Bonus: I can aaaaaalways find this at Marshall's or TJ Maxx!

This is the original 2007 composition, I am not sure if the newest version is any different but based on my feelings for this bottle, I doubt I'll be testing it to see.
The bottle itself is gorgeous, and I'm sad to say that's the only thing I really like about it. This scent is inoffensive I suppose---I felt it opened kind of harsh and cleanser-like, but it's mostly a musky floral-fruity scent with not much personality once it dries down. It has absolutely nothing in common with the edt or edp of Burberry Brit--it's not really a 'sheer' version of those as there is no familial connection. If you like musky fruity florals with no personality, then this one is for you. Safe for office or classroom for sure.

I bought this perfume because I read that it is similar to bright crystal by Versace.
This perfume opens with a burst of juicy fruity notes (some citrus, pineapple, lychee) which, the first time I sprayed it, literally made me say 'wow'. For me, these fruity notes last only about an hour then it dries down to a soft powdery floral musk which is pretty unremarkable.
I think this is a nice subtle scent if you want to prolong that 'just out of the shower' freshness, and I will be using it in Summer or at the gym when I don't feel like wearing a strong fragrance.
This perfume is similar to bright crystal in that it is a light fruity floral, however I think Bright Crystal is superior.
Unfortunately this smells like a house cleaner to my nose. I do like the pineapple scent that comes through but I just can't get past the cleaner sharpness.
beautifully fresh, i smell grapefruit (yuzu + lychee?). summertime classic.

I bought a box of 5 Burberry sample sizes particularly because I wanted to smell this fragrance. I wanted to love it. Out of the bottle it smells very potent, and the citrus is very overwhelming feeling almost cheap. It dries down to a very synthetic, chemically smell. Not very pleasing almost clinical and cold. Maybe nice for beginners on very young women.
*UPDATE:
I decided to give this fragrance a 2nd try and On a rainy day outside it smelled delightful on me. While still being a bit chemical smelling, but juicy and a bit floral. it was sort of pleasing. IDK how to describe it. This is a bit fruity compared to other Burberry fragrances. It is definitely different. I'll update again on attempt 3.

I just dont like this. The citrus is overpowering, sharp & it comes across smelling like something you spray on your countertops to clean with. I think this is the only Burberry scent I have ever disliked.

Perfect clean and fresh out of the shower scent! Nothing absolutely special about it, but nothing bad neither... it's a good everyday scent that could not bother anyone... it's good, but not great if you see what i meen... I tryed this one because of it's comparaison to bright crystal wich I love, but except for the clean aspect, I personnaly dont think they are dupes... I prefer the sweet tarteness of bright crystal, but that just my taste
To me, the grapefruit smell is way too strong and makes it smell like a house cleaner. Wouldn’t suggest.

On first spray, it made me literally say "YES!" because it was perfectly fruity and pretty and sparkly, however after about 20 minutes, it smells like straight Clean Linen Lysol on my skin, almost masculine. I wish there were a way to keep that top note because it was amazing!

I love this scent when it's hot outside. It's very fruity and clean smelling and doesn't really slap anyone that might be in close proximity in the face-it radiates about arms length and very very lightly.

The opening for me is nothing but citrus and after an hour or so I get gentle peony and just a little lingering fruit but nothing complex. Very simple fragrance. Nothing seductive or multi-faceted to this one at all. It's all clean laundry and eating fruit on a hot summer day.

When it's very hot and humid here in Montreal and 35+degres outside, i find myself reaching for this one. Its not the kind of perfume that will totally blow your mind but Sheer is a fragrance that is simple,refreshing, soapy, clean and light that when its very hot outside, it suddently transforms into the "Mr Freeze" You want. Its great to have that option in your collection. Sometimes i mix it with My Burberry Blush, try it ! The two can easily be wear together, blush adds a little and gentle sweetness to Sheer. Either way, sheer by itself smells awsome in hot summertime days. There were times i almost get rid of it ...i'm glad i didn't!!

This is a pretty but very generic, fleeting scent. It has terrible longevity, lasting about 1 hour on my skin and pretty bad sillage, barely a skin scent after 20 minutes.

I'm don't know what you make of Burberry. They are a pretty bold, edgy brand but their scents are so meh.

I prefer this over the Brit Rhythm. Brit Sheer is so fresh and light and on me I smell mostly peony and musk notes in the opening and dry down. I smell very little of the citrus notes but perhaps my body chemistry doesn’t pick it up. Longevity and sillage is moderate for me. Such a beautiful floral scent that I would wear in the warmer months day and night. Love it!

I received Brit Sheer as a gift and after a quick test,I gave it to my sister.her signature is lanvin eclat arpege and Jesus del pozo Halloween kiss and she was looking for a new signature,something that belongs to the same league of delicate,super feminine,clean scents but with more fruity punch
Brit sheer was a love at first sniff for her.she loves cool scents(as opposite of warm),something bright,crisp,refreshing,youthful and uplifting and brit sheer is exactly mentioned things.I remember almost sour and sweet,mouth watering,fresh fruity notes,light and delicate florals and a hint of clean musk.
Versace bright crystal was my signature about ten years ago.I haven't tested it recently but from my memory,they belong to the same league but they don't smell similar.brit sheer is more sharp and fruity sour
My sister is satisfied with it's longevity but she says sillage is moderate at it's best.all in all considering it's price,it's a good choice for ladys who love refreshing summary fruityflorals
Reminds me of perfume I had as a girl. More interesting than Burberry...but still generic.
It’s a little busy. An exuberance of notes like an enthusiast jam session. Summery and cheery and flirty in a similar way to the other Burberry’s of my acquaintance

On me this old version opens more yummy in a fruity way. I feel litchi. It also seems to me more heavy than later done version, despite it's still light peony. And besides, this version seems to me less citrusy. This one is better, only maybe the last one is more fresh for the summer season. And only the later done reminds me Bright Crystal a little bit,it's not cool,because that fragrance is everywhere in summer.

I like this fragrance. It's fresh and nice. Only the lasting power is bad(

I like this. I don't think it smells anything like Bright Crystal. I don't smell the similarity at all. Also for a toilette, it has pretty amazing staying power on me and scents usually tend to fade on me pretty quickly. It's more sweet and floraly and has that Burberry undertone dry down to it. It's a really nice everyday scent. I don't get tart or crisp at all, more soft, sweet, floral.

I loved how this smelled on the tester paper. Before I buy a perfume, though, I usually try it on- so I spritzed this on and it did not disappoint! For me, it is very floral. I think my body chemistry burns off the citrus notes pretty quickly- but that's okay because I adore peony which is most intensive for me with this perfume and then just the right amount of musk and 'white wood' to keep it from being cloying. Sidenote- this is truly the only Burberry Scent that doesn't smell like a floor cleaner or acne medicine on me. Must be my chemistry but I have tried almost every scent of theirs and it just does not work for me- but this one has gotten me compliments.

It's very clean, and it's pretty the way early spring time is pretty. The way 9 year old girls are pretty, with their over sized teeth. It just doesn't offer enough interest, or refinement. Especially considering it's Burberry, I had higher expectations. After the initial display of bright and juicy top notes, Brit Sheer smells exactly like a pink Calgon body spray I convinced my mother to buy me when I started junior high. It smells like feeling very grown up and *thinking* I was wearing perfume. It smells like the beauty aisle at Walgreens.

I agree with the comparisons to Envy Me, though I like that one a little better and for a little longer than I do this (it has a longer lifespan on my skin).
the yuzu sings a sweet melody over a bouquet of peony,timelessly fresh
I had it long time ago. Fresh, sweet and feminine
I very fresh citrus that really lasts! I have never had a citrus scent last like this. amazing longevity!

Class in a bottle. I can see this fresh scent paired with a tweed suit. Dignified powdery essence married with subtle fresh fruit. Its crisp and it LASTS. Great projection, and not overwhelming. Perfect for autumn. A keeper.
Generic good soapy scent. I like it - but not really love it.

Generic fruity and woody scent. Has the same cedar/wood smell as Brit. Very short lasting on my skin only sticks around for about 3 hours and wears very close to the skin. It does have a nice woody freshness to it. I could see this being an easy grab and go type of summer fragrance for someone who doesn't mind having to reapply regularly.

A light little breeze of a fragrance. It's very linear. It's just fruity and not much else. The dry down has some very light wood, but it's almost non-existent.

Brit Sheer is pleasant and innocuous. It would be a good gateway scent for a tween girl. It's probably too simplistic for someone who really loves perfume.
Pleasant uplifting fruity sheer something, sweet pineapple and peony. That's literally it.

Wayyyy too light I smell an orange nottee but it's not fresh and pronounced maybe if it was I would love it. The orange note is covered in synthetic cloying high fructose corn syrup fake sugar... Overall, 4/10! Not caliber of Jo Malone orange blossom now that's fresh oranges with green leaves you picked from the tropics not Walmart oranges...that sat around for weeks...


Safe scent but nothing I'll run out and buy with all of my tax refund check only Mariah has it like that...from me to you Mimi you got it like that ;)! Ha

Clean
Green
Fresh
Floral - crisp
No sharp edges
Cool

Edt, not sure if lasting power just yet, will edit

when I wear this perfume I get lots of compliments )
very feminine and lovely scent
I do not really like the original Brit but this one is perfect for me. I had about 5 bottles and can't stop buying
I often use it during spring-summer period and for sunny days and cloudy april evenings it suits great.
the design of the bottle is also nice

Love this one in the spring and summer. It's one of my top three summer scents, actually. So much so that I have a 3.4oz backup bottle.
It's the light fresh girly quality that makes me happy. It isn't sugary or tart, and it's clean without being a white musk. I suppose it could come off as dryer sheet or laundry detergent to some, but I have to use unscented laundry products so have been saved from that association, yay for me.
Besides use as a personal fragrance, I also like to use this as a freshening spray on my bed between cleaning the sheets or in my closet.
Good stuff!

I used to wear this perfume in high school and would always get compliments on it when someone used to hug me. And that's really the only time someone would smell it...when they hug me.
This lasting power on this perfume isn't too bad (moderate) but only people that's standing super close to you can smell it.

It smells very "pink", fruity, girly, but also something interesting that's lingering in the background of this perfume!

I got it as a gift and enjoyed every drop of this perfume. It's worth a buy, but there are better perfumes out there that I would rather spend my money on than this!
Bright and fresh fruity fragrance. Happy, exotic scent for younger women to wear during spring and summer. In competition with Verace Bright Crystal, Burberry wins.

It's the only thing I can wear in this mad heat! And I'm slightly falling in love... of course it could be the madness talking caused by the heat - since there was a time I didn't think too highly of Brit Sheer. But all the that really matters at this point is that I really enjoy it.

I tested it in a store a few years ago, liked it enough, bought it a day later... and disliked it almost immediately. Something in it smelled like an air freshener to me, and I cannot stand it. A few weeks ago I thought I'd give it a second (fourth? Fifth maybe?) chance, and funnily enough the "air freshener" note has become unnoticeable. All I notice now is fresh juicy fruits (grapefruit???) mixed with cold "watery" (read: dewy) flowers (must be the peony coz there's some sharpness to it as well) on a clean musky-woody base. Nothing too special or memorable I guess, but still - I cannot deny the fact that I'm happy I found it again! Even if it's just a quick summer fling and nothing serious at all :)

I've been craving fresh florals lately, and I thought Brit Sheer would fit the bill. However, like LillyBunnyBoo (below), Brit Sheer made me feel sick immediately after spraying a tiny spritz on my wrist. It's very sweet and artificial, like concentrated kids shampoo. I tried to let it sit for a bit to see if the dry down would be worth it, but I had to scrub it quickly as a headache was coming on and my stomach turned every time I caught a whiff. I don't know why it made me feel so viscerally ill, but it did.
Beautiful scent, very fresh and femenine, love it.

This is an amazing fragrance for everyday wear. Very soft, yet interesting. I prefer to use it in the summertime, because I think it is more citrusy than floral. I finished a 100ml bottle, and I am already finishing my 30ml one.

I don't think this smells like Bright Crystal. It has a similar vibe, as in it's citrusy and clean, but Brit Sheer is less sharp, less aquatic, and more bitter, which makes it slightly more unisex. And most importantly, Brit Sheer smells less cheap. I believe its ingredients are of better quality. Bright Crystal has this weird deodorant-like sour musk that not only offends my nose, but also triggers a huge headache. I actually adore this scent. I find it similar to Victoria's Secret Bombshell, only perhaps less tart and a bit more bitter (perhaps this also contains the peel of some of the fruits).

I asked a lady that I don't know what was the name of her perfume she said it was this one, I might have looked creepy or whatever.. I just wanted to let her know that her perfume is so nice that a stranger would comment on it

You can not go wrong with this one. Perfect for warmer days or formal occasions where you must keep it simple but don't want to give up your perfume.
Very simple and clean perfume.

I finally bought this the other day! I've wanted this perfume for ages now but it's not exactly inexpensive! Thankfully, i found a new website that sell perfumes for next to nothing, so I got the 100mls of this for 37.50!!! It's so fresh smelling and so clean, girly and soft....just to name a few! Definitely worth the money

This was one of my everyday favorites for two years (in rotation with l'eau de Issey and J'adore).
But suddenly, and without warning, my closest friend started wearing it everyday!!!
Needless to say, I was upset, I don't share fragrances well..... I don't like to wear what other people around me are wearing. And no matter how much I love a scent, if one of my friends had a favorite/signature scent that they wear religiously, I won't even entertain the notion of wearing it (which is the reason I can't wear BBW' s Beautiful Day. :( )
So, I no longer wear this beauty. Unfortunate, because I loved the fresh, tart citrus smell. It has great longevity too, it lingered on my skin and clothing long afterwards.

Decent longevity for an EDT, and surprisingly unique in a sea of ultra-generic smelling Versace Bright Crystals and the like... Yes, it's another one of those sweet, fresh, fruity florals but there's that signature "oh, that's a burberry scent" note in there that makes it a touch more sophisticated than the others. Hard to hate, easy to wear. Perfect for these ridiculously humid summer days.

This is so yummy. Starts out cool, fresh grapefruit on me, I guess it's the yuzu. Then it settles into this really nice mashup of juicy fruits and peony. It lasts a good long time and winds up smelling like laundry detergent in the best kind of way.

What's really nice is that it's pretty and feminine but sits pretty close to the skin and is basically inoffensive. I can wear it to my job at a hospital no problem.

This one surprised me! For some reason I associate Burberry with stuck up snotty rich kids, therefore, I can't stand most of their fragrances! That being said, I actually really enjoyed this! It's girly, summery, flirty fun and soft! It would be something that would be amazing after having bath at night and curling up in bed to go to sleep in!! I would say this would be very well suited for office use, casual day time use...those types of occasions! The downfall would be the longevity, perhaps on others it lasts longer but on my skin it's gone within the hour, actually more like the half hour!

Very clean, fresh, "sheer" scent - it's a very "innocent girl" scent.

This is my daily go-to spring/summer scent when I'm just going about my daily tasks. It doesn't last very long on me - about 4 hours tops and that's being generous. The bottle is pretty easy to carry around though, so I don't mind it very much.

Oh my! Cassandra's review is spot on! I loved the fresh powdery (but not too powdery) citrus scent I had the first hour. But then I kept smelling playdoh with something I couldn't put my finger on. It IS sunscreen playdoh. I'm so disappointed!

When I first apply it, I get this fresh tangy and sweet mix of citrus and litchi, with a bit of floral, very girl, and fresh. It's pretty good, however, after it dries it has this disgusting smell of play dough sunscreen. I don;t know what and it's really disappointing because the initial scent smelled so good, but the dry down is just nauseating.

On me it had a very bitter citrus opening note. But once the bitterness faded it was a short-lived but nice little fresh and light fragrance. I could wear it in summertime and it wouldn't be overwhelming or cloying at all.

This is so weak that it only lasts for about 1.5-2.5 hr on me. I did not find any interesting notes in this EDT. It's just so normal and smelled like an unisex perfume for its Yuzu note perhaps. It's a fresh perfume and should be wore in summer instead of winter.

I bought a 50ml one many years ago after trying it on my wrist. The fresh and bright fruity notes had attracted me a lot. It has a similar base note with Marc Jacobs Daisy which was in my wishlist (and was on my another wrist at the same day I tried Brit Sheer).
Nowadays it still lasts less than 10ml in the bottle and it just dosen't come to me again to wear it. Maybe it's because I'm no longer a young girl like years ago to match the pure fruity fragrance. My taste changes. The scent becomes too "flat" to me now.

The citrus note comes on quickly and sharply, and almost sour, and there is a citronella character that is a bit overwhelming initially. There are hints of lychee and pineapple that don’t quite do enough to round it out. Very slowly, the white musk begins to emerge, and the dry down reminds me vividly of Revlon’s Fire & Ice, which I was obsessed with when I was 13 years old. On the blotter it dried down to an underripe mandarin. Certainly not a favourite, but I can understand the appeal.

This perfume is close to Gucci envy me (could be from litchi and pineapple) but without the spices and sexiness. The longevity is poor on me. Somehow, I still enjoy wearing this in-aggressive perfume, it gives me a happy mood for some reason.

Sheer versions of popular scents are usually done one of two ways: either they smell like a lighter "watered down" version of the original with perhaps a slight variation for interest OR they take the wearer on a completely different journey that often solidifies a time and season that the original and it's offspring are meant to be worn. Brit Sheer is the latter. Miles from it's mother scent, which I consider a chilly fall/winter creation, Sheer is a cirtus-pear base with a veil of summer peonies. Experiencing it blindly, Burberry would not necessarily come to mind, but it most definitely has some bitter refinement that makes it discernible from a fruity bath shop body spritz. The clean woodsy note gives the potential for some to get furniture cleaner from this scent if overdone, which is easy to do with light summer creations. But applied appropriately this is a happy and light addition to a strong and eclectic fragrance house and a sweet but slightly rebellious progeny of the classic Burberry Brit.
Fresh clean soapy girly

This reminds me of the original, loud and fun Escada perfumes like Taj Sunset, Ibiza Hippie etc. Except that Brit Sheer is not as loud or sweet as the Escada perfumes were. I smell the lychee and pineapple as well floral notes and a clean white musk. It's soft and not very long lasting, but it's pleasant and pleasing for those around you. Not something I would wear any more but maybe once upon a time in my early 20's yes I would have before Fragrantica opened a whole other world of perfumes to me.

It's clean, bright and crisp. But for my nose it's too sharp, and I don't understand what smells like this, because when I look at the notes it seems that I sense something else in it. For some reason, I can't smell tropical pineapple or fresh litchi. I think it's more floral than fruity.
Not even closely as good as Burberry Brit EDT.
love from first sniff . Its already on my list.

I received this as a sample from Sephora, and I reminded why I am not fond of "fresh" perfumes.. Fresh perfumes always dry down on me to smell like soap. This one is no different. It smells exactly like Dawn dish washing soap to me.

In my opinion it has very little to do with Burberry Brit edt/edp.
It's a rosy light on a newborn spring/summer morning. Light, fresh, sweet, from the first sniff innocent and girly, but a bit later it shows its adult and naughty side smiling and teasing. Reminds me young Brigitte Bardot in her girly, romantic vichy dress dancing in a huge flower garden. The same sensual innocence, flirty and a bit naughty glances.
The dry down on me turns a bit soapy, but in a good way -fresh, clean, almost transparent joy of life.
It's not unique and recognizable, it's just a nice, fresh, clean spring/summer scent.

I have this new image of Burberry Brit Sheer..

(I sprayed 7x it really smells cheap.. First few minutes.. )

15 mins later you I appreciate the smell of Burberry Brit Sheer it smells like Versace Bright Crystal.

It smells Sweet, Fruity Floral and sort of really feminine. I have staffs (men and women) appreciate the smell on me. But it would give me a slight headache for 3-5mins and then minutes have passed I do appreciate the scent. I can't help to say or think if something is wrong with me or Burberry Brit Sheer isn't for me? (I don't know it's a bit complicated to describe)

So far -- I like it but not that loving it. On the bright side of this perfume.. Days have passed, (doing my laundry 1-2 weeks later after spraying, due to traveling and travel --tip-- if you asking why it took me so long do the laundry.. )

I would really sniff my shirt, my dress and say --woooohoo! smells good!

i am really amazed it's still there :D

I used to get confused which one to choose between Brit Sheer and Brit Summer.

At first sniff I fell in love with Brit Summer coz the tea + amber combination is quite crisp and unique. However, I find myself wearing SHEER more often.

Brit Sheer starts with fruity + immensely sweet opening (I'm not into sweet scents by the way), but after a few minutes.. W O W.. the drydown is LOVELY!! I find SHEER safer for everyday use because it develops into something clean and uplifting despite the hot weather.

Brit Summer on the other hand develops nicely during cold seasons or nightouts, will make a statement as compared to Sheer.

On my skin, both are DIVINE and included on top of my list!

Incredibly light, fresh, and very subtle. A great spring, summer, or early morning perfume. I find this perfume doesn't have a lot of staying power though, and most people don't even detect I am wearing anything since it doesn't have much of a tail. Hubby bought me the roll-on as a stocking stuffer, so I wonder if that application (vs. spray) has something to do with it. A truly lovely scent, however not a personal favourite as I prefer slightly more prominent perfumes. I will likely keep a small bottle on hand for spring/summer and when the mood strikes for something crisp and light. It reminds me of something that would be nice to spray on the bed linens since it is such a soft scent.

I smelled this side by side with Weekend (my old love), and I have to say that this is a younger sister (or daughter?) to Weekend. This is Weekend diluted with fresh fruits added in place of the deep florals. I believe this should have been released as a Weekend flanker, not a Brit flanker, as it has absolutely nothing in common with the latter.

At the start, Brit Sheer and Weekend are quite different, Brit Sheer opens much juicier and lighter. But at some point, they start to smell quite similar (hello musky peach blossom!). 'Clean, bright, fresh, peachy, musky, uplifting', are words I would use to describe both scents...but Weekend is warmer, heavier, cozier, more floral and has a very noticeable clean laundry note. Brit Sheer is much fruitier with citrus and litchi, sweeter, lighter, much more crisp and airy. Same DNA though! If I had both, I would wear Brit Sheer in late spring and summer, and Weekend in fall and early spring.

Lovers of Weekend should check this out for a more modern, lighter alternative...and haters of Weekend need not worry, everything you dislike about Weekend (I assume it's the heavy, laundry-floral vibe), is nowhere in Brit Sheer. I will definitely be treating myself to a large bottle of this next summer. Longevity of Brit Sheer is moderate on my skin (good for a light summer scent), as is the sillage, but I can still smell it days later on my scarf.
Fresh, citrusy, clean, sweet. A very uplifting and energizing scent! Love this :) It does remind me of bright crystal, but this is way more fresh, and not nearly as powdery.
Fresh, sweet, citrusy, crisp; good morning perfume. I like it.

How do I begin to describe this? I have always adored this perfume for its crisp, clean and light scent (I always spritz this on when I go to a store) but have never really try to analyze this until today. Again, it is nice, though I can't really detect any fruits.
In the opening, I get a very clean (almost alchoholy-bleach kind of smell I always associate with operating theater, which I love, call me weird) and fizzy scent but it later dries down into something flowery and aquatic almost like Body Shop's Aqua Lily although if you smell it really close, you could smell something else underneath. What I love about it is the base which is soft but gives the perfume more depth.
Overall, despite the fact that it does smell nice, I'm not very pleased with the purchase, wouldn't buy a second one.

The first perfume I ever bought lol. Light, sweet and pleasant; I don't think this perfume would offend anyone at all. I do note that this perfume disappears extremely fast on me, but I think that might be because of the fact that I own the roller ball rather than the spray.

When I tested this in the store it honestly smelled like all the perfumers did was take Burberry Brit and then decided to water it down and gave it more floral notes. It is not unpleasant at all but is unoriginal and it had no staying power.
Love for the first smelt, love it^^

I've never been a huge fan of citrus but I'm exploring citrus scents a little more and realizing citrus can be sexy too. I've had this Brit Sheer hanging around for some time now since it is not my favorite fragrance and has not been used but once or twice. Still not sure if this is the citrus for me but I'm appreciating the crisp airy quality this lends. It's like I'm airing out my aura, lol. What I don't love is the sharpness of the pomelo or litchi and at the same time the pink girly aspect. I would like to try Brit Summer as I like the combo of lime and pear.
Super fresh and girly :)

Though I'm not a fan of Burberry scents overall, I picked this up in a rollerball on a whim while traveling. Yuzu, Lychee, peony and a light but steady musk make it pretty, young, and wearable. Definitely good for the office or close quarters on planes/trains. Reminds me vaguely of Versace Bright Crystal, but not nearly as memorable or likely to elicit compliments.

Citrus, clean, musk. Nice and light for summer. Doesn't seem like it would be strong enough to offend so would be perfect for office or other similar situations. Will enjoy finishing my sample but won't buy a FB

I like this a lot. It's just a really pretty, bright, summer-time smell. I can even wear it on my weekly hikes and find it doesn't feel out of place. It smells like Versace Bright Crystal, but better. Compared to Bright Crystal, this feels like a higher quality and better composed scent.

I work in an animal hospital, and this is one of the few scents I know I can wear safely without bothering anyone in close proximity to me. Every time I wear it to work, someone tells me I smell great. My boyfriend loves it too, which is a plus.

That said, I don't *love* it. I just get a little bored with it, if I wear it all the time. I will still repurchase though, because it's really a lovely scent.

Oh, and it lasts ALL day on me. And, as I said, I work in an animal hospital, so it's not like I sit at a desk all day. I'm up and about and my job is pretty physically demanding. I do spritz pretty heavily (for me anyway, which is about 5 sprays). I have a large 3.3 oz bottle, and I got halfway through it in about 3 months. That's huge for me as I've only ever finished one bottle of perfume in my life, and that was a 1 oz.

I was sure that I would love this. Brit is one of my favorites and I thought I can't go wrong with brit sheer. On me it's nothing like depiction. It's not fruity, it's not sweet, It's soapy. So damn soapy.

If you consider purchasing brit sheer go and try it first so you won't make poor blind buy like I did.

I loved the description and smell on the bottle but when I sprayed it, I don't really enjoy it - which is strange because it really smells fresh, but just didn't get the chemistry. I bought the full size so I sprayed it on my stuff in the office and used it as room fragrance lol..
Maybe I'd give it another try - when I forgot to wear perfume.

Totally agree with maine_girl, i smelled it on a colleague and i thought it was Chanel chance, it was really so classy, she offered me to spray it on me and OMG it smelled like new plastic doll on me -_-

I so wish this perfume worked on my skin, but it is pure soap on me. There was an initial blast of citrus, which I loved, then 5 minutes later all I could smell was dove soap. I wasn't even sure where on my arm I had sprayed it. I think this is one you should definitely test out before buying because it seems it's quite affected by skin chemistry.
I love this one! Fruity-sweet-fresh! It will brighten your mood on a gloomy day:)
Very non-offensive, very fresh and very clean. But for me- too plain. I like perfumes with bit more character.

I wouldn't call this tropical by any stretch. Fresh, clean...wait...this smells exactly like my deodorant (soft and dri aluminum free in sweet bliss)! I love the way it smells as a deodorant but do I want to smell like I wiped it all over my body? Mmm, not so much. Kind of has a body mist vibe to it- fresh, soapy floral. Easy enough to wear or use as a clothing spray. Or you could just use fabreze.

I love this perfume. It's just kind of light and clean and fresh. It's simultaneously energizing and relaxing. It makes me think of bathing in a waterfall on some tropical island somewhere, surrounded by trees and flowers and a distant sea breeze. Very lovely, very feminine. Also, this lasts quite a long time on me. I sprayed it n my wrist in the store 10 hours ago and I can still smell it. It's lost a lot of the soapy quality and now just has a subtle mix of peony, peach blossom, and musk with a little hint of wood. It is slightly similar to Versace Bright Crystal, in that it is the same family, but I think that they are different enough that I would like to have both.
I used to really enjoy this scent, but these days the drydown smells exactly like Scotch tape on me. (And it seems I'm not the only one, looking at other reviews.)
It smells a lot like Baby Doll by YSL, but it doesn't last more than 15 minutes on my skin, It's way too soft, I wouldn't buy it again, I'll get another bottle of Baby Doll instead.
Absolute love at first whiff! Smelt it while I was testing a 4 piece set of Burberry minatures at the store! Fruity clean fresh spring in a bottle...

This was love at first sniff for me. This fragrance was perfectly created. I can smell the pear more than any other note. It smells very feminine, fresh and clean with a touch of musk. It does smell like Versace Bright Crystal but the projection in this is far greater than Bright Crystal - at least on my skin. I really love it! Perfect spring/summer frag. Burberry mostly does it for me.

What a lovely scent! Feminine delicacy in a bottle.
It starts with cheerful fruity notes, fresh and subtle, little sweet. When it develops its gentle floral notes, it is WOW. Peony is such romantic and charming in here! Scent is just wonderful. Perfectly blended, nothing is too much or too less.
Spring & summer miracle.

Update: Very clean fragrance, good for all formal occasions.

This smells so elegant, sophisticated, classy yet fun. Waaaoooo! I would have never discovered this gem if my friend wouldn't have given me a sample. It's a very fresh, fruity(in a classy way!) fragrance. And the litchi note makes it so delicious . . . yumm! I just picked it up yesterday at My Chemist for such a good deal(which is rare in Australia) - $45 AUD for 100 ml (3.3 oz). Couldn't be more happy <3 Also, packaging is so classy yet simplistic. It retails for $89 AUD for 50 ml and $119 AUD for 100 ml in David Jones/Myer.

I love Brit so I thought I'd try Brit sheer- my review may be biased as I was expecting something similar and they do not seem related at all in my opinion. On me this smells like a soapy fresh floral. Its a crisp fresh scent, not warm like Brit. I cant pick up any pineapple and I'm definitely not getting a tropical vibe as listed in the main accords, in my opinion this resembles chilled florals. I'll be sticking to my Brit but someone who likes cooler or soapy scents should give this one a shot
Romântico e leve, perfeito para dias quentes ou praia, doce na medida certa, cheirinho de banho recém tomado!

This one is nice! Light fruity floral that it suitable for all weather and season. I can see the resemblance to versace bright crystal , I think it's the yuzu. But it's definitely lighter and not as intense as versace bright crystal. I do prefer this to bright crystal, for sure, as it doesn't make me dizzy when I wear it. So pleasant! I can't stop smelling my arm! Haha.

I have a nearly full bottle of versace bright crystal though if anyone wants to buy or swop. I def prefer burberry brit sheer for sure.

I love this one. Fresh tropical fruits on the opening, then turns soft flowery musky. Freshen up your day, it's like summer holiday & clean laundry scent. Invigorating, clean, feminine, fun, happy. Summer holiday lazy sunbathe. Reminds me of Versace Bright Crystal which have the same kind of summer fun scent only it has more elegant side. Longevity is good too.

This fragrance is a mystery to me. I love it but it is so soft and low key that I hardly notice it some days. Maybe it is my own skin, the heat and/or chemistry? I prefer gentle perfumes, and this is definitely one of them. Summery, fresh, light.

This is one of my favorite fragrances of all time. It's what I wear when I want to smell good but don't want to think about it too much. I've gotten tons of compliments in every type of setting and occasion, and while it's very light and playful and young, I really don't think you can go wrong when wearing this scent. It's not overbearing at all, and while it's definitely strong in the citrus department (especially at first), you don't exactly smell like you just spritzed on a citrusy perfume. No one's ever asked me what I'm wearing - it just seems to evoke a "Hey, you smell really good!" reaction. The initial application is citrusy and fruity - I find the pineapple and pear to be the main notes - and rather quickly but smoothly settles down into a more fresh floral scent. I do find that there can be a *very* subtle artificial quality sometimes in the top and middle notes, but it doesn't bother me very much, if at all, and pick it up very rarely. I absolutely love the drydown, which to me just about smells like the best part about fresh laundry (without the soapy, powdery connotations) - clean, crisp, and happy. This is a very crisp, clean, fragrance that manages to be flirty and feminine without being cloying or obvious. The main downside is that it doesn't last long :(

I really adore this perfume, it's one of my favorites.

It opens with a soft fruity, tropical mix, with the litchi the only fruit I can actually identify.

Then it settles down, and it is just a sweet, clean, dreamy soapy smell on my skin. It's a very feminine clean smell.

What I absolutely love is that despite how utterly soft the scent is, it lasts and lasts on my skin. I remember when I first tried this on, I forgot I had tried it. Throughout the day I kept getting these whiffs of beautiful, sweet, clean soap. Finally after a few hours I realized it was this fragrance and made up my mind to immediately purchase it.

I sort of think of this as the ultra feminine counterpart of Light Blue in my perfume arsenal. Don't misunderstand me, they don't smell alike; rather their nature is the same. Light blue is a clean, everyday unoffensive fragrance for me, but it borders on being masculine. Burberry Brit Sheer is the same in my mind: a clean, everyday unoffensive fragrance, but ultra feminine in nature.

I'm very anxious to try this one out. I sprayed some on my skin at the perfume counter. On it's initial spray, I detect a clean fresh scent, almost like a floral shampoo, but not in a bad way. I was pretty pleased with the scent. I Can't wait to purchase this one. Will review later....

*****UPDATE******
I finally purchased this scent, and to be honest, it's not that great as when I tested it on my skin. It starts off with a fresh, soapy, clean floral shampoo like scent to it, then as it settles into my skin, it turns yucky!!! Almost like there is some sour note spoiling the fragrance. Perhaps it was just my skin chemistry not agreeing with this scent. I'm glad to finally be done with the bottle, but I don't think I'd repurchase this one. It just didn't work out with my skin type.
I LOVE this perfume, the scent is floral and sweet a bit but soft, i could smell peony also. I had the miniature size and now its out of bottle. This is my signature perfume definitely.

Oh my, I was never inclined to buy Burberry perfumes because all the ones I had sniffed didn't appeal to me. Until I randomly smelled Brit sheer. I spritzed a little on my forearm and went around the store to shop for other things. I kept getting sweet little whiffs of it as I walked here and there and fell in love with this scent. Its fruity but not too sweet, floral but citrus at same time. Drydown is mainly floral and soapy/clean smelling on me and it lasted for a good 5 hours on my skin. I bought it on the spot, without hesitation. Got a good deal on a gift set including a 100ml EDT, a purse spray and body lotion for $60 (same perfume all by itself at Sephora cost over $70.) I smelled the regular Burberry Brit and liked it as well though I'd probably like it better for fall. Do I need any more summer scents in my collection? Nooo, but when I like a scent I gotta have it. Highly recommend.
i can really smell the honeysuckle

I really like this! So clean and fresh. Just like you have had a fresh shower, open the door. The sun is shining, no clouds in the sky. A little fresh breeze blends your neighbours fresh laundry with the light smell from the shampoo you used in the shower.

That is what I feel when I use this. Fresh laundry, "just out-of-the-shower", a fresh summer breeze and no worries.

I will put this on my wish-list!

I don't usually go for Burberry perfume, but I just had to buy this one because of the heavenly first note. It reminds me of Gucci Envy me, but a little softer. The citrus/fruity note will stay for quite a long time and it feels really refreshing, especially on hot summer days.

I often spray it on my neck and wrists, enjoy the sour yet sweet smell of mandarin mixed with litchi for 3 or 4 hours and be content with just that, eventually my nose gets used to it, I cannot smell it on me anymore.

Today at work, a guest told me when I was walking up to him: 'There's some kind of flower that smells very good, I cannot figure out what kind of flower it is.' I took a sniff at my wrist and was really surprised that it had developed into lily/peony kind of flowery smell. How could I never noticed this before! The lasting strength is brilliant, too, since it was almost 4pm already.

Fruity or Flowery note, all smells so amazing for me. Definitely a must-have in my perfume collection.
I have a 30ml bottle (90% full) up for swap worldwide! Pm if you're interested ;)
My girlfriend has it and I simply adore! Smells a little fruity, a little floral, very subtil, not strong, not overpowering. Go for it, girls!
Fresh laundry scent. If you want to emphasize that, this perfume is the way to go.

I smelled it in the store and I really liked it. It felt fresh and fruity but mature at the same time. But after a few hours I just feel the sharp wood and flower notes. As other say it feels soapy. If it wasn't for the soapiness I would love it!
This is a happy scent that lasts a long time. I like that it can be found almost anywhere, which makes it easy to buy. I think it has a tropical vibe to it.

very pretty for the summer. Mainly citrus floral rather than fruity. Nothing like original Brit and is very soft and inoffensive. To be honst many fragraces might smell similar to this one, but its balance is what probably makes me like it.

For me this fragrance was sharp and soapy. I did not smell anything fruity, tropical or sweet in it at all. Disliked at first, but after some I like it and respect it.. still not the fragrance for me, sadly.

i love this perfume. I have the EDT, and the smell was great. really suits on me and get some compliments on it :)

the only thing i dont like about this perfume is the longevity.It only lasts for about 3hours.

This perfume is noted as the most reminder of Versace Bright Crystal, but be aware that if you like VBC that doesn't mean you'll automatically love Burberry Brit Sheer, and I suppose the opposite is correct too.
Personally VBC is my favourite perfume, on the other hand I didn't like BBS and I don't even find a similarity
A very light perfume and it is nice. Would not buy it again but recommended as a casual scent.

Got a sample of this with a Sephora order. I was very surprised to find that I liked it. First impression reminded me a lot of Davidoff Cool Water that I used to wear sometimes as a teen - but this is more elegant and understated.

Smelling this at a distance it smells aquatic and a bit "cold" in a calming way, but close to the skin I can definitely detect the litchi, accompanied by just a bit of pineapple.

I am still debating if I would buy a full-sized version, because "cold" watery scents don't often suit my mood, but I'll also try this on again in the summer and see if my opinion changes on how the fragrances makes me feel.
Love this better than the brit . its soft young . i will definitly buy it again for the up coming summer .

Very bright, happy, elegant and refined.
Smells very citrusy to me

Young, flirty, clean, happy, flowery, soft. All the things I'm not lol it's a cute perfume! But is not for me...doesn't stay on my skin long of my skin and it is very soft.
Day time and casual scent.
Reminds me of clean laundry or the way a bathroom smells after a long shower!
