In two words: Quality, Understated. It's not challenging or head turning, rather its understated and mass appealing. Making it great for the office and daily use. The minimalist bottle allows you to really appreciate the little details. It exudes quality, very heavy and solid feeling in the hand and the weighty magnetic top adds to that. The color contrasted atomizer is really good, maybe amongst the best, which is a good thing because you will need quite a few sprays of this to have it project and last. The fragrance notes do not contrast or change over time, rather they merge into one singular understated olfactory experience which is a fresh yet dark wood. Its smells familiar and comforting but you can never quite put your finger on what it is which is what keeps drawing you back for more.
Smell like sweaty t-shirt. Sexy sweaty t-shirt, but still sweaty t-shirt. Hate this.

Other reviewers have said similar stuff, but I I wore it today, It's woody smoky spicy scent, It smells ok but why would I wear this over other stuff in my collection I don't think I would.
As someone said below me, there's no wow factor.

Burberry hero is a very subtle and inoffensive scent. Something you can wear day to day in any environment or under any circumstance. Whilst it’s a great compliment getter in the summertime, it heavily underperforms in the wintertime.
It's not my favorite. It's like a slightly woodsy take on 1million. Reminds me of a scented pinecone. If that is your scent, you will like this a lot.

I really like this! Sure, it's nothing ground-breaking, but it's probably my most worn fragrance. Super mass-appealing and its simplicity is what makes it great IMO. It's like every male fragrance mixed together. It's citrusy, woodsy, metallic, musky, fresh, and aquatic all at the same time. Opening is great but the dry-down is fantastic- a super clean smelling, slightly soapy citrus which I really love. I dont really think it's "dated" as many say. Just an all around great fragrance that's an easy reach. Only complaint is the longevity but it does its job. I get like a solid 6 hours with this usually. 8/10

one of the more basic smelling perfumes. If you tell any regular person to describe cologne, chances are it'd smell like Burberry Hero. But, I like it because it's a nice fragrance and I think it can be worn all 4 seasons. Though mainly in the spring/summer/fall, I do think you can get away with this in the winter too.

Honestly i wanted to love this for the fact that is a SUPER generic easy versatile scent. All the way through you get a dry aromatic slightly spice coniferous cedar and it's something that i've smelled a million times, really reminds me of a body wash.

With that being said this stuff smells absolutley fantastic and is super mass appealing but the probelm is that it is just sooo weak. The fragrace is very thin and airy to begin with and a single spray to the wrist is hardly detectable and drowing myself in this it becomes a vague skin scent in 30 min
People say its generic but I can't think of anything else that smells like it. Love the scent. Wish the performance was stronger.
It's pretty generic, it smells good on my husband but doesn´t have a "WOW" factor.

The most 'whatever' I've felt for a fragrance.

It's clean, it smells good, but in a clean and smells good way that reminds me of slightly above average room air freshener with random sky blue packaging like Febreeze. How pathetically weak it is + the slight soapiness also contributes to this air freshener feel.

Nothing special about this at all, no twist, no mystery note that keeps you coming back for more.

It is totally devoid of personality and completely unmemorable. Your life would be exactly the same if you have or have not smelt this fragrance. Just pass on it and spend your money elsewhere.

Simple scent but absolutely beautiful imo. I love crisp, airy, masculine fragrances and this is just that. The note breakdown is a simple and fairly accurate description of what you are getting with this one. Fresh woods, clean/airy juniper with a touch of bergamot and pepper. There is a very slight soapiness to the scent. Even though it is not listed, I would assume there is a lavender note in here. Perhaps the overall scent could be described as a simpler, smoother, far more wearable version of Santal 33. The scent is extremely versatile - casual to formal, warm or cold- it’s a modern masculine scent that just works. Love this one, just wish performance was better. Will need to overspray for this to last more than 3hrs.

Nothing special,very oridinary.
5/10

This was a blind buy after seeing ads. Now, I do think it's on the safe buy in terms of blind buys, but I don't have any great remarks to have it a clear blind purchase. The smell is good, I don't think it will offend anyone, at least the grand majority will like. I wore it only during the days, for casual things like getting lunch, or shopping around. I can not see it as a date night, or overall, any nighttime activity go to fragrance.
6.5 out of 10.
Woody fresh

Woody, fresh, sweet, powdery, soapy, citrusy, sexy, peppery, slightly floral and most of all this is not boring.

You would think there is vetiver in here because of that peppery wood smell, but it's just actual pepper with wood. But it smells like vetiver

Something in here smells like pdm percival (must be the powdery & woody smell) to me and then sometimes when I smell it then it's a bit like dior homme 2020
Reminds me a lot of Calvin Klein’s “One”

I am in love with this fragrance. Smells uncomplicated and sophisticated, safe but not boring. I think it works well for any occasion, but may not be perfect for any occasion. Not ideal performance or projection but unless you want to shout out your presence with the way you smell its fine. It definitely isn't a 'wear you' cologne. I'm introverted, but not shy. Hero fits my personality perfectly.
Very woody and sexy smell, the only problem i have with it, is the longevity and the sillage. On my skin it lasts 2-3 hours max, on clothes 4 hours

I smelled this once or twice smells like exactly like the notes the brightness of bergamot disappears 10 minutes in and smells like black pepper on a cedarwood table. if that's your jam go for it. dm me to buy a bottle off me. Edit this is growing on me, nice scent to wear anywhere, But I don't think it's worth retail.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: my first perfume ever given on my 13th birthday. used it religiously on our cruise to norway but never again not sure why... smells so fresh and clean but it does smell kind of sour whcih i don't like that much. maybe it is the pear?

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: Very bright, fruity yummy scent! So fresh and vibrant....two sprays are enough! Puts one in a good mood, a blind buy for those who like bright and sunny scents.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
I bought my first bottle at Marshall’s 5+ years ago? Love the limey sparkling opening and cozy almonds notes. When I finished the bottle, it was discontinued & couldn’t find it anymore with a decent price. Got an opened bottle 3/4 full recently from Poshmark & the refreshing top notes are gone and all the other notes are dulled.
I’ll finish the bottle. Maybe if I had bought a new in box bottle it’ll smell better? Who knows? Just be careful when you buy an opened one, you might be disappointed.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: Potent and leaning masculine. The tea note here isn't calming at all. Perhaps should've gotten the original EDT/EDP instead.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
I have a tester bottle that looks exactly as shown (vertical - not diagonal -white plaid design, tho without the cap) but labeled Burberry Limited EDT only, no Brit or Summer anywhere on the bottle or sticker. The sticker on the back states very similar notes but with some subtle differences to those on Fragrantica, they are as follows:
Top notes: lime, icy pear, green almonds (not tea)
Heart notes: white peony, sugared almonds
Base notes: mahogany wood, amber, vanilla beans ( not musk)

This fragrance opens with a crisp, zingy, bright and very fresh lime note that manages not to be sharp, is slightly green without being bitter. Within an hour it gives way to a delicately sweet “wedding” almond note, then it rests on a very smooth wood and vanilla/amber base. This phase lasts for maybe 4 more hours but is very close to the skin.
In the excruciating summer heat I don’t mind reapplying it every hour to enjoy the refreshing initial limeade blast.
Overall it’s an easy grab for hot summer days when you need a zing but still crave some sweetness 😊

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
My bottle of this fragrance with the same name edp and all, is designed like the burberry brit gold, red, and brit sheer.
From what I c tell burberry brit edp has the larger plaid design with bigger black stripes, mine is fine print with more like pinstripe plaid - in the same colour pallet.

My bottle is more sheer feing than recent burberry brit edp I have tested, the latter one is much more pronounced.
Both bottles have that same warm sweet wool nutty smell, with a cosy freshness. The lime is not at all citrus or dry, the pear is not fruity per se, perhaps lends a gentle sweet facet.

I very much enjoy the bottle with the larger print, i might use to swap/sell this one I have. Both are nice but just a preference.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
One of my first ever perfumes.
Very easy to wear, and affordable.

The opening is very heavy in lime and tea for me, with a hint of sweetness from the pear.

That citrus and tea scent stays through the whole journey, but becomes more mellow, sweet with pear and somewhat smooth, thanks to the almond, and musk.

An easy buy, not overwhelming and very pleasant. Good purchase for a sensitive nose, amazing for the summer and good throughout the whole year.

The sillage is pretty weak unless over sprayed, the longevity is great.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: The opening is very citrusy, fresh and clean but it quickly deepens into a vanillic, almondy ambery scent. It's not exactly pleasing, nor is it disgusting. Very warm and cozy. Feminine and not too in your face. I don't get much pear to be honest, not a fruity perfume at all, BUT the tea is here somewhere behind if you pay attention. I find Brit Summer way better, more airy and subtle than Brit. Although both are immensely sweet which is why I stopped wearing them after 20. This is not a very mature scent. I place this on the same line asLa Vie est Belle or Black Opium... young girly girl perfumes. It's definitely a day scent, uncomplicated, smooth and happy. Smells like garden afternoons to me !

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: In the top this is very very fresh. It reminds me of Elizabeth Arden Green Tea meets Shalimar Souffle de Lumiere. Lots of citrus, some tea and a little bit of baked lemon goods. There's peony and musk in the mix. Those are the notes for me. Not too complex. Wonderful for summer if you like sweet and citrus. It's much fresher and less dark and sultry than the Shalimar flankers.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I am in love once again with one of many fragrances by Burberry. A real delight. Those who want to compare it to Brit EDP or EDT, although nice in their own right, would be mistaken. There is no tonka, vanilla, or sugar present in this fragrance. Instead smooth green tea, and soft musk are added to the traditional peony and green almond. The warm amber and dark wood in Brit Summer is much lighter as well, leaving way for the musky, citrusy, almondy freshness of this fragrance. A nice warm weather fragrance that has very good longevity and silage for an EDT. Good for any occasion, can definitely be worn without offending others.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Delicious, delicious! I instantly and easily loved Brit summer. Light, fresh, sweet citrusy. Now this scent reminds me of Disneyland since I wore it there and I could smell it all day. It takes more sprays to get longevity but get some on your shirt and you'll be catching yummy candied pear-citrus whiffs all day.

This is so fresh-sweet it is mouthwatering. I love lime and pear. Tea gives it a calming property and ensures this never becomes overly sweet or screechy. The sugared almond keeps it mellow-sweet. A perfect balance of calm/energy/fresh.
Wear this for a friendly perk-up, or for summer of course.
Try this if Brit was too heavy.
I think I am officially a Burberry groupie. Now, time to scour the web for an extra bottle as back-up. Summer lasts 6 months here!! I'd love my summer to smell of this.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
To start off I’m a man and I got this fragrance by mistake as I ordered the original Burberry Brit for men but got this instead.

BUT I looked at the note breakdown at the back of the bottle and thought the note breakdown looked interesting so I decided to give it a shot and I was pleasantly surprised at how good this smelled. After smelling this I was actually confused as this smells like it could be a mans fragrance or unisex at least as it smells VERY similar to Givenchy PI and due to the mahogany note in this I’d even say this is also more masculine than PI.

To describe the scent on its own this opens up with a nice blast of lime,tea and almond giving this a very smooth but fresh and relaxing smell.Once this dries down the citrus and tea stays in the background but then the almond and mahogany take over giving this a milky but deep masculine touch. I really love the Mahogany note in this which is similar to the Mahogany note in Mahogany Woods by Bath and Body Works. All in all I love this smell and it smells like a half lemonade/half iced tea mix if you then applied almond milk. It sounds weird but this stuff is delicious smelling and great for all seasons for both Men and Women.

Performance on this is great as it lasts 6-12 hours and this doesn’t project very well BUT it does leave a nice Sillage and you will get whiffs if this hours later.

Needless to say even though I got sent this by mistake I’m going to end up keeping this hidden gem and I actually like this scent better than Brit anyways !

First initial wearing review — 8 out of 10 ! Unique smell with a great blend of notes that’s good for all season

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Fragrance -Burberry Brit Summer for Women
Bottle from - 2016

Burberry Brit Summer is an intriguing and sensual fragrance that goes from fresh,clean,green and citrusy scent to a nice moderately sweet,woody and powdery mix of musk,pear, amber and almond as it settles into the skin.

Longevity - 7/10(7+hours)
Silage/Projection - 6/10(soft to moderate projection and silage for the first 2-3 hours)
Weather - best in best in spring,summer and early autumn
Age - 20+
Compliments - 8/10
Scent - 7/10

Main notes according to me - lime,tea,pear,almond,musk,flowers.

The drydown is nice and i get some woodiness,musk,amber and almond.

Emotions -fresh,pleasant,sensual,bright,clean,relax,casual.

Occasion -for more or less any ocasion,perfect for casual activities and office.

Could be a nice signature scent.You'll get compliments with this one.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
I have a like-dislike relationship with this fragrance and have more than once considered giving it away. I'm glad I didn't.

I finally realized that what kinda spoils this fragrance for me is the green tea and lime, which initially open strong and sharp (in my opinion).

For this reason, I never spray it on my neck since it would be overpowering and screechy. If you must use it behind your ears, use the dab method. The wrists and inner elbow are best for sprays.

Once it dries down, the soft almond and amber come through leaving a creamy, warm scent.

The sillage can be strong if you use a heavy hand, but this doesn't typically last to the end of the day without re-spraying. Longevity might be better when sprayed on clothing.

I initially thought that this fragrance was best used in the summer as it's likely to project a lot better in warmer weather. Nope. I tried using it during the summer once and ended up with a headache-inducing cloying mess. My body chemistry doesn't do well with green tea and lime/lemon notes in warm weather, but I carry them flawlessly in colder months.

Burberry Brit has lemon in it, yet I find it to be a lot more wearable than Brit Summer. So if I were to pick between the two, I'd go for the original Brit.

I would suggest testing Brit Summer before you buy it, as those tart notes may not work well for everyone. I don't regret this blind-buy and I'm glad I held on to it.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Safe scent for any woman.
I bought this for my ex.
She loved it and it smeled wonderful on her.
Last about six to seven hours.
Would buy it again.
It only cost $20 for a 3.4 Oz bottle.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
In general, I'm a fan of the Burberry Brit family of scents, and I think that Burberry Brit Summer EDT is a nice addition to it. This scent opens with a strong lime/pear blast that is way too bright for fall/winter. Am sure this would be refreshing in the summer - which is, obviously, it's intended season. The tea shows up shortly afterwards, but on my skin, the lime dominates for a couple of hours. Eventually, it settles into a slightly sweet peony/tea scent with a hint of amber for me. I look forward to revisiting in the appropriate season.

Longevity - 6-7 hours
Sillage - moderate for first 2 hours, soft for the next 4, then fades almost completely away
Season - most definitely summer

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: Very masculine and too strong on the lime... I couldn't wear it... I'm not a big fan of unisex perfume and this is what it reminds me of

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
If anyone would like to swap for this, I have a 1.7oz bottle that is full. Sprayed twice. US only please.

I bought this blind hoping that it would be like the original Brit. I do like it but I'm missing the vanilla almond dry down that the original has. That is my favorite part. This smells like a green tea with fresh squeezed lime in it. Not bad at all but not my favorite.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Hi ladies, here a male short take on this...
I just bought it for a girl...it was a blind buy, what can I say? we were not dissapointed at all...it smells nice and citrusy in a nice feminine flowery way...something quite different to be honest...but in a good way...very distintive and feminine...you can feel there is quality in it...not cheap smelling at all and I guess a useful one in everybody´s collection...

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
This Brit flanker opens up with a green tea/citrus combination, with the addition of a really juicy pear. You can grasp a hint of these notes in the original Brit, but you can tell right off the bat this is going to be a much fresher version!

The heart is pretty close in comparison to the original Brit - the musky, almost-powdered-rice-or-osmanthus-like quality of sweet yet bitter almonds. Fizzy and slightly musky, but the tea throughout the fragrance makes Brit Summer a little more crisp and sheer. Sometimes I get bits of Honeysuckle flower (real life flower, not "In perfumery" flower!), amongst the heart notes, though it is not listed here.

I feel this is a flanker situation where if you have one, you don't need the other - though I do find these are two bottles that are pleasant for winter vs. summer. Overall, when comparing the original vs. flanker side by side, I think Brit Summer wins me over with it's added freshness! It avoids any chance of the scent becoming cloying as it wears on.

Soft sillage, and decent longevity! I can always smell it all throughout a 7+ hour work day, and then some. Which surprised me, for a fruity tea scent! A nice addition to a collection that needs some uplifting notes.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: This is a nice perfume, you can really smell the pear. But I would like it more, if it had more depth.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
This a fresh green scent with a hint of sweetness, it has been very humid and sticky, thunderstorms etc where I am and I have found in these conditions this scent really comes into it's own, it smells great for oppressive weather and gives you a feeling of clean zingeyness.

I agree with Christinavictory about being reminiscent of a mojito, I totally got that yesterday evening during a storm!

For me it starts full on lime tea and green pear, as it warms on your skin you get a sweet peony and creamy almond finally vanilla musk woodsey notes, very nice indeed could unisex in my opinion.

I've found wearing it with dove body lotion seems to complement it well, I think it brings out the almond scent which stops it being to sharp.

For EDT I found it's staying power good, though you feel so fresh when you put it on I did respray 2 or 3 times yesterday even though 1 or 2 would have been enough.

I'm really pleased with this and it will be my go to in hot humid weather.

Recommended to my friend who got a spritz on paper in the shop during her lunch break and it smelt horrid, when she sprayed mine on her skin she couldn't believe the difference they smelt like different scents, so make sure you try on your skin otherwise you might be unnecessarily put off a lovely scent.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
I almost didn't buy this. Citrus fragrances always scare me because I'm afraid they're going to be too sharp. But thank goodness, there really isn't any sharpness to this.

It's like the lime was sugared down, I think someone mentioned lemonade? I totally get it! Like a super juicy half tea, half lemonade. I know there's no lemons in here, or technically straight sugar, but somehow that's what comes through in the beginning and it's awesome. It softens a bit to the peony but never quite loses the lemonade factor.

That may be a negative for some, but for a fun summer fragrance I think it's great, both for the really hot days and for the light rainy days. It only comes in an EDT, but it's pretty long lasting for an EDT so at least there's that.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
EDIT: I've got a 3.4 oz bottle of this (sprayed 2-3 times, 99% full) up for swap! Contact me if you're interested ^-^


Just got this today in the mail!
I sniffed the trigger, and was slightly alarmed because all I could smell was bitter pears.
Luckily, it did not smell that way when applied on my skin.
First thing I notice is limes. Not the sweet candied lime, the real thing.
Second thing was a white flower of some sort (that I now can identify as peony.) It gave a ladylike undertone to the limey scent, but this perfume is really complex on me.
The limes and peony stand out the most within the first hour or so. It then develops a new side, losing that citrus edge and becoming fruitier. Like icy pears.
It dries down to a musky amber with traces of tea.
Overall, it's a nice scent but probably for the 25+ crowd.
Its fresh, citrusy, and musky. A little bit bitter.
I can appreciate it for what it is, but for a 16 year old, its a little bit of a joykill (at least for a summer fragrance).
Obviously this doesn't apply to anyone who enjoys fresh, sophisticated, fruity fragrances! It is still such a beautiful scent, and I like it much more than the original Brit, but I probably won't be wearing it much.
End thoughts: If you liked Brit, but want a fresher version, I'd say give this a try!

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
I finally got this in the mail! Burberry Brit Sheer is one of my absolute favorite fragrances, but I had never before smelled Burberry Brit. Well, the other day I did go to the store and test the original Burberry Brit, and it just smelled TERRIBLE on me. Anyways, I got really nervous and then I read on here that Brit summer was similar to the original...and I was going to cancel, but the person I bought it from had already shipped it. I figured I might as well try it, and I am SO GLAD I didn't cancel it. This smells absolutely nothing like the original Brit.

I love London, it's one of my favorite places in the world, but there is nothing about this fragrance that screams "British!" to me. Instead, it screams "Cuba!" The description does not say that there is any mint or sugar in this fragrance, but I can distinctly smell both along with a strong lime and a little bit of rum. Essentially, this fragrance smells EXACTLY like drinking a mojito in a garden of peonies. It really brings me back to Havana. I LOVE it, A++

Edit: the dry down is a bit reminiscent of Burberry Brit. I like it way better in the beginning, but the beginning last several hours on me. While there are some similarities in the dry down, this is still a lot better than the original.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: Sorry, but this one smells like smashed rotten lemon. Not for me.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
This creation by Burberry house was in my test list, but when I saw that many of you find similarities with the original Brit,I desided it's not worthed trying it, because I don't like vanilla in perfumes.
Today I was in the mall and I saw it on the shelf and I thought to myself "OK, why not?". It turned out on me was a fresh, a bit sweet lime-pear scent. After a few hours it changed to a mix of musk, wood and hint of peony. I find it lovely and very wearable spring scent!

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Brit summer is a gentle sister of the 5th Avenue Style in my opinion. Despite the difference in notes on the list, they both start with nearly identical burst of citrus, while in Brit citrus soon gives way to pear and tea in 5TH Avenue Style it stays for much longer with dominant rasberry and spice. It the end they are still, two very similar scents.. with brit being sweeter not so in your face fume.

This is a refreshing, soft, creamy and very wearable scent, perfect for a hot summers day.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: smells great from the bottle, smells lame on me :( Hopefully I can find the normal Brit one day and see how that goes.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: So refreshing! Burst of icy lime and pear, lightly sugared almond heart with a fresh, yet sensual drydown of amber, wood and white musk. Light, sexy fragrance for summer. It brought the image of sitting in an adirondak chair whose wood has been warmed by the sun and body heat on the back porch overlooking a lake. You're with someone special, sharing smiles and the occasional laugh. A vase of lightly scented flowers sits on a side table with a selection of iced tea, sparkling limeade with iced pear cubes and sugared almonds. A rather safe scent, but lovely.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
This gem has surprising longevity for an edt. I sprayed it on at 9am this morning, and now at 5pm I can still smell it when I bring my arm up to my face. Other than the almondy base this perfume doesn't really resemble the original brit to me. It's dominated by the lemon note from the beginning to just before the end. The pear note is pretty prevalent throughout. My experience with this surprised me somewhat because I had read about how similar this fragrance was to the original, but I was not surprised in a bad way.

This fragrance is pretty fantastic. It's the sprite to the original brit's latte if that makes sense. Where the original brit is more creamy this one has a little more bite. It smells fresh and clean without being soapy or sterile. I would say that it could be unisex, but it leans very much more towards the feminine, and I'm sure that's mostly because of the pear involved.

All in all, I'm happy I purchased this one (at a discount from groupon *Cheer*). And I'm more than a little sad that this is only a summer fragrance.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Tranquility in a bottle!!!

I enjoying this perfume a lot. Burberry perfume creators if you read this please make Burberry Brit Summer in EDP form.

Impression:
Initial sprits: lime, pear and tea
5 minutes: lime note dominates
20 minutes: a nice balance of lime, pear and tea
1 hr later: pear and almond mostly
4 hrs: the lime is completely gone; I smell pear, almond, vanilla and a hint of musk

My skin type: oily / youthful
Office safe: Yes very
Potency: Light (5 or more sprays are necessary)
Projection: arm's length
Longetivity: 6 hrs
Timing: Summer / day time
Price: $49 for 100 ml/ 3.4 oz at Winners / TJMaxx
Packaging: 7/10; standard for Burberry Perfumes

Will I Repurchase: NO

Update# 1:
this perfume lasts a lot longer than I thought it did...a few nights ago as I turned over in bed, around 2 or 3 am, I smelled Brit Summer. I was so surprised, as this was over 14 hrs after I had applied it. Brit summer projects more as the weather warms up.
Projection: arms length for 4-6hrs, then sits close to skin for 6 - 8 hrs
Longevity: 12 hrs +

Update #2:
Burberry Brit EDP is the better / stronger alternative to Brit Summer. Burberry Brit EDT had no almonds or vanilla when applied to my skin.

Disclaimer: my experience may be different from your experience based on my skin type, my chemistry, the season, and my personal tastes

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Lime and tea dominate in the top and mid phase, and it turns into a "soli-musk" in the base.

Sadly, the piquant and refreshing top and heart notes don't last very long at all

I wish this scent had a bit more oomph in the longevity/potency department-

Thanks for the sample, BB!

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I don't think this smells too much like the original. A very light simple floral. Pretty and traditional.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I`m sensitive to smells and this perfume stinks and makes me wanna puke. It`s too heavy and strong.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
Burberry Brit Summer may have a similar scent pyramid to that of the original, but I can't say that they smell exactly alike. I much prefer this Summer flanker. It's softer, fresher and fruitier.

Anyone that follows my reviews, will know that I don't usually enjoy fruity fragrances. There are only a few fruit notes that I like, and pear and lime are two of them. These two notes, when blended together, create a scent that is sweet, green, juicy, soft and feminine. Thankfully nothing in this fragrance comes across as being too overbearing.

Brit Summer is a really delicate fragrance. It is far more subdued than the original Brit, which often turned sharp on my skin. I would most definitely reach for this flanker during Summer.

The heart is well balanced with sweet, mashed pears, green lime, soapy peony and sugared almonds. It's almost a gourmand, however I'd describe it as being more crisp and clean.

The musky drydown is even more pleasant, striking me as being rather sensual and soothing. If only this Summer flanker wasn't a limited edition. It's one of my pet peeves when brands discontinue limited edition flankers, especially when they smell better than the originals.

The sillage of Brit Summer is fairly light and inoffensive. The lasting strength could have been better, but it's certainly not disappointing. My word to the wise is to go out and test this flanker as soon as possible. I fear that its existence will be short-lived.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: Good choice for those who find the original a bit too cloying. A very fresh scent with a hint of sweetness in it. Almost certainly feminine, but not to a point of being girly girl. Just got this myself hours ago and so far I'm enjoying it. I got lots of green tea freshness which is balanced by the sweetness of the sugared almonds. I like it that way as it keeps the scent from becoming too syrupy sweet because of the sugared almonds or too bitter-green by the green tea. Of course other ingredients also affected the composition in some ways, but as a whole it is certainly to me a pretty balanced concoction. As I said, fresh yet sweet. Staying power is pretty decent for an EDT. This one is a sure compliment getter, provided if you use it in just the right amount. Highly recommended for just about any occasion, be it office or a special event. It is not so heavy so it is suitable for both day and night wear.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I love this summer version of brit! I usually go for sweet perfumes, which I both love and hate, so I bought this to balance out my perfume wardrobe. It smells really good, sexy, fresh, and somewhat spicy/woody. I got this instead of the original brit because I wanted to stay away from the vanilla sweet drydown a lot of people comment on. Even though it's "fruity" in a sense, it's not a super sweet, victoria's secret type of fruity. I think it's quite strong and could be a good work perfume if you spray lightly. It's a perfect end of summer, going into fall perfume, as it is a green, fresh scent, but also gives you a spicy warmth and good lasting power.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I hate this smell. I sprayed some on my hand and I did not like it. It only gets worse too, I don't even know how to describe its awfulness, it smelled like fried grass, dirt, and wood. I let my mom sniff and she thought it was pretty gross too. Not my cup of tea.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: If you're going to start trying this perfume, spray it on your body instead of sampling it on the paper! On paper is smells absolutely awful. But, when it's on skin it takes about 20 minutes to dry down into a soft pear, peony and musky smell. It smells so awesome once it dries down!

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: A tiny bit more fruity then the original to me. a little stronger on he pear note . But else i am whit the other . This is so close to the original.. Hmm.. i havening a little flash back to my brothers car whit lots off wunderbaum.ha ha ..

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content: I tested it in the store. Too me it smells almost the same as the original Britt eau de toilette which I own. I don't smell any difference.. It has a prettier bottle than the original Britt, but nothing new here.

product_name: Burberry Brit Summer for Women Burberry
review_content:
The top notes are fresh and green, lifted by the lime and tea notes, and the pear adds just a touch of fruitiness, without causing the fragrance to feel sweet.

In the heart of the fragrance, I can't say that I detected peony or almond specifically, or any of the individual base notes, for that matter. What I did experience was a gradual increase in dewiness of a cool, green, minimalistic scent which evoked memories of sun-warmed blades of summer grass and the green Bumble and Bumble Seaweed shampoo I used to love a long time ago.

And just as I was beginning to think this clean, fresh, green, and somewhat unisex fragrance would be perfect for hot summer weather, I walked outside into the cold rainy morning, and realized this is a perfect "California Winter" scent for my skin.
This is basically a weaker version of Aqua Di Gio Profondo with a different opening.

Indigo was my very first real big boy fragrance.

I do not know if it is because of the memories of this fragrance being the culprit for me starting my fragrance collection/journey, but it smells absolutely amazing to me.

There is nothing else quite like this on the market, and it does not smell generic. There is a nice, unique mint note which makes this stand out from everything else I have.

Perfect 10/10 for me, but again, it could just be because I am biased to it.

While I can't say it smells like curry/celery, I still can't say I enjoy Indigo. Maybe it's my skin, but the herbs in here feel thick and inescapable to the point of giving me a headache. In theory this one should be a "love" for me based on listed notes, but as a composition I don't really think it works.
Just water with pepper — a poor man’s Profumo.

In the opening there is a very strong scent of celery curry. I feel the same tickle in my nose! In any case it gets away after some minutes to leave room for an aquatic, minty, herbal, spicy scent that I like very much.
As a blue fragrance, meant to be safe, good for any season or occasion, I like it a lot, more than BDC and Dylan Blue for sure!! but that's my taste.
Got it as a gift. Really nice unique minty woody freshness. I like it really much!

Sleeper. Ordered a backup immediately.

I love the hate that this gets. Shows the shallow, delicate nature of the 'noses' here.

Anyone with any skin in the game at all for any length of time will get Essenza in the mid and drydown.

And don't sniff this up close on skin. I don't think this was designed for arm-sniffing. FK composes many fragrances that are made to be smelled IN THE AIR. Yes it projects. Yes it performs. Not a 'beast'. Wasn't meant to be.

No one is going to say 'Wow! Something smells great!' .....

...And then run up to you, grab your arm or sniff your neck on-skin and say 'I changed my mind I hate this now it smells like celery!' 'Or curry!'

If it doesn't work on your skin, fine. Tell the community how horrible it is, and keep the rating low, so there is less of it floating around and those of us that love it can continue to enjoy it.

I can't stand lux perfume for men. It's very rare for me to smell something doesn't trigger a "meh" reaction. And this is one of them. No trace of grandfathers, daddies, locker rooms in the gym, deodorants, shaving foam etc. Fresh, clean, light. The first lux composition in the last couple of years has gone on the shelf in a full bottle
Careful with this one. Got as a sample a while back, but it smells exactly like curry on my skin. Apparently that's not just me, so be wary. Maybe it will work for you, but it didn't for me.

Really underrated sleeper fragrance, a safe wear. It is on the generic side, but along with a nice combination of notes, that to me smells like the rural Pacific Northwest. Pretty decent projection and longevity too. Judging by other reviews, it might not be a safe blind buy.

This is a very versatile sleeper frag. Minty and the musky dry down. Wear it on your shirt for all day performance. Office safe, perfect for just about anything. This is a MFK underrated drag. But let people sleep on this.
Literally smells like a cheap , typical men’s perfume. Though sometimes it smells like nothing but alcohol. It’s a very “blue” scent in the most boring way possible. 2/10
Smells like salad

This is the sexiest frag I've smelled on my partner. He wears others from time to time, but this is the only one that really draws me in. Fresh and very masculine. This is exactly what a real man smells like to me.
One of the best mints on the market in my opinion, but yes, it's not the most unique or magnificent perfume ever made but it has its good side if we don't compare it.

Whoa the rosemary opening in this waaay too much. Smells terrible. Once the rosemary dies down, it starts to smell good, fresh and minty green, versatile..Then the hedione mid gives off a funky weird smell which makes it smell bad again. In the air it smells a lot better. On skin it smells terrible. This one had some potential but Id pass if I were you.

This one smells exactly like ADG Essenza; when I first applied this beauty it smelled like mint or some type of herbal note, half hour later the Essenza smell unexpectedly and I’m so happy that I gave this badass a try
the first thing i remembered when i first sprayed Indigo was... walking into a chinese medicinal shop here in Malaysia. strong harsh herbal aroma. but it dryed down beautifully soon after. love it !
Like most have said best in the line,kurkdjian would charge 5x the price on his own label.a little gem 4nowt.

It's a bit of a hidden gem.
I just returned from a fragrance haul, and this one was included in it . What a surprise ! It's incredibly fresh and delicate. While it's not overwhelming, it lingers beautifully on my skin for a solid six hours. It doesn't project strongly, or perhaps one becomes nose blind after a while, but I can still catch hints of the scent even after six hours. It's close to the skin but certainly not a mere skin scent. Discovering it was a pleasant surprise, and it's definitely a keeper.

Update: I was wearing indigo a few days ago and sprayed it onto my t-shirt as well . Now I am doing the laundry, 5 days later and the T-shirt still projects like a beast , fresh like it’s nobody’s business 👍

Nice and fresh fragrance perfect for the summer.
Mouthwatering minty citrusy scent with that nice hint of florals and woods.
Could only be a bit more powerful on the sillage and longevity.
Strong recommendation though.
This fragrance is incredibly subtle. Even after applying generously, you'll only catch occasional hints of a vaguely minty scent.
Fantastic summer frag with refreshing mint note and great performance.. ❤️

I just sampled this and it is very very familiar.
It took me a while to place it but once I did and I went to my collection it was remarkable how close it was and you're wondering what the cologne was!.... it was vintage 1992 Chanel Egoiste Platinum with the platinum on the bottom the original first vintage.
They both have a certain note that's prominent, they're oh so similar

A great hidden gem of a fragrance. It's minty fresh and a heavy green aromatic type of fragrance. Also it has amazing longevity on me for an edt. Also there is no curry smell on me either that I noticed that some others get from it.

Maybe it’s just me, but this cologne will always stand out and be close to my heart. It has a peppery, fresh and poppy scent to it that I found grey from spring and summer. This was my got to fragrance in high school and I have yet to buy another bottle since. I would recommend this for someone just getting into fragrances looking for a cheaper option. The longevity is decent and projection is alright so it’s nothing that’s going to receive a lot of attention.

CURRY
It’s fine, nothing amazing, pretty middle of the road men’s designer fragrance with a lot of curry thrown in.
Very poor performance bring this to a 'dislike'
VERDICT: for lovers of indian food
Herbal citrus fragnance. Nothing special. 3/10

First scent i get is like nettle bushes.. as usual it feels like somebody swooshed listerine in their mouth and the air onto me. Its so cold and fresh in a not so good way like every other male perfume, this is a EDT however so fair enough . But might as well just but any axe body spray instead. Soooooo boring. If u buy this u would smell better without it

To me, the opening is a blast of curry and celery-like odor. Not what you want on your skin! However, once it dries down a bit, it evolves into a really great, uniquely fresh fragrance. I personally believe that if this is discontinued, it will reach Gucci Pour Homme II status.

This one is just really likeable for me except for the performance. Couple hours projection and a couple more hours for skin scent. First time I tried this, it just made me think of Florida. Cloudy, damp days surrounded by green nature and citrus groves. I don't get that image for every wear, though, which is one of the reasons I like it. It can smell a bit different for every season in different situations. Today as it dried down, I smelled like I was covered in a lemon herb sauce ready to be eaten like a chicken breast, haha.
Seriously, this stuff smells really good and not synthetic at all. It's cheap on discounter sites so that's a big plus.

In my initial review I called this fragrance generic and weak, but I recently had a funny experience that has made me change my mind a bit.

I had planned to go to a concert with a couple of my male friends, so I wanted to wear a low amount of a relatively uncontroversial cologne. As soon as I got to my pals house, we went down stairs into his basement to jam a little bit. I had played drums for about 5 minutes then came back up the stairs to get a bottle of water. At this moment his mom came out of her room, and started walking down the stairs from the second floor of the house. Before she even got halfway down the stairset she said “someone is wearing WAYYYY too much cologne” which was equally as funny as it was embarrassing. Bear in mind I was on the opposite side of the room on the floor beneath her as she was saying this, and I had only sprayed 4 times. I was honestly shocked by this reaction because I had considered this one to be pretty weak and not a stand out in my collection compared to some other bottles I own. I still think you could do better for $40-$50, but it’s good to know that the fragrance works.

#205 of my "Tour de Fragrance"

My experience with Burberry scents so far: Hero-reliable but boring, Touch-uselessly weak, Brit, London-generic. Indigo is not bad, it's just another generic scent. "Meh." Burberry Classic remains the only scent in the line I'd bother with, and I've not bothered with it. My one non-negotiable is performance. Indigo is not great, but it's okay. It has some projection till morning coffee break. It's a skin scent to lunch. But there is nothing here that isn't already on my fragrance shelf many times over and in scents I've given away. Nothing unique or that draws notice. In that sense it's much like Hero, but not quite as good in the dry down, and I've already passed on a bottle of Hero. Indigo is office safe, even carpool safe, so there's that. But once it dries down it really smells like you didn't wash off the shave cream after you shaved. So, I think its 3.88 rating is about right. It's a nondescript, indistinct, unidentifiable, characterless, middle-of-the-road scent (and who really wants that?). This was a sample for me, and I see no need for more.

Orto Parisi has a fragrance very similar to this, Megamare, yet Mr. Burberry Indigo takes the win all day every day. Truly, a very unrecognized and forgotten dark horse fragrance that will sadly only gain notoriety upon discontinuation.
FK and Burberry were very ballsy to release a "niche-like" fragrance out for the mainstream consumer. Those days of designers putting out daring and off the beaten path type fragrances have long been over, and Mr. Burberry Indigo is a prime example and reminder of what unfortunately happens. Bottle this up under Amouage instead of their new junk and the fragcomm would be flipping out "Have you tried the new Amouage??? They back OMGGGG!!"
Mr. Burberry Indigo is cheap, it's wonderful, it's unique and it will rise to amazing gem status in the near future.

Reminds me of a polished off code colonia on opening, has that dry, smoky type thing going on like clinique happy, lots of citrus here, tart, yes, verging on the smoky tart. If you have ever smelt someone who sprayed perfume after they had a cigarette…thats what i mean 🤣 smoky, dry, tart, fruity. This branches off with aquatic accords. Very pleasant.

Extremely spring-y and green to me, more so than "indigo." My mental image is of a pond in a Japanese garden on an overcast day (I love it on a rainy spring afternoon), but this is not a minimalist or ethereal scent. I would also say it's unusual; this is not reminiscent of any of the other big name blue fragrances. You might expect a minty citrusy blue, from the listed notes. That's not what I smell.

While I like it quite a bit and am weighing buying a whole bottle, the "curry" (cumin??) note others have mentioned is real, but probably depends as always on your skin.
Fresh, modern and versatile. Perfect for Summer, Day- Time. I purchased a Shaving Cream for a friend of mine as well.

It's a very masculine, very young yet dark scent in my opinion. It is a really different scent with the dominance of green spices, citrus and the intense use of masculine water notes. A signature worthy of Kurkdjian, I can say.
Smells like curry, celery and mint + water. Not what it's supposed to be, it performs weird on some people's skin, but even when it's messed up it smells pretty good, even if it's curry and celery

You've smelled this before. You may already have something that smells like this or close. Minty green, slightly aquatic, inoffensive, "shower gel" blue, versatile, mass appeal. It is quintessential designer for modern men. It fits the brief and can easily be lumped in with the rest of the blue fragrances (Sauvage, Bleu Chanel, Invictus, Carbon Luna Rosa)...but...

Francis Kurkdjian can make a fragrance and a darn good one. This is no exception. What first smells familiar and derivative actually shows some complexity every time you smell it. The aldehydic green notes remind me of old school powerhouses while the aquatic tones make it up to date.

Don't get me wrong, it's a like for me, not quite a love. However, I won't be surprised if I keep going back to this time and again; above the other fragrances I have that can do the same thing.

This is truly a GEM, perfectly blended, herbaceous minty fresh, and slightly aquatic, this truly shines in the heat as the rosemary, mint and aquatic qualities really shine. This is a must-have in my collection perfect for summertime.

Smells pretty good. Opening is bad though. Not quite to my liking, too herbal. Like icy-hot or something. It stays like that for some time but in the air it is quite nice. Fantastic sillage, moderate longevity, alright projection. I do recommend it though.

Scent: 7.5/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 9/10
Projection: 8/10
Presentation: 9/10
Overall: 8.3/10

Gave this one a lot of chances. Just couldn't get into it. On paper it looks like it would be a hit, but the execution isn't good. It smells like some sort of herbal ointment, but not in a good way. It seems to temper a bit more in the summer time when the greens soften up a bit. I believe I wanted to like it most solely based on the presentation. The bottle is gorgeous.

I see the comparison to azzaro aqua but where azzaro is more airy, sweet and youthful, Mr burberry has a bit more debth. It's greener and more mature but still maintains its freshness. Think of fresh cut cucumber. It's perfect for those sweaty hot days as the iso super helps this fragrance last on skin.

This has, to my nose, an almost celery-like note in the opening that is not entirely unpleasant. I get the same celery note from Sauvage Elixir. I’m going to enjoy this in the coming months when the weather gets warmer.
To me it smells like curry? Idk why it smells like a curry type scent. Smells extremely unique though.
Same as Roadster Sport by Cartier 🙂

This will be a collectible in 5-10 years.

I find enjoyment in this fragrance. Sure, it could have been better, but this fragrance is what it is.

When this is discontinued in the future people will look back and think "Ya know, Mr. Burberry Indigo wasn't that bad of a fragrance after all."

The top notes gives the subtle fruity fragrances.However, from somewhere getting the fragrance of peppers.Perhaps from the middle notes combination of herbs.Good value for money, a great choice for evenings.

Her mevsim kullanılabilir ama yaz için çok uygun bir parfüm tam bir aquatic.Maison ustalığını sergilemiş bu parfümde.
Koku:10
Kalıcılık:7
Belirginlik:7

It can be used in all seasons, but it is a very suitable perfume for summer. Aquatic.Maison has demonstrated his mastery in this perfume.
Fragrance:10
Longevity:7
Sillage:7
Mint, water and violet notes stand out during the entire formation. There is also a trace of spiciness. This perfume is refreshing, but overall the smell reminds me of a stern lawyer / businessman...

Not many indigo or purple scents out there, this one is really nice if you want a creative, herbal aquatic. A unique and fresh scent from a master perfumer, ready to fill up the color spectrum on one's cologne shelf. Cool, classy, and for once true to the description from the company: An oceanside breeze off the cliffs of Britain.

I want to warn you right away. If you have previously owned hamsters or other rodents - The "hamster cage" effect is real and kept me from buying a bottle. Beautiful, strong, even formal, but unfortunately, a nostalgic olfactory misfortune at times for me personally. Do not let it keep you away from testing this one out, but it does require sampling with this degree of "unlikeness". A typical Burberry scent: bold, brave, and quirky while somehow polite and contemporary.
Does anyone else get curry vibes with this?😐,im getting strong coriander/cumin in there,maybe my nose is broken 🤷🏻♂️

I see mint being mentioned over and over.
I get it, but I think it smells like black salty liquorish.
Very interesting.
This smells like a spearmint infused Acqua di Gio. Very nice if you are looking for a mint-based freshie.

One hand ADG and the other Indigo, along that DNA but NOT the same. I feel like a walking spicy bitter herbal tea when I spray this on. Not a very well balanced green fragrance IMO. The only thing I like about it is the fresh mint. This is definitely not a safe blind buy.
Was at Sephora trying out some new scents, came across this and the initial whiff reminded me of a hamster cage.

I just can’t get behind this one no matter how hard I try.

It’s too green and spicy. There’s something incense-y I detect from Mr. Burberry Indigo, slightly smells medicinal.

One thing I can say about this scent, it’s unique and if you like it, you won’t quickly get bored of it.

Not my cup of tea, but I can see older guys pulling this off.

I've never smelled ADG but this perfume is quite nice. It has a soft, mildly spicy aromatic freshness to it. The mint and rosemary really cut through and are noticeable notes, they're almost addicting. It's definitely more fresh than the other Mr. Burberry scents. It isn't a spectacular scent, but the well rounded blend of all the notes does make it a nice smell. It has the typical designer generic vibe to it, but the mint is stand out. Not sickening like Beach Hut Man (amouage) mint, a much milder and smoother mint.

7/10 scent.

Projects pretty good for 2-3 hours, then it's a skin scent. But i could pick up wafts of through the day for about 6-7 hours.

id consider a bottle at a cheap price.

Had this on for a few hours now. Its like bitter Acqua de Gio....got cheap for like 25 bucks for 100ml - great. Yeah. Its a more masculine version of Acqua de Gio. I enjoy the original and the flankers...this has same floral note as the OG AdG but attenuated by the bitterness...feels like it lasts longer too It grows on you. Its pretty cool. You know it reminds me of Sauvage. Doesnt smell the same way...but its aromatic and attenuated like that but with different notes. Kind of genius really

Citrus aquatic opening does smell a bit like aqua di gio. Verrrry bitter rosemary sets this apart for sure, but they share an opening accord.

Have this layered under Fahrenheit edt & it’s pretty glorious on a very merry day in May.

A youthful spring/summer freshie. I agree that it is not like Armani's ADG, but it is very reminiscent of D&G's The One Sport. I gave up on The One Sport because of its appalling performance, though Indigo is slightly better performing and more fairly priced, albeit modest in terms of projection. Not expensive smelling, but all the same, thank you Burberry for releasing Indigo!

Very unique scent, does not smell like acqua di gio so here's what it actually smells like.

Opening is very minty & citrus but it's also quite aquatic in the opening, then it becomes more green/herbal and you can smell the rosemary in here but the fragrance always remains very fresh, minty, citrus and I think the rosemary combined with mint and citrus is just a gorgeous combination it gives a super fresh and unique scent with a lot of character.

With this said it actually reminds me a little bit of D&G K EDT, because it is slightly spicy and green smelling and it does what D&G K EDT does but just a little better in my opinion.

Don't be put off by the rosemary in this, it comes across as a slightly more herbal juniper smell in this fragrance.

To me this is one of the most unique fresh fragrances out there, it's full of personality and character and makes a great signature scent. Not a scent for everyone though, don't blind buy and also performance isn't the best but also not too bad either.

It doesn't deserve any hate and more people need to give this fragrance some love, plus look at the perfumer it's Kurkdjian the man knows his stuff!!

This is a surprisingly good outdoor spring fragrance.

It's a well blended, fresh herbal, not too citrusy or too sweet. Really quite good in the right season and weather (spring), and not very expensive.
My favourite of Burberry's middling offerings.

And no it is not at all a clone of Acqua Di Gio. It's far less citrusy, and much more herbal fresh.

This is freakin' Acqua Di Gio man.
Like not even a little bit but full blown...which is a good fragrance in itself but, you buy a fragrance for it's own, not to be a copy of something else.

Fortunately for me, I got this sample when I bought another fragrance.

To everyone else, if you have Acqua Di Gio, you don't need this... and if you don't, you can go with this. Longevity is excellent for me.
Spring time is golden but can be pulled off for the summer as well.

"It's not what I expected". How is that even possible to expect how a perfume could smell before you smell it?? I'm cooking about 4 days per week, I know really well the smell of celery and this one it's not even close for me. I can smell rosemary, fresh mint and something heavy-smoky. I think that comes out of oakmoss. I enjoy freshies with oakmoss (p.ex. Hacivat). For my own taste it's a modern masterpiece and the first thing that came to my mind was Acqua di Gio Profumo. They are not the same juice but in the same philosophy. It wasn't my intention to offend someone and if I did it I apologize.

I am agree this smells like a more fresher Aqua Di Gio. I enjoy this right between spring and summer. Last about 6 hours and projects good for the first hour. Not groundbreaking but it isn't bad either.
Just rosemary. 1.5/10

Functions as a good summer work fragrance, especially when I'm set for a day of concentration-heavy work. I can also go straight from work to gym with this and it doesn't smell out of place. Something about Rosemary puts me in the mental "zone" seemingly powering up my working memory and promoting a calm and collected state of mind. When I'm feeling flat it gives me a zing and when I'm too fired up it soothes me. Probably not the biggest compliment magnet per say but it's more for myself, it's inoffensive and it does it's job well for what I intend it to be.

Smelled this at my local Sephora and was not a fan. I was expecting something totally different. One reviewer commented that it smells of celery and I understand why. The initial smell is something that is bitter but aromatic, kind of like celery. Then, as you get deeper there is something else but that perfumy celery is so strong that I can’t make out what it is.
Not for me, I wouldn’t blind buy. Make sure you smell before.
Celery in a bottle. Why oh why.

In general I don't care for the fresh aquatics so I won't review this one. But I am blown away that anyone could say this reminds them of ADG Profumo. Maybe Profondo but no way Profumo. If someone was looking for something in the vain of Profumo based on the 'reminds me of' they will be seriously disappointed.
Like a review below…..go up to a mint leaf…..smell it…..Burberry Indigo.

This is straight up OG Aqua Di Gio with mint and it’s bomb. I’ve been smelling Aqua Di Gio since I was a kid and got that vibe immediately.

I received it as part of a sample pack my girl got me from Sephora. Out of all the scents, I liked this one and Aqua Di Gio Profondo. And for 40 bucks for a 3.3 once on fragrancenet, it’s beyond a steal IMO. For sure there are better more well blended scents out there, but for a day at the beach, after the gym, casual little adventures, even to work when your burnt out on that Bleu de Chanel and Sauvage, Indigo hits.

Performance isn’t bad, it’s super inoffensive, and it’s really clean smelling. The mojito of fragrances.
Never had as visceral a dislike to an opening as this. Tested a sample and it was an immediate no. Maybe the drydown is better, but it smelled like pepper and herbicide over ADG and ... yuck.

This is super underrated in my opinion! I don’t see this getting as much love as other designer fragrances, but this one is unique. Minty and herbal goodness, this is like the dictionary definition of a ‘green scent’. I use this year-round, but I really like it in the spring and summer where it shines best imo when the higher temperatures really bring out the notes I feel. Longevity is not amazing, but I still get like 4-5 hours on my skin. All in all, a nice scent that you can appreciate on your fragrance shelf. If this was a niche label like Creed or PDM, people would be raving about Indigo.
Really like this one,surprised it didn’t get more attention

Off the top, I definitely get the fresh ADG comparisons, albeit with an herbal undertone. Unfortunately, for me, this herbal note becomes prominent and takes on a strong savory celerycelery salt note. This overshadows the fresh mint to the point it becomes unpleasant.
I don't want to disparage the scent at all, but would say please try before you buy as this scent seems to perform differently based on personal skin chemistry.
Good for a gym scent, 6.5/10.

Go up to a mint plant and smell it. That’s this cologne. The opening is a bit harsh, but it dries down to a very clean herbal scent with a slight sweetness to it. Light, wearable, and not at all overpowering or cloying. Definitely a good spring/summer fragrance.
Why does this smell like celery? Ew...

Green aromatic by Burberry.
It opens nicely with Green Mint and Rosemary notes and a touch uf fruity citrus. As it develops Mint becomes more sweet and Rosemary less prominent, also Tea and Violet notes are becoming apparent. Dry down is a classic modern woody with a pinch of Oakmoss. Nice release by Burberry and it should have been recognized.

For me: 7/10
Mr. Burberry indigo is a very herbaceous scent. It opens up fruity with a slight touch of mint. I love it. It dries down to this bubblegummy type scent (which I love). Overall, great fragrance.

Smells fantastic to me. A very contemporary men's "cologne" smell. Indigo is not a fragrance that is blended into one "perfume". Rather, a kalaidoscope of all the notes, and they are very complimentary, of equal tone and they sort of sparkle together. You can easily single them out for your attention when you choose. A dance is performed for your nose and imagination. It's a delightful, baroque water garden impact, like the gardens of the Villa d'Este. So modestly priced yet elegant and effortless. The water garden dance lasts about an hour - which is decent for a "cologne" type fragrance. Then it's a pleasant mint and wood, which really is a bonus because many pretty cologne waters just disappear after their lovely opening acts.
I think it is an okay scent. Very aromatic and masculine scent. Green and spicy as well.

I’m actually pretty surprised by this one. Didn’t think I would like it as much as I do. To me, there is a acqua di giò profumo vibe over this, but it’s sweeter. Very versatile, and pleasant. Longevity is pretty good to. At the price, this is a win for me 👍

I don't have a lot to say about this, it's nice. I do like the smell it's versatile, it's quite moderately strong lasts about 4 hours on my skin and I get compliments for it.. nothing more to say it's a nice versatile fragrance..

Smells nice reminds some herbal adg, like profondo, with a touch of hugo. On the other hand this is the least lasting fragrance in my collection. I thought some of my perfumes didn't last long but with this one I literally discovered the new depth of short lasting fragrance.

The opening is definitely different and a bit odd at first, kind of synthetic.
Right up front it’s citrus then the mint and rosemary followed quickly by the tea and sage. I find this fragrance reminds me of one I used to own called Freshwater from Bath and Body Works which is an Aqua di Gio clone.The biggest difference is this fragrance is blended a bit better and “toned down”. Once it dries down, it’s woodsy with the iso super. I don’t get that much Amber or Oakmoss…very subtle.
It does remind me a bit of Aqua di Gio Profumo which I own. Profumo is just a bit richer, but they are similar. Profumo on me is a beast.
I don’t find it to be anything more than moderate in the performance department.
It really needs the warmth of summer to bring it to life. I do enjoy wearing it as it doesn’t smell like anything else in my collection…definitely different and definitely masculine. It seems to do better on my clothes than on my skin.
If you like “green watery” Frags, you will probably enjoy this one.

Scent 7
Performance 6
Sillage 5
Longevity 6

This reminds me of one of the first fragrances I bought as a teen. This is Cool Water Deep with more mint
(Cool Water deep is discontinued and can go for a lot of money these days).
I like this because of the 90's blue/green/herbal nostalgia. But I wouldn't wear this much (tis why I bought the 50ml bottle), mainly because it smells too 'generic'. But every now and again I crave a throwback to my youth. This satisfies my craving.
I'm a little surprised Francis Kurkdjian created this.

Its a herbal, green, ozonic fresh scent.

I can detect lots of rosemary in opening, which made it a quite unique scent.

After that, the mint starts to blend with rosemary and it turns from green to slightly aquatic fresh scent.

The longevity is quite good, sillage and projection is moderate.

A good scent for me but not for those who hate the herbal bitter scent.

Being relatively new to the frag world- I was very interested in adding a mint fragrance to my collection. After discovering Kurkdjian was the nose behind this and my affection for Burberry Touch, I thought this might be a good place to start. The opening is undeniably fresh, a spearmint bomb if you will. The spearmint though is somehow juicy/sweet at the same time, almost mouth watering IMO. The dry down is absolutely gorgeous, reminiscent of a basic ADG DNA but with that beautiful spearmint. Lol, I suppose a “spearmint-infused ADG” would be the easiest way to describe the scent.
It is quite versatile IMO, the mint notes give it a cooling, sophistication that make it suitable for most all seasons & occasions. The 100ml was an absolute steal at $28. This could be my new signature, but then again I do love mint...

Really like this one after the initial 10 min or so opening.
Really reminded me of Burberry weekend at the start which I'm not a huge fan of. Smells very orange peely to me.
I sampled this from one of those little splash on bottles so maybe that has something to do with my experience of it.
I'll need to sample again with a spray bottle in store some time.

Indigo is a very good Mr. Burberry flanker. Its aroma is herbal, citric and woody.

The output is very fresh, it can smell herbal, green notes, such as mint and rosemary, surrounded by citrus and floral notes, these first minutes are very pleasant, as if we were smelling a mojito.
As the minutes pass, the green notes are maintained, the citrus fruits are reduced, but a woody and aquatic base emerges. It reminds me a little to Artisan Blu.
Indigo is a daytime fragrance, perfect for use during summer and spring because of the fresh trail it gives off. In fact I liked it more than Mr. Burberry EDT.
Its duration reached an 8 hrs., With regular projection
A seller on eBay has them now for $36 for 150ml

Raysmooth
I wonder where such gifts are for $33 ?))

This was a unexpected gem for me,blind buy worthy if u like mint,got a 150ml bottle for 33 bucks,it was a absolute great deal,this frag deserves more love.i don't get the acqua di gio or profumo comparisons,to my nose it smells more similar to dylan blue than acqua di gio.to me it smells like a mix of dylan blue and boss bottled unlimited,performance is solid as well

What are people thinking that rate this as similar to Gio is beyond me. It is nothing like either Gio or Profumo at all. This is a super soapy Irish Spring/Alfred Sung Homme type of fragrance, aromatic if you will. Not my thing but projects decently.
Fresh aquatic herby scent on my skin which lasts a decent amount of time. Reminds me anyway of Bvlgari Aqua a lot! Works for me 👍

At first I enjoyed the different herbal notes: the lemon, rosemary, sage, and the dominant mint that stays for the whole duration of the ride. However, these notes began to take on a food-y, savory quality, as if they were garnishing a dish of yellow rice. Eventually, the association became downright unpleasant.

Perhaps I bought a bad bottle, but my parents seem to love this one. I was happy to pass it on to them.

What a fantastic scent this is. To my nose I am picking up an herbal mint tea. Im VERY surprised so many people have not sniffed out more of that tea note in this. To me the tea is pretty prominent in this.

It actually reminds me somewhat of another "Indigo titled" frangrance from Nest (Nest Indigo). They are both herbal tea based scents to me, but Nest goes stronger on the herbs while this one has mint. I adore Nest Indigo as well.

So happy with this one.
Smells fantastic but the performance is an absolute 0. Longevity is about an hour and projection is non existent

Opens extremely herbal. If you've ever juiced celery, it really reminds me of that scent. This is a pure herbal opening, pure green.

Next it morphs into what could be described as a mix between an herbal Acqua di Gio and CK Eternity Aqua. It's like it wants to be AdG but has a big dose of aquatic herbalness lingering.

I initially disliked this but it's grown on me. Think of it in the vein of John Varvatos Artisan Acqua or Artisan Blu. An age 30+ cologne that isn't super committed to being any one thing, and just smells of a mish mash of different influences. This is like that but it's decent in the end.

When you first spray this on yourself you will get a Muhammad Ali punch of mint, it is very strong but good, the performance is pretty good also, I get about 5-6 hours of OK projection. I blind bought this one and I was satisfied!
8/10

I've being wearing this fragrance for a while now and based on my own experience this scent gives you olfactory fatigue very quickly. Be aware of this before reading all these reviews saying it doesn't performs cause it does. Be careful on the trigger not to choke people out around you. Peace.

It's a nice fragrance, This is a fresh,herbal,woody scent. Top notes : Blackcurrant, Rosemary, Lemon. Heart notes : Violet leaf, Driftwood,Spearmint. Base notes : Amber, White oakmoss,Musk. It opens up with like fresh citrusy then dry down is green woody.It smells like ocean breeze. The Spearmint note is dominant in this fragrance. Best of the Mr.Burberry line. This perfume reminds me of Acqua Di Gio Profondo. I really enjoy it , I love Mr.Burberry Indigo and I'm so glad that I have it in my collection. Longevity is very good. Highly Recommended.
Bravo Monsieur KURKDJIAN !
Two Thumbs Up.
Rating : 8.5 / 10

It's a refreshing scent. The mint note makes it stand out among the many blue fragrances. The performance however is mediocre at best. It becomes a skin scent after 2 hours and I can barely pick it up on my skin after 4 hours. It's a shame because I found the scent itself promising but the poor performance makes it a purchase I regret.
Give this one time, it will grow on you. This is definitely more of an office scent. for some reason it reminds me a bit of prada luna rossa.

Excellent Fragrance with good price.

Fresh, Green, Very cooling dominant mint with some citrus. The mid and base have high dose of iso E super / synthetic woods with acceptable performance.

Very herbal smelling, smells like some roots. It's not my thing. It has an amazing atomizer, the bottle itself is not that bad. The smell is liked by my dad, mom, fiance, just not by me. I wear perfumes that people will like, but most importantly i have to like it. I just can't stand this one. Good thing i got a 50ml for unbelievably cheap, but yet i still feel it was a waste. This is my personal opinion, but i would definitely test it first before purchasing. The opening is what kills it for me.

I love this mass appealing fragrance and best of all it is really good any season. I personally love mint but done right this is done right. I hear performance issues but boy not on me, in fact I am careful with the trigger. The price at discounters are good for this beautiful, quality juice, I am buying a back up for this and Azzaro Aqua as good things never last long with a good fragrance. The companies can’t leave well enough alone and it’s disturbing, and costly for us.

Good cheapie. If I was younger, or better yet, if I had a teenager son who wanted to know a good place to start I would say give Burberry indigo a shot. And it's not a million miles away from louis vuitton l'immensite which has a big price tag.
This is a barely there fragrance. Even after dousing yourself in this, you’ll only get an occasional waft of something vaguely minty.

In the opening I get what almost smells like licorice. It's a big aromatic aroma in the opening and dark too. Once this settles that licorice aura fades and then it turns into a mint bubblegum type of smell that is very good and still maintaining an almost dark blue indigo edge. It's also pretty herbal throughout the duration. If you're patient with this one it will be one you really enjoy especially for the night and warm months. I don't think this is a daytime fragrance but maybe others will, maybe in spring and fall. It's a little musky too the way Kurkdjian usually makes them. Overall it's good and you can smell distinct while wearing this. I give this an 85/100.
90% identical with Paco Rabanne Utraviolet but slightly more fresh and aquatic. Women going crazy about this juice!
I am not sure about this frag. I don't like the opening. It doesn't smell fresh and don't smell mint. Maybe I should give couple more tries.
So Fresh smelling, has ocean air, citrus notes and a touch of spice. Amazing! Must have for my collection.

Green, herbal in the opening & light aquatic green in the dry down..

i would say this is very safe scents for professionals, office wear & formal corporate events..

to my nose it got a transparent Bvlgari Aqva Pour Homme vibe in the dry down..

if i would give a color to describe the scent temperature, i will describe it as Turquoise.

7/10 from me.

Aquatic transparent!

It's starting minty, fresh, herbal.
The development continues with smooth violets, sea feel and transparent base.
You can sense the greenery from original
Mr. version.
Good summer fragrance, in addition to the Mr.Burberry line.
Very herbal, very nice and versatile. 1oz for $15. Great outdoor fragrance. 8/10

The sea note in this is the exact same as:
l'eau majeure d'issey issey miyake
Zara Deep Blue Sea

so if you like the aquatics of this you might also like to check those two out.

I would say this is the superior smelling one of the three to me as it has a nice fresh aquatic citrus opening with some mint and rosemary peeking through.

Unlike the other two I have mentioned this is clean and doesn't have that dirty (almost stale urine smell) in the drydown due to the lack of musk.

Performance is so-so but this really is a casual daytime beach holiday type fragrance so not a dealbreaker.

Blind bought this at a local discounter (Marshalls/TJ Maxx)

I get the mint, and a slight rosemary green with a faint amber base...but its all very light and transparent....this stuff doesn't last long at all. It's a typical 3 hour designer "freshie". Sits close to the skin, no projection.

Probably a good dumb reach for basic summer, gym or office scent, but with the poor longevity....its really not even worth it. Although the scent is just "ok", its very boring and not worth even the discounted price. There's so many much better ones out there for less $.

Will not re-buy, and even though the scent is nice, i still wouldn't recommend to anyone. Not worth wasting your money on this...

The performance reminds me of a "fake" or "knock off", where the initial spray smells really nice,....but then 1 hour later your like "where did the scent go???"

Aquatic, green, hints of citrus, woody/musky background.

This is a very good, feel-good fragrance. It's clean & a little soapy but not in a bad way.

It is true that it is similar to Acqua di Gio, Acqua di Gio Profumo, & a cheapie from the early 2000s called Nice Feelings by Sapil. The same aquatic, citrusy semll, with a hint of woods for all of these 4 fragrance.

Mr. Burberry Indigo is fresh & spicy, casual & happy. It has no similarity at all to any of the other Mr. Burberries.

The performance is really good. Above your average designer fragrance.

Overall, a lovely fragrance that deserves your testing time.

"Love"

Field test:

3 sprays (one on each side and back of the neck). Currently at the 6 hour mark. I still smell it when I stand up or move around. Mostly get a lemon + rosemary/mint at this point with some light woods.

Opinion:

I have not liked a cologne from Burberry since the original Brit for men. The Brit Rhythm and other Mr. Burberry's were completely boring to me. This one is actually enjoyable.

At $30-$40 online, this would be a great gift for a young professional who needs an office scent for his first job.

To be truthful, I was not expecting much from Mr. Burberry Indigo but, I saw it at a major discounter for dirt cheap and took a chance. I’ll say that I have the OG Mr. Burberry edt and that one is a pretty good performer that works anytime of year for any occasion. Not a Tour de Force but, it handles it’s business in a classy way. Indigo just completely punched me in the mouth! Not that it’s ground breaking or Oh My God! different, it’s just a well done fresh, semi citrus with a nice herbal feel to it. Very delightful and as inoffensive as a scent can get. Manly scent with a light fresh vibe that will work anywhere, anytime year round. Yes, probably a bit better for the warmer days but, the overall composition and combination of scents give a very nice overall melding of notes that transform modestly and softly during ones wearing.
