A little lemon & rosemary plus mint at the top and then it goes on a nice, mellow transformation into the mid notes of soft wood, oak moss and a light, semi sweet musk. It really transforms nicely and is a solid performer for me going 6-8 hours. Not to shabby at all......

While both Mr. Burberry Eau de Toilette and Eau de Parfum run toward the direction of Calvin Klein Contradiction, this Indigo version runs directly towards the citric scents I know. To my nose, there's something of Dior Cologne or Armani Code Sport here, but not screaming so loud. Mr. Burberry is here, a bit shy, with the citric ruling the scent. Not particularly original, but nice anyway.

Nice, clean, fresh mint and slightly juicy citrus. Great for summer day time wear. Really nice if not spectacular or innovative. You wont go wrong if you want a clean, fresh mild citrus fragrance for summer.

People have compared this to Versace Dylan Blue. I like both but for me, the two are very different. Mr.B Indigo is much more citrusy (lemon) and juicy, whereas VDB is very one dimensional, focusing on an almost but not quite minty patchouli throughout.

Longevity is OK, not great. Overall, the smell is great.
God that mint wants me to puke.

STRENGTHS: crafted with quality ingredients, smells natural, decent longevity, "nice" smelling, probably safe for work.

WEAKNESSES: pretty generic, not a whole lot of character, expensive for what it is.


CONCLUSION: Mr. Burberry Indigo is a summer fragrance that's designed to be classy but inoffensive.

If your personal style is basic, if you find yourself in conservative environments, if you have some money to throw at a fragrance, then MBI is a good choice. Regular, down to earth people will like it very much. It's great for people who don't know a whole lot about fragrances and want a safe bet.

But if you want a fragrance that makes a statement, if your style is not conservative, if you want a fragrance that expresses your individuality, then MBI is a bad choice. Creative types will find MBI pretty boring. It's not a very stylish scent.

I think of this as being a daytime, professional scent rather than for date night.
One of the best summer fragrances for me. Love every second of this scent, bought the 5oz bottle and couldn't be happier. Just a unique and gorgeous frag through and through
Smells like a lemon grass mojito, if that was even a thing. The mint is very prominent. I can see the appeal, but not a big fan

Minty, fresh, acquatic, long lasting, moderat projection, good price (50€ for 150 ml), made by Francis Kurkdijan.
For me is a winer for this summer!

This scent is considered safe, nothing ground breaking and is compared to other fragrances like Acqua di Gio Profumo, but I’ve smelled most that this is compared to and I find that this is the younger brother that has his own unique twist. Trust your nose and try it, especially if you’re knit picky. Wear what appeals to you for enjoyment.

I actually find this one very refreshing and prefer this to........ It’s perfect for spring casual wear with jeans, T-shirt and going out for the weekend; out and about. This fragrance is minty fresh and the rosemary adds a certain sweetness, further balancing the mint to make it a bit more sophisticated, without trying so you can wear that sports coat into the spring night and it’s still pulled off effortlessly.

The oakmoss base intertwining with the violet add that edge to give it character.

Like most say; this isn’t groundbreaking, but I don’t think it’s meant to be, like Baccarat Rouge 540, Lumiere Noire Pour Homme, Ultra Male or Grand Soir. Look in your closet; you have that clubbing outfit that gets you lucky or that suit outfit that makes you GQ material, which suggest the other fragrances that would fit appropriately with the occasions.

Yet, you also have that road trip favorite pair of distressed jeans and T-shirt outfit that makes your day effortlessly and confident. I believe Mr. Burberry Indigo is the fifth sense to complete the look. Francis Kurkdjian is no mannequin.

I love this masculine down low fragrance and will definetly rock this when I’m chilling. It’s a wardrobe staple.

Also working at the office crowd pleaser.

Mr. Burberry Mojito

This fragrance may have little innovative, as is a custom lately, however It has some "kindness" to be highlighted.

The bottle is beautiful, has an excellent atomizer and I think that Mr (mister) is due to the detail of the bow tie under its huge lid.

1- first impression
Imagine sitting in a bar, facing the beach, feeling the pleasant sea breeze, conversing with your friends, drinking gin tonic, lemonades and MOJITOS; Well, I smell this triple of drinks in this cologne, (in the good sense of the word).

I can perceive very clear the mint leaf and that icy (frozen) and fresh sensation that makes it an "uplifting" smell.

2- Drying:
It reminds me of the 360 Red Men by Perry Ellis, only that in Mr Burberry indigo I feel a lot of rosemary, but both are fresh.

3- Its Name; INDIGO (A variation of the blue color)

Does it smell "blue"? Well, it does not smell like Bleu de Chanel, but if you use your imagination thoroughly, you can feel a little vibe of Polo Blue, but the green notes feel much stronger.

The longevity is good and I do not complain about the projection. It is quite versatile, clean and feels more natural than synthetic. For summer evenings, informal and use in offices.

To be honest I would not pay the $125 that they ask in stores, wait a bit since Burberry perfumes can be obtained at a better price in a few months after launch.

Personally I like it, I do not love it, but I'm glad it's in my collection.

Update: I tested Polo Blue eau de parfum and there is a huge similarity among both fragrances.

This can be best described as a ubiquitous scent. I imagine a European nightclub to smell like this. The inital blast of mint then it is oakmoss and violet. An earthy note. If I smelt this on someone I would think nothing about it. Now a lot people fall into this "safe" brigade, these are the people who wear Black, Navy Blue, or dark grey as it is the safe option. Nothing ground breaking.

Very, very nice. This one has grown on me. I sampled it probably a dozen times before I finally purchased a full bottle.

Other reviewers have compared this to fragrances in the John Varvatos Artisan line, Polo Blue, and Bvlgari Aqua, and more. I honestly don't find this similar to any of the above.

Easy enough to find in major department and cosmetic stores (eg Sephora, Ulta), it's definitely worth testing, but different enough that I'd avoid a blind buy.

The balance of mint, herbal notes, and amber is delightful. The violet is very smooth, not piercing or scratchy in the least. The ingredients feel very high quality. In fact, if you told me this was a new release from Creed, I'd believe it. It feels green in sort of the same way that Green Irish Tweed feels green (but it does not smell like GIT), like garden-fresh and slightly earthy.

Versatile enough that you could pull this off at just about any time of year. I'll be reaching for this one often; it may even be signature scent worthy.
Clearly the best of the Mr. Burberry line

Lemon and rosemary in the top lead to the aromatic heart of violet leaf of violet and mint oil. The base is made of warmer amber accords and oak moss
The Score is
Smell: 4.8/10
Longevity: 7/10
Sillage: 6.5/10
The smell like Varvatos artisan acqua and artisan blu + Ralph Laurent polo blue.

The smell of this fragrance is liked by the majority of women .
The fragrance is striking for women and brings love directly. Try and will not regret well.


This perfumes reminds me a little bit 20% of creed silver mountain DNA why? i dont know ^_^
Longevity :5-6hours. Best
Projection from 1- 2 hours smooth
Bravo Mr burberry

I honestly blind bought this one.

I am glad I did. $53 for a 150ml GIANT bottle. Couldn't pass that one up.

Upon first application, I immediately got a Varvatos Artisan Acqua/Artisan Blu vibe. Although they are similar, they also share their differences...which in this case is good.

The above Varvatos's are good, however, they turn very original really fast.

What separates this from the rest is the lovely, prickly, green mint and rosemary. This is an absolute beautiful use of the spicy rosemary. There is just enough to give this stuff a superb green dimension without being too "in your face." This is hands down the best recent/modern Burberry release. Very casual, very easy going, very appealing, and most of all different enough to establish itself.

OVERALL:

I get a lovely mint and spicy/prickly rosemary mixed with some aquatic notes infused with some violet and a juicy oak moss.

---Nothing new. In fact, it's 'similar' to Varvatos Artisan Acqua/Artisan Blu, however this is just so much better. It has more dimension and overall depth.

Also, the last thing I want to add is that this is my go-to bedtime scent. I've hardly ever worn frags to bed, but for the past 3 nights I have wanted to wear this. This is somehow incredibly comforting and uplifting. I love wearing this stuff before I fall asleep.

Another girl and I were literally stalking a guy at the mall who was wearing this fragrance...I wanted to know what it was so bad! This perfume made the dude wearing it incredibly attractive to me for some reason, maybe because he looked so clean and refined when he walked past...classic masculinity.

This definitely made all the ladies turn their heads that day haha

Excellent flanker. Minty, fresh, woodsy aquatic done right. Smells VERY natual, as if you crushed up spearmint in your hands that you just picked. No need to over explain. Just imagine yourself on a warm summer day wearing a crisp, white, long sleeved shirt with the sleeves rolled up. Nice pair of chino shorts and a pair of tan driving shoes. You are dressed nicely, but not casual, and not dressed up. That comfortable but well put together middle ground.
You are outside at an outdoor restaurant on the water. Nice breeze, nice view, relaxed. Drink in hand, a vodka and tonic, a mojito, feeling relaxed, confident, soaking in the vibe, the outdoors, and your drink. You aura is calm, confident, smartly dressed.
That is mr burberry indigo. An outstanding summer creation that surpsasses its criminally hated and undervalued flankers. This might be their best fragrance made, period.

Mr. Burberry Indigo is a green summertime masterpiece that smells natural and fresh. I do not mean masterpiece in terms of creativity but masterpiece in the sense that it perfectly executes the concept of a masculine fresh scent without resorting to generic aquatic notes as many others before it have done.

Indigo is undeniably masculine and earthy with realistic mint taking center stage amongst a backdrop of citrus accords. The scent is linear for the most part but that realistic mint note does die down a bit in the dry-down. All in all, a very easy masculine scent to wear. Performance is nothing to write home about but it certainly is in line with majority of modern designer releases.

Indigo is reminiscent of Dior Aqua Fahrenheit. If you enjoy scents similar to Aqua Fahrenheit, Indigo is a must-try. Indigo takes a completely different path than it's predecessors so try Indigo even if you were not a fan of the original or the EDP.

Indigo is a solid warm weather release and in my opinion it deserves a 4/5 ☆ rating
Very green in a good way, too bad it says MR as it could be unisex
I get a major basil note in this one! But don't see any basil in the note breakdown

Mint and rosemary (and I swear some basil is in there). I'm not sure if I like it because it is different, or because I think I can wear it. It is refreshing and could even pass for an essential oil of some sort.

I think this is a casual scent and even a comforting scent. It could possibly be an office scent too.

I don't know if I will buy it at it's current price though. When it gets under $30, I'll give it another look.

I do appreciate the trend of using fewer ingredients and blending them well though. Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.

This is how I like my masculine fragrances, done right. Its smells DAMN good. Fresh and Spicy, not to heavy though. It last and projects. This will draw compliments. Its a good comeback for Burberry to get there sales back up. Its blended good for a Designer fragrance, couldn't really pick up the litsed notes. Go get it, a good buy

Here's a modern take on fougere.
Nice minty herbal fragrance. The mint is very pleasant and uplifting, rosemary gives it a bit of an edge - but still not being too sharp. Everything underlined with very real lemon and a little but of grapefruit and oakmoss in the background.

Fresh, light, quite sophisticated. Good choice for hot summer.

Quite nice addition from Burberry house.

To me 6,5/10.
It stinks. Really, it does.

Nice addition to the Mr Burberry line. Very different from the EDT & EDP to my nose. I get mint and citrus with aquatic notes. There is a resemblance to Ralph Lauren Polo Blue as others have mentioned but this is by no means a copy.

I got 4 hours from 4 sprays today, Summer climate 24C , which is not great but it's decent whilst it lasts and is a safe scent for lots of occasions.

It would be an 8 but performance is slightly lacking. Will test again in the colder months and see who it performs then...

7/10

I blind bought this one. Smells great as a fresh herbal minty scent.perfect for the spring, more than summer because i think its too weak for the extreme heat. Reason being is that it sits well on the skin with low projection. In my country the heat is very high so in my opinion its better suited for spring. Performance is moderate in my opinion. Overall i give it 7/10

I just sprayed some on my wrist and to me it smells 99.99% identical to Ralph Lauren's Polo Blue EDP. Very potent citrus smell but not potent in the overpowering sense. Very fresh and perfect for a summer day. Can't yet speak to longevity but if I had to pick between this and Blue EDP, I would choose indigo purely from a cost perspective; Indigo was going for like $108 CAD (for 100ml) approximately whereas I think I paid around $120-130 CAD for 100ml of Blue EDP.
Nothing new & expensive in India !

Incoming hate reviews. Looks like almost everyone hates "generic" fragrances nowadays. This is the fourth day of me trying Mr. Burberry Indigo. And I can say is that this fragrance is your typical freshie scent. Nothing compared to Mr. Burberry EDT or EDP. It's safe, fresh and the mint man. The mint here is blended magnificently which made the scent really smells ohh so good! Pretty versatile perfume, though I would only wear this during casual/daytime. I do not see it wearing in super cold climates. Longevity is not the greatest about 3-4 hours on my skin. Projection is pretty good on the first hour mark. It projects strongly, but quickly dies down to skin or closer scent afterwards.

It is a safe blind buy for me. I really love the scent! Better than his two brothers(or cousins)! But the performance is quite lacking. It's a new fragrance so it's quite expensive. For now, I would prefer the cheaper Hollister Wave than this or better yet Dylan Blue. I would really love to give a high remark on this if only it performed better!
Oh dear, I have just bought a decent of this without knowing mint is one of the notes, I don't like mint in frags at all so I hope the mint in this isn't overpowering.
The best of the line, in my opinion.

This has the Acqua Di Gio Profumo vibe. Smells terrible on paper, and is way better on skin, so give it a wear. Doesn't project a lot.

All in all, it's a nice perfume for summer evenings. Nothing groundbreaking and if you have Profumo, I wouldn't advise to get this.

I love moss, mint, rosemary, amber and violet, not the best longevity, surely average longevity but very nice scent (too general statement) hahaha, perfect for summer, casual, and work. Some perfumes are close to this stuff, not exactly similar, but they can battling each others

Mint, Moss and Lemon are apparently dominant, very aromatic, very modern, nothing wow, just ordinary, but really really pleasant

I could imagine a handsome navy wearing this perfume on his graduation ceremony, fresh and breeze from the ocean.

Polo Blue RL EDP and EDT
Bleu de Chanel EDP
Dior Sauvage EDT
Mr.Burberry EDT
Calvin Klein Contradiction
Hugo by Hugo Boss

Yet another fragrance doomed to catch hell from almost everyone on this site. It's going to get bashed for smelling too trendy, generic, cheap, so on and so forth. Thing is, does anyone like anything around here? Every release gets treated like garbage. And yet you find that the product sells like crazy once you start shopping. So...this thing is great. Yes, it may feel like it's part of a trend in perfumery. Luckily it's not another sweet fruity invictus thing. It's not for the party going 20something (at least not to my nose), and while I haven't had a chance to wear for a long time, i'm not expecting long life from it. IN my case that is true of most fragrances. So how does it smell? Damn good. get your nose on it if you can sample it and you will probably like it. The opening feels mature without feeling old, which is a great achievement when you're talking oakmoss. violet seems to come to the surface pretty soon and while I'm not a huge fan of violate, i find it pleasant. Reminds me of the violet note used in Bvlgari man. It's strong and almost spicy. Overall I find this a pleasant release, and thanks to a great sales promotion at Macy's I was able to get 1450 for a good price in terms of $/ml. It's still cool in the northeastern USA and for me this is perfect. Looking forward to see what happens at when it warms up. cheers and enjoy your fragrances...even if everyone on this site tells you it's crap. It's yours, on your skin, and if it makes you happy, it's worth wearing!

2nd wearing when the weather warmed up. A few complements. So far the only con is that stores only have the large 150 ml bottle. I don't know if the smaller ones sold out the smaller bottles or that's the only one available outside of Burberry stores.

First impression: Acqua di Gio Profumo in the opening. That rosemary mixed wth lemon its very fresh and green. Then i smell a little bit of mint and oakmoss but the fragrance seems to die very quickly. It starts to smell like others. Boss Night, Be different and Cool Water came to my head. Might be wrong but it seems a mix of all these fresh scents.
Tried it out at a local Macy's. Great opening but light. If you are in an office setting, it shouldn't be a problem. Will have to see if it gets me complements
Call it Mr. Boring. Mr. Boring Blue, instead of Indigo. Because you feel sad and blue when you encounter another mediocre fragrance from Burberry, especially the one signed by Mr. Kurkdjian.
Sounds like a nice fresh fragrance. I hope it perfoms. Burberry has too many less than moderate to weak frags related to performance

Tried this. Nothing common with the previous versions.

A simple combination of modern citruses and mint. Smells natural, but cheap and ordinary.

I was at Miniso yesterday, and one of their perfumes really reminded me of The Beat EDT. It's one of their travel sized "tubular" ones with the Jo Malone looking labels. I think it was the one called Palma Lake, the liquid was blue. Really cheap too! Check it out, hopefully it can be a good replacement for the EDT or even the EDP which I've never tried.

I just got a bottle of this from a seller on marketplace and I was super excited because The Beat is my absolute favorite perfume but it is impossible to find anywhere since being discontinued and a 30ml bottle retails for $300 on eBay. However, I find that it's not close enough to the EDP like I hoped. While I find this perfume pleasant and kind of close to the EDP, it's a lot more fresh and it doesn't have the creaminess of the perfume. Lasting powder is also a lot weaker unfortunately. Overall, it's a very nice fragrance albeit a bit forgettable. I'm going to try the korres Bellflower next to see how it measures up the perfume 🤞

Why was The Beat line ever discontinued? I was given my EDT by a family friend, it was discontinued by the time I started wearing perfumes two years ago so this is the only version I'm familiar with. Just checked the batch code and it's from 2011.

The Beat EDT is citrusy with tea and cedar wood. It's not sweet, mainly very fresh and clean making it perfect for summer. This should have been likeable enough to not be discontinued but here we are. Does Burberry have anything this fresh in their current offerings? I feel like they might have killed off a whole women's fragrance category within their brand with this decision.

I should mention I love the name of this line. From the modern British rock bands inspiration to my own association of the name with 60s beat groups. Does Burberry ever resurrect past fragrances? They should with this one.

This was my fav perfume and unfortunately I can t find It Anymore. It was perfect: fresh and relaxing, I could wear It everytime from morning till Midnight. Versace bright Crystal Is quite similari though.

I've been wearing this fragrance for over a decade and it truly is my all time favorite fresh smell. It's bold and it stands out while also being inviting. I agree with other reviews that it may lean slightly masculine to some, but to me it's more unisex. The scent is not very complex but it's an interesting blend of ingredients.

The Beat, by Burberry, is a tea-like cedar based perfume. It is a spa-like, peaceful, casual day wear type perfume. This could go anywhere and would be appropriate for office, school, dates, errands, lunch, brunch, etc...

The closest thing in my collection is Calvin Klein Beauty which has a similar cedar based lower note which grounds the fragrance and makes it feel more spa-like and down to earth.

The Beat is fairly simple and spa-like. The interplay of notes is young but not juvenile. The chemical interchange of notes has a sparkling Tinker Bell type quality to it...which keeps it from smelling generic. The tea notes have an optimistic type lift that smells fresh and spontaneous almost like the fizz in a carbonated soda pop (similar to a 7-Up/Cola type blend). The tea note seems to be the strongest association but then there is the soda pop fizziness which makes the perfume smell refreshing and commercial.

This reminds me of the younger sister/daughter version of Madonna's Truth or Dare (the 2nd version of Truth or Dare... the darker alto blend). The Beat is a lighter expression - and Madonna's Truth or Dare is a stronger and more mature smelling perfume, but with a similar chemical interplay of ingredients.

The cedar note is nice in The Beat- it has an earthy woodsy quality about it which grounds the perfume and makes it appear more "down to earth".

This general vibe of this perfume is pretty, a bit playful, and trendy.

I like this one.

This is Blake Lively's favorite perfume - I can see that especially after seeing the movie "The Shallows" where she plays the role of a surfer on vacation. The movie is kind of like vacation surfer girl meets jaws - and lives to tell the tale.

----------

If you like this type of spa-like peaceful perfume I would definitely recommend trying Calvin Klein's Beauty. Valentino's Donna Rosa Verde' is also a nice spa-like perfume, that has more of a candy lemon drop type smell to it. It has a similar freshness to The Beat perfume by Burberry.

Burberry Body perfume is fun and upbeat with more of a sweet, slightly sharp, "bubble gum" smell (there are some mint notes which makes this come across like a dentist's tooth polish - the kind that they use when you are in the chair having your teeth cleaned). Burberry Body is sweeter and possibly more juvenile than The Beat, but it also has a vivacious lift to the notes with that type of Tinker Bell sparking quality to it, when it is first sprayed. The longevity of this is short, but the notes are nice while this lasts. Burberry Body reminds me of some of the notes in Viva La Juicy's original perfume.

Madonna's Truth or Dare is very similar to The Beat - I would recommend this if you still wanted to keep with the same general theme of The Beat, but would like to have something that goes more business, elegant, dressy. (The Beat is fairly casual for an everyday type perfume).

-----------

Verdict:

I have moments where I really like this.
There is a subtle stuffy nose thing that is happening with this one, it is almost like it scratches my nose/throat -- very similar to the reaction I had when I tried Ivanka Trump's lemonade perfume. They both irritate my sinuses in some way.

This is less obvious than Ivanka Trump's but - the smell that I get is almost like when the TV is filled with static electricity. The fragrance has a dissonant almost static electricity when I smell it.

I'm sure that this would be good on other people and they may not notice what I'm talking about -

This is not bad - there are truly some great moments with this one -
But there are other perfumes that I gravitate to - a bit more.

Perfect work fragrance. It's fresh in a Zen peaceful way, not in a citrusy energizing way. The dry down becomes sweeter and I get really pleasant whiffs of this as the day goes on. Not girly but not masculine at all. I wish I got a bit more cardamom and cedar but this is beautiful, a staple in my collection now. Easy but not blah. Super different compared to the EDP, which is much thicker and much sweeter. I also love that one but not the same vibe at all.

Blind bought this, looking for a new alternative to my staple CK spring citrus frags.
Love how it smells, but the longevity is SO poor on me. I feel like I got maybe 10 minutes max. I get a lightly floral citrus tea. It's beautiful, but what's the point if it's not even a skin scent anymore after an hour? :(
I decided to give the bottle to my mother, who loved how it tested on me - it smells much more like a woody floral on her, and the longevity she gets from this is hours!! She got tons of compliments wearing it as well. I'm thrilled it worked for her, but I would not repurchase it for myself.
Very feminine frag for every day use. Office safe. I have similar parfume from Betty Barclay - Pure Pastel Mint. It reminds me just a bit of Lacoste Pour Femme. Same powdery feeling.
I don’t know why but all I smell is a fuel type of scent with this fragrance.

I have to confess that I love humble bergamot scents and this one is one of them for summer. Close to Bergamot The Body Shop discontinued, which I had back around 2005. wood and cardamom just walked path by these and waved at them. Now it is pure bergamot (earl grey tea with lemon), and purfect in 30 degrees celsius in shade Hungarian summers.

I wore this as a teen and it brings me sweet memories. I liked the sort of austere almost unisex vibe it gave off, made me feel as close to a strong professional woman a 15-year-old CAN feel.

I liked the grapefruit note, I lived in a place where it was not very popular, it almost felt exotic. Also, I felt like I was fighting against the stereotype of teen girls smelling like candy.

This is NOTHING like candy. It opens sharp and bitter and dries down bitter and herbal. I got a lot of "are you wearing men's cologne??" comments that only made me double down on my devotion to this jus. It fed my aspirations to "not be like other girls". It was a step on my journey to finding my current "scent identity".

Airy and fresh, lovely fragrance!
There is a feel-good, zen quality in this.
I can definitely detect tea, which I love. It's serenity in a bottle, like a yoga session in a spring garden.
I love it. It's much better than the edp, which is sweeter.
I only wish it would last longer.

Loving this fragrance, not as much as the perfume but great for layering as a pair. The cardamon and vetiver are much more pungent compared to the peppery perfume. The sharp citrus and mild tea make these a dynamic duo for all year and all day wear. Very smart, casual scent. Nice to have around.

I bought this back in 2009, I remembered it well because it was my very first perfume that I chose myself during my studies in Europe and there it was generally more green tea floral and dried down powdery on me. I loved it right away (my best friend thought it is kinda dizzying...but I chucked that opinion directly to the bin). I went through one bottle then I came across an old one on sale, from 2012. I am already back in my home country where it is always 27-30 degrees C and after 1 spray the pepper notes jumped at me. I was slightly surprised. I had to layer it with something more floral to get it smelling like it used to. I don't know because it is not very fresh or it has been reformulated. I still wear it though, because somehow the spray mechanism is really satisfying.
Two words: spicy crayons.
I agree with everyone who claims that this is similar to Bright Crystal.

I have a sample of this and I like it. Crisp, clean, with a little spice so it doesn’t fall into the “clinical, sterile” type of scent. I can see owning a full bottle of this. The tea note is present but not overwhelming. I would like a sample of the edp to compare.

UPDATE: so, this is going to sound strange, but I have finally found a replacement for my beloved L’Effleur. It is NOT a dupe, but it gives me the same aura, especially in the opening. Huge thumbs up.

Late spring/summer in a bottle.It has the same vibe as Moschino Funny or Versace Versense. A blast of citruses followed by a relaxing tea note and a just a little bit of powdery iris which last for hours. Surprisingly, sillage and projection are pretty good for an EDT. When it's warm outside and I get tired of my favorite sweet/ oriental fragrances, I spray the Beat on myself and suddenly the day seems less torid and my mood improves. A big like!

My first Burberry perfume. I have wanted to try this brand for so long, being English myself and I know how popular it is worldwide. This is definitely a spring scent, to me, as it is fresh, crisp and clean. However, it is almost like it contains a note I don't like as I get a really sharp scent from it, more suited to a male aftershave - this is quite a masculine smell on first spray and I much prefer the softer more feminine smell that remains after a few minutes. There is an undercurrent of a soapy smell too, which I like in a fragrance. I would wear this during the day and I think this would be a good interview scent, non offensive but something about it says I am in control. I am a big believer in anyone wearing anything male or female and this says that perfectly to me. Just a quick word on the bottle, I hate it. The only part I like is the Burberry print on the glass part. The top of the bottle and the lid are in a cheap plastic and an odd shape and although the perfume inside is more important, I don't like this bottle at all. Looking forward to trying more from Burberry though.
The top note is beautiful but after 30 mins, it's not my cup of tea

Very fresh, very citrucy and grassy. This smells young, sporty and is highly inoffensive. I can wear it year round, best suits me during the day, when I don't want to smell too specific, just need a blast of freshness and uplifting citruses.I reach for it most often before I go to the gym or run random errands. On me I don't get the Elizabeth Arden-type-of-green-tea note (or else I would have disliked this, as I hate the EA green tea!). Overall a very versatile fragrance, short to medium longevity, for the young at heart (or age:)

EDIT: This seems to be getting a lot of compliments lately, both from women and men. Everyone says something along the lines: oh, how lovely and fresh! Ha! This is a keeper for me for sure.

This smells like Bright Crystal on me too! I love this and am so thankful it was gifted to me. This smells like my favorite (Bright Crystal) only BC gives me a headache and this one doesnt! This has lasted pretty good too!!

I blind bought this hoping for a nice, preppy scent for the fall. At first spritz I thought it felt preppy, but in a very sporty and fresh way. The more I wore it, it actually started reminding me of Versace Bright Crystal. It is light and refreshing, but missing whatever that weird note is in BC that turns on me. I think this is lovely for the summer and am looking forward to testing the EDP for comparison.

I think this fragrance is very citrusy, spicy and there's also strong tea note. Something about it smells weird to me, like desodorant mixed with sweat. It also reminds me of cheaper perfumes from the not so fancy cosmetic stores. I know that it's super fancy and popular scent, but somehow it just smells cheap in my opinion. What a pity.

It smells nice. Fresh and feminine. I like to use it when it`s very hot, because it is quite refreshing.

But it`s nothing to write home about. The longevity is an absolute joke, so you have to reapply once an hour.

The EDT is very different from the EDP version. I love the EDP, but this one is just okay.

Sour, sour, sour + melting plastic + pencil shavings + tobacco.
And some green tea, like Elizabeth Arden Green Tea.
Oh, and I can clearly smell indolic jasmine here to, even though jasmine isn`t listed as a note. :-(
Very spicy, all what I can smell is mandarin orange.

Just purchased this today and at first I really did not know what to think of it. The tea note was very strong at first mixed with citrus. Then the beautiful pink pepper note surfaced. I love it. Fresh and just spicy enough to notice, but not to overwhelm the rest of the notes. I am sure that I will enjoy this during the hot summer months to come.
The Beat smells fresh, light and soapy. It is ideal for the workplace but it doesn't last very long

This is a light, fresh tea scent. To me it smells predominantly of green tea, with a slight fruity complement. The green tea note is a true one, it smells almost exactly like dry green tea leaves waiting to be brewed. I appreciate that this smells like actual green tea. I've found that what often masquerades as a 'green tea note' in perfumes smells nothing like the real thing. This one is the real thing. The slight fruity complement makes it smell like a lightly flavored green tea. This is a light, fresh scent that is easy to wear. Unfortunately it does not last very long. After an hour or two it's basically gone from my skin. I've used both the EDP version of The Beat, and this EDT, and I like the scent of the EDT better. Unfortunately, though, it does not have the staying power of the EDP.

I love love love this, this is my signature scent! I feel really good with it... it's really perfect, so fresh, clean, particular and sophisticated too. I get so many compliments when I wear it. I bought my second bottle <3 In my opinion, I don't like edp version, it's different and too strong.

I think this fragrance was created for early spring and early fall. Many girls tell that it's an everyday scent, but for me it's not. I wear it when I have some special mood. It smells very good in sunny and cloudy weather, but I personally like it in cloudy weather a little bit more. I can wear it with jeans and T-shirt, shirts, leather jackets and big manly watch. At the beginning it smells very fresh and citrusy, I can recognize bergamot and mandarin which are a little bit tart. As the time passed, smell of citruses transformes into smell of tart green tea with lemon. I can also feel powdery smell of iris. And the last one note that I can smell is note of tobacco! I think that probably vetiver smells this way on my skin.
Meine Körperchemie lehn dem Duft ab, wie viele andere auch. Schade.

I kinda regret not buying EDP, cause this one unfortunately doesn't last long on my skin. In the opening all you can smell is citrus, but than that goes away and it turns into nicer orange-tea smell.

Actually I'm sort of used to the fact that a lot of Burberry perfumes are opening with the citrus note, but thankfully they all change their scent in a few minutes into something much more sophisticated. I can imagine wearing this after a long morning run. It's sporty and fresh.

After reading all these reviews I was wondering whether I would like this or not.
It's lovely and fresh to start with, the mandarin, iris and quince blossom are all there blending perfectly and you smell just like you've stepped out of the shower. I love smelling like that. Then it mellows into a softer smell which although you think might be fading away (many people have said it doesn't last) it really does last.
I sprayed it in the morning and could smell this beautiful waft around me all day. It's subtle but it's there and it's such a lovely clean smell. I've often envied other women who waft past me smelling so fresh and clean but I'm pleased to discover that can now be ME!! :) If you like strong lingering perfumes then this isn't for you as you will say it doesn't last very long. If you're looking for something clean and feminine that lingers and makes people want to sniff you then this is for you.
I'm finding some of the strong perfumes that last in strength all day make me feel quite sick after a while and you'll find men/women prefer a subtle clean feminine smell rather than those nose burners like Opium, Poison, Youth Dew!! I'm really pleased with this!! I think it's simply lovely and I smell great!! :) Happy Days

got it as a birthday gift .. well i dont wanna sound mean but i didnt like it . smells too masculine and active for me .. really suites an athlete girl!

too citrusy with a bit of cardamom .. nice combination but still not my cup of tea

I am a guy and jus bought this to a good lady friend of mine, I think its a beautiful scent. Its safe for different noses to keep up with since its not out there loud and can be worn to office as well. It will be best for indoors Spring/Summer day times I think. Its not flamboyant, simply beautiful.
I love the EDP version, but this EDT I couldn't even smell. Wayyyy too faint. I sold it and bought the EDP.

My signature perfume right now. Love it! It's spicy, fresh and a little sweet. It smells nothing like the Edp version, I've had both of them. This one smells less musky and vanilla, although I like them both in different ways.

I'm surprised about all those negative or 'meh'-reviews for The Beat EdT as I have to say that for my untrained nose iT is a lovely summer scent. Uplifting, fresh, feminine, rather detectable. Not generic as so many reviews state.

Or maybe my admiration is based on the fact that although I've been looking for a fresh fragrance for ever, high and low, have found nothing but disappointment so far, until I sniffed this. The Beat manages to avoid all those rough corners that have put me off so many times before - it's not sharp nor masculine, it's also not soapy nor watery, not easily fleeting nor annoying. It's not "watermelon-y", not "too young", not too sweet, not air freshener or detergent-like, and not stingy. And to me that says (and means) a lot! The Beat manages to be simple, uncomplicated, refreshing and mood lifting, unpretentious scent, easy to wear, easy to like. :)
This one is a really fresh fragrance, but the tea note smells a little bit like grass on me. :(

My first impression was that of a very generic green tea and citrus fragrance. But who doesn't need one?

I see green tea as the 21st century lavender...a staple,the bottle you reach for when pretty much everything else seems too this or that for the occasion...job interview, meeting with friends, taking the kids to a theme park, a first date why not ?

After I have worn this on the few warm spring days we have had so far, I would say that the intensity of the top citrus notes as well as the somewhat harsh grassy ones weaken after about 30 minutes and let the floral and spicy sides of this composition add some warmth and complexity.The fragrance definitely seems more feminine at that stage, even though it remains on the fresh/casual side.



It has surprisingly good staying power , about 4-5 hours ; Green, herby scents aren't usually detectable on me after 1-2 hours !
Oh, and I love design of the bottle : modern, classy and fun.I have the 30 ml one, very easy to carry around.
LOVE LOVE LOOOVE this one!!!! Thank you Burberry for the perfect, english stile! :-D

I recieved this EDT version today for christmas! :) i asked for the EDP version but my dad buyed this one thinking it was the same scent except lighter, and well it isn't at first i wasn't so excited because i really wanted a new edp (i almost dont have nothing left of it D:) but im really liking it, it is much more woody and musky than the edp but i think is a good perfume and i will grow to like it, and hopefully repurchase both versions :) i highly recommend it. (the only thing that drives me insane is that i don't belive in edt versions because the scent dosen't last, hopefully this will)

This smells light and fresh, nothing like the orginal, thats sad:( I was hoping this would smell like a lighter version like the orginal, I think the orginal smells too strong so i got this version unsmelled. Mistake. i like how it smells, but its too weak, doesent last at all.

I tried this one from my friend, it smelt super fresh and light and eau so good! I didn't aware the huge different between this one and the edp version so I bought the edp under the impression that it will last longer. I was WRONG! Yes, it does last longer but the smell is pretty different! The edp has vanilla note, pretty heavy but not unbearable. The edt just cut the vanilla off so its fresher and lighter. I still love my edp though, but I do appreciate the edt so I am pretty skeptical whether I wanna buy the edt one or not, let's see
My absolute favourite!

I bought this one under the impression it was the EDP. To my disappointment, I didn't find them very similar... This one is a really nice and fresh smell, I can be very sensitive about strong fragrances and this one is not strong at all. Very good for summer. But it didn' have that lovely almondy warm note I get from the original, and the staying power is kinda weak. I usually take a long time to finish a perfume bottle, and because this one is very wereable and doesn't last long on my skin I finished it pretty quickly. Now I want to get the EDP which was the one I was originally going for.

It goes awesome on my skin. I really love notes, especially the base one.

smells like a cheerful girl wearing white puffy knee dress

What a difference a few months make! I sprayed this in February and it did not work (sharp and a little unpleasant) but I sprayed it last night and it was fresh and divine. My girlfiend who was with me at dinner kept complimenting me saying that whenever I moved the beautiful scent wafted over to her! I adore this in the summer months.
Most of all I feel the bergamot, pepper and iris notes in this fragrance, like in the original, only this one is lighter. I don't like both of them. Not interesting at all.

Fresh and youthful fragrance which is perfect for spring but not only. I would say that tea is the key note which is made lighter with some citrus and subtle florals and more defined with some spices. Simple and very clean scent.

I cannot make up my mind about this one. Every time I smell it, it leaves a huge amount of SOMETHING lacking, and I keep going back to smell it to try to "process" the scent but I just can't. My first impression, honestly, was that this smelled exactly like soap. So it's an extremely clean scent, and also quite masculine - I'd say the most masculine off all the Burberry perfumes. This is something I'd wear when I don't want others to think I'm wearing perfume. It would definitely be safe for work since it has about zero projection. The scent doesn't come across as complex and is definitely "safe."

I'm probably going to try to get rid of this bottle. If you are interested please contact me (I have the 2.5oz EDT with the white top).

This one is just so likable. Its really fresh, and floral and powdery all at the same time. Its quite comforting and not sickenly sweet or headache-y. Makes you think of a stunning British summer day when you get up and the sun is shining. Its definately got that energising, green smell as well as the lovely ceylon note. Its a pity the fragrance is a tad weak but I really really enjoy this one.

It's very different from Burberry Brit. When sprayed at first, I could smell alcohol, and after a little time I could smell the scent itself. Has a little freshness on bottom notes. In general it's very weak scent..fades away very quickly unfortunately.
love it.fresh & elegant . English style

This one is a light, fresh floral which is inoffensive without being overly generic. I really like it. It smells like Burberry Sport, except its a sharper floral with a little more citrus to it. If you already have Burberry sport then you don't need this one & vice versa. Staying power is kind of weak.. only lasts about 3 hours.

This one is quite safe and very boring. smells rather nice, creamy and more like a body lotion than a perfume. I dont find this one fresh, still it could be a perfect choice for office or daytime wear if you tend to be shy and dont want to be noticed...quite longlasting...with no up and downs or any surprise.

its not a review its a recollection.i go to lahore to buy all my stuff. so i went to the perfume store and found this!it was perfect.i bought it,came home opened the bland box to lose myself in the spirit of freshness and i found out.....they had bloody given me the wrong one(the pink and silver one which smells totally different)i tried to get it exchanged the next day but the store wouldnt budge so i was stuck with the other one which i didnt love nearly as much as this

Okay, I am a huge fan of D&G light blue. I used to wear it for years. However, I recently discovered that I was allergic to it and it made me itch. So I had been searching for a replacement and I found it!!! I absolutely love this scent! Its nice, light, and fresh and has similar notes to Light Blue. But its not as popular (wish I love) because too many people have seem to discover light blue.

When I first put this on I was in love! However it's one of those, head over heels moments and then after a while you start noticing the flaws and you can't wait to get rid of it.
Great in the beginning, full of body, fresh, girly and different, BUT does tend to fade quickly and then you're left with a dissapointing, bland, insipid, after taste. Not appealing at all.
Pity had so much potential

Someone gave this to me because she did not want it anymore. It's nice, foral and a bit fresh, but I couldn't find anything special or really enjoyable in it. The staying power is weak and I just didn't like it much. There has to be something I enjoy in a scent and this didn't have anything.
very fresh, feminine and comfy - perfect for everyday wearing. unfortunatly, somebody liked it more than me(as i guess of somebody stoled it from my bag, hah)

Smelled it today in the store. Very nice I must say. Feminine, fruity and warm.

And this comes from a guy, if that matters.

The Beat EDT, smells young and cheerful and clean, modern and energetic. I think Burberry does a good mainstream job again. The scent goes on a little strong so be careful with how many sprays you use, but it is long lasting and very wearable. The packaging is way fantastic. The shape is like a hip flask and etched with a Burberry plaid design. Very charming.

I love this scent. I've been searching for a fragrance to stay with for a long time and finally I've found it!

The Beat EdT is fresh and citrusy but not sharp. It doesn't smell of lemons but rather of... well mandarin oranges perhaps? ;)

In the same time as it's really fresh it's also comforting. As if there was vanilla in it but in so small amounts that it doesn't get sweet or heavy at all.

The only sad thing is that the scent disappears too soon.

To me the EdP is a totally different fragrance. That one's just heavy - I can't stand it. The EdT on the other hand is perfect. So light in every way and just oh-so-wonderfully-smelling!
It is sexy, playfull, a beautiful young fragrance but ..sooo weak!!! just 15 minutes and it has gone !!! it should be just a mist!!!

Strange as it may seem the top notes are similar to Moschino Funny and Incanto Bliss put together at least on my skin. It's fresh, careless and sweet, a totally wearable EDT for the summer. Although not listed, I can detect some pepper in it in the top notes. Unlike other reviewers say, this lasted quite long on my skin, it's just not loud. It comes to the signature Burberry soft vanilla/musk dry-down, just a bit fresher. If you have tried the EDP, you might recognise the mossy note in the drydown, but it's barely there. Certainly it has less character than the EDP (and it differs from it significantly), but it's still lovely.On clothes it leaves a clean laundry impression. Yeah, I already imagine myself wearing this at my favorite beach bar. This is more than perfect for summer and everyday wear.
On my skin, it's totally different from the edp and it smells almost exactly like D&G Light blue !

It's a sweet floral fragrance, but on my skin it becomes very warm sweet at the end. To sweet, so i have to be careful not to overdose.
A pitty it doesn't stay as fresh as when i spray it on.

Both the original and this later, less concentrated version of The Beat had little lasting power on my skin. Disappointed was I that they hadn't made a more intense version of The Beat.

This fragrance was so light that I could barely smell it at first. A subtle citrusy opening was all that I could detect when I pressed my nose to my wrist.

Eventually The Beat EDT strengthens a little allowing me to enjoy the introduction of the tea and iris notes. This fragrance is very refined and classy, like MoietToi mentioned. However, it is a far cry from the original which possessed a boozy like quality that I really enjoyed.

The original had spunk, but this lighter version is enough to make me yawn. Summing up The Beat EDT; a basic yet pleasant floral with hints of citrus and tea. Need I say more?

What??? I´d like to know why Burberry released an EDT version of Beat. The original version, EDP, is so light and with weak staying power - it could be considered already an EDT.
I love The Beat, but it is way too light.

IMO, this version is a waste of money.

I was given this perfume as a gift from my Dad. Anyways I spritzed it on and I smelled this cloud of tea,lavender and something citrusy. When I smell this scent I imagene myself sitting in an old fashioned English garden drinking tea and eating scones. Very classy yet extremely comforting. One spritz is enough allthough beaucse it's really strong.

OMG I just bought it and wow I'm so in love with it!!!!
Amazing,so girly and young..
I really really love it!!!
One of the most differnt modern fragrances burberry have done in a long while x

The fragrance is really pleasant, refreshing and light, however its staying power is very very weak!!! I sprayed on my wrist and after 15 (!?) minutes there was nothing! I wouldn't buy it, it is the weakest perfume I have ever tried!

Vetiver, tea, musk. very unisex, a bit of spring, but not especially original. Nothing sexy about it - which is surprising given the musk note - then again, it is a very synthetic musk. other fragrances might be peeking in and out here and there.... bluebell??? who could tell over the big domineering tea/musk/generic citrus aromas? cardamom is an absolute fav of mine, but undetectable here. Pink pepper? I know that's the hawt little ingredient for 2008, but where is it in this mix?

Could be a high end Burberry scent, could be the fragrance added to a man's deoderant stick, could be gym locker deodorant for a high-end raquet club. overall, this one gets a "meh".
a feminine fall fragrance, first it seems a bit too sweet but once it settles you feel the wamrth of the woody notes
So sad this has been discontinued. What a shame. This is such a beautiful elegant timeless fragrance. It's versatile and very underrated.

Aromatic & Green Chypre with Peach Tea drydown...
This is another contemporary interpretation of a chypre from master perfumer Michel Almairac. Opens with a burst of wormwood-chypre and dries down to peach-tea and cashmere. In the first couple of minutes after the spray dries, I can the feel the fruity green-apple & peach accented by the bitter-green, herbal & aromatic tones of wormwood. Wormwood here reads a little like a greener oakmoss with a dash of incense to my nose. Already the rose & tea are swelling through. As it transitions to the heart the rose & tea move forward and sandalwood adds a woody sweetness. This all rests on a fluffy musk & Cashmere wood base with hints of amber-vanilla. Performance is well above average.

Contrast to Body by Burberry EDP:
Also composed by Michel Almairac, these are very similar, although the EDT is slightly less sweet, and the tannic component is more obviously a tea note. Both are well above average performance-wise.

Contrast to Body Tendre by Burberry:
Also composed by Michel Almairac, these are very similar, although Body Tendre is more rose forward. Both are well above average performance-wise.

Overall: gorgeous green, aromatic chypre with peach-tea drydown and well above average performance that becomes beast mode when layered over its matching body lotion. It's a longtime love for me. Enjoy!

I really love the apple note in this fragrance, and it's the reason why I chose the EDT over the EDP.

I think of Burberry Body EDT as an ideal professional scent. It's a perfect one to wear to a job interview, or on the first day of a promotion, or just any time you want to feel put together and get taken seriously. While this is a very pleasant perfume, it's also quite serious, making it a good fit for a more serious-type person.
I'm a teacher, and this fragrance screams educational professional to me (think high school level teacher, school administrator, or even college professor).

And while I wouldn't necessarily say that Body EDT has masculine vibes, it definitely leans unisex.

Also, longevity and sillage are just as good, if not better, than a lot of EDPs. I get 6-8 hours wear from it on my skin, and it lasts all day on clothes.

Light sour apple with hints of artemisia
It is less powdery than EDP, it's more fresh
I'd say its perfect season is the early spring
A musky powder with hints of peach and rose. Does not project like an EDT normally does...sits very close to the skin. Good for the office.

Burberry Body EDT reminds me of Givenchy Ange Ou Demon Le Secret EDT (the pale yellow one) but it's jasmine is replaced by rose here. fortunately I can't pick up wormwood. I can detect apple and rose and tea(which is one of rare green notes that I enjoy) in a light musky,woody base. it's notes are well blended and I don't find it too rosey, or too fruity, or too musky or too woody or too green. it's a bit of each of these blending together creating a pleasant,springy scent which I find versatile,easy to wear and ageless .it's fresh and crisp but also warm and sunny. I don't find it too unique or interesting but who cares? there's no need for every perfume to be earth shattering.it's work place friendly and can make a safe gift choice. longevity and sillage wise it's not too strong but not bad for an edt.it's recognizable for people standing close to you without being overpowering to bother anyone
من رو یاد جیونچی آنجو دمون له سکرت ادوتویلت(اونی که زرد کمرنگه) میندازه بااین تفاوت که انگار اینجا بجای یاس، رز داریم. خوشبختانه من اون نت ورم وود رو حس نمیکنم. من سیب میگیرم و رز و چای تو یه زمینه ملایم چوبی،مشکی. بنظرم عطر دلپذیر و همه پسند و راحتیه. ملایم و فرش و تمیزه درعین حال یکم گرمای ملایم داره شبیه گرمای آفتاب اوایل بهار. عطر خاص یا پیچیده یا خیلی جالبی نیست اما برای محل کار خیلی مناسبه و گزینه امنیه واسه کادو و بنظر من از اون عطراست که محدودیت سنی نداره. از نظر پخش و موندگاری قوی نیست اما واسه ادوتویلت بودنش بد هم نیست. درحدی هست که دیگران هم اگه نزدیکتون باشن متوجهش میشن اما نه به شدتی که بتونه واسه کسی اذیت کننده بشه

Love this in warm spring weather! It’s way more tolerable than the edp cuz the wormwood is toned down and not hogging the stage as it is in the edp. I get green apple, rose and cashmere. It’s a nice comforting, safe but beautiful all grown up fragrance ❤️🥰 I’m loving her today! It’s still a fruity floral but with an edge.

After the first like few minutes this special peachy flowery note fades away and what remains is actually very generic. You feel you have smelled it thousend times before. I prefer the edp version, it lasts much longer, but I think I need to revisit this in summertime🙂

Smells like a toned down version of Kenneth Cole Reaction.
Glad, I only ordered a sample

This is a likable scent , its light which means I can wear it during the hot summer days and not get a headache. As most comments had said that if smells "fresh and clean" I agree that it does , I will be wearing this after showers, running earrands and to work. Body EDT does not project it is more of a skin scent on me.

the powder scent in-it really stands out, this scent makes me feel clean, fresh
wore for 6h+ and could still catch sniffs of it on my clothing
but tbh this fragrance is just to mature in the like elderly-woman type thing.
This is so nice, it does remind me of Gucci Envy Me. I am glad I have it since that one is discontinued. A fresh, modern rose and perfect for daily wear.

Nanalvzpink is right, this is baby Tresor!
I remember disliking Body EDP a few years ago but now from a sample I love the EDT. It even has some Biagiotti’s Venezia Pastello in it (not the original Venezia).
Anyway, a pretty yet slightly 90s smelling rosy musky pretty womanly scent, reminiscent of some Sophia Grojman creations with that type of rose used.
Off to try the EDP again!

I'm with waikikid -- my sample is so synthetic it's gross. It's rare that I "dislike" any fragrance, because usually there's something to like, even with cheap body sprays... but here I have to make an exception. It's so bad, in contrast to so many reviews, that I wonder whether there's something wrong with the batch being distributed at this time.

I tried Burberry Body EDT and EDP for five days.

I decided to get the EDT because it’s the sophisticated clean and fresh smell that I was looking for. Although it’s not the EDP version, don’t think you won’t get performance because you will.

EDP is a baby version of Tresor by Lancôme. It’s too musky and rosy for my liking.

It was difficult for me to pick between the two. I sampled them for several days because they are both lovely.
However, I decided in EDT because it’s more me.

I like the edt and the edp but it took awhile for me to get used to the edp. I assumed the edp would be better but i was wrong. This one, the edt, is better to me because the rose stands out more in this than in the edp. The edp has a really strong wormwood smell that is only deepened by the peach and its not good right away because of that. The edt on the other hand has the apple which opens the door for the rose to step in and use the wormwood as a doormat, which suits this scent far better.
the depth of the edp is far more my style as it lingers thick around my body and i love that. Although the airy crisp rose is a stunner too in the edt as it dances around and envelops leaving a trail as well. Im glad to have both since i crave both quite often. They have actually replaced my beloved Spellbound which i never thought that could happen. Not cuz theyre similar scents but the essence of the fragrance is similar.
All I smell is rose... Cheap shampoo rose. 60 year old woman attending Easter Sunday mass.

I have finally discovered the perfect light apple scent. Body EdT is my favourite of the Body line. The wormwood in Tender is so strong and bitter, it dominates the composition and makes it unwearable in warmer weather. The rose is more subdued than in the EdP, and the apple note it just right. Lovely!
It reminds me of the sadly discontinued Gucci Envy me.
I smell a refined Apple and flowers. Did not love it at first sniff,but as times passes by, it is becoming a favourite. Also, not a massive scent.

The first time I tried Burberry Body EDT I did not like it, I felt it smelled of pure incense, very strong, I ran to shower and left it aside. I gave it another chance, this time I applied it further and let it dry .... and now it is my favorite fragrance, it is clean, beautiful and intelligent, nothing strong if you apply it carefully ... I am of sensitive smell, so i try to buy only edt
This is my bedtime and study-time scent. It doesn’t last long but smells clean and comforting while also being unique. I tried the EDP and didn’t like it, but the EDT is just right.

This is a very lovely, fresh but warm, a bit unusual fragrance I think. I used to almost not feel that I had it on after a couple of hours, but then after a full workingshift at the nursing home when I walked by a couple of coworkers, they told me I was smelling so good. Sweaty and all..! 🙂 So I guess this goes well with my skin, then. But since I did not feel it so much myself, I went buying the edp. But unfortunately it’s a bit too strong for my nose - the absinthe, I think. So next time I will stick to this lighter version after all - I just have to respray a little, if needed!! And then I want the Tender version as well... maybe even more lovely. Well worth having both, I think! For spring and summer mostly.

This is ok, it's alot better than some perfumes I've tried recently and more complex, it's pretty, but there is something about it that just isn't screaming LOVE to me.

This smells pretty much identical to the edp with only a small difference,..but for me that small difference is enough for me to much prefer the edp over this one, this perfume is basically just the edp backwards..with the edp the wormwood is more upfront and it makes the scent warmer and the fruit and rose is in the background but still noticeable, with this one the wormwood is in the background and the fruit and rose are upfront and prominent, this is basically the lighter daytime version of the edp.

I thought that I would like this just as much but I don't, strangely for me I'm not actually sure about the blend of the rose and fruit and so the wormwood in the edp actually took the edge off of that for me..I don't know what it is as it's still pleasant but it kinda ends up smelling dare I say it..like a peachy room freshener, not as bad as some that I've tried, nowhere near..but enough to make me not sure about it, the wormwood being more upfront in the edp takes the edge off of this for me and overall it just blends better and I actually enjoy the rose and peach in it because it smells more rounded, less sharp and less pungent with the wormwood taking centre stage, the edp is also alot more unique x
This is exactly the same as body tender. Come on now! Be more creative!!!!

I bought this during the summer along with the Body tender. They are quite similar, but being an EDT this doesn't last very long on my skin. A bit fruity, but not as much as you'd expect. It's fresh and woody, but soft and delicate. You can aid the silage and longevity by using along with Burberry's Body Milk, which smells absolutely divine. This fragrance makes me feel very feminine. The design of this bottle is absolutely gorgeous as well, Crystal-like with some define heft. The tall thin Body bottle is the perfect vessel to be held and easily sprayed. Burberry did well once again with the Body line.

My mom used to wear Shower to Shower powder which used to choke me....this smells similar and yeahhh I do not feel choked! Fresh, clean scent that reminds me of Mom's hug. Perfect for office or just a relaxing day at home.

Clean kind of scent, fresh laundry kind. Soft, musky, really really musky. Daytime, office, just not my kind of musky type. Soapy after 30 minutes. Rose shows off subtly.
Apple there's none.
If talking about daytime office scents i choose Nina Ricci Love in Paris.

As winter gives way to spring and the weather starts warming up, the EDP of this perfume is better replaced with this EDT that opens with cool, crisp apple and peach followed closely by rose and refreshing tea. A light sprinkling of woods and musk are not far behind and all of the notes are in harmony with each other. Eventually, the apple fades but tea, rose, a good amount of musk, and a light woodiness remains on the skin.

This is really like a “just out of the shower” skin scent. It’s aptly names “Body” and has become a staple in my perfume wardrobe. Great for everyday wear. Lasts about 5-6 hours on me that I can pick up faintly when I press my nose to my wrist, but there have been occasions that I was complimented long after. So maybe this lasts longer, but I just can’t smell it after a while.

People, especially men, seem to love this on me as well as the EDP during the winter time. Trick is, don’t spray this too heavily. When they pick up a subtle hint of this fragrance, it seems to make them turn their head and wonder, “where is that beautiful scent coming from?” It doesn’t bash them over the head. It’s intriguing, a bit coy, and alluring. For that reason, it’s a bit mysterious.
This lasts well on my skin. I do not smell any fruit or florals, just a fresh, clean scent. Safe for work, school ect. Nothing special.
This is decent if you want to wear a basic fragrance that is normal. Seems the staying power is decent. Just a regular floral musky scent.
I love this light scent. It is uplifting throughout the day. It smells intoxicating.

Ahh yes... This is my favorite version of the Burberry Body line! The original was too heavy for me, but the EDT version strikes just the right pitch. It's an amped up clean skin scent on me - the apple is definitely there, but it's more tart than sweet, lending a crispness to the scent. Peach and rose are definitely prominent, just like the pyramid suggests. The original could definitely come across as a more "mature" scent, while I find the EDT much more versatile. The powder and woods are toned down, but still present in the dry down. Essentially, this Body smells like a combination of freshly washed skin, lotioned up, with some natural rosy muskiness. Clean and comfortable and elegant. Lovely and feminine.

And BONUS! I am in love with the oil spray, and the EDT is much more similar to the oil than the original EDP is. A few squirts of the oil and one spritz of the perfume and the fragrance envelops me in a comfortable hug that hints at something more.. Just a touch more intimate than friendly, not quite sensual, but the chemistry's there. ;) <3

I thought I remembered falling in love with this perfume after testing it last summer. However, regrettably, after buying a 35ml bottle online I discovered I must have been remembering a different Burberry fragerence as this is rather unpleasant on my skin, sort of tart and metallic but with a nauseating sweetness, my brother mentioned it smelt just like Turkish delight, and I agree! Fresh and fruity at first but as as it dries the main note I can smell the rose/Turkish delight. To me its a very cold fragerence, reminds me of cool glass, I suppose like roses in an elegent glass vase on a fresh spring day. I can see why others love this, its delicate and fresh but unfortunately just does not sit well on my skin. This is probably a long shot but does anyone in the UK want to arrange a swap (preferably for another fresh, fruity spring/summer fragerence, but I'm open to trying other things)? I'm new and don't know how that works on here, but please do let me know!

This is a heavenly, green, rosy, sophisticated fragrance. Although it is not hugely popular, it is one of the best fragrances I have ever smelled. However, the one down-side is that it has absolutely no lasting power or sillage. The EDP lasts longer, but the fragrance is different. I am torn between whether I should repurchase or not.

Oh my god, I can´t smell anything on my skin!? Literally nothing? I even asked the sales assistant to smell my wrist because I thought there was something wrong with my nose. She said: Almost non existing! Anyone with the same experience? I´m really dissappointed because I had so high expectations for this one. Maybe the edp or Body intense is worth a try.

Update: Indeed the BB Gold limited edition EdP is beautiful and very long lasting. So glad I didnt give up on this one too easily :)

Not bad. I bought this for work. I needed something classy and not to heavy. It's fruity and woody. It's such a pleasant fragrance for a pleasant woman . Kinda smell corporate so that's why I like it :)

I have the spray-on body oil version of Burberry Body. It is very light and pleasant. On first application it reminds me of canned lychees. Then it develops into a barely-there soft-musk scent with a perceptible woody tone. I have to put the back of my hand up to my nose to smell it after 2 hours or so; by then, there is the faintest hint of tobacco (might be the tea). I don't get any rose or apple tones. This is a keeper: a your-skin-only-better scent for sure. Funny, but the dry down of this reminds me of the considerably less expensive Cafe Cafe, albeit much more subtle. The tall, sculptural bottle is a work of art.
This one smells way better than the eau de parfum which is too thick and strong.

Smells great. It's light, fresh, flowery and not cloying at all. It smells different and more special than typical floral scents.. I have the edp and like that but this one is more wearable and not as heavy. It also has great longevity and sillage. It lasted overnight on me and lasted long on my clothes. I'm surprised at how much I love this. This is an everyday scent but I can see it worn more in the spring or summer.

Just bought this and I LOVE it. I find the eau de parfum version a little too strong/woody, but this lighter EDT version is perfect. Smells kind of like Chloe EDP but not so floral... It reminds me of fresh laundry, roses and expensive soap. Somehow I think it manages to be simultaneously warm and fresh - it's a very comforting scent in my opinion. It also doesn't smell too "perfumey" if that makes any sense... It's the kind of perfume where you would get more comments saying "you smell good" rather than "your perfume smells good".

I am probably going to end up buying this one. The scent from Burberry Body is definitely what I would call fresh. Very office/professional appropriate. Like others, I definitely like the EDT better. The EDP is a bit cloying. Pretty, feminine, fresh and light.

Horrible, definitely not like the smell of wormwood, bitter and spoils perfumes. Or maybe I met him in bad combinations. Another was a Le Male Jean Paul Gaultier.
Maybe it in a perfume of summer, just tea and green, or milky notes ... But not with lemon and citrus, and woods notes, this is too much

Wonderful scent! Very similar to the Body EDP and the other flankers. There's no iris or freesia in this one, but the similarity is still stunning.
The thing I love about it, is the soft composition of peach and rose with a little bit of wood.
Warm, feminine and simply elegant.
And typically Burberry.

Lovely and fresh rosey scent, perfect for spring or summer when the EDP would be too heavy. I am a huge admirer of Body EDP, however I wouldn't wear it during summertime, I find it too heavy and smokey on me. This nice edt version is the solution for this, I think it is nothing like "old lady", it is a really delighting and smiley fragrance, maybe not for teenagers though.

I've been searching for a new fragrance for a long time, testing and spraying whenever out shopping. I always seemed to go back to this so I finally made the purchase only to discover that my daughters think I smell like "old lady"! When I wear this I smell vanilla, sandalwood, peach and rosy powder? I like it, but won't purchase again as I don't want to smell like "old lady". So off again to find the perfect fragrance.
Fresh rose and peach smell. beautiful. Smells better that body EDP. I love it.

Lovely light fragrance for every day. For me, the EDT is fresher compared to the EDP and the longevity is good. It starts off bright and rosey then after about half an hour it becomes soft and powdery. I like the bottle too.

I have loved perfume, sine the first time I bought my first bottle. Over the year my my taste hasn't changed, but I still hadn't found the "one". Recently with a lull period of not wearing any perfumes. I found Burberry Body. This perfume is me (today - described in detail within the scent). I love it. Powdery and woody smell, with musk and fruit scents, after a few hours the woody/powdery scent comes out more and the one important thing, is that my husband loves it on my skin. I love this smell.

First seconds after spraying I feel some cool, refreshing, "sparkling", fruity champagne, then comes the sugar coated but still sour, mouthwatering apple followed by a nice rose bouquet.
When it settles down, it becomes warm ( sandalwood, I think). It's a pity that I don't get all the base notes- no vanilla, no cashmere. It's musky and keeps some of the apple sourness, freshness.
I imagine it on a young, modern woman wearing high heels and following the trends.
Nice, "positive", sunny perfume for summer but nothing unique I would recognize.

I like the smell of roses. It reminds me of the rose garden my grandmother used to have when I was little. That said, this perfume doesn't smell like 'old lady'. Well, at least not to my nose. It's subtle, fresh, and puts a smile on my face. It' also somewhat soothing. I can smell the wormwood in the opening, then it's mostly rose with a hint of peach and tea on my skin. These are the notes I have been able to distinguish, so far. It's classy and sophisticated. It won't offend anyone unless you bathe in it.
I'm going to test it a few more times, then perhaps get it with my Sephora discount card within the next couple of months.

I agree with flowergirlsusie. This is lighter and fresher than the original Body edp, which I found could get quite sickly and a bit cloying (I imagine the edp would induce headaches in those that are sensitive). The apple in the opening of this EDT makes the scent crisp and airy. The apple note is not like the one in dkny delicious. I found it to be more like the note in the body shop apple shampoo from a long time ago. This perfume is also woodier than the edp and I found this to be enjoyable. It is a clean scent and easy to wear. Good for day wear and I would say any season really if it's just for day use. Others found this scent pleasant and I had a couple of compliments on it.

I got the tester for this one. When I first sprayed it, I thought: "No way, I'd never wear this!" Then, as it dried down, I began to detect a really nice rose and peach smell. What I like most about this is those two notes. It's rather soft, sensual and feminine. I wouldn't wear this everyday, as I'm more into unisex fragrances, but I do appreciate this one. Pricey.
May give this one a try if it's softer that the original edp. Actually the latter is a very good one but way too sharp on my skin.

Need something summery, floral and fruity? This can turn into your signature scent and you will keep restocking it like forever! Its not that long lasting but even sniffing an essence of this scent is enough to keep your day going.
Don’t really like Burberry fragrances but this one was so good, loved it. Unfortunately discontinued.

This is one of my and my husband’s favorite summer scent. It reminds me of my childhood. When my cousins and I would run through muddy and grassy lands to get to the fish pens at the back of our subdivision. This has a very light scent. It’s like a beautiful sunshine in the afternoon during summertime. It has wonderfully captured the scents of woods/grass, and exotic flowers

Fresh flowery woody & a bit spicy. Nice fragrance. Soft, inoffensive, clean laundry fresh. I think it's a sporty summer scent. Good for all ages & everyday wear. Unfortunately the sillage is soft & the longevity is weak. Reapply is needed in every several hours.

Extremely baffled with this one. The first time I ever tried it I seriously couldn't smell a thing! I could smell a very light woody flowery scent from the sample vial I had, but the minute it touched my skin it was like water. Decided to give it a couple more chances a short time later, and the next couple times I smelled a very light, fruity aquatic scent that lasted for about 3 hours or so. Well, last night I put some on right before settling down in front of the TV, and this time it was like the first time. Barely there! I would catch the faintest whisper if I turned my head a certain way, but it smelled very watery and not much like a perfume. Even that faint whisper was gone within an hour. Anyone else have this experience? I also have the 2011 summer edition which is a lot better in terms of sillage and longevity.

I LOVE this perfume!! When I first smelled it, I was really struck by how it really did remind me of summer & I was shocked to smell watermelon, but I just made it up I guess. The one complaint is that it doesn't last long at all.

This is refreshlingly pretty to wear, floral sweet but not too heady, just perfect to arouse the senses. Not cloying on th skin and very cozy to wear. I love this summer edition. Just too bad the lasting power is quite weak. I had to re-spray myself most of the time to enjoy the scent. Still, this is very pleasant, sexy and playful scent. Just lovely! Perfect for a very hot day!
It smells a bit artificial. I guess it is the pomegranate... I love it though. Burberry classy...Perfect for every day use. Not very durable.
i super love this smell,,,its so nice and refreshing not too sweet just light....love this

Soft smell and sweet make me feel relax.
This nice smell not make me headache and stay on my skin more long hours.

If one can find the earlier version (the one with the pink rope writing), I would recommend seeking that out as it's an unrivalled summer scent, making use of herbal, sweet and fruity notes to maximum effect. If not, though, this year's release IS rather good - a mandarin and apricot yogurt scent, with the same Burberry Summer dry-down of its predecessors. Perfectly sweet and joyful, with expected lasting power; this would accompany a summer dress very nicely. I would note the Burberry Summer scent has got sweeter - I just hope it doesn't get sweeter again next year, as that would push it too far into candy ubiquity.

This is my favorite perfume. I purchased it once and all my friends were asking me what a beautiful scent I am wearing. It is so lasting and powerful. It does make men pay attention to you when you pass with this fragrance on. It is just perfect for hot summer time and for a very warm spring. I love it. I can wear it again and again and never get bored from the smell it brings. It can be vividly opened on my skin and all its notes are are very distinct. Unfortunately I cannot find it anywhere in the stores in my town. It is everywhere out of stock...
I think it's better than the 2009 edition. Burberry Summer for Women 2010 is fresher and softer, but still sweet, with strong peach and mandarin orange notes.
At first, i like the first 5 minutes, but the perfume doesn't last.Thats a pitty, wouldn't buy it, the perfume from 2009 ist far better than this one.

oh Burberry!
You did a better job last year.
I preferred the 2009 edition.
