This is a weak one. Has no sillage and lasts very shortly.
In the beginning I could smell currants and pomegranate, and I thought the scent would be just stronger than the previous edition, possibly even for evening wear. But then came the middle notes, so faint ... Very light flowers, couldn't even detect which ones. And that's how it stays. I don't get any woods or musk in the drydown, just those pallid flowers.

This fragrance is not bad neither good. But that's ok. You don't have to fall in love with every flanker, do you ...

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Really inoffensive scent. Not super original, but very classy and girly. It's a sweet rich floral and soft patchouli. Smells like an expensive shampoo to me. A cheap (if you buy it used) safe grab. I got my full bottle for $24. Only downside is the sparkles deteriorate and it looks cloudy on the bottom of the bottle. Wasn't a wise move on Burberrys part.

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I bought a bottle two years ago and forgot about. It still smells great, but the glitter has semi dissolved and are stuck at the bottom :(

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I liked this a bit better than the original. The sparkles were a real treat! So pretty! But my sparkles got all stuck to the bottom of the bottle. :-(

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: For me I find it 90% similar to the original my Burberry, and weirdly I find similarities with Burberry body!

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Wow! I love glitter!

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: i bought it via online, not much change to the original. i do love this frag, very nice scent and inoffensive. i put 5 pump and it last 5 hours on my skin and 10+ hours on clothes.

product_name: My Burberry Festive Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Almost the same wonderful smell... I love both of them, but owning this sparkling juice will be nice :-)

burberry summer
(why are there years missing?

summer going into autumn so cooling off.
about 5 sprays to inner elbow - the tester was a bit stuffed but i got a reasonable amount out.

lovely green floral
gently zingy - not sour, not sharp, but a little angular and crisp.
one thought came to mind as Oscar de la Renta Flor seems and feels like its similar to this - that one is much zingier in a limey bright zing way, burberry summer is toned down.

i prefer this to my burberry blush which i have tried recently (that one was a bit too similar to others i either have at the time or have tried, not a bad scent tho)

ok sillage - its not loud, ive had a good three hours with it and it lingers on fabric well.

Fan of all things Burberry. This one is a light, green floral I ❤ for daytime casual wear. Perhaps a better spring/summer scent, it is a floral fragrance I'd wear year round, due to the abundance of woody aromas. It doesn't' last very long and can really spray the stuff on without offending. It is a beautiful blend of green, white flowers, wood and musk, with a slight punch of juicy pomegranate.
I'm not a fan of this. Anyone want to swap or buy this from me?
A citrusy rose musky fragrance and I agree about the skittles note. I don’t think it’s brilliant and it’s nothing that stands out but I wear it occasionally. Staying power isn’t great.
This smells like sweet lemon Skittles or Starburst. Not my cup of tea, but I can see the appeal

This is a soapy powdery smell on me. Nice enough.
Clean.
This smells exactly like pomelo. At first it starts with fruity floral then develops to pomelo and orange peel. I'm not impressed.

A nice, spicy floriental! A friend gave this to me because she wasn't a fan, but I really quite like the subtle sweetness behind this, and the added woody notes. I find that although Burberry are not always at the top of my list of favourite perfumes, I always find their fragrances strange and compelling. The combination of orange and musk in this is pleasant, alongside the pomegranate. I don't find it as distinctive as a lot of other perfumes though, and as genny17 said it's a 'safe' scent that is nice but not overly memorable. It also doesn't last too long, but the scent itself is an interesting warm-floral fragrance.

Mainly I get pomegranate from this.
To me it is sweet, fresh fragrance. Good for warm weather.

To me it smells like fresh, sweet plastic. But i still like it.
My male friends say it smells like straight up rasberries, and they seem to love it so... not a favorite for summer but i'll wear it. :)

I must admit I like it although I was a bit sceptical because the idea of flankers annoys me a little. This has absolutely nothing to do with the original Burberry except the bottle. It's bursting with cheerful floral freshness and is a great, light and safe choice for the hot summer days. The bottle is in perfect harmony with its content - the smell of pink, definitely. It is also a good one for very young girls.

Lots of freesia. There was also a hint of LOTV but that was gone in a few minutes. Sort of watery vibe that dries down to soapy musk. Longevity - so-so.

EDIT: Wanted to add that there's also a detectable unisex/masculine note in it, possibly the cedar.
More rose than anything!
I have a love for Burberry perfumes but unfortunately not for this one. It's nothing special, the scent is barrely there and wears of really fast. It's just boring.
A lovely blend of roses and musk...very very feminine. This is for all floral lovers bt others can have a go with it.
Nice but no longevtiy on my skin :-(

This one is so not worth the money! It smells to simple, more like just lemon juice and disappears in short time. My first choice of fragrances usually is Burberry, but this one, really not worth the name.

@tropic sugar, I think you did a great review. I have dry skin as well and the notes come off the same as you've stated on my skin as well. The original Burberry was too strong for me, so I ended up getting rid of it. However, I think this a great scent that I can actually wear.
Yuck, this is a mash of different citrusy scents that don't work for me.
I really wanted to like this one, but the lilly of the valley note would overpower the citrus for me, and id rather have the citrus stand out. Perfect, im sure for someone else.

I have to say that I love this fragrance!I was shopping one day at Younkers department store and saw this at the fragrance counter so I sprayed this on and went on my way.This is so pretty.I usually like more heavy amber and tropical fragrances but lately I have been craving fresh and airy scents and have been looking for a more natural fragrance to add to my collection.This is very natural smelling for a summer scent no strong alcohol smell at all.On my skin I smell pomegranate, lily of the valley,freesia and a soft woody base.If I could pick one word to describe this scent I would say fruit sorbet.It is cool and airy and the citrus smell stays all the way through the drydown.The woodsy notes are soft but noticable.I have dry skin and the 2 squirts I sprayed on my wrist lasted a good 6 hours.This is not going to be a silliage monster but if you did 4 squirts on the neck and a couple squirts on the inside of the arms people would smell you as you walked by.This will be fabulous for humid hot days and nights as there is something romantic and elegant about it as well.I think soft flowers,italian fruity ice or fruit sorbet with a touch of green and soft woods.The bottle is so pretty as pink is one of my favourite colors.This will not make you feel sick as it is very natural smelling.If you had to pick one fragrance for summer I would say this is the best summer fragrance I've smelled so far.Men will love this as well as they tend to like soft clean smells on a women.Pair this with a cute floral sundress and some gladiator sandals and you will get admiring glances and you wont kill everyone with a strong overbearing fragrance on a hot summer day.This is fruit sherbet in a bottle!LOVE IT!

This has the word “garden” written all over it. Smelling it straight out of the bottle it smells like the tomato plants in my garden, very green with a hint of bitterness. After it’s sprayed I get a strong hit of Lily of the Valley -a transport back to my grandmother’s garden. I thought maybe the floral would be too strong for my liking, but then after about half an hour, it really lightened up; almost too much. I keep pressing my nose to my wrist to drink in my summer garden. The lasting power is not good on me, so I don’t think I’ll purchase, but I think it’s really nice. They really managed to bottle nature with this one!

Very aptly named as it is a perfect scent for summer.

It's light, it has a lovely freshness and ever so sweet and faintly floral. It is really pretty while being a wee little bit woodsy. It has a watery freshness to it that I really like.

It is perfect for an inoffensive scent. It doesn't project much at all.

Longevity is 3 hours - if that. Great summertime scent you can wear for anything. Spraying clothes and using an unscented lotion helps it last longer. I still have to bathe in it quite a bit because it just doesn't last. It will be perfect for HOT months when you want something refreshing, lightly sweet and floral.


I will have to buy multiple bottles as it is a limited ed only.


If you like Eclat d'Arpege -- you will like this!! If you like Issey Miyake Eau d'Issey -- you will like this!!

I was able to get a sniff of this Friday when I went to Dillards. I was expecting a sweet fragrance for teens, but was pleasantly surprised by the tart citrus/woodsy scent. It's very earthy, musky, and crisp at first and then drys down to a powdery/woody scent. It reminds me of a hot summer day down here in the South; the name fits it perfectly.

Too bad it's only a limited edition, I could see myself wearing this year around.

This is nice, I tried it today, it is vibrant, not too fruity, but honestly I can hardly remember the smell, other than it smells pleasant. A safe scent,, nice, would make a pretty gift for the summer, I detected soft floral notes , and a warmer base.
sounds amasing! :D i love burberry fragances
this is disgusting. its celery and bugspray please don't even sample it, seriously. I feel bad for my nose

At first I found this very off putting but I gave it some more wears over time and it really grew on me!
Only thing that still keeps me wondering is if anyone else smells some celery note in there? Very earthy and rooty.
Got the 10% concentration if that helps.

Fragrance -High Tide Burberry
Bottle from - 2017

He's got that romance by the sea vibe going on.
This fragrance is Francis Kurkdjian’s enthusiastic,marine, bright and a bit ozonic take on jasmine with the tender trace of bergamote in the opening and with a nice,peaceful, woody and mossy drydown.I think it's a unisex smell.

Longevity - 7/10(7+ hours)
Silage/Projection - 7,5/10(moderate projection and silage for the first 1-2 hours,than sits closer to skin for the duration of the scent's evolution)
Weather - best in spring and summer.
Age - 25+
Compliments(low-medium-high) - medium
Scent - 8,5/10

Main notes according to me -
jasmine,marine notes,aldehydes,moss,violet leaf:.

The drydown is nice,peaceful,woody and mossy and I get some moss,woodiness and flowers.

Emotions -romance by the sea,enthusiastic,marine,bright, sensual.

Occasion -For more or less any ocasion.

Could be a nice signature scent.
Aldehydes and sea notes are a beautiful summery scent! I also smell the jasmine flowers and bergamot on it! Good for summer lovers and worth a try! My mom bought it in the airport!
This one was too ozonic for me, reminds me of old school bitter colognes with too much calone & moss-imitation.

You’ve got to respect a house like Burberry trying to add something different and interesting to the market, and Clary Sage does just that. But sadly, I really don’t enjoy this, it leans far too heavily into the herbal facets, to the point it doesn’t even smell like a fragrance anymore.

It’s a sharp, dry and herbal affair, with a strong presence of sour Mediterranean vegetation, and particularly loose leaf green tea. There’s a strong green and earthy character to it, it’s very leafy to the point of unpleasantness.

As I said, it doesn’t smell like a fragrance, instead I can very well picture people thinking you smell unclean if you wore this. I commend the creativity here, and it’s clearly a well made fragrance, but the actual smell is a no for me.

I blindbought it at a good deal. But I ´m kind of dissapointed. Not that if everything below wasn ´t truth: herbal, powdery, rich, balsamic- it indeed realy is. But it screens: Aurelien Guichard: Santal Austral/ Bois d' Ebene bases. With all the negative sides for me: ambroxan overdose, that ruins the Matiere premiere line for me. But my husband loves it, so he will wear it.

This seems to capture the “English countryside” theme nicely. It’s got a rich, powdery, herbaceous character. It reminds me of herbal tea and has a witchy and comforting vibe. Kind of like a little cottage with drying herbs hanging around the room. Totally unisex to me. It’s a shame that it’s been discontinued. Get it while you can!

Underrated. Imagine a grand soir-esque fragrance with long lasting top hits of clary/cardamom. Warm Spicy balsam.

Good quality and well blended.
Cardamom and leather. Don't get much sage here. Good quality but it's not my cup of tea.
@fragrantica can we get the notes put up for this. Such a great fragrance to only have half a profile!

Surprised I’m the first and only review. This is a fantastic scent. The whole signature collection of Burberry totally underrated by fragrance community. Clary sage is a fantastic, natural-smelling herbal scent with the right amount of sweetness and earthy notes. Long lasting, incredibly elegant and perfect for any occasion or season. Could be a signature scent. Absolutely love this hidden gem that probably will be discontinued very soon.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I don't understand why this version was called Intense since the original version seems stronger to me with more pronounced florals, particularly the rose. That also performs much better than this. While this starts off very strong, it quickly nosedives and becomes a skin scent whereas I can easily smell the original Body for hours on end. I also don't care for the woodiness of the dry down here. I prefer the sweeter musk and amber dry down of Body, even though the intense version has the same base notes. It still comes off very woody and dry to me.
Maybe at this point it doesn't matter, since this has practically disappeared from the market with only a few bottles showing up on secondhand sites now and again at inflated prices. For me, I don't think it is worth it. I'd rather stick to the original, which is still readily available at more reasonable prices, even though it too has been discontinued.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Such a shame took way this frag

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: It's 100 % ok; smells a bit like grass. Or rotting leaves in the fall

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: This perfume is very nice and inviting a bit strong at first but once settled down it’s not harmful at all my mother picked it up for a pretty good price.. to be honest in my opinion this scent is more for spring and summer but I can say you might be able to get away with it in the fall time but it’s definitely not a winter scent.. I would recommend to wear it in the day time and if at night time probably for a special occasion! Other than that you really can’t go wrong with this scent it’s long lasting and like I said very inviting

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Body burberry
عطر ثري مميز لامرأة اكثر تميزا تنبعث منه رائحة جذابة مفعمة بالانوثة ، ملفت للنظر، مثير للفضول، غامض و لكن بوضوح، هادئ لكن بصخب، يعطي احساسا بالتميز و الجمال و الغرور.
سيظل Body burberry ايقونة عطرية رغم انه ليس من أحدث العطور و لكن جماله الغير مسبوق و تميزه جعل منه عطرا يبدو انه الاكثر حداثة بين العطور. مناسب لجميع الفصول.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Rose is a dominant note in my opinion. Its ok for an everyday scent. inoffensive, nothing too special.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Works great in the winter and fall, as it is a very cosy warm scent. It smells strongly of roses and ripe peaches with a nice warm base. It is quite strong (max 3 sprays) without being overwhelming, as well as long lasting. Best to use during the day, as it is very wearable and will not offend anyone in the office.
Does not work well in the summer for me, as it feels too heavy and cloying with the smell of peaches/rose.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: No lasting power, generic and a very light skin scent, glad I didn't pay a full price. Such a shame as it's a intense version and in my opinion is less potent than original one... Disappointed!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
This is a `private`, deep and a little `dark` peach scent for me. I like it a lot.

It is quite different from Body Tender, which I am about to give to my mother, because it´s not my taste (a lightweight, clean, floral scent).

Maybe not the most practical bottle, but heavy, special and classy.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: wanginya terlalu manis dan sudah banyak orang yang menggunakan parfum yang sama. menurut saya tidak unik untuk kalangan dewasa, tapi mungkin cocok untuk remaja. wanginya juga stronge dan mungkin ini bukan selera saya.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: This is a bottled of relaxation,peacefulness.If this perfume have had a character of a woman,it definitely would be confident,calm and at the same time a powerful lady.This is a woody,powdery smell that has soothing effect with a fantastic performance.It became my favorite.Absolutely recommended!❤️

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Праскова, роза, ирис, пудра, с пикантна горчива нотка. Шлейфов и траен, единствено не става за горещи дни и нощи, в междинни сезони и ако сте в движение е супер. Има нещо парадоксално в смесването на съставките, което всъщност го прави много специален, ако имате добра химия с него

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: I can get only rose note. Its not nice smell though. Waste of money, I would like to layer with rose lotion, so it last and smells good rather than alone. Disappointed with fragrance and doesn't worth it.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: This is just a nice, casual scent. It's well balanced and perfectly wearable in any occasion. I don't think it's that special, but it doesn't have to be. It's good as it is!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Have you ever heard the saying "if a little is good, more is better" . Well that's not the case with this one. Just do yourself a favor and try to spray once or twice only from distance and you'll thank me!
Rich powdery sexy . Great longevity, heavy sillage .
It's becoming one of my favorite perfumes

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: This is quite potent and needs to be applied at a bit of a distance. The first hour is quite sharp, but then it becomes a gorgeous, sensual musky frag. I'd say it might be too much for office wear but a perfect choice for date night. Many compliments will come your way!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
This smells like very expensive soap.
Powdery and musky, no rose and no peach.
Too much powder, its like car scent.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Okay, not bad. It was a subtle creamy warm and slightly sweet settle down. It lasts a solid 5 hrs. Not strong, but its still there. I don't feel extra sexy in it or anything, but its pleasant.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: انصح بهذه النسخة المركزة اكثر من غيرها

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
ما اجمل هذا العطر
رائحة انوثة ممزوجة برائحة الاطفال
ماذا تريدين يا حواء اكثر من ذلك
العطر يجمع بين الجمال والاثارة
جميع اصدارات هذا العطر فواحة وثابته الى حدٍ ما

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Gorgeous! Long winded story warning! Had a spray from the tester & was so disappointed. I can't describe the smell. Walked away & waited for my prescription to be filled. And then, miraculously, I detected grapefruit & floral. I bought the EDP & have just tried it again several hours after the tester. It's delightful. It certainly has the Burberry tang I find in the other Burberry perfumes which is attractive. So glad i waited a while & let the scent dry down. Very elegant & wearable. Versatile. I could wear it anywhere! Love, love, love!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Thought the scent was so sexy at first. Never felt like that before. Fell for it and bought it the instant.
A few days later, i rolled it and it gave me a headache. Nausy. Tried it some more time and gave it away.
Buy this if you can handle it. It still is sexy.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I don't find anything special in the classic version of Burberry Body, but the intense version is gorgeous and classy. This is clean,rosy scent. İt is perfect for summer but I love it so much that I can use this perfume in every season.

Since I bought it, I haven't use any other perfumes. Normally, my mother doesn't like perfumes and even she said that 'what a beautiful scent is that.'
However, there is a disadvantage in this scent for me. Longevity and sillage are very poor. I am very surprised when I read comments about its moderate longevity.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: One of my favourites. Body Intense is so young and elegant, modern and classy at the same Time. It has a good lasting power on me (6+) and get's frequently noticed by strangers. Starts a bit strong and you may be scared by the wormwood but it developes into a cosy, discreet fruity and very powdery scent. If you question yourself whether buying the original or the intense version, choose the Intense. Difference is not big but this one is a bit warmer and deeper. Lightly sweet, generous and wearable 24/7. Love it!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
So my mum wore this originally a few years ago and i thought it smelt nice and suited her but never thought to wear it for myself.
I tried it out today out of curiosity and was pleasantly surprised at how nice it was on me.
I wouldn't call this perfume sexy, pretty or feminine but it is beautiful. Its not like any other perfumes at all.
Its so warm and comforting like a hug and its starts quite soft and drys down quite woody.
Overall i found it quite clean, soft and dynamic.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: luxurious woody, powdery, musky & floral i love it its sexy and luxury :*

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
This perfume smells very differently from the first half an hour that you apply it to the hours afterwards, my advice is: spray it, wait 30 mins and then take your conclusions. Probably and bit too musky and powdery for some but I love it. For me it's a modern take on roses, very elegant, creamy and powdery with a hint of peach.

UPDATE: unfortunately this perfume at the end of the day gave me a headache, not sure why.... sad because I really liked it.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: my girlfriend told me that this was not good one but I still bought the body mist to try..I absolutely love it..I don't agree with a comment here that said this would smell the same on everyone..Perfumes always mix with the wearer's own chemistry and change with it to create a unique and special blend..This perfume, even the body mist--smells fabulously yummy and stays and stays in your pores..very different, very high quality..can't do the note analysis like some of you do (which I enjoy reading) but to me it's an amazing fragrance..ps after the body mist, I bought all intensities :-)

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: This the first Burberry perfume that I have owned or even tried and it's a winner to me! I could see this as a daily wear possibly a signature. Definitely a crowd pleaser. First blast is rose, rose, rose....reminds me of Chloe EDP. After a few minutes it settles down into a lovely clean powdery vanilla floral. I do see the similarity to clean skin after a shower. Great longevity, great sillage. Nothing niche or eccentric about this....just a nice, unoffensive scent that smells good!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Beastly at first smell but suddenly glamour and mon amour...Perfect for summertime and unique scent.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I don't perceive this perfume as a crowd pleaser and I don't perceive it as heavy, either (coming from someone who's been very sensitive to strong/sweet fragrances lately). Bold would be a better word to describe it.

Could be suitable as an office scent, if applied lightly. I really wanted to buy it, but the store only had the 85ml bottle which was too much for me.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: It's a classy perfume, but always reminds me of marijuana. I'm sorry, Burberry.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: After Miss Dior Cherie EDP having been my signature scent for over a year and having trouble with it lasting on my skin; this is a big change, I'm in love with Body EDP intense. Its sultry and soft but at the same time it is powerful. The bottle design is lovely and unique.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Overall: 8.25/10
Here's Why:
I feel like Burberry hit the nail on the head with this one.
It's by no means comparable to niche fragrance, but it is the best of the Burberry Line.
Warm, soft and classic.
Easy to wear - likable.
Some of the reviews on here comparing this to detergent - I have no idea what note they are picking up on as I have had nothing but wonderful things said while wearing this.
It is definitely more feminine, but I wear it anyways because I don't follow the men/women rule - if I like it... I wear it.
Performance is great.
Blends well with others, I specifically like this with one spray of JPG Le Male.
Overall, a winner.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Oooops, its heavy powdery scent scared me a lot. l'm sorry to say that I would only spray it on me when I want to looks elderly.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Perfect 'womanly' smell.
It's creamy, warm, feminine and super musky. I don't get much fruit, just a hint of peach then it's all cashmere wood, sandalwood for a solid 6hrs +.
A perfect rainy day, giant jumper affair for sure.

Edit:-
I'm quite surprised, but I'm actually really loving this!
It's one of my favourite grab and go fumes and my obsessive collection is over 100 deep these day's, so I'd say that speaks for itself.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I LOVE this fragrance, it's really clean and fresh.
I do not smell the rose though, the woody notes are more noticeable on my skin.
It lasts around 5-6h so moderate longevity.
The bottle it is really pretty but since I have the 85ml it sticks out between all of my other perfume bottles (that are quite big as well since I always buy the biggest bottle available) and it looks kind of weird so I tend to set it horizontally instead of vertically.
I'd give this perfume 8.5/10

EDIT: This time I could also smell the rose and the drydown was a very warm vanilla! Love it even more!!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
This is a clean deep scent. Clean as in fresh out of the shower clean. A bit powdery and this Intense version is somewhat sweeter than the original in my opinion. Deep due to the woody notes.

Perfect for hot summers - makes me feel fresh.

Great longevity and sillage, over 6 hours.

A man complimented me on it and confused it with Pleasures by Estee Lauder. Now, they do not smell alike at all - Pleasures is flowery and Body is well not :D - but I do get where he's coming from. They're both 'intense' loud perfumes that give off a neat crisp vibe.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
A lot alike Body EdP but with little more woody notes. Wonderful. In base a hint of powder that dances around you. Timeless -both young and mature women can wear Body EdP Intense in my opinion. Longlasting on my skin.

Ganska lik Body EdP men med lite mer tränoter. Superhärlig. I basen hittar jag en mjuk pudrighet. Tidlös - både yngre o äldre kvinnor kan bära Body EdP Intense tycker jag. Väldigt hållbar på huden.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
This intense version of Body is very similar to the original. Even the notes are the same. I might be wrong but I think that the original Body has more intense rose note, while this one has slightly stronger wood note.
Both perfumes are so similar that I must admit I don't have many new words for this one. Both are delicious, elegant and signature scent material.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Dear Bihter,

I have tested both the EDP and the intense version and I can confirm they are not the same scent.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Dear Fragrantica Friends, I would like to know if Body edp and Body Intens are the same scent. Thanx ♥

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I received this as a Christmas gift. I have the Gold Limited Edition EDP, which I think is the same as the regular Body EDP, but in a differently shaded bottle. (Correct me if I'm wrong.) The bottle design is very nice. It's not something I would have purchased for myself, but I'm giving it a try. As others have said about Body, it's quite soft and clean. I get the 'hairspray' and even the 'scotch tape' (ha!) that have been mentioned.

There are no notes that come forward very strongly. I think the best use of it for me will be as a canvas for layering other fragrances, helping to weave them together. Today, after I showered, I put on Red Flower Hammam Cardamom Amber Oil, then a spray of Sonoma Scent Studio's Ambre Noir, and a couple sprays of Burberry Body. Later I added Red Flower Guaiac perfume. That may sound like a lot, but everything is very warm, mellow, and comforting for a winter day. I'm also going to try it layered with Allure to pick up the peach and vanilla notes, and with some of my rose fragrances.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I get why people compare the smell of Body to hair spray and soap. Just give this perfume a few minutes to mix with your body chemistry before you form an opinion. Imagine a clean scent that smells like a nice shower, freshly washed hair, and clothes fresh from the dryer. That's what this scent gives me. Usually that 'i just got out of the shower' scent, goes away in a matter of minutes. Using this fragrance allows me to have that smell all day. It's great for the office or even as an everyday scent while running errands.

I don't expect to get compliments with this perfume as it doesn't really smell like perfume to me. It just smells of fresh lien and a more intense version of how my skin would naturally smell after my morning routine. The name Body is perfect! This scent can also be used as a layering scent. I've used it with different types of body splashes and they all mesh well.

The packing of this fragrance is amazing. It's luxurious, classy, beautiful and chic. The downside to this fragrance is the price. I believe I paid $100 for a 3.4oz which is a little pricey for a perfume that doesn't demand attention and probably won't be complimented often. However, the price can be justified with the fact I haven't found anything cheaper that lasts as long and performs as well. 1-3 spritz and it lasts all day. I'm not sure if I'm going to repurchased, but I will enjoy every last drop.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Sometimes its make me wonder why Michel Almairac created this perfume because I really adore some of his creation. This smell tooooooooooo common already. Shampoo, soap and car fragrance most of them has this type of smell. Another big mistake for me because blind buy this one 2.80z but luckly bought as a gift for my mother. I would pick-up Gucci Guilty Intense anytime over this one.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Its gorgeous omg and very classy. When iam out of my bottle , well buy one for sure.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Blech this is actually kind of gross...ugh I hate being so negative but this is one scent I never want to smell again. It really synthetic smelling, but its quite heavy maybe even a little cloying. The peaches smell too ripe in a bad way almost like they are on the verge of rotting. The rose smells like a overly sweet rosewater and I barely pick up the woods and musk...According to the notes this should be right up my alley and I usually like all the Burberry fragrances, but it totally ended up not working for me. This is one of the scents that should have a warning label saying "Warning!Try at your own risk."

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Smells soft and warm on me, sexy in a quiet way. I don't get how many people dislike this but maybe it is one of those love-it-or-you-don't fragrances. I don't really care for any of the other Burberry fragrances (too ordinary) but this is an exception. It makes me think of my Secret Obsession but in a softer way - easier to wear in warmer weather than the S.O which is a cold-weather fragrance to me.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Goodness ,like Burberry needed more plain smelling scents!? Body is not interesting to my nose, it smells pretty much like nothing, so I don't see the point really , only for lovers of minimalists perfumes. A waste of Almairac ' s talent.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: The peach is horrible, nothing unique and its not more than a soap scent. not worth the price.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Perfume very attractive, slim, soft, feminine, sexy. This is among my favorites ... Simply wonderful!!

Perfume muito atraente, fino, suave, feminino, sexy. Está entre os meus preferidos... Simplesmente maravilhoso!!!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: I personally don't find anything particularly special in it when I wear this perfume, but men...they call it a Viagra, intoxicating, very sexy. So I keep it :)

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: The green absinthe note, besides mixed with the freesia note, makes this fragrance too sour. I don't like this fragrance. I can't call it pleasant.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: the tan box isn't all that exciting but the bottle is nicely designed :-)

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: at first i felt a little weired!!! but then i became an addicted to this frag.!! Beautiful and refreshness one!!

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
Pretty interesting smell, reminds me a little of my White Musk Blush from The Body shop - musk with hint of vanilla mixed with fruity note and my favorite freesia flower note + amber in the drydown.
This perfume gives confidence :)

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: I tried this a few days ago and loved it - at first. A few minutes later, I couldn't help but smell nothing but potatoes. Weird! Not getting that one after all.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: I love this perfume . . . very classy . . . makes me feel like a high maintainence rich girl

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: I *think* I personally like Burberry Body, but I've known at least 2 people who say this scent gives them an instant headache. They just launched this in June 2011 right? Maybe I have my launch facts wrong...anyway, this will be discontinued within 2 years at least. Not a popular scent, although personally I like it. Not love it though...

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
I was wearing it last night..Typical saturday clubbibg with friends. I had it as a sample so i said...lets give it a try. Honestly and its just personnal, IT RUINED MY NIGHT. I couldn't smell it, i thought i wanted to throw up. I said maybe it was just an awful thought so i started have fun forget about it.But it was coming to my nose and OMG. I found nothing sexy or beautiful about it.I asked a friend-man to smell it and comment it but he was trying to ''find'' it on my neck! And it was all around my nose.
Maybe its just not my type but i think burberry has one treasure, Brit. Nothing else for me...

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content:
There are two koncentrations of Burberry Body, EdP and EdP Intense. Make sure to test both! This review is for the EdP Intense.
I have never been fond of Burberry-scents before. OK, London is fresh and nice, and The Beat is wearable, too, but the rest of the Burberry-scents are way too sweet and heavy for my taste. I have never owned a Burberry-scent before.
But Burberry Body EdP Intense got me! I find similaritys to my old fav Cristobal by Balenciaga and to Chanel Allure EdP. Body EdP Intense is female in the same way as these two frags, just a little softer in it's expression. For an new release, I find Body EdP Intense a unique scent.


Det finns två koncentrationer av Burberry Body, EdP och EdP Intense. Se gärna till att prova båda. Detta inlägg handlar om EdP Intense.
Jag har aldrig förut varit förtjust i Burberrys dofter. OK, London är fräch och trevlig, och The Beat går att använda, men resten av Burberrys dofter är alldeles för söta och tunga för min smak. Jag har aldrig ägt en Burberry-doft förut.
Men Burberry Body EdP Intense fick mig på fall. Jag hittar likheter med min gamla favorit Cristobal av Balenciaga och med Chanel Allure EdP. Body EdP Intense är kvinlig på samma sätt som dessa två dofter, bara lite mjukare i sitt uttryck. För att vara en nylanserad doft tycker jag att Body EdP Intense är en unik doft.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: So mellow...ideal for daytime. It is sultry without meaning it. I can feel the musk and the amber...and some fruit too. I like it a lot.

product_name: Body Eau de Parfum Intense Burberry
review_content: Oh for Pete's sake! Didn't they just release the first version 3 months ago? Am I the only one who is bored to tears with all these flankers that are breeding like rabbits? Are perfume houses so out of new ideas that they don't have anything better to offer? How about making one really good new perfume instead of dozens of new "versions" of something that wasn't too original or memorable at the beginning.

You cannot deny the smell of Burberry (nothing to do with actually liking/disliking it).

While I do think all Burberry scents smell somewhat alike, I have strong favorites (Beat) and strong dislikes (Brit) within the brand. I think it absolutely is a good sign, that a brand has a face.

As for Sport Ice, it smells like a dream of sea, sand, summer and an expensive leather bag. Kind of dreams one has during the the Fall, waiting for the paycheck and vacation or reminiscing vacation long gone.

Colder scent suited for spring, summer or even for colder weather. Refreshing splash of ginger soda and salt water and ... yes, a floral detergent.

It's ok.

I live by the sea & so enjoy the salty sea air & marine freshness on a cool, bright morning walk. I live in the countryside & love the way the ozone clings to my washing when I line dry it. What I don't like is when these beautiful, natural, cool, fresh scents are ruined by some cheap & overpowering fake citrus musk.

Ice is the person in front of you who cleaned their shirt in budget lemon washing powder - the one that assaults your nose with its industrial strength fuzzy-musk & citrus scent.

Of course, there are many people who love this pseudo-fresh musk scent (Lord knows I slip-stream enough washing powder folks as they mosey on down the street). But, for me Ice doesn't cut it. Mix the soft citrus bakery scents of some CKin2U types, mix with some ozionic 90's classics & then dump in a washing tub full of bright, white, fuzzy clean musk. You get the picture: nice, clean-without-the-green, soft citrus musk.

Plain, crisp, white shirt....just not my style. 'Nuff said.

I was never a Burberry perfume fan. They somehow never worked for me, so I didn't even bother to try Burberry Sport. But since I was given Burberry Sport Ice, I just had to try it and it was such a nice surprise.

I got a sharp, cleanser-like, floral with a strong, lovely, water note which later warms into a nice sandy note. A great summer fragrance, nothing too sexy or sweaty, but clean, cool, and really fun.

I tryed it on me and i can say, it's quite refreshing for summer. As a brit lover, i could buy it for this summer. The only thing i didn't like was the time that i could smell it on me..For a few hours, 2-3!
Sharp floral detergent. A must try for fresh laundry kinda cologne fans.Not at all bad but pretty average.

Burberry Sport Ice is thankfully more palatable than Burberry Sport which was a synthetic disaster to my nose.

The composition is mostly citrus with an icy twist, and combines delicate musky and sandy undertones to give it that little hint of originality. Yes, it does appear to be a cold, frosty scent, and although refreshing, I think it could also suit moderately cold weather, especially a rainy day.

It's not a sillage monster, but it projects rather well for a subtle citrus-based fragrance. Many are mentioning the ginger note, and while it's present, it's not particularly prominent. Burberry Sport Ice falls either into the category of being a clean citrus fragrance or an aquatic. Floral isn't the right word to describe this perfume.

I'll agree that it reminds me of a chilled glass of soda water, especially since I feel that this fragrance radiates a somewhat sparkling quality. It's feminine and inoffensive, which are two things that have drawn me into liking this fragrance. However I must add that I'm disappointed in Burberry for producing way too many forgettable flankers and not coming up with new fragrances like the classics, which were the reason why I came to love Burberry in the first place.

For a Summer scent, Burberry Sport Ice is right up there as being a pleasant and wearable fragrance. I find this fragrance a little similar in both style and scent to Burberry Brit Sheer, so lovers of that perfume will most likely enjoy this.
So similar to the original Burberry Sport, but more citrusy and, ergo, more sporty.

Can't really notice the ginger in it. Mainly aqua and floral note stands out, and the powdery musk with sand follow after 3-hour development.

Not really my cup of tea but i have to say it's a nice scent itself.

I so loved it! Sweet but not over sweet, rich smell, deep and earthy, and the same time very very elegant and sic. Peach and cinnamon and something mysterious like liqueur! The bottle, excellent, classy! Please, please, please, bring it back!!!!

Society is class and sophistication bottled. At first the scent intimidates
almost smells dirty. Stong and bold, after settling into it you realize it is dirty...sexy dirty. A well blended Burberry classic that may not be suitable for younger women. Definely not a beginner scent. Projects well and lasts 6-8 hours. A masterpiece that can't be compared to anything I've ever smelled.

I'm not crazy, after all. Every time I've worn Society (vintage) I thought I smelled cassia/cassis/blackberry/redcurrant, and apparently others do, too.

Sillage seems moderate, I have a co-worker who is quick to complain about whatever I'm wearing, and her silence at this one seems to confirm it, although I try to use a light hand (4 sprays max, unless it's weak.)

Cassia and similar smelling notes are a challenge for me, but I like this. I'm a fan of Chypres, so the other notes are familiar to me. I occasionally get a waft of air that reminds me of Dana Tabu. Something about it makes me think of middle school, (I attended '95-98) so I'm wondering if a teacher wore it. It makes me think of the cultural expectations of moms of that era, stereotypically feminine yet somehow asexual.

I'm not sure what occasion this is for. I wear it to work, and can't imagine where else. Church, a family reunion, maybe a wedding? Somewhere a little formal but not a place where you need a tool of seduction. Not a job interview, either, could be migraine inducing for some.

Oh, do I feel privileged to have a wee sample of this beauty!

For some little while I have been extremely fond of vintage floral bouquets. Some are soapy. Some are challenging. Most are Big and Gorgeous, others sensitive and delicate.

Burberry Society strides right down the middle - neither massive nor shy. The name is utterly appropriate. More like an elegant woman wearing a linen dress with corsage than a young girl wearing a vintage Laura Ashley dress, but either image is appropriate.

The first whiff was quite reminiscent of DVF's charming Tatiana. Indeed, the orange blossom is to blame! As the fragrance develops it leans another direction altogether and even slightly resembles EA's Splendor. Splendor has too much Freesia by far for my skin, whereas the lilies here give a similar effect without being overwhelming or shrill.

I will not lie. If I found an inexpensive bottle I would buy Society, but at the current prices I will hold fast to my other delightful floral bouquets without a backward glance. This is not as distinctive as Sung (greens and narcissus!) or Estee Lauder Beautiful (roses AND so much more!), both of which are fast favorites of mine. Distinctive or not, Society is Stunning, however, and you will not be sorry to have met her. :D

Spring in a bottle.

Society is one of the best Osmanthus perfumes I have smelled to date. It smells like natural osmanthus. I love this perfume, this is the Osmanthus scent I've been searching for. A super stunning yellow floral/floral perfume. Why do they discontinue these older gems? This smells like class, elegance, and like old money. Gorgeous. I will be buying more mini's of this beautiful scent. If you love osmanthus you need to find a bottle or a mini.

Edit: 6/13/22 This has an osmanthus/orange blossom darkly seeped smell. Like all of the notes have been steeped to make a darkly brewed tea. Really lovely.

Translating this fragrance is like deciphering the code to a great many youthfully vintage perfumes - one stammers with anything more than monosyllabic noise and big facial expressions. Society fits well into the same, leaving breathless mouths agape, and "wow", "well", and "whoa" descriptors. Although I feel this site portrays, in large part, an approachable catalogue of perfumes and their identifiers, I feel missing the cassia top note just plain negligent. Supported by research on other sites I feel confident when I say, that despite very strong character support provided by Osmanthus, Tuberose, and Gardenia, Cassia dominates from the start through to final gasps of dry down. It is for this very reason some may find such strong uric notes to challenge them out of wear or welcome. In fact, I would share that inkling if not for the vast play underfoot. Torpedoes of light, sweet and musky, entwine with the woody and smoky tones encasing a heart of amber. On the surface, placid waters remain still, confidently smothering the passionate torrent below. Dubious floral chords arise sporadically, and convincingly summon a gentle floral presence before, again placing the wearer in the heart if a traditionally pungent chypre. As for this chyprephile, and bonafide perfume enthusiast, I can only say my affections remain fickle. Whose to know which days something unusual becomes a fine caviar, and which days it is plainly fish eggs.

Bought this out of curiosity... because its compared to my belove scent tribu.
I personally cant detect the resemblance of these two. Maybe distant cousins..

Burberry society is classy, feminine and truly burberry english.
Society is for the mature and sophisticated bosslady.

Flowery, strong and potent...definetely not for the faint of heart.

Longevity is eternal and silage is more than an armslenght.

If you like me like vintage perfumes this is for sure a must try.

I love it, a sparkling diamond in my collection

🙂 okay, so... Burberry scents are usually so well blended, it's kinda hard for a newbie like me to recognize the notes. but i'm working on it. i have one of those humble, tiny bottles. upon first "splash" it was just so-so. but after the drydown i got a really nice, exotic medley of flowers. i do get the tuberose. i do get the hyacinth. and there's a hint of something cool and fresh. almost minty. its really nice. distinguished and respectable. this strikes me as a unique, pleasant, and professional "boss scent". something an established entrepreneur would wear.

don't always need expertise to know what's good, right?
The opening is very strong and pungent and it causes me headache, but when it drys down after two hours its heavenly, and it leaves the most intoxicating trail I have ever smelled in my entire life.

I have the vintage, and this fragrance is a VERY vintage scent. Lovely. The main notes in order are: a deep, honeyed, rich floral; osmanthus, orange blossom, mimosa, orchid, oakmoss, hint of rose, musk,

Review of vintage edp:

OSMANTHUS. Plummy, suedey osmanthus. I love this note- it is always much darker than I expect it to be, and for me that alone makes this an evening scent. If you want to like leather, but find you can't wear it, try osmanthis- it's a very similar effect, without the harshness or tang you get with leather notes.

In the heart, I get mimosa and a light orchid note, warming BS and softening the scent.

The dry down is greener, with a touch of green hyacinth, bergamot, and incense added to the now soft osmanthus.

Over all, I find Society to be warm, a little dark, plummy, with light floral and citrus notes. Very elegant, with an almost voluptuous vibe, but restrained. Think of a full skirted dress with a cinched in waist- controlled, but very, very feminine, and you can't help noticing the shape of the body underneath. Not in an obvious way, but you are very aware of curves ;)
I'm surprised there is not a berry or cherry note listed in this. All I get is a strong heavy sweet cherry syrup note.

I had this scent as a kid, and I only vaguely remember it. I do, however, remember the ad campaign...

Society - You were born to it.

And the Kardashians wept.

For me this is a classical indolic scent in the vein of Joy or Kate Moss Vintage Muse - not at all what I expected from reading the other reviews. Society is quite smooth and rich, evoking an elegant 80's vibe. It's definitely NOT a cold or sparkling scent on me. The top notes from my bottle are musty, which could be because my bottle is a little old, but the heart and base notes are still good. Sillage is moderate and longevity is quite good on me.

I'm surprised there are no berry notes listed in the opening. For me, this scent is about rich, dark berries over a base of moss and musk. I loved it when I first smelled it, in the 90s when my late father gave it as a gift to my mother, and I love it still. Look for the original Burberry version, not the later reformulation by another company. The original version will say "By Burberrys" on the box and on the bottom bottle label, under the perfume name. There's also an image of a white knight on horseback on the original's red, rounded bottle cap. For a special treat, layer the original version under a quick spritz of Hanae Mori!

It's like having a mouth full of 5 flavour lifesavers. Only better. Truly one of the unique fragrances of yesteryear. Therefore in the hoard category. I must add an enveloping aroma. best of Burberry's scents ever. Not available here any more either.

Still on the fence if this is 'love', or just 'like', but leaning towards love, at the first spritz.

It was nice, well behaved, proper fragrance, certainly flowery but very well blended.
Gardenia seemed prominent, and African orange flower poked through, not so much of the hyacinth or rose though, a hint of vanilla, all ever so lightly but nicely "smoked".
And then there was this monster something that was sweet nearly to the point of cloying... is that osmanthus? I have never came face to face with the real osmanthus, so I do not know how it smells.
I was thinking how could anyone put so much of "it" into the fragrance but, at the same time, I was strangely drawn to it. It reminded me of something from the distant past, perhaps a place, or a flower I smelled in passing, but I could not recall what that was, only that I actually liked that smell.
Apparently, still do.

Overall, I get this feeling that Society is very aptly named as I keep imagining it worn at a fancy dinner in a fancy garden, by a well dressed, well versed woman who could very possibly bear a title of Lady. After all, this is Burberry.
I get this feeling that pairing Society with jeans and tee shirt might be a sacrilege, nevertheless, I will most likely do it as I'm a rebel.

I'd say Society is a nice fall fragrance, not so much for dead of winter, but ideal for the Indian Summer.
Sillage: rather soft, no tail.
Longevity: amazing! I took a long shower with one of those Dove Cashmere Oil soaps and, several more hours afterwards, Society is still here. And the drydown is heavenly; I can't stop sniffing my wrist...
I love this my son says it smells like christmas.. Very enjoyable a bit muskier than I usually wear but love the tones. Wish I could buy some in Australia

The name says it all... .
Classy, feminine, sparkling and fresh, not too young. Suitable for every woman who wants a classy and easy to wear perfume.
Burberry Society EDP is my favorite and wonder where I could buy it again in Singapore
So elegant, English style, cold and amazing , timeless …the best one of Burberrys.

I bought this from a "bargin bin",an untested impulse buy.
It is inoffensive. I spritz it on my way out the door to no where special.

I do not mean to damn this frag with faint praise as it is pleasant.
If the bottle was a bit groovier I would suggest it was for a young girl. The staid presentation of bottle and box is at odds with carefree ,casual fragrance.

As the notes suggest it is a bit fruity, a bit floral with a musty, powery ondertone.
It lasts for a couple of hours. Definitely won't offend or frighten so okay for work.
So sad this has been discontinued. What a shame. This is such a beautiful elegant timeless fragrance. It's versatile and very underrated.

Aromatic & Green Chypre with Peach Tea drydown...
This is another contemporary interpretation of a chypre from master perfumer Michel Almairac. Opens with a burst of wormwood-chypre and dries down to peach-tea and cashmere. In the first couple of minutes after the spray dries, I can the feel the fruity green-apple & peach accented by the bitter-green, herbal & aromatic tones of wormwood. Wormwood here reads a little like a greener oakmoss with a dash of incense to my nose. Already the rose & tea are swelling through. As it transitions to the heart the rose & tea move forward and sandalwood adds a woody sweetness. This all rests on a fluffy musk & Cashmere wood base with hints of amber-vanilla. Performance is well above average.

Contrast to Body by Burberry EDP:
Also composed by Michel Almairac, these are very similar, although the EDT is slightly less sweet, and the tannic component is more obviously a tea note. Both are well above average performance-wise.

Contrast to Body Tendre by Burberry:
Also composed by Michel Almairac, these are very similar, although Body Tendre is more rose forward. Both are well above average performance-wise.

Overall: gorgeous green, aromatic chypre with peach-tea drydown and well above average performance that becomes beast mode when layered over its matching body lotion. It's a longtime love for me. Enjoy!

I really love the apple note in this fragrance, and it's the reason why I chose the EDT over the EDP.

I think of Burberry Body EDT as an ideal professional scent. It's a perfect one to wear to a job interview, or on the first day of a promotion, or just any time you want to feel put together and get taken seriously. While this is a very pleasant perfume, it's also quite serious, making it a good fit for a more serious-type person.
I'm a teacher, and this fragrance screams educational professional to me (think high school level teacher, school administrator, or even college professor).

And while I wouldn't necessarily say that Body EDT has masculine vibes, it definitely leans unisex.

Also, longevity and sillage are just as good, if not better, than a lot of EDPs. I get 6-8 hours wear from it on my skin, and it lasts all day on clothes.

Light sour apple with hints of artemisia
It is less powdery than EDP, it's more fresh
I'd say its perfect season is the early spring
A musky powder with hints of peach and rose. Does not project like an EDT normally does...sits very close to the skin. Good for the office.

Burberry Body EDT reminds me of Givenchy Ange Ou Demon Le Secret EDT (the pale yellow one) but it's jasmine is replaced by rose here. fortunately I can't pick up wormwood. I can detect apple and rose and tea(which is one of rare green notes that I enjoy) in a light musky,woody base. it's notes are well blended and I don't find it too rosey, or too fruity, or too musky or too woody or too green. it's a bit of each of these blending together creating a pleasant,springy scent which I find versatile,easy to wear and ageless .it's fresh and crisp but also warm and sunny. I don't find it too unique or interesting but who cares? there's no need for every perfume to be earth shattering.it's work place friendly and can make a safe gift choice. longevity and sillage wise it's not too strong but not bad for an edt.it's recognizable for people standing close to you without being overpowering to bother anyone
من رو یاد جیونچی آنجو دمون له سکرت ادوتویلت(اونی که زرد کمرنگه) میندازه بااین تفاوت که انگار اینجا بجای یاس، رز داریم. خوشبختانه من اون نت ورم وود رو حس نمیکنم. من سیب میگیرم و رز و چای تو یه زمینه ملایم چوبی،مشکی. بنظرم عطر دلپذیر و همه پسند و راحتیه. ملایم و فرش و تمیزه درعین حال یکم گرمای ملایم داره شبیه گرمای آفتاب اوایل بهار. عطر خاص یا پیچیده یا خیلی جالبی نیست اما برای محل کار خیلی مناسبه و گزینه امنیه واسه کادو و بنظر من از اون عطراست که محدودیت سنی نداره. از نظر پخش و موندگاری قوی نیست اما واسه ادوتویلت بودنش بد هم نیست. درحدی هست که دیگران هم اگه نزدیکتون باشن متوجهش میشن اما نه به شدتی که بتونه واسه کسی اذیت کننده بشه

Love this in warm spring weather! It’s way more tolerable than the edp cuz the wormwood is toned down and not hogging the stage as it is in the edp. I get green apple, rose and cashmere. It’s a nice comforting, safe but beautiful all grown up fragrance ❤️🥰 I’m loving her today! It’s still a fruity floral but with an edge.

After the first like few minutes this special peachy flowery note fades away and what remains is actually very generic. You feel you have smelled it thousend times before. I prefer the edp version, it lasts much longer, but I think I need to revisit this in summertime🙂

Smells like a toned down version of Kenneth Cole Reaction.
Glad, I only ordered a sample

This is a likable scent , its light which means I can wear it during the hot summer days and not get a headache. As most comments had said that if smells "fresh and clean" I agree that it does , I will be wearing this after showers, running earrands and to work. Body EDT does not project it is more of a skin scent on me.

the powder scent in-it really stands out, this scent makes me feel clean, fresh
wore for 6h+ and could still catch sniffs of it on my clothing
but tbh this fragrance is just to mature in the like elderly-woman type thing.
This is so nice, it does remind me of Gucci Envy Me. I am glad I have it since that one is discontinued. A fresh, modern rose and perfect for daily wear.

Nanalvzpink is right, this is baby Tresor!
I remember disliking Body EDP a few years ago but now from a sample I love the EDT. It even has some Biagiotti’s Venezia Pastello in it (not the original Venezia).
Anyway, a pretty yet slightly 90s smelling rosy musky pretty womanly scent, reminiscent of some Sophia Grojman creations with that type of rose used.
Off to try the EDP again!

I'm with waikikid -- my sample is so synthetic it's gross. It's rare that I "dislike" any fragrance, because usually there's something to like, even with cheap body sprays... but here I have to make an exception. It's so bad, in contrast to so many reviews, that I wonder whether there's something wrong with the batch being distributed at this time.

I tried Burberry Body EDT and EDP for five days.

I decided to get the EDT because it’s the sophisticated clean and fresh smell that I was looking for. Although it’s not the EDP version, don’t think you won’t get performance because you will.

EDP is a baby version of Tresor by Lancôme. It’s too musky and rosy for my liking.

It was difficult for me to pick between the two. I sampled them for several days because they are both lovely.
However, I decided in EDT because it’s more me.

I like the edt and the edp but it took awhile for me to get used to the edp. I assumed the edp would be better but i was wrong. This one, the edt, is better to me because the rose stands out more in this than in the edp. The edp has a really strong wormwood smell that is only deepened by the peach and its not good right away because of that. The edt on the other hand has the apple which opens the door for the rose to step in and use the wormwood as a doormat, which suits this scent far better.
the depth of the edp is far more my style as it lingers thick around my body and i love that. Although the airy crisp rose is a stunner too in the edt as it dances around and envelops leaving a trail as well. Im glad to have both since i crave both quite often. They have actually replaced my beloved Spellbound which i never thought that could happen. Not cuz theyre similar scents but the essence of the fragrance is similar.
All I smell is rose... Cheap shampoo rose. 60 year old woman attending Easter Sunday mass.

I have finally discovered the perfect light apple scent. Body EdT is my favourite of the Body line. The wormwood in Tender is so strong and bitter, it dominates the composition and makes it unwearable in warmer weather. The rose is more subdued than in the EdP, and the apple note it just right. Lovely!
It reminds me of the sadly discontinued Gucci Envy me.
I smell a refined Apple and flowers. Did not love it at first sniff,but as times passes by, it is becoming a favourite. Also, not a massive scent.

The first time I tried Burberry Body EDT I did not like it, I felt it smelled of pure incense, very strong, I ran to shower and left it aside. I gave it another chance, this time I applied it further and let it dry .... and now it is my favorite fragrance, it is clean, beautiful and intelligent, nothing strong if you apply it carefully ... I am of sensitive smell, so i try to buy only edt
This is my bedtime and study-time scent. It doesn’t last long but smells clean and comforting while also being unique. I tried the EDP and didn’t like it, but the EDT is just right.

This is a very lovely, fresh but warm, a bit unusual fragrance I think. I used to almost not feel that I had it on after a couple of hours, but then after a full workingshift at the nursing home when I walked by a couple of coworkers, they told me I was smelling so good. Sweaty and all..! 🙂 So I guess this goes well with my skin, then. But since I did not feel it so much myself, I went buying the edp. But unfortunately it’s a bit too strong for my nose - the absinthe, I think. So next time I will stick to this lighter version after all - I just have to respray a little, if needed!! And then I want the Tender version as well... maybe even more lovely. Well worth having both, I think! For spring and summer mostly.

This is ok, it's alot better than some perfumes I've tried recently and more complex, it's pretty, but there is something about it that just isn't screaming LOVE to me.

This smells pretty much identical to the edp with only a small difference,..but for me that small difference is enough for me to much prefer the edp over this one, this perfume is basically just the edp backwards..with the edp the wormwood is more upfront and it makes the scent warmer and the fruit and rose is in the background but still noticeable, with this one the wormwood is in the background and the fruit and rose are upfront and prominent, this is basically the lighter daytime version of the edp.

I thought that I would like this just as much but I don't, strangely for me I'm not actually sure about the blend of the rose and fruit and so the wormwood in the edp actually took the edge off of that for me..I don't know what it is as it's still pleasant but it kinda ends up smelling dare I say it..like a peachy room freshener, not as bad as some that I've tried, nowhere near..but enough to make me not sure about it, the wormwood being more upfront in the edp takes the edge off of this for me and overall it just blends better and I actually enjoy the rose and peach in it because it smells more rounded, less sharp and less pungent with the wormwood taking centre stage, the edp is also alot more unique x
This is exactly the same as body tender. Come on now! Be more creative!!!!

I bought this during the summer along with the Body tender. They are quite similar, but being an EDT this doesn't last very long on my skin. A bit fruity, but not as much as you'd expect. It's fresh and woody, but soft and delicate. You can aid the silage and longevity by using along with Burberry's Body Milk, which smells absolutely divine. This fragrance makes me feel very feminine. The design of this bottle is absolutely gorgeous as well, Crystal-like with some define heft. The tall thin Body bottle is the perfect vessel to be held and easily sprayed. Burberry did well once again with the Body line.

My mom used to wear Shower to Shower powder which used to choke me....this smells similar and yeahhh I do not feel choked! Fresh, clean scent that reminds me of Mom's hug. Perfect for office or just a relaxing day at home.

Clean kind of scent, fresh laundry kind. Soft, musky, really really musky. Daytime, office, just not my kind of musky type. Soapy after 30 minutes. Rose shows off subtly.
Apple there's none.
If talking about daytime office scents i choose Nina Ricci Love in Paris.

As winter gives way to spring and the weather starts warming up, the EDP of this perfume is better replaced with this EDT that opens with cool, crisp apple and peach followed closely by rose and refreshing tea. A light sprinkling of woods and musk are not far behind and all of the notes are in harmony with each other. Eventually, the apple fades but tea, rose, a good amount of musk, and a light woodiness remains on the skin.

This is really like a “just out of the shower” skin scent. It’s aptly names “Body” and has become a staple in my perfume wardrobe. Great for everyday wear. Lasts about 5-6 hours on me that I can pick up faintly when I press my nose to my wrist, but there have been occasions that I was complimented long after. So maybe this lasts longer, but I just can’t smell it after a while.

People, especially men, seem to love this on me as well as the EDP during the winter time. Trick is, don’t spray this too heavily. When they pick up a subtle hint of this fragrance, it seems to make them turn their head and wonder, “where is that beautiful scent coming from?” It doesn’t bash them over the head. It’s intriguing, a bit coy, and alluring. For that reason, it’s a bit mysterious.
This lasts well on my skin. I do not smell any fruit or florals, just a fresh, clean scent. Safe for work, school ect. Nothing special.
This is decent if you want to wear a basic fragrance that is normal. Seems the staying power is decent. Just a regular floral musky scent.
I love this light scent. It is uplifting throughout the day. It smells intoxicating.

Ahh yes... This is my favorite version of the Burberry Body line! The original was too heavy for me, but the EDT version strikes just the right pitch. It's an amped up clean skin scent on me - the apple is definitely there, but it's more tart than sweet, lending a crispness to the scent. Peach and rose are definitely prominent, just like the pyramid suggests. The original could definitely come across as a more "mature" scent, while I find the EDT much more versatile. The powder and woods are toned down, but still present in the dry down. Essentially, this Body smells like a combination of freshly washed skin, lotioned up, with some natural rosy muskiness. Clean and comfortable and elegant. Lovely and feminine.

And BONUS! I am in love with the oil spray, and the EDT is much more similar to the oil than the original EDP is. A few squirts of the oil and one spritz of the perfume and the fragrance envelops me in a comfortable hug that hints at something more.. Just a touch more intimate than friendly, not quite sensual, but the chemistry's there. ;) <3

I thought I remembered falling in love with this perfume after testing it last summer. However, regrettably, after buying a 35ml bottle online I discovered I must have been remembering a different Burberry fragerence as this is rather unpleasant on my skin, sort of tart and metallic but with a nauseating sweetness, my brother mentioned it smelt just like Turkish delight, and I agree! Fresh and fruity at first but as as it dries the main note I can smell the rose/Turkish delight. To me its a very cold fragerence, reminds me of cool glass, I suppose like roses in an elegent glass vase on a fresh spring day. I can see why others love this, its delicate and fresh but unfortunately just does not sit well on my skin. This is probably a long shot but does anyone in the UK want to arrange a swap (preferably for another fresh, fruity spring/summer fragerence, but I'm open to trying other things)? I'm new and don't know how that works on here, but please do let me know!

This is a heavenly, green, rosy, sophisticated fragrance. Although it is not hugely popular, it is one of the best fragrances I have ever smelled. However, the one down-side is that it has absolutely no lasting power or sillage. The EDP lasts longer, but the fragrance is different. I am torn between whether I should repurchase or not.

Oh my god, I can´t smell anything on my skin!? Literally nothing? I even asked the sales assistant to smell my wrist because I thought there was something wrong with my nose. She said: Almost non existing! Anyone with the same experience? I´m really dissappointed because I had so high expectations for this one. Maybe the edp or Body intense is worth a try.

Update: Indeed the BB Gold limited edition EdP is beautiful and very long lasting. So glad I didnt give up on this one too easily :)

Not bad. I bought this for work. I needed something classy and not to heavy. It's fruity and woody. It's such a pleasant fragrance for a pleasant woman . Kinda smell corporate so that's why I like it :)

I have the spray-on body oil version of Burberry Body. It is very light and pleasant. On first application it reminds me of canned lychees. Then it develops into a barely-there soft-musk scent with a perceptible woody tone. I have to put the back of my hand up to my nose to smell it after 2 hours or so; by then, there is the faintest hint of tobacco (might be the tea). I don't get any rose or apple tones. This is a keeper: a your-skin-only-better scent for sure. Funny, but the dry down of this reminds me of the considerably less expensive Cafe Cafe, albeit much more subtle. The tall, sculptural bottle is a work of art.
This one smells way better than the eau de parfum which is too thick and strong.

Smells great. It's light, fresh, flowery and not cloying at all. It smells different and more special than typical floral scents.. I have the edp and like that but this one is more wearable and not as heavy. It also has great longevity and sillage. It lasted overnight on me and lasted long on my clothes. I'm surprised at how much I love this. This is an everyday scent but I can see it worn more in the spring or summer.

Just bought this and I LOVE it. I find the eau de parfum version a little too strong/woody, but this lighter EDT version is perfect. Smells kind of like Chloe EDP but not so floral... It reminds me of fresh laundry, roses and expensive soap. Somehow I think it manages to be simultaneously warm and fresh - it's a very comforting scent in my opinion. It also doesn't smell too "perfumey" if that makes any sense... It's the kind of perfume where you would get more comments saying "you smell good" rather than "your perfume smells good".

I am probably going to end up buying this one. The scent from Burberry Body is definitely what I would call fresh. Very office/professional appropriate. Like others, I definitely like the EDT better. The EDP is a bit cloying. Pretty, feminine, fresh and light.

Horrible, definitely not like the smell of wormwood, bitter and spoils perfumes. Or maybe I met him in bad combinations. Another was a Le Male Jean Paul Gaultier.
Maybe it in a perfume of summer, just tea and green, or milky notes ... But not with lemon and citrus, and woods notes, this is too much

Wonderful scent! Very similar to the Body EDP and the other flankers. There's no iris or freesia in this one, but the similarity is still stunning.
The thing I love about it, is the soft composition of peach and rose with a little bit of wood.
Warm, feminine and simply elegant.
And typically Burberry.

Lovely and fresh rosey scent, perfect for spring or summer when the EDP would be too heavy. I am a huge admirer of Body EDP, however I wouldn't wear it during summertime, I find it too heavy and smokey on me. This nice edt version is the solution for this, I think it is nothing like "old lady", it is a really delighting and smiley fragrance, maybe not for teenagers though.

I've been searching for a new fragrance for a long time, testing and spraying whenever out shopping. I always seemed to go back to this so I finally made the purchase only to discover that my daughters think I smell like "old lady"! When I wear this I smell vanilla, sandalwood, peach and rosy powder? I like it, but won't purchase again as I don't want to smell like "old lady". So off again to find the perfect fragrance.
Fresh rose and peach smell. beautiful. Smells better that body EDP. I love it.

Lovely light fragrance for every day. For me, the EDT is fresher compared to the EDP and the longevity is good. It starts off bright and rosey then after about half an hour it becomes soft and powdery. I like the bottle too.

I have loved perfume, sine the first time I bought my first bottle. Over the year my my taste hasn't changed, but I still hadn't found the "one". Recently with a lull period of not wearing any perfumes. I found Burberry Body. This perfume is me (today - described in detail within the scent). I love it. Powdery and woody smell, with musk and fruit scents, after a few hours the woody/powdery scent comes out more and the one important thing, is that my husband loves it on my skin. I love this smell.

First seconds after spraying I feel some cool, refreshing, "sparkling", fruity champagne, then comes the sugar coated but still sour, mouthwatering apple followed by a nice rose bouquet.
When it settles down, it becomes warm ( sandalwood, I think). It's a pity that I don't get all the base notes- no vanilla, no cashmere. It's musky and keeps some of the apple sourness, freshness.
I imagine it on a young, modern woman wearing high heels and following the trends.
Nice, "positive", sunny perfume for summer but nothing unique I would recognize.

I like the smell of roses. It reminds me of the rose garden my grandmother used to have when I was little. That said, this perfume doesn't smell like 'old lady'. Well, at least not to my nose. It's subtle, fresh, and puts a smile on my face. It' also somewhat soothing. I can smell the wormwood in the opening, then it's mostly rose with a hint of peach and tea on my skin. These are the notes I have been able to distinguish, so far. It's classy and sophisticated. It won't offend anyone unless you bathe in it.
I'm going to test it a few more times, then perhaps get it with my Sephora discount card within the next couple of months.

I agree with flowergirlsusie. This is lighter and fresher than the original Body edp, which I found could get quite sickly and a bit cloying (I imagine the edp would induce headaches in those that are sensitive). The apple in the opening of this EDT makes the scent crisp and airy. The apple note is not like the one in dkny delicious. I found it to be more like the note in the body shop apple shampoo from a long time ago. This perfume is also woodier than the edp and I found this to be enjoyable. It is a clean scent and easy to wear. Good for day wear and I would say any season really if it's just for day use. Others found this scent pleasant and I had a couple of compliments on it.

I got the tester for this one. When I first sprayed it, I thought: "No way, I'd never wear this!" Then, as it dried down, I began to detect a really nice rose and peach smell. What I like most about this is those two notes. It's rather soft, sensual and feminine. I wouldn't wear this everyday, as I'm more into unisex fragrances, but I do appreciate this one. Pricey.
May give this one a try if it's softer that the original edp. Actually the latter is a very good one but way too sharp on my skin.

I agree with others that it is the most practical, but it is not generic smelling like some say. It’s a woody fragrance, yet the EDP is the most woody for me. I get a lot of compliments on this. I like it a lot. It’s professional smelling. You can find testers on EBay for around $45. Crazy

The EDT version is the cleanest-smelling and most practical version. It's truly fresh and quite masculine. The other products in the series can be a bit boring with their leather and coconut notes, but the final stages are all very clean and practical. I think they offer a quality profile that's not too noticeable yet, but blends in well.

There are four fragrances in this series, and all four are different from each other.
