I'd like to help those interested in this perfume sort:

Clean, light, bright, vibrant, and sophisticated: EDT
Slightly subtle, but relatively energetic, with a slight coconut note: EDP
Deepest, very leather-themed, close to the skin, and uniform: PARFUM
The coconut is the most pronounced, vibrant, and leather-themed: PARFUM INTENSE

My preference for this particular fragrance was definitely the EDT version. The only version in the series that feels different is the EDT. If you're blind-buying, go for the EDT only. It's inferior to the others in terms of longevity, but on average, all of them last 4-8 hours.
Fresh and woody, quite versatile, smells nice, kinda weak though.

daily drivers can be found in the hero line, and this edt is the dailiest of them all.
citrusy woody and peppery. smells great albeit very simple.
it didnt last on my skin for as long as it did on my clothing.
my dad thought the smell that lingered was my fart.

it is still worth getting.

as most say, yeah it's a bit boring, I can't see myself buying a full bottle of this and actually finishing it.

that said the whiffs are pretty nice, and this is quite strong, even if the smell is just ok to me, I would wear this if I got it for free or something lol, a spray on my hand happened to latch to the sleeve of my sweater and its been here for over a week!
Terre D Hermes but better in everywhere

The entire Burberry Hero line deserves better ratings. The freshest of the bunch, Hero for Men lends itself to layering with its brothers. I like to lay down a little base of Parfum Intense and spray this on top. Opposites do attract!

This is definitely a safe blind buy. I love the edt for daily use, it's powerful in the beginning, very spicy, but quickly calms down and you can really appreciate the scent in its fullest form. I'm not great at describing all of the notes, but to me this is such a good blend of citrus and woody, neither is begging for the attention, which allows you to really appreciate both for what they're worth. It's such a simple fragrance that you can't really go wrong with purchasing it and as long as you can handle the spicy opening, you will really like this for a good daily and year-round fragrance.
This was one of my favorite scents, i wore this daily and wore it everywhere when i was 19-20 . i received so many complements wearing this. Super safe blind buy or if you want to buy it as a gift.

Overall one of the best office scents out there average performance get about a full day of work out of it just a super easy wear nothing you’re going to write home about but if you want to smell nice without thinking about it such a easy pick up
If your looking for a clean office scent .. . This is it .

I’m a girl but I enjoy smelling perfumes and colognes at the mall for fun and I realized that I don’t smell many guys at my school wearing cologne—so I tested it myself! This is the BEST cologne I’ve ever smelt and I’m so shocked that more guys don’t wear this? When I get a boyfriend if he doesn’t already wear this I’m buying it for him because it is so good.

Surprised by the "low" score on this one. This fragrance (EdT) has given me several unsolicited compliments from strangers and friends over the years.

This is a safe, clean scent. Phenomenal for office and brunch (!). Works great for all four seaons. You can easily use it as a date-fragrance as well.

What I smell in the drydown is tonka bean, same as in Burberry Touch. I doubt that they are logging the Himalayas to get Himalayan Cedar. Or the Atlas Mountains for Atlas Cedar. Those are all made-up notes concocted from coumarin. Boring.

This is totally my kind of scent. I love woody colognes, and this one delivers. It's almost entirely built on a warm rich cedar base that is very masculine and appealing. It brings lots of peppery spice to add character and the juniper and bergamot give it liveliness and lift. There's just enough sweetness to smooth things out a bit, and the overall accord is a traditional woodsy one but with a modern refinement. This is a great versatile all season scent that's safe but interesting. The only knock is that the performance is pretty average, with several hours of moderate projection before it becomes more of a lingering skin scent. This is one you will need to reapply it you're looking for an all-day scent. But so-so performance aside, if you like woody scents you still can't go wrong with this one. I dig it.

I got a sample of this with my Sephora bday gift which was a mini bottle of Her. I thought it smelled nice, ask my boyfriend if he wanted it & forgot all about it. Tonight we went out to eat and in the car I kept getting powdery, masculine, clean whiffs of something off him. He smelled soooo good. I complimented him and he told me it was this. Will probably be getting him a bottle for Christmas, bc it def suited him well. I think this may be a “boring” option for people who are really into cologne collecting, but it’s a nice gift for guys who just like to smell nice and appreciate a little something nice. Brand name and from what I’ve seen, fairly affordable.

I don’t understand the hate towards this, I like it very much! Smells fresh, clean and professional yet more unique than other blue scents.

Can be worn anytime and I believe it’s the best fragrance to give a good first impression.

Longevity is good for me, around 6-8 hrs with 4 sprays

As a bonus, magnetic cap and decent atomizer!
When you want to smell nice this is safe one, black pepper comes through and bring into a scent profile
Nothing but cedar
Pretty boring. Smells like something I could buy in a body spray gift set from Walmart.
Good, but boring.

I really like the smell, doesn't smell synthetic. The top and mid notes last for about 30 minutes and then there is this rich smelling slightly spicy and fresh cedar. It lasts for about 5 hours but it projects well only if you are sweating or in high heat. Definitely don't pay retail price, buy it at the trusted discounters.
Smells good, but a bit boring as which means very office safe. Last maybe 4 to 6 hrs arms length. 7/10. If you want a better version get DH 2020.
This is a great scent if you can’t afford dh2020 and want something in that same ballpark. High end designer clothing store type of scent like some have mentioned before on here

So, some dude was wearing this in the elevator, and he smelled amazing. I thought it was Virgin Island Water at first, since I have some. Turns out, he was wearing Burberry Hero. I told him it smelled like a Creed, and he thought I was calling him a creep. How awkward, right? But I really liked the scent, and it left a nice trail. It smelled super crisp.
Fresh & Woody, i like this a lot! its so good, very underrated. And i love the presentation ! Thick bottle and excellent magnetic cap

Honestly get DUA Lionheart for exact scent and great longevity. Great masculine scent that's fresh and woodsy. Burberry doesn't last that long here. The edp and parfum are much better. But great scent

Citrus design pretty simple. It's not bad at all. It's a super simple type of fragrance. There's def better stuff out there. It's a 7/10–6/10 nothing unique, but it does the work I guess... I've only really used this cologne as my room's air freshener haven't really worn it. I feel like there's just so much better stuff out there, so much other stuff out there that makes me overlook this fragrance. It's alright, nothing groundbreaking (just my opinion). Someone else said it semlls like holister there honestly right smells similar.

A slightly sweet and smooth citrus with a nice touch of cedar. Great for daily wear but shines in high heat weather. The most versatile in the hero line. Lasts slightly under average and projects close to your skin. High quality and nice bottle with magnetic cap. Solid 7.5/10

Smells like when you enter Hollister, straight wood and musk.

55$ for 100ml is what i paid

This smells good but it’s kinda generic at the same time. There’s nothing unique or special about it and for a freshie it doesn’t wow me like GNtonic & LV cactus garden did recently. This is very similar to DH2020 especially on the drydown where it’s literally just iso e super. I already have the purest form of that in m01 so this would just be redundant DNA for me. Still a decent scent but an easy pass for me.
Unique smelling, easy to wear, summer scent. Refreshing

Nose Note #220

Funny how it doesn't remind people of anything else but other flankers of Hero and Wood&Wood by Issey Miyake. 2000+ votes and only three similar fragrances, I haven't seen anything like that on Fragrantica.

This is one of the only fragrances that I would call truly "woody". This is absolutely cedar heavy. So much cedar that it comes off smokey for some reason. But still the performance is underwhelming + I quickly become noseblind to it.

Overall nice woody scent with a fresh spicy accent. 4/5 or maybe 3.8/5

I just wanted to add context to the other reviews who say this is “generic”. I feel like it might give off those vibes because it is blended so incredibly well. This is actually a positive if you are looking for a very inoffensive, office, or first date friendly fragrance.

I liked the EDT better than the EDP because I felt the EDT was a little closer to the skin. It has a gentle presence that isn’t too old or young. On the one hour dry down, the sweet cedar kinda gives a tonka bean note.

Meh. Smells cheaper than Hero Eau de Parfum.

honestly, it’s pretty similar to Hero Eau de Parfum. It’s more like the leaves of a tree, just faintly in the distance, like you're walking through a park with your dog. It’s grassy and, frankly, kind of boring.

It doesn't really smell like a person at all. More like a used leather bag and jeans. It's just kind of there. Flat and uninteresting.
I did not expect to like it so much. Just wish the performance and longevity were better. Scent bubble pushes for 3-4 hours and then becomes a skin scent.

I received this as a sample from Sephora. Its starts out with a very strong bergamot note and then quickly fades into a light dusty woody scent which doesnt linger long. This is not a very strong projecting fragrance. It definitely sits close to the skin and leans masculine. It reminds me of a weaker Born in Roma Uomo. Not full bottle worthy in my opinion. This would be a good fragrance for someone who wants a light woody smell.

I bought this fragrance when it first came out. I loved it then and I rebought it and still love it. However, I love the opening. That’s it. The projection and longevity is weak. Which is kind of a shame because the scent profile is incredible. It’s SUPER Bergamot heavy. It’s probably the most bergamot in a fragrance I’ve ever smelled but I really like it. I see how people compare the harsh opening to bug spray, but it kind of tickles your nose in a good way. Overall good everyday grab in the spring/summer time. Wish it lasted longer but great scent profile. 7/10
I think the EDP and Parfum smell rich but the sharp cedar and juniper notes just remind me of Off bug spray. Everybody else seems to enjoy it but I could not use this myself.
average woody with a sweet part to it (im sure theres ambroxan or iso e super here). Safe typically masculine scent. Dont spend a lot of money on this "hero".
Very inoffensive, very weak . Does not last. Very overpriced. The smell itself I like.- Woody , almost woodclass solvent type, of smell. Way too weak and overpriced.
is it just me or does it kinda smell like stomach acid and spices
citrus and woods, amazing 8/10

If you like scents like DH 2020, you will like this. Just a very nice, slightly introverted scent in a sea of sweet attention getting try-hards. Some might call it boring, but it's anything but, personally I think it's sexy and has character. The first time I wore it I wasn't overly impressed, but what I find is that the more I wear it the more I appreciate it's simplicity and versatility. It's a grower for sure. Performance could be better, but it's not terrible. I get around 5 hours of moderate projection, and moderate silage. Signature scent worthy and a 5 for me.

Green aldehydes, it's a little waxy but smells natural.
Has a Pine note, is a bit airy, with faint spices.
Starts to smell dour.
Becomes slightly earthy, maybe some leather?
Turns woody/coniferous, then balsamic.
More woods, a little smokiness.
Becomes a pleasing cedar wood skin scent.
As it warms off the skin it has a soapy-apple aroma.

Fine all year, daytime. Masculine, any age. Projection is fine, longevity not the best.

It's OK.

I really love this, it is a guilty pleasure for me. It is very fresh but also very woody scent and it smells very masculine. Opening is citrusy, dries to peppery-woody blend. Nothing is too synthetic or low quality, impossible to offend anyone and gets the job done. Great for all seasons in office-daily use, can be bought for very cheap prices; I believe 150ml bottle can be found for 70 usd which is a pretty good deal. Scents like this one, MB explorer, Monclear Pour Homme or Missioni Parfum are amazing all year rounders without smelling just like fresh clean citruses. They have some depth and character in them. Wished it was a little bit stronger tho, doesn't last much longer than 5 hours but projection is satisfying.

I really like this one. Macy's keeps sending me samples of the EDT and EDP. They smell different and my preference is clearly for the EDT. I finally purchased a full-sized bottle. It's a strong, pleasant citrusy cedar scent with good performance. It's better than that the perfume rating here indicates. Recommend.

Woody bergamot and cedar open Hero. Sweet cedar heated with spice; defanged black pepper. It fills up your olfactories with comfort. I imagine a chest of drawers built by hand by your grandfather. It radiates the care he put into it. This is where the name Hero comes into play for me. While the Adaminotaur swimming around is cool, that hits somewhere nearer maybe the imagery for Musc Ravageur.

Here, Hero brings the thought of one you look up to rather than a savior or a superhero. One who can does things you admire and things you hope one day to be able to do.

The warmth of Hero is somewhere in the neighborhood of Spicebomb or the Night Vision EdT, while staying nearer to the trees rather than all inning the pepper. The sillage is large, even 2 sprays on the back of my hand got attention from a few people 5 feet plus away from me.

Another bit of imagery, which i touched on in my first impressions video, was the image of a stuffed animal lion. A small and favored comfort to a child, the lion also being a heroic figure itself. Maybe one set inside that handmade cedar cupboard in hope its comes to life to be a protector.

A bit into the dry down, a warm apple note tinged with cider cozies up. Autumnal, cedary and dry with walnut, mature.
So boring. Tries to be a safe masculine woody scent, with flat results. If you are scared of hurting someone, while at the same time being a macho man, Hero is probably the one for you.
Woody fresh sweet. 8/10. Need to overspray
Clean scent, but basic. Fine as an everyday scent.
Smells like pee

this is just woody bergamot, not sure what else to say.

i'd say that this your average male cologne, but even those ones are a bit more interesting.

I don't like to tear down fragrances with bad reviews, unfortunately this men's fragrance is so obvious, predictable and commercial. No temporal olfactory evolution. Fragrances created to sell and sponsor the brand. Nothing to add.

This was a blind buy and it was amazing! People are mentioning that this fragrance doesn’t last long, but on my skin I get easily 7-8 hours of longevity and STRONG projection for the first 2-3 hours then mild to soft projection through out the day for me.


It smells woody and spicy but not in a warm terms. It sounds like it’s a basic smell, which it could be but it has something that makes it stand out compared to others in this price range.

I personally love it and think it’s a safe blind buy, but performance will vary person to person!

Smell like exactly like Celery salt when you drink a clamato and doesn't last long on my skin. After 20 min I could't smell anything, its very basic and wouldn't even consider blind buying it. Please buy the EDP its way way better

It is fairly unique in its scent profile, but it is still rather generic. It smells like cedar to me and nothing else. If you like cedar then this will be an amazing pick and it is masculine, but if you don't love cedar or want a little more complexity I would look elsewhere.

TENGO LAS TRES VERSIONES "EDT😍 , EDP & PARFUM.
SIMPLEMENTE SON UNA MARAVILLA, SON MIS FRAGANCIAS FIRMA 10/10

The smell is unique so this is good addition for anyone's collection, must go crazy with the sprays for any type of sillage, will last and project for 30 minutes up to an hour and half depending how much you overspray then becomes a skin scent and that last for about the rest of the day so at least you can smell yourself, i loved it but got bored of it quickly, and I guess yes I'd recommend it to someone, knowing what I know now I don't think I'd buy it in the first place.

Absolutely love this!!!
An amazing fresh, woody, and slightly citrusy fragrance. Extremely versatile fragrance suitable for all occasions. I tend to wear it spring through fall, but not often in winter. I find it isn’t strong enough, and doesn’t project well in temperatures below 10 degrees centigrade. A great daily and safe purchase.

Nice, but nothing special. Smells like any other men's generic luxury fragrance. Overall lackluster performance. Safe blind buy.

4.5/10
I do not like this

Burberry Hero EDP smells amazing. It gives off a fresh out-of-the-shower vibe and keeps me smelling fresh all day. The scent balances warmth and freshness perfectly. It's ideal for fall and winter, with its cozy, clean, and warm aroma that fits perfectly with the cooler months.

I find it interesting that 2 of my most favorite designer scents (this and D&G K EDT) are also 2 of the most hated amongst the fragrance community lol. I love this stuff. Bright with a hint of spice. People say it’s generic but it’s quite unique to my nose. I went back and forth between if I liked this or the EDP more, but I think the EDT is my fav. If I had to strip my 40+ bottle collection (niche, designer, and clones/cheapies) to 10, Burberry Hero EDT would make the cut. Plus my wife likes it on me as well. It’s longevity is it’s only drawback in my opinion. Projects really good for me for maybe an hour and then suddenly turns into a skin scent. I have a dupe roller ball oil that I sometimes wear with it to help. But yeah, this is one I’ve been kinda obsessed with since I first smelled it in the mall 2 years before I actually bought it.
A maritime forest if you condensed it into a bottle.

It is a little woodsy, but sweet, manly, but not too musky. Not too unique, candleish, but well blanced, which I think is always key to any cologne. Definetly long lasting and pleasent to keep smelling. Not one of my absolute favorite scents, but I think this is certainly a winner and will be popular for a long time.

Edit: The more I smell this, the more generic it gets. It reminds me of the Armani, invictus, saint laurent, zara, legend, jimmy choo, coach, boss, etc odors of the sweeter kind. It's still good, but less unique than I first thought with a sample.
woodsy wood chips moist dirt after rain
nice freshie longevity is between 3-4 hours and in the last hours it becomes like a skin scent and nice atomiser imo
actually a very good subtle woodsy fresh scent. I would use this as an everyday but the longevity is piss on this. Like 30 minutes and then it's a skin scent which only lasts for another two hours.

When I think of office-style fragrances, this is the first thing that comes to mind. It's safe, inoffensive, masculine, yet somewhat subtle. Smells clean and woody. Virtually perfect for the office imo

This was "meh" to me on intial spray, but, for some reason, I kept wanting to smell it.

After a few days, I realized that this is really good. It's not a heavy or resinous scent, just a lightweight, sweet cedar with a little spice.

Appropriate for just about any occassion or season; it's not sweet to the point of seeming juvenile or dry to the point of smelling overly mature. Longevity and projection are on the lighter side of moderate.

You can get the 100 mL for under $70 right now on discounters, and I think that's fair.

In the end, this went from a "meh" to a firm "like."

Honestly nothing ground breaking. It’s an inoffensive fragrance that works for any season or occasion. You really cannot go wrong with this one. The projection and longevity is shit, but it’s ok since you can overspray. The bottle really speaks volumes for how creative this fragrance is. You’d be better of buying Versace Dylan blue or Ysl y EDP, but if you’re looking for a yellow ish bottle, get this I guess. Also if you’re new to fragrances and need something that works for everything, maybe get this, but I’d still recommend the previously stated fragrances more. Other than that I would not recommend. Kinda alright I guess.

6.5/10

I'm coming back to this. This has the "cologne" smell familiar with the classic masculine fragrances. I really like it. Suitable for more mature men. I wish they would make an EDP concentration of this. The current EDP is a completely different fragrance.
It's a good cologne when just want to apply without giving it a thought. Compliment worthy, clean, really nice take on woods. Not exactly my favorite but not disappointed at all. 7/10.

IN LOVE WITH THIS! The scent is familiar.. maybe reminiscent of Sauvage? Y? Terre d'Hermes? .... But oh my.. that one is soo simple yet so addicting... It's RAW cedar wood for once.. Barely affected by other notes.. It has a sweet woodiness to it.. enhanced by the non-empowering spiciness of black pepper and the green accord of juniper.. and the bergamot is here for a soft citrusy touch, that balances the woodiness.. This is just.. PERFECT... Not a singular synthetic note to my nose... Smells like hiking in a deep green forest...

9/10

Citrusy spicy opening with a warm wood in the background. Definately more for day and warmer months, as it lacks the sweetness and heaviness of notes like leather to make it appropriate for cool weather.
This gives me the same vibes like Sauvage, that is, a spicy bergamot opening with a warm base ( here it is wood instead of amber ). The wood lingers for the drydown, providing a serene, warm, soothing feeling, smelling like cardboard / recycled book pages with tea, peppered with spicyness, sitting close to the skin.
A mild, generic, inoffensive and likeable smell, projection moderate, longevity moderate. For the price I would say not worth it.

I reviewed this one on here already, but I’ll say it ONCE, TWICE, 3 TIMES, THIS IS A F ING MASTERPIECE PERIOD!!! IF YOU ARE LOOKING FOR A DUPE DONE AT EXTRAIT DE PARFUM LEVEL CHECKOUT DUA FRAGRANCE AND THANK ME LATER ✌🏼❤️

I could really see Adam Driver using this. It is masculine to say the least but it also has some kind of sweetnes to it. While it may not be a groundbreaking smell, it is definitely good. This could go nice inbetween 10-22 C°. Nice with an overcoat and a light jacket.
I like Burberry in general and this was something that I expected to be good and it fulfilled my expectations. It has that overcoat-scarf-hat combination kind of smell (by that, I mean it would suit that trio really good). Because it was not groundbreaking, I was really in the middle of a 7 and an 8 and at the end of the day...
8/10

People have to understand summer fragrances, some climates are hot and humid and you will be very limited on what you can wear and enjoy, and this definitely won't shine in Switzerland summer, this is needs a Dubai, Bangkok, Indonesia kind of humidity and this will shine, it gives me a cigar humidor vibe not that i am saying it smells like tobacco, this woody with hint of herb, i used to wear the discontinued Dsquard he wood, probably similar scent profile but to my nose Burberry hero EDT is the winner, i have ignored hero because realistically Burberry makes super safe fresh fragrances for the summer, not alot of character in them if that makes sense they are your typical YouTube reviewers safe for likes and views, not this one tho, i don't care about your European beautiful summer breeze wear creed smw or rasasi hawas for that, you live in high humidity climate sample this one, look for 2-3 ml sample give it a try for that humid night out, i have a sample of this, and i do have some nice collection for the humidity this is on my wishlist and will definitely pick up a full bottle
While it may not be ground-breaking or very unique, this fragrance is an inoffensive smell that can be worn in any occasion, I would highly recommend.

Finally picked up a reasonably priced bottle after trying it in store over a year ago. Smells completely different than I remember. The bergamot is so fresh and juicy, and I love the strong cedar backbone. This is perfect for all year wear, as with most Burberry fragrances, performance and longevity are slightly above average. I have a feeling I'll be reaching for this one a lot this summer.
Wow people were right its all about skin chemistry. It smell completely different on me but in a good way I might have found a new favorite.
Mild inoffensive and clean.
This would make a perfectly safe, pleasant, inoffensive office fragrance: smells clean and smooth and slightly sweet with soft-but-noticeable projection suitable for almost anytime use.

Got this as a sample kit with the 2 flankers as a gift from buying London. Honestly, this is pretty nice. On my skin, it's really weak though. A skin scent within an hour, and doesn't last longer than 3-4 hrs. Also, I'd say it's overpriced, even though it's about 40-60 euros

I've got this as a sample from notino, it reminds me of legend spirit for some reason.
It's a nice freshie but a bit generic to be real, good but doesn't wow me in any way

I honestly think this is a masterpiece. It's a very woody fragrance but with a warm, slightly sweet hint to it. It's masculine but sexy. Youthful but sophisticated. I could wear this all day long, every day. At work, on a date, just lounging round the house... I can't get enough of this smell.
It's perfect for all age ranges too. It's just a great all round classy scent. I've recently bought a few supposedly woody fragrances on my search for a new signature scent. Terre d'Hermes, Dior Homme Sport, MontBlanc Explorer but this is hands down the best of the bunch and as soon as it hit my nostrils, I knew I'd found the one.
Projection and silage is average. It's not beast mode but it's not a poor performer either. It's what I'd expect from this sort of price point and there's nothing stopping you from applying a couple of extras sprays after a few hours if you want to top up the performance.
This gets a perfect 10 from me. It's my new signature scent and is probably the best masculine woody fragrance available today.

Simple.
'Teenage' smell.
Smells a bit cheapish.
Generic.
Sporty.
'Safe'.
Very weak performance, but what a smell, very great masculine smell, I was hoping a better performance
I like it but I find the EDP to smell better
Fresh woody in the same time nothing other to say it is a perfect daily deisgner frangrance. I love niche ones but i wear this pretty much daily as said only the logetivity and sillage lacks.
First wear, a lady gives me an enthusiastic compliment. Mmm, you smell like coconut!
Gatekeep This!

Bergamot provides a fresh, citrusy aroma, juniper adds a crisp and slightly woody note, while cedar offers a warm, earthy scent. Sets down nicely on the skin and is not too overpowering or masculine.

The combination smells refreshing and comforting, and the fact that i find it unisex highlights its versatility and appeal across genders. A well-balanced and elegant fragrance can certainly be appreciated by anyone! I really like it.

nobody gives burberry hero any recognition, the scent is amazing, its a fresh spicy at first then it develops into a woody cedar scent, its a very pleasant smell that is super underrated, the bergamot note is super nice and smells amazing.
the longevity is about 7-8 hours which is enough to wear to school ( which is mostly what I use it for ), its also fancy enough to use for formal events like business meetings, I preferred to wear it during spring. its projection is kinda mid, it projects well for the first 3 hours but after that it isn't as noticeable.
it costs about 120$ cad for 100ml, not a terrible price but not worth it honestly
7/10
It is worth picking up as a more formal fragrance
underrated. Simple but still smells incredible
Arko nem shaving Cologne... İ ve just bought for my boyfriend and he said that
criminally underrated

I love this fragrance! It's simple but it is one of my favorites! While overall proformance isn't that good, it is still a beautiful fragrance while also being versitile. It smells very woody with some fresh bergamot and personally reminds me of the smell of a fresh cristmas tree. Fresh, woody and citrusy would be how I describe this fragrance. I love it!

This is way better than the EDP. Please make sure you're reviewing the EDT!

Just vanilla and woods. Beautiful Pacific Northwest mountain range.

So why do I think this smells like the perfect mix of Mont Blanc Legend and Dior Savage? Two that I LOVE on men. It's amazing!
It also smells similar to Burberry Brit Rhythm, another love. In fact I could say Hero is a more refined more expensive smelling Rhythm.
this perfume may be slightly generic. i dont find any wow factor in this but it still it is still a very nice scent. very versatile and youthful. good for summer afternoons and night.

This bad boy right here is a masterpiece, it's everything I could want in an everyday masculine fragrance. It has a beautiful sweet citrusy followed by a powerful woody and addictive dry down while still maintaining that subtle sweet scent. I love it and it's my beautiful underrated boy.

I found this very similar to Diesel Only The Brave. They had both same Virginia Cedar note, similar citruses as top notes, similar spicey note usage (pepper vs coriander). I still give my vote for Diesel Only The Brave, it seems to be a little bit better performer between two.
It is just a great cedar fragrance. Nothing challenging. Masculine and classy. Love it.

This fragrance is one that you can wear anywhere anytime. You can wear it to school or a business meeting, it doesn't really matter. Lasts a decent amount of time and smells like a woody classy fragrance that's slightly subtle.
Scent: 7.7/10
Projection: 6/10
Longevity: 7.5/10
Easy to wear, sweet top notes, smooth cedar dry down, nothing special but nothing wrong either. If you see a discount, you could grab one. (Mine is 50% off, 50ml).

Sure, it may be non-complex and fairly simple... but it's a really nice masculine scent. I agree with the reviewer who said it actually ends up being quite unique in its simple goodness. It certainly is versatile. I really like it... although the woodsy vibe isn't my favorite profile overall. Only issue I have is, the performance is unremarkable, while the price is still high compared to other casual frags like Mont Blanc Legend or what have you. So you can overspray it and smell great, but it's a tad pricey for that type of thing. Still... it's an easy everyday reach, so if you like that woodsy profile, go for it.

BTW -- I find using the EDT in the daytime and the EDP in the evening is a great way to go with this.

Bought this for my fiancé because…well…I liked it! It smells amazing on him and I’m sure it does on almost everyone. It’s a fresh, lemony-spicy and tingly opening, then slightly woody, very inviting and „manly“- sweet (just teeny-tiny bit). What’s best is that it doesn’t start to smell „old“ or „worn tor too long“ as I think lots of the gentleman’s perfumes do (like Dior sauvage or gucci guilty etc). In short: Smells like a manly man who just showered and is always in a good mood with a big smile on his face but in a cool, not goofy way

It's been awhile since the last time I've worn this, but boy, is it good. For around 50 euros, it's a very nice-smelling fragrance that lasts I'd say, around 5–6 hours. It has a very woody/citrusy smell and smells very fresh. As far as the sillage, it's moderate. I very much recommend this for spring, summer, and fall.
Update: I sprayed some on my wrist yesterday night (around 12am) and I can still lightly smell it at 6:40PM today.

This is my friend's signature scent. It isn't groundbreaking, but it does smell good. You get a woodsy, citrusy, fresh manly scent.
Pretty sure he picked it up because he likes Adam Driver.
Good pick tho!
Smells good but not lasting at all. Very weak performance.
I bought this Fragrance today and I’m gonna keep it for the summer to wear it, until that day comes INSHA’ALLA, I’ll update my review .. C U 😘
I adore this scent and I typically stay away from cedar frags. Genuinely think this is signature scent worthy!
Signature scent worthy. Great every day clean smelling fragrance. Nobody will find this offensive, other than pompous fragrance snobs and influencers. Don’t listen to those people.

This fragrance doesn't deserve the hate, it's criminally underrated. This has my all time favourite wood and cedar smell to it, possibly the best cedar fragrance out there besides byredo gypsy water. Amazing scent!

As a woman, I love this on a man! Smelling it, I associate a romantic date or a late summer evening stroll hand-in-hand by a lake, cuddling up when the colder air hits after sunset. The combination of the cooler top / middle notes and the warmer base notes reminds me of late summer and early fall days in nature. I also appreciate that there is no unpleasant sharpness, just freshness, which adds a tad of sophistication.
Very good at its job, being a spicy woody combo. Also comes with a fresh out of the shower scent for me. Not overwhelming whatsoever in its simplicity. Great as a day office/class fragrance.

woody and fresh very hard to pick out any specific notes bar the cedarwood
projection and longevity are cheeks
idk if i got a bad bottle but lasts ons kins for about 2h for me

This was my signature scent for the longest time. Wore it for 2 years straight (maybe skipped some days). My partner loved it and when I was around the house I only sprayed twice and never more than 4. So definitely projected within arms length and smells pleasant. It's rather safe and hits it's stride best on a warmer day. I started to associate this scent with moments in my life I needed to be daring, brave or courageous towards the end of my 100ml bottle and the funny thing is so did the people around me because they've smelt this off my skin for so many years. I created this signature identity around this fragrance which makes me consider picking up the EDP for winter. I think what you get here is a money well spent pleasant softly projecting woody fragrance that won't blow you away but has so much versatility and is a joy to wear in the great outdoors.

Maybe the safest scent you can get.

My go-to for gym, work, family gatherings etc.

Don`t expect something crazy, it`s just safe and mid.
I think I just hate juniper and black pepper combo. It smells like a 90s perfume in a very bad way. Cheap and linear smelling, won't finish my sample because it gave me a headache

I was not impressed with this one. I feel like they couldn't decide if Ithey wanted something sweet or something woody aki to Dior homme 2020. What you are left with is a generic woodsy scent with some sweetness in the background. It's not bad it actually smells wonderful, but it's just kind of boring, like I've smelled similar a hundred times but what I usually smell that is similar is better. Longevity is nothing to impress either I get 4 to 6 hrs. Overall I have to give this a 7 out of 10 as it's just mediocre.
I meant to get the updated “Hero”—- didn’t know there existed two versions with the exact same name…🙄 This smells like hospital or public restroom cleaner. It’s straight up awful!

This and the EDP are unique. Nothing smells like them. They stand out on any walk through smelling of a departments scents. It's not blue and it's not ambroxan and it's not sweet. This bucks the trend. It doesn't smell like any older or classic scent so it really has potential to create new and unique impressions on people. This stands out. If you smell several scents in a day and also smell this, you will understand. Closely harmonized accords of a gentlemanly and sexy wood, not smoke nor tobacco. Not fresh citrus or sailing scent. This is a sophisticated lumberjacks go to, the homesteading bitcoin investor who home schools his kids and knows self sufficiency and tradition forever trump the worlds cheap plastic values and fake virtue signalling for "diversity" and conformity. For the farmer who drinks bourbon and the philosopher who still reads books on paper. Mans cologne of thought and action.

The smell is addictive, to say the least. One of my favorite colognes ever. Its performance and longevity is ok. However, it makes up for it with an amazing scent that will for sure get you some compliments. Oh, it is also very versatile and could be worn in every situation imaginable.

Less challenging prada ocean edt. With barely acceptable drydown.
But I like it well enough thus far.
Stronger than you think.

Great scent for spring and fall days very fresh and woody. Only complaints is longevity sucks I find myself respraying also atomizer isn’t the best really eats up the juice quarter of the way gone after only 2 weeks of ownership

Wasn't sure about it after an initial wear, but it has really grown on me. I get really good performance off my skin and have received numerous compliments. I love the simplicity of the scent. So much so I just ordered another bottle.

IMO, signature scent worthy.

Probably the most versatile and safe scent that you can get.
It ticks all the boxes: it can be causal, sporty, elegant but also fresh and summery scent.
Bottle looks very nice too, simplicity at its best.
It is very weak though, but that's actually good because it makes it a good everyday "work" scent, you won't suffocate everyone around with it.
Nothing great and extraordinary about it, but you really can't go wrong with this one.

Great versatile scent. Don’t get the poor performance reviews. Get 8-10 hours with really good projection still get people saying I smell nice after 6 hour mark.
Clean cedar juniper berries all the way through

10/10

This is good. Can be worn anywhere anytime. I noticed the people that say fragrances don’t smell nice are the niche snobs that want to smell like vanilla beans under hay in a barnyard. This stuff smells good and gets the job done, trust me
Take Elysium by Roja and add the modern sweet spicy bubblegummy DNA, you'll get this. I liked this surprisingly more than I thought I would.

I'm really convinced hero is one of the best contemporary generic perfumes ever created. It follows the contemporary trend of minimalistic design. Designed for compliments. Simple recipe blended masterfully to perfection. High quality ingredients. Citrus, juniper berries, black pepper and cedarwood oils. The result is a sophisticated ultra masculine luxurious shower gel. I love it and i can't get enough of it!!

This is the best wood ever used in fragrance and when I say that I mean this is my favourite type of wood to smell out of any fragrance, the wood here is just done to perfection. Wood is actually quite a hard note to do correctly here it's amazing they picked the right type of woods, the right amount of wood and it smells like the quality of the wood is done well too. No stinky woods or green poisonous smelling woods used, only clean smelling woods.

Also I think i'm the only person to notice this but I think it smells similar to Byredo Gypsy water which I also own a bottle of

i really liked the smell of this cologne, a comforting, woody, warm spicy scent that is hard to hate on. many people even told me i smell “spicy” wearing this lol.

but the performance is what made me sell this, very weak. maybe would work for an office fragrance but personally i’d want something stronger. if they released this fragrance again but in a higher concentration i’d probably buy it.

perfect for a blind buy or gift in terms of smell. more on the mature side but can be worn and liked by all ages.
A simplified and even more generic than before cedar-juniper combo. Ok...next

I don’t know what it is about this fragrance, but I REALLY enjoy it, and there’s room for it in my collection. I love the simplicity of the bottle design, the versatility and wearability of the fragrance itself - it just really does it for me. The reviews saying it’s nothing mind blowing are correct, but it’s also not another ambroxan or tonka bomb. Clean, sophisticated, and safe. Definitely blind buy worthy!

Smells like Lacoste l'Homme and YSL l'Homme.

There's nothing wrong with this fragrance, really. The only problem is that it's been done a thousand times over and it offers nothing new. Smells nice, but boooooooooorrrrrrrrrring and as generic as it can be. As cedar fragrances go, I prefer l'Eau d'Issey pour Homme l'Eau de Cèdre. It's more polarising in the community, but at least it's not boring.

At the end of the day, Burberry Hero does its job: makes you smell nice, but that's all it does. It might wow some people who don't know much about men's fragrances but it's completely mediocre to the learned noses. Just like Adam Driver: he acts, and that's all he does.

#184 in my "Tour de Fragrance"
Burberry Hero
Safe, Simple, Cedar

Like all Burberry scents there's nothing out of the ordinary here. You end up with Juniper and Cedar, pleasant, inoffensive, mildly projecting, completely safe for office wear. This is a total snoozer, but the performance is at least middling with a cedar note that will make it to lunch.
Not a bottle buy for me, but not an awful scent for workplace use.

Not everything needs to be complex to be great. This is a linear and simple fragrance but done very well. A cedar based masculine scent. Subtle yet very manly and potentially extremely sexy if used during a summer date night. If she catches a whiff of this it won’t go unnoticed. Only drawback is longevity, about 6 hours but i think projection is as perfect as it is. It doesn’t need to be overpowering to work its magic
scent is amazing just wish it could last longer

This is a basic but well-executed masculine fragrance. It was designed to sit squarely in the middle of safe market ground. In my mind it's reminiscent of some of the stronger men's colognes from the 1980's and it's appealing to the same type of wearer. Despite its simplicity it does have merit. It opens with a compelling raw bergamot smell, intermingled with juniper berry to give it deeper tone. There isn't much else to it but the wood. It smells good, is unambiguously male, and can be worn by nearly anyone.

The fragrance community might be disappointed by it but there is a good reason this is a best-seller in the US right now. It's a mass market departure from the Blues in a way that does not feel dated. The bottle design and marketing are communicating all of this pretty clearly too. It looks like a golden-hued brick with bold lettering, even moreso than Terre d'Hermes. In an calculating way that clarity makes it stand out even more on a shelf full of gaudy Paco Rabannes.
addictive woody citrus scent, drydown is great 9/10
Opening is woody. Dry down is powdery/woody. Overall, a fairly versatile fragrance though not an extremely compelling one.

Slightly acidic with a light metallic note. Everything is a little soft here, the cedar, the juniper and the pepper. You won't stand out with this fragrance and most will like Burberry Hero. It is suitable for all seasons.

The scent didn't excite me. Especially in the drydown, the Hero gets slightly stinging. A property that is often found in cedar scents.

I find it amusing when a designer fragrance is called generic and isn't remotely similar to anything else.

Hero by Burberry is like stepping into a fresh cedar forest on a brisk morning.

I can't help but compare it to Dior Homme 2020; while Dior takes you on a crisp, clean journey with its breezy and effervescent vibes, Burberry's Hero is like the rugged and adventurous sibling.

Versatile and masculine

This review is from the POV of a woman in her early 20s. I received a sample and immediately loved it and gave it to my boyfriend to wear. It smells like a very attractive man I would feel comfortable around. Sweet, reminds me a little of shampoo, but nothing light or fruity. It’s very pleasant and would be great for summer or daytime. My boyfriend and I compared it to Burberry Hero EDP and both agreed this is the winner. The bottle is nice and classic, not too flashy just like the scent. I would recommend and also convinced my boyfriend to get it lol.

WEAR THIS IN THE HEAT, 80° or hotter, will improve performance immensely

i get good projection and easily 8 hours off this

i wear to work, tried it in the spring, did ok, wearing it in the summer and now it's a beast

I think Hero is a great name for this masculine, somewhat warm and powdery, slightly sweet cologne. The notes are simple but very clear. This is a very understated scent that doesn't offer much from afar but up close is very nice.

This could easily be a signature scent and should work for men of all ages, although I do think this would fit a more quiet, understated type of person. 7.5/10 on scent. It does smell nice but nothing I'd go out of my way to smell, yet at the same time it would be a great blind buy. If you consider price then this could easily be an 8 or 8.5/10 scent.

After a couple of months with the sample, I'm bumping my overall score to an 8.5/10. This is just a really great, everyday, casual scent that I could see myself buying one day.

Burberry Hero EDT: A warm, soft, fuzzy, woody frag. Would make a nice gift for a man just entering the fragrance world, but a woman could rock it as well. Not loud, not a whisper, perfect in between. I like it a lot more than Hero EDP. Great job Burberry.

Upon first sprays, it doesn't seem like this edt will perform well. While Hero is not a strong fragrance, it does give some sillage and lasts a few hours. If you like woodsy and spicy perfumes like I do, it sure could be a signature/wear anywhere anytime scent, or a good inoffensive work fragrance. You can get 5 oz bottles for great prices

It's completely fine and wearable for every day.
If the price drops to where other Burberry scents are. ( Like 40 bucks) i can completely understand people making this their signature scent.
Right now i feel that scents like Explorer and Dylan blue will have more of a wow effect for a cheaper price.

In general i personally like to wear something different that makes me stand out and i gladly pay a little more for that so this is not for me.
In a world where everything in a perfume store at least smells nice, this for 70 bucks for a 100 ml is not a great pick up.
I didn't want to smell exactly like a combination of celery, cucumber, and a cheap gin and tonic - but alas I do.
This parfume so underrated. tbh, i love the smell. it smell like kinda sweet, fresh and woody. but sadly this fragrance get poor longetivity and performance on my skin.

Peppery, kind of sweet. Woodsy. You can definitely pick out the cedar in the opening. I would have expected maybe some vanilla or something sweeter in the note breakdown. But overall, it’s kind of a generic, wintery pepper scent.

Whoever designed this bottle should be fired.
Whoever created the scent should be promoted.
Cedar woody on the fresh or cool side (the juniper). I have several fragrances in this zone so I won't buy it but it certainly smells nice and well done!
This smells like nuclear strength pineapple shower gel to me.

Smells a lot like King C. Gillette's Transparent Gel in my opinion - super fresh and I absolutely love it! Bunch of woody smell and suits great for an all-around fragrance (might not be great during winter, however).
I like it. Mainly get Cedar and Juniper. Fresh and woody scent. Safe for warmer weather. Office and casual wear. Mass appealing scent.

This just came in...
Initially nose gives me a typical mass Appealing designer scent, something along the lines of CK Deny Edp
Then it settles down fast to a very nice very lovely woody cedar scent.
Should be a compliment getter

Hero Edt comes with a very nice solid metallic cap, as good or better than Doors
I tried to shake it very hard and it still holds solidly
This is a very nice Woody cologne with a spicy twist. It’s extremely masculine and I love it.

It smells unique, mass appealing and uplifting. The woody base balances the sweetness. Despite the uninspiring bottle, I was pleasantly surprised. Performance is good but not worth the full price. Not an everyday option after real-world use, especially in hot weather. Strong projection fades with moderate longevity

I'll first start with a story. Almost 30 years ago, as a high school student, I purchased a cheap Imperial Leather deodorant, a green one. It was a typical fresh masculine fragrance with lots of pine/juniper notes. Well, it proved to be a an absolute magnet for schoolgirls and I often received compliments from them. Mind you, I wasn't a popular guy, so, yeah, that fragrance kind of made me popular :) It wasn't my cup of tea though but I didn't hate it. And actually I thought it smelled more expensive than it really was. I haven't encountered a similar fragrance recently.

Well, I got some samples from a beauty store today, and when I finally sprayed the Burberry Hero on a paper I immediately got those old memories of that Imperial Leather deodorant and all these girls that were mad about it. I don't know whether the Burberry Hero and that Imperial Leather deo are exactly the same, I'm only relying on 30 years of fading memory but I'd say they are in the same ballpark. And while it may sound like comparing the Hero to some cheap deodorant, that was not my idea. It's a very nice and masculine fragrance that you can't go wrong with. It's not one of those masterpieces that everybody talks about, it's also not one of these polarizing fragrances that people love or hate. It's just a very nice, above average quality, well-crafted and safe fragrance with old school hints (no pun intended), fresh, manly, assertive but not overpowering. I'm not sure I would purchase it and I will have to demo it to my wife and see whether she would act as a teenage schoolgirl (pun intended).

Got this as a small sample, and from the first sniff off the atomizer I thought - nice! I like the woodiness of this, with a lot of cedar. It's the note I like in other perfumes, plus juniper is ingredient for gin, my favourite spirit. Pleasant smell, but I have to say that I can't pick it up from my clother after few hours, it could last longer.
I still need to compare this one to EDP I also have for tests, but I believe the notes are slightly different as well.

Hero is manly, woody, and fresh. No sweetness or something horribly chemical here. Mr. Guichard's professional hand can be detected in this product. And though the fragrance is not particularly distinctive it is indeed very "nice". It lasts some 6/7 hours and projects discreetly. It is a very "professional" office scent. Is it bad? Not at all: it does very well what it has been designed to do. Is it particularly memorable? Certainly not. Try it.

WHAT A MASTERPIECE BY ONE OF MY FAVORITE PERFUMERS! Simple but Manly from young to old….. woman/ Men I’ve received compliments just wanted this EDT to be stronger! I see a lot of reviews saying for the office safe blah blah blah! IMHO ITS SO VERSATILE, on a cool summer night wearing this to a lounge/bar Latin club salsa 💃 dancing would be a lady KILLER!!! One love ❤️✌️on earth 🌍

Hero EDT is clearly very spicy and woodsy and it's same characteristics stay until the end. However, it's not new smell. I find it very close to Dior Savage. Someone who doesn't want to spend 100$ to test this one can buy Ajmal Kuro (also a clone of Dior Savage). It's about 85% clone of Hero with super beast mode projection and longevity. It will be available at around 20$ or so. Hero is not worth the price I feel and also the blend is not that great. I would rate it 5.

Very woodsy, very fresh, very nonoffensive, but also very generic. It’s not a bad scent, but you’ve probably smelt something very similar before in other popular fragrance.

I haven’t really seen this comparison before, but it kind of reminds me of LNDL by YSL. I think it’s the bergamot/cedar with a hint of spiciness that makes these scents pretty similar. But LNDL smells way more sexy/interesting/delicious than Hero. Hero kind of smells like LNDL’s depressed younger brother, haha.

Overall not too bad. Not really interested in buying a decant/bottle, but I can see how this can appeal to some. It’s a great office fragrance due to it being nonoffensive, clean and manly. But it doesn’t wow me a whole lot.

Hero is beautiful but it can't compare to the intoxicating essence of Dg light blu. Hero is dry and weak, relying only on three cedar woods for its strength. Differentiating the scents is a mystery. I'm at the beginning
This scent is so annoying 😬 Super woody with a little spice witha touch of green nuances. This is a scrubber for me 🧼🧽
I love it! I wish it lasted longer.

I think it would be a great fragrance for everyday use, especially for the office. It has a bit of character but it won't bother anyone. The performance is medium, which is good for me. I don't always want a super strong and aggressive fragrance.
What about the bottle? I think it's very sleek and modern. I love it! I'm really happy I bought Burberry Hero and I can't wait to wear it more often.
Cheap simplistic smelling fresh woody fragrance, related but not similar to Dior Homme 2020, just as the "reminds me of" section suggests. So, you have now two of these to pick from.😁

I think certain cedar oils are just always going to remind me of Deep Woods Off. Smelling like insect repellent is outdoorsy, but I'd prefer to smell like a tree.

Pleasant enough, no personality.
Reminds of CH MEN/CAROLINA HERRERA
Very citrusy, very simple, very good.
Woody and vaguely spicy fragrance. Really pleasing. I’d call in the perfect office scent. Only fragrance that got any compliments at work.

For me it shares some similarities with Dior Homme 2020. At the current prices though I would choose DH 2020. If this makes it down to the Touch price range it will definitely be worthy of a full bottle purchase. The market is flooded with samples so I'm hoping it will be sooner rather than later. Between the EDT and EDP I much prefer EDT.

In two words: Quality, Understated. It's not challenging or head turning, rather its understated and mass appealing. Making it great for the office and daily use. The minimalist bottle allows you to really appreciate the little details. It exudes quality, very heavy and solid feeling in the hand and the weighty magnetic top adds to that. The color contrasted atomizer is really good, maybe amongst the best, which is a good thing because you will need quite a few sprays of this to have it project and last. The fragrance notes do not contrast or change over time, rather they merge into one singular understated olfactory experience which is a fresh yet dark wood. Its smells familiar and comforting but you can never quite put your finger on what it is which is what keeps drawing you back for more.
Smell like sweaty t-shirt. Sexy sweaty t-shirt, but still sweaty t-shirt. Hate this.

Other reviewers have said similar stuff, but I I wore it today, It's woody smoky spicy scent, It smells ok but why would I wear this over other stuff in my collection I don't think I would.
As someone said below me, there's no wow factor.

Burberry hero is a very subtle and inoffensive scent. Something you can wear day to day in any environment or under any circumstance. Whilst it’s a great compliment getter in the summertime, it heavily underperforms in the wintertime.
It's not my favorite. It's like a slightly woodsy take on 1million. Reminds me of a scented pinecone. If that is your scent, you will like this a lot.

I really like this! Sure, it's nothing ground-breaking, but it's probably my most worn fragrance. Super mass-appealing and its simplicity is what makes it great IMO. It's like every male fragrance mixed together. It's citrusy, woodsy, metallic, musky, fresh, and aquatic all at the same time. Opening is great but the dry-down is fantastic- a super clean smelling, slightly soapy citrus which I really love. I dont really think it's "dated" as many say. Just an all around great fragrance that's an easy reach. Only complaint is the longevity but it does its job. I get like a solid 6 hours with this usually. 8/10

one of the more basic smelling perfumes. If you tell any regular person to describe cologne, chances are it'd smell like Burberry Hero. But, I like it because it's a nice fragrance and I think it can be worn all 4 seasons. Though mainly in the spring/summer/fall, I do think you can get away with this in the winter too.

Honestly i wanted to love this for the fact that is a SUPER generic easy versatile scent. All the way through you get a dry aromatic slightly spice coniferous cedar and it's something that i've smelled a million times, really reminds me of a body wash.

With that being said this stuff smells absolutley fantastic and is super mass appealing but the probelm is that it is just sooo weak. The fragrace is very thin and airy to begin with and a single spray to the wrist is hardly detectable and drowing myself in this it becomes a vague skin scent in 30 min
People say its generic but I can't think of anything else that smells like it. Love the scent. Wish the performance was stronger.
It's pretty generic, it smells good on my husband but doesn´t have a "WOW" factor.

The most 'whatever' I've felt for a fragrance.

It's clean, it smells good, but in a clean and smells good way that reminds me of slightly above average room air freshener with random sky blue packaging like Febreeze. How pathetically weak it is + the slight soapiness also contributes to this air freshener feel.

Nothing special about this at all, no twist, no mystery note that keeps you coming back for more.

It is totally devoid of personality and completely unmemorable. Your life would be exactly the same if you have or have not smelt this fragrance. Just pass on it and spend your money elsewhere.

Simple scent but absolutely beautiful imo. I love crisp, airy, masculine fragrances and this is just that. The note breakdown is a simple and fairly accurate description of what you are getting with this one. Fresh woods, clean/airy juniper with a touch of bergamot and pepper. There is a very slight soapiness to the scent. Even though it is not listed, I would assume there is a lavender note in here. Perhaps the overall scent could be described as a simpler, smoother, far more wearable version of Santal 33. The scent is extremely versatile - casual to formal, warm or cold- it’s a modern masculine scent that just works. Love this one, just wish performance was better. Will need to overspray for this to last more than 3hrs.

Nothing special,very oridinary.
5/10

This was a blind buy after seeing ads. Now, I do think it's on the safe buy in terms of blind buys, but I don't have any great remarks to have it a clear blind purchase. The smell is good, I don't think it will offend anyone, at least the grand majority will like. I wore it only during the days, for casual things like getting lunch, or shopping around. I can not see it as a date night, or overall, any nighttime activity go to fragrance.
6.5 out of 10.
Woody fresh

Woody, fresh, sweet, powdery, soapy, citrusy, sexy, peppery, slightly floral and most of all this is not boring.

You would think there is vetiver in here because of that peppery wood smell, but it's just actual pepper with wood. But it smells like vetiver

Something in here smells like pdm percival (must be the powdery & woody smell) to me and then sometimes when I smell it then it's a bit like dior homme 2020
Reminds me a lot of Calvin Klein’s “One”

I am in love with this fragrance. Smells uncomplicated and sophisticated, safe but not boring. I think it works well for any occasion, but may not be perfect for any occasion. Not ideal performance or projection but unless you want to shout out your presence with the way you smell its fine. It definitely isn't a 'wear you' cologne. I'm introverted, but not shy. Hero fits my personality perfectly.
Very woody and sexy smell, the only problem i have with it, is the longevity and the sillage. On my skin it lasts 2-3 hours max, on clothes 4 hours

I smelled this once or twice smells like exactly like the notes the brightness of bergamot disappears 10 minutes in and smells like black pepper on a cedarwood table. if that's your jam go for it. dm me to buy a bottle off me. Edit this is growing on me, nice scent to wear anywhere, But I don't think it's worth retail.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: ADG-like, but less fishy and fresher. Easy grab. Just find it cheap and take it!

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I’ve recently revisited after many years… and maybe it’s bc I’ve been feeling nostalgic.. But if you love the original AdG EDT dna… This is a fantastic option.

I’ve taken many of my cheapies and just things I don’t wear anymore up to my cabin… try to get some use out of them. This is one of them… been wearing it all Summer long… can’t argue with how good it smells. There is a touch of polo blue in the dry down… stays a little fresher cleaner and not as aquatic as AdG… Regardless, it smells nice.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Good fragrance not much else to say about it

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: this is so so fresh and sexy to me, it's honestly addictive to smell. don't listen to all the hate on this fragrance, if you like luxurious and youthful fragrances this is a uniquely fresh take on the adg-esque dna. one of my favorite fragrances of all time. out of all my fragrances i choose this as my current signature. i just bought a spare because i love this stuff so much.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Everyone is pretty spot on. Love the scent but it completely disappears in less than an hour.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: If this stuff had any longevity or silage it would be a winner…but the performance is woeful.so disappointing when some great smelling perfumes just disappear so quickly.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: A good smelling aquatic fragrance with that nice melon/cantaloupe in the opening but the longevity isn’t their 3 hrs and it’s gone I love the burberry brand but this isn’t it better options out their

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I'm a burberry fanboy and this one is just ok. A light, inoffensive freshy you can spray liberally for a casual outing during the spring or summer.

Gave it to my brother..

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: I liked it in winter more than summer ☃️👍

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: This is super fresh and light as a cologne but does not smell cheap. It very versatile and easy to wear and the scent lifts my mood. A great buy for me.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: This is one of my favorites. Mostly for the subtlety and simplicity. The name fits perfectly. Smells like a splash of cool, minerally water. This is one of the two that gets rotated in my gym bag. I generally use it on days I don't want to smell like anything, but don't want to smell bad. Fairly certain no one even notices. Can't really compare it to anything else. There is not really much spice or sweetness. I wear this year round, but would say its probably intended for hot weather. I like this enough to have purchased a 200ml bottle, and it gets used at least once a week. This is a good example of sometimes less is more.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
Regarding similarity to ADG, they share only the freshness,
Otherwise there’s no citruses in here

Quite nice scent with intoxicating effect, with the performance being the negative point

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Smells almost exactly like aqua di gio especially in the opening but after a while it'll start to smell different

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: A citrus - aquatic rather than woody-aquatic scent. Good persistence (4-5 hours) and good projection for an hour. Doesn't smell similar to Aqua di Gio, as I've read on other sites. If you like your scents a little sweet then it's worth purchasing with your eyes closed. Conclusion: excellent value for the money!

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: The definition of aight. Everything about this fragrance is good enough to be serviceable, but then that's it. Got this as a gift, and never seriously wore it.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Burberry's answer to Acqua di Gio. A great floral, watery freshie with an even poorer performance than ADG (if that was at all possible). Stuff just evaporates after two hours. Maybe you'll catch a few faint whiffs on your wrist but even that's a stretch. Someone seriously needs to have a word with the Burberry guys on performance.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
Definition of fresh, summer aquatic. It smells familiar, but in a good way. I compare the fragrance to that of the great-fitting gray suit you have. It may not pull as much attention as some of you off-color suits, but it does what it is supposed to and it does it very well.

The scent has a very familiar/generic fresh & herbaceous opening which is why I believe this fragrance doesn’t get much attention. While nothing jumps out at you in the opening, the magic happens when the melon and aquatic notes emerge in the dry down. The dry down is absolutely beautiful and one that will get you plenty of compliments.

This is not your typical, youthful, fruity summer scent (Nautical Voyage, etc), but rather a classy, fresh/aquatic, masculine summer fragrance that may be your best blind grab in hot weather. Essentially, this smells like a melon-infused Versace Pour Homme

*Side note- this smells absolutely nothing like ADG!

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: I had a list of 'to buy' scents like versace eau frache , versace poure homme and le male fragrances. I love fresh scents, so I am always in search of a aquatic+aromatic scents. I went to sephora to buy one of them from my list, when I first entered the shop a salesman recommended me to test the BB Splash, with the first sniff I was blown away. Because like other aquatics scents this is not blue or oceanic. This one little melony and bit aquatic, it is a best blend for both. For those who like aquatic and fresh scents and like to try bit different I recommend this. But this is not for someone who expects a aventus or a tom ford style fragrances. This is a simple non complex scent and does its job of what it says. You will smell like you just splashed from a pond or a river. It lasts just like any other fresh scents. If you like melony freshness then its for you.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: The first hour is pleasant. Clean and fresh. Very generic. Very mild. If it's for a good price and you're someone who really love fresh clean safe scents, sure it's fine. Otherwise, unremarkable. 4.5/10

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I just got a decant on this and the opening is really fresh and the dry down reminds me of my Polo Red White & Blue Ralph Lauren for men.

I double check it and and spray it on my other wrist and for me they’re both the same scent but splash is on the lighter side. A 3/5 for me :)

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: So yeah, got a 50ml for $17.77 at shopper's drug mart today so felt since they didn't have the other two advertised in their flyer, I'd try this. Smells NOTHING like any of the Brits, nothing like ADG to me. Cannot recall the Claiborne curve line so I dunno if it smells like 'em. Very mild, cheap smelling...flies away in minutes at most...but it is just a splash like they say. If it's similar to any Burberry, it's the Sport one in the black & red bottle. You don't need or probably want this. I put 'like' because it doesn't smell gross but other than that,pass. lol.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
This is why I can’t stand reviews/comparisons from the fragrance community

On what planet does this smell like ADG? Not Earth, maybe Uranus?

It’s a nice light, skin scent which doesn’t smell like ADG

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Finally i have this Burberry fragrance, imho it’s a refreshing citrusy fragrance, it truly reminds me of ARMANI ADG. I love ADG and i’m loving Brit Splash, it’s perfect for summer, my new go to summer fragrance, longevity is moderate nothing spectacular but perfect for everyday use, office friendly and an affordable alternative for the lovers of ADG. The bottle is simple but beautiful.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
“Saltier. Woodier. AdG”

For my review I will be using AdG as a comparison. It saves me from having to talk about notes.

I think if you are an AdG purist you might not like this juice. I think for some people AdG is the classic fresh aquatic for men and that’s ok. However, this is perhaps what a younger AdG fan would wear at the beach. To my nose there is less lemon/citrus and more woods in here. Despite that I get a saltier note that reminds me of the ocean. Wearing it I get average projection and performance on this one. For a designer cologne I got this at an average price (~$40). Pack this one if you’re headed to the beach.

Verdict:
7.5/10 - Functions for me as a beachier flanker of AdG. While not original, it’s a better than average scent with decent projection and silliage. Price is average to below average. Safe blind buy. I’ve had my bottle a year and it’s half empty. Haven’t thought about repurchasing yet.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
This is A copy of ADG and Not A very good one at that. Perry Ellis 360 Red is A MUCH Better Buy....The Burberry is week and Fads out very quickly..


Masculinity 6/10
Versatility 8/10
Value 5/10
Projection 4/10
Fragrance Quality 3/10
Bottle Worthy / No

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I have a sample of Burberry Brit Splash for Men and I must say the full sized bottle is easily redundant. If you have any number of Acqua di Gio scents including but not limited to most Acqua di Gio flankers, Michael Jordan 23, Perry Ellis 360 Red (for men), Zegna Uomo, Liz Claiborne Curve Appeal or even Usher He, then Burberry Brit Splash is a fragrance you can skip on.

I find that Brit Splash is a very light but melon heavy Acqua di Gio style aquatic. It lasts about 5 hours tops with an hour or so of soft to medium projection before becoming a total skin scent. It is entirely generic and unless you go to online retailers, you will find it highly over-priced for what you get, especially when you compare it to comparable scents that do what this does but actually better. Michael Jordan 23 is about the same note wise and is much cheaper for about the same sizes and gives the same performance.

I would rate Burberry Brit Splash a 6.0 out of 10. Why, it isn't strong and is a dime-a-dozen scent that is sold often for inflated prices. If you don't have any Acqua di Gio style scents including clones like Perferred Fragrance H2O or Belcam Geau, maybe this is a buy, but only if you can find it discounted. If not, SKIP.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Literally smells just like ADG, which I do not like. It actually smells closer to the Walmart knock off of ADG, I think it's called Geau or something. Just don't like the light metallic mineral water smell. Amd it's actually weaker than the knock off. Just but ADG profumo

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: The performance bars above are spot on. Nice enough scent upon initial application but soon after no one, including yourself, will know you are wearing it.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: It's good soft slightly soapy in the opening. I do get little bit of absolute dry down ADG vibe. Longevity and silage are poor for the price and the brand.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: This is just pure nasty cheap perfume. Nothing worth wearing or remembering. Bears a slight resemblance to ADG Essenza. I can't stand it honestly, will never wear again or purchase ever.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I've never really worn Acqua di Gio but I sampled it occasionally and for what I remember, yes this Brit version seems similar but not that close since is missing all the citruses notes that at some point get too cloying for me from Acqua de Gio.
I wore it a night in a very public place but it did not draw any complements whatsoever, probably because it becomes a very common scent that nobody bothers to ask what are you wearing since it can be easily found elsewhere.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
Received a mini bottle of this as part of a sampler, and liked it enough to buy the full sized bottle.

Very close to Acqua Di Gio, but without the saltier side. I really enjoy the melon in Splash.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
As a woman, I find it essential to hear a man's opinion on our perfumes.

And as a woman I'd like to add, that this scent is a gorgeous fresh scent.
An easy aphrodisiac.

As a woman, I hope you men take me seriously when I say that this fragrance is a safe blind buy for any age as my handsome father in law has just received it.

If you like Clinique happy for men and Aqua di gio, you'll love this 'relative'.

Let the heat kick in and enjoy your splash, fellas!

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: I think this is a very pleasant scent. It's really clean, fresh and aquatic. Definitely a good one for the spring/summer. Would I wear it everyday? No, but I don't wear any everyday. I'd put it in the rotation during those seasons though. I think it's easy to like. Does it last forever? Maybe not, but it lasts though. You know, I don't understand why people get so caught up with projection, that it has to fill up a friggin room. Too much is just too much. It makes a great fragrance offensive, you become "that guy" to everyone. I think a lot of the haters on here are "those guys." There's also nothing wrong with smelling nice for yourself, and not for people across the street from you.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Very nice aquatic citrus scent, and very much like ADG, but without that lingering drydown smell of ADG that can be a little nauseating. I like it better and it's a nice value.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I tried this at the Burberry Store, Houston Galleria.

The smell was gone after 30 min and it was weak to begin with, I'm starting to think Brit Rhythm is the only GOOD scent Burberry has ever done :-/

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
The top note is nice and aquatic-citrusy but dry down smells too much like Paris Hilton Just Me for Men (not ADG as ADG smells very sour)!

I still like it by the way, but JM for Men is much cheaper :D

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: I hate these typical men fragrances.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
Splash tries to be an aquatic but ends up on the warm side due to cyclamen.

This is for boys that dont care to mix up two different genres (aquatic and floral).

Not so impressive!

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Smelling it right away reminded me of Hugo Boss Pure. They both smell so alike. It's quite fresh, clean with that soapy scent. This is perfect for day time, Spring or Summer. Projection is light nothing overpowering. I've gotten 4-6 hours out of this so far. I rate this 8/10.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: I wouldn't be able to tell the difference between this and ADG if you put them side by side, good news is you can get testers of this cheap as hell.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content: Acqua Di Gio clone. Buy whichever is cheaper out of the two.

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
A devoted beach scent. Burberry Brit Splash is a nice aquatic scent. But being somewhat weak and shy, add to that the fact that the scent isn't something spectacular, informs you that this scent only works as a beach scent. And among beach scents you can find a lot of similar smelling (Even better) cheaper colognes.
5/10

product_name: Burberry Brit Splash for Men Burberry
review_content:
I tried this today, smells fresh and clean,
but nothing special, it does not have anything
in common With rythm other than that they both smell like mainstream fragrances these days, this is not
for the collector, this is a fragrance for those
who just enjoys a regular fragrance for what it is.

I've bought this perfume as a present for my hubby.
He loves its comfortingly autumnal vibe: warm, spicy, smokey and earthy; it feels to me like a sitting on big black tyres by the campfire on a chilly night in the pine forest with a dram of whisky shared with your best friend. Reflective memories....
The scent reminds me of the iconic Black Bvlgari unisex perfume, but in my opinion both of them rather suit for men indeed. I like them too.
It has a relaxing, peacful magic, like a night walk on a tropical island with no one around.

#987 in my "Tour de Fragrance"
First off, this smells nothing like Bvlgari "Orom." It resembles Joop "Absolute" insofar as myrrh comes across like an incense note. But there's really nothing out there that I've run into in my explorations that really matches up with this, and for me uniqueness counts a lot. The myrrh is really strong in this, and I love myrrh. But the Burberry Signatures Collection you have to order directly from Burberry and it's not cheap. $295. If you're a man, before dropping that kind of green, you should first get Amouage "Boundless." You can find it for $170. The overall note combination is more masculine, and it combines myrrh and incense. So for this kind of scent I think it's a better overall choice for the guys.
