That said, this scent performs, no doubt about it. And it definitely get's noticed. Can't imagine anyone being disappointed with longevity and sillage. It's not office wear. Dates maybe, formal occasions definitely. I like it enough and it's unique enough that I would order a bottle for my collection if I thought I'd have occasion to wear it. But I'm no longer seeing the classical pianist for whom I got a symphony series subscription, and that was the only formal event I attended regularly. And I have a couple hundred other acquisitions on my list. So this can wait.

Similar to Joop Homme Absolute - it shares the pepper and smooth woods (similar wood accord as CdG Wonderoud, too) and cool green feel, but this has less of the creamy/smoothness of Joop Absolute, here being more spiced with a dry and almost cool/minty green thyme and smooth earthy ginger. I get a hint of cumin and there's a good and rich, natural vanillic base. The lavender and especially the rose is primarily here just to smooth things out - the rose does take center stage briefly in the mid dry down, especially if your skin heats up. Thisnrose accord smells like a baby wipe, and that's not a bad thing to my nose. Over the cool green woody aromatic base it pulls the fragrance towards fougere category. Mostly the rose functions like the rose in Memoir Man, a glue to bond and smooth the notes together.

It smells a bit like Memoir too, even sharing a bit of cool green minty wormwood effect, but it doesn't have the liquorice notes. It stays greener, simpler, and again leaning more classically fougere.

Other points of reference are Andrea Mack Coven (share some greenness, though no clove here and less earthy overall), and the aforementioned Joop Homme Absolute and Wonderoud. They all share black pepper and some smooth, velvety wood synthetic (pashminol?). Whatever that chemical is I absolutely love it. I'd recommend just going with the Joop for most, it's far less expensive and has more of a creaminess in its florals that probably makes it more mass appealing. This is drier but more elegant - it doesn't try as hard to please as Joop and thus registers as more mature.

One last point of reference is Guichards very own Bleu Turquoise for Armani. The way Guichard combined the incense, black pepper and vanilla into the core accord of that scent is identifiable here, too. The rest of the drapings are completely different so the scents don't really smell alike, but that smooth and sweet peppery richness is here too, this time in shades of purple and green. Bleu Turquoise? No, this time it's Mysterious Alexandrite.

this was my first real perfume as a teenager and i remember liking it so much i emptied the entire bottle in one summer (probably also due to the fact that i didn’t know how to use perfumes at that age haha). it’s nostalgic seeing the bottle and i’d love to smell it again.
This perfume is refreshing and summery. A light and an innocent scent to recharge your body scent.

I love this fragrance for the summer - it is light and fresh, just what I need living in a humid place. I get compliments on it. It's very modern, a floral but not toooo sweet, due to the heady base notes. The ultimate summer smell!
OMG this smelt terrible on me..thank God i didnt buy it...the best i like from burberry is Burberry Brit for women.
feel like lying in a field with mandarines!! a summer perfume. light and fresh! when october comes dont bother where it's been hidden.

this one is SWEET, fresh, and slightly crisp with a pinch of woodsy note.
For me this kinda smell like vera wang princess but with a bit of woody note.

I'm with missk on this one. I was to get another bottle of the 2007 edition of Burberry Summer, but they sent me this instead. It was a surprise, but I wasn't disappointed.
It starts a lot fruitier than the older edition. Rarely can I tell prety much all the notes in a perfume but this was the case. A light burst of mandarine, followed by a fruity mix of red currant and grape (riesling as the olfactive piramid on the bottle says). The cassis, the grape and litchi blend really well giving the perfume this sour sweet berry smell that lingers on through the middle and base notes. Slowly the flowers show up and mellow the citrus and the fruits, while the cedar of the base blends with the musk to give it something of a greenish (mint/moss-like to me) nuance sometimes even from the start.I still have a few drops left of the other bottle and I can tell they share the same powdery, a bit green quality in the drydown wich I happen to enjoy.
The lasting power of the 2009 edition is better on me and hot weather gives its contribution to the delicate sillage. Actually it's one of the few frags that I can tolerate in the blistering heat (I think we got over 40C at noon!).What I've noticed with both fragrances is that when I can't smell them anymore, others still can. I've been wearing this for only two days and got complimented by friends and colleagues near me.It's very well done so it sits smoothly on the skin for hours. It's just what I need for summer: a light but still present and unique enough fragrance that I can enjoy every day without actually smelling like a chemical fruit syrup. Surprisingly, I got plenty of compliments on it, same thing with the 2007 edition (someone said it smells tempting - bergamote and freesia, go figure:D)

I tested this on a paper, not on my body so that I cannot review it properly. But - this smells like sweat. The start was nothing special, some flat flowers, but after a while everything was gone and I could smell something inapropriate - sweat (maybe because of the musk)! My boyfriend has the same opinion.

Not for me. It smells kind of synthetic and cologne-like along the lines of CK 1 but not exactly. You cannot make out the notes except that it smells fresh and a bit fruity. It doesn't last at all on my skin. Any BBW product has better staying power for less money.

Burberry's fragrances don't work with me (with the exception of Brit Sheer which I love!). At the beginning it is so woody, then a little bit sweet and the base notes are fresh and citrus. An odd one.

Nearly finished a bottle of this already!....Nice and fruity, quite fresh, good for summer...but not very long lasting on my skin...sprayed it on my clothing mostly :o) I don't think I'll get another bottle.....

Burberry Summer '09 is a lot fruitier and fresher than its predecessor.

While this version maintains the pretty floral notes found in the original, the added notes of litchi, mandarin orange and red currant gives this fragrance so much more character. Crisp yet delicate, I find this fragrance much better suited to hot climates.

I tested this fragrance on a relatively humid day in the city and I'll admit that I felt very refreshed simply by wearing this scent. Rather than being sharp or potently fruity, Burberry Summer '09 sits smoothly on the skin and never feels too sticky.

It is a perfect balance of fruits, florals and woodsy notes. The cedar and sandalwood in the base notes has an almost clean, soapy quality which rounds the scent off nicely.

So far this would be my choice if I had to choose a Summer scent from the Burberry line.

Finally got to test this one and it really falls flat and is very bland. It smells like lemon and that is about it. Not sweet or woodsy or anything else. I can not make out any other specific notes. On the positive side it has really good sillage because the scent stayed on the top of my hand hours after I left the mall. It was still there after I washed my hands a couple of times. Thankgoodness I didn't buy it unsniffed. NEXT! 0.o
This is one of the best perfumes ever! It smells sexy and fresh, not too sweet and I can still smell it after 8-9 hours. I wish it was not only a summer perfume so I could buy it again and again. :(

Based on the notes in the description, I was dying to test this. Dissappointingly, I didn't smell litchi or any of the other notes I was hoping to smell:( It was rather nondescript compared to others I was testing. Since I was testing other fragrances, I'll test this again before I rule it out.

I agree!
Very tasty without being too sweet. Gentle and innocent, and in the same time - modern and urban.
In the beginning the fruits are on the floral base, then they become lighter and I can smell a really nice fruity juice with sparkling water :)
The base reminds me of L'Eau par Kenzo.
Really makes me smile :)

It smells refreshing and lasts. The Litchi, mandarin orange and red currant are so perfectly blended that you smell all of them at once and the mixture is addicting.

The cedar base note adds a minty fresh scent that is perfect for summer.

It is well blended and has the right amount of sillage, not too much or too little. The notes of lemon, ginger, rose, and musk are exactly what I like, and it could be something to add to my collection but I think I need to get a decant to give it a proper test (I just sprayed it on my arm at the store). The fact that it doesn't hit you in the face is, in my opinion, a good thing. If a travel size were available I would probably buy that straightaway.

I do like this one, especially the warmth that comes from it. Not too complicated and don’t have to think too hard about it. A nice go to when I don’t have time to really think about which perfume to wear. Classic, simple and elegant.

I cannot stand the original Her. It makes me nauseous. But Her London Dream is fantastic! I am mostly a gourmand lover, but this fragrance is just so lovely that I can't help but adore it. On my skin and to my nose, it smells like lemons, peony, and rain on the pavement. It smells really fresh and clean. It reminds of Acqua di Gioia as well as Air di Gioia. I think if you sprayed both you would get something similar to Her London Dream (Acqua has lemon, Air has peony). It has a cologney note so it could easily be unisex and may come off as masculine to some people. I live in a hot climate and it is working well in this weather. I think it is a spring and summer scent. It seems to sit closer to the skin. I will be buying the full bottle. Love it!
No, just no. That’s all I can say about this. Bad
It’s so BORING. It smells like a generic holiday soap from TJ Maxx. It’s different than the other Her flankers. Honestly it would fit more in the Miss Dior universe. I’m so disappointed in this.
LOVE this perfume. I don't even know how to describe the smell. It reminds me of someone who classy and confident. Will be repurchasing!

Tho sadly it doesn't last long on my skin, I actually really like this perfume its notes are things I dont usually go for or wear in a perfume but the lemon ginger and sweet musk combination is really nice and very unique to me. Love it!

I like this, but I'm a clean/fresh-perfume person, and I wasn't looking for something that resembles the original Burberry Her. I wear this in the summer when I want something light and slightly floral. Does it last? No -- but I'm not usually looking for long-lasting performance in 90-degree heat, anyway. I can spray this to my heart's desire and not worry about choking anyone out.

initial smell from spraying it is exactly how i want it to smell the whole time but it ends up smelling a tad too clean for me… which is a bummer because burberry her i fear is too sweet for me… this was like so perfect in theory but execution left me…. meh

I have a very refined sense of smell and taste. Now, flavours and fragrances can absolutely be subjective, but in my experience, this perfume has been a BIG disappointment to me.
I am a huge fan of Burberry Her, and I am also exploring the other versions of it. Impressive how many there are. As soon as I wore this perfume, I realised it was a big mistake, and I wanted to wash it off my body immediately, but I couldn't, I was already out, and had to endure this smell all day long.
Let me try to explain what this smells like.
At the very beginning, as soon as you spray it on yourself, it gives you a very brief illusion that they nailed it again. Wrong. That's until it dries on your skin and you start noticing that it's changing. It slowly but not that slowly turns into a perfume that smells cheap and bought from Poundland for a few quid. I hated wearing it. It did stick to my skin for quite a long time, so I had to smell something I disliked so much for hours and hours, blending with my skin's pH. I honestly don't recommend this perfume. I know that there are plenty of people who like it, and that's ok too. However, in my opinion, there must have been an unusual mix of notes resulting in an unexpected fragrance that comes out only a bit after spraying it. I could have been the ginger, I suppose. Hard no for me. Invest in Burberry her, the regualr one, Eau the Perfume.

This is probably one of the most "clean" smelling perfumes I own. I love to wear this after a shower - and I think if I want something light and not crazy heavy - this is a go too. I love the florals and the soapy vibe. Very clean.
this version doesn't smell anything like the other ones in the line, this kind of reminds me of a cleaning product: very fresh, gingery and lemony, not my taste in perfumes :/

its her’s older, cleaner and lighter sister from another mister (i say from another mister because it doesnt quite fit in the her collection) i enjoy rose and peony and appreciated the hint of lemon but i can see how this isnt for everyone! lasted quite a while on my skin (about 6 hours?) very minimal sillage. a scent i do not recommend blind buying but i do recommend smelling it :)

Don’t think it should’ve been a Her flanker as it doesn’t really share much of the original DNA from what I can perceive, but this is so gorgeous. It’s an ultra feminine, beautifully floral yet light, clean scent. Smells like an effortlessly sophisticated, wealthy woman lounging in her garden after a shower, reveling in the scent of newly blossomed peonies and roses wafting through a cool spring breeze. Have seen it described as generic but that’s what makes it so wonderfully versatile and mass appealing. Gets me compliments left and right whenever I wear it. My skin really highlights the fresh peony, musk and amber and I absolutely adore it. Great everyday scent!

TRADE REQUEST:
i purchased a bottle of Burberry Her London Dream, thinking it was the original Burberry Her parfum. Does anyone have interest in my bottle of London Dream in exchange for another burberry her? i’m open to the parfum, toilette, intense, or elixir.

I don’t love most variations of Burberry Her (including the original) as they’re too floral for my nose, but this is definitely my least favourite so far. It has very distinct rose on drydown, then it’s mostly peony, musk, some lemon, and hint of ginger. I don’t get any amber and it’s nowhere near sweet enough for me. Has minimal sillage and lasts about 8 hours. Saw that this was compared to Oakcha Praise the Perfume but I disagree. Praise the Perfume is much sweeter and quite woody.

i got the sample of this, for me it smells pretty generic.
my husband said 'you smell so good like a 5 start hotel'

not sure this is a nice thing hahahah

You know what? Looking at the color of the juice, I just think "Arnie Palmer," and that's actually what the perfume smells like too. Like lemonade diluted by something else. I say "something else" because I can never really taste any tea in an Arnie Palmer. I never understood the appeal of that drink. Likewise I don't smell any tea in this fragrance. On the whole it just has a murky, ambiguous Arnie Palmer vibe. I do smell ginger, which gives it a little spice and enhances the lemon, and I also smell a nice sweetened amber in the drydown. Arnie Palmers are very popular with a great many Americans...but I have never liked them. Likewise I don't feel convinced by this perfume either.
Generic and boring, nothing special to it.

It's a nice fragrance. It smells good on me and I like the citrusy notes up top. It's pretty basic compared to some of the more complex perfumes out there. It does have decent silage and longevity. It's a good fragrance for work or anywhere you don't want something really out there. Definitely has a more spring and summer energy to it.

it's funny-- i hate ginger as a flavor, but as a scent, i'm all for it. i sampled it at ultra earlier today and fell in love! a floral, musky ginger lemon! it's like candy. definitely need a travel bottle.
Generic and unimpressive, I don't hate it but it does nothing for me

I want to be clear that this perfume is very much my type of perfume, so while I do try to give somewhat unbiased opinions, this one really ticked all my boxes and smells similarly to other perfumes that I like. Overall, I think what's most impressive about this perfume is its value. Generally speaking, Burberry perfumes are not inexpensive, but this one really lasts, has a fairly strong sillage, and it is NOTICEABLE. I wore it for a day and kept getting so many complements. It's a well-layered fragrance, so if you're considering a perfume in this scent family, I highly recommend.

Scent Description: Fresh Citrus
Sillage: Strong - noticeable by others easily
Longevity: Long - truly all day

This one is a head scratcher, as it shares none of the recognizable Her DNA that one finds in the EDP, EDT, and Intense. When I saw the name, I wondered if Burberry was going for a mix of London and Her. Since I like London but find the floral sometimes a bit screechy, I was intrigued by the idea of a “Herifying” London. But not to be.

I get a ginger musk, with a peony-floral supporting note. After seeing lemon listed as one of the notes, I can tell it’s there (although this might just be the power of suggestion).

I got this as part of a sampler set with Her EDP, EDT, and Elixir—London Dream was the wildcard, and I would have bought it for the other three regardless. But as much as I like the others, the floral-ginger-musk scent here really isn’t working for me, sadly.

Skin test. winter.
So I don't agree with with I'm hearing online about online about scent, I don't think it is a cleaner type scent (if so, a flipping nice one!).
I got a gentle but bright floral fresh scent, not incredibly ginger or lemony (but they are there) nothing like the Hermes ginger (which I find horrific) and not at all like the Chloe nomade (which feels like a totally different scent).

I get a more fresher type, a touch of woods, clean, a smidgen dry, a pinch of ginger, and a few drops of lemon.
Really nothing like the really lemony scents out there.

I'm disappointed on the longevity, it goes a bit flat on me too. I got a lovely half hour or so and it waned from there to not much at 3-4 hrs.
This could do much better in summer heat I feel.
It's quite pricey so i would test first due to longevity and Review discrepancies though

Top tier designer fragrance. Suitable for any occasion. Perfect for everyday wear. I find designer fragrances to be “generic” but not this one. It smells gorgeous. Fresh, soft spicy, floral. Beautiful! If only the performance was better… I would’ve bought the full bottle (100 ml). I own the 50 ml one and almost run out.

Burberry Her London Dream is quite different to the original fragrance and is less sweet, which may be more appealing for some.

This flanker opens with a sweet, feminine blend of rose and peony. The rose accord in this fragrance is bright, effervescent and lemony with a dash of ginger. The composition overall is a crisp, Spring-like floral with less sweetness than its predecessor. Burberry Her London Dream dries down into a smooth white musk with a hint of amber, that smells more like ambroxan on my skin.

The ginger note in this fragrance brings to mind ginger ale, and whilst this accord is not overpowering, it adds a slightly edgy tone to this flanker. If I were to compare the original Burberry Her EDP to Burberry Her London Dream, this flanker is her edgy, tomboy little sister.

Unfortunately, most fragrances containing a dominant peony accord react poorly on my skin, further amplifying the tart, sometimes sharp aspects of this note. This flanker smells like ginger scented vinegar on my skin, so adding this fragrance to my collection is a definite no from me.

The sillage was moderate and the longevity average, lasting approximately 5-hours on warm skin. It's not a stand-out from the Burberry line, but it is an incredibly pleasant citrusy rose which would suit warmer climates.

Reading all these reviews for London Dream Burberry Her and I've come to the conclusion that I'm extremely lucky in how this fragrance suits my skin chemistry.
London Dream opens up with a blast of Lemon and ginger with the rose and peony in the background against a smidge of ambery musk, but after 30 minutes and it's all rosy amber and musk with hints of the other notes, after two hours and the fragrance reaches its final phase which is just this amazing Amber musk with something earthy and floral beneath it, it smells otherworldly at this point and it stays on my skin in this phase for the next 10 hours with good projection around me, and by like the 12th hour it's a skin scent, but it's still noticeable if someone hugs me.
I seriously don't know what magic Burberry did here for such a fresh fragrance to last over 12 hours on my skin, but I'm here for it.
Compliments pour in whenever I use this scent, and despite it being a woman's perfume, on my skin the scent becomes quite unisex, it's a fresh floral musk amber scent and I love it.
9/10
I dont care that it's marketed for woman I'm going to rock this as long as Burberry keeps making it.

London Dream has been my go to scent for years now. It’s more of an everyday wear perfume which I enjoy, great for after a shower on a day out. It carries that sophisticated smell with for me the Rose being the star and after a few minutes the musk and amber settles in so nicely. The zest of ginger and lemon goes away a bit quickly for me. If you love the floral but not too powdery and has warmth this is the one for you. I can’t give this one up!

The weather has warmed up and this fragrance is softer and sweeter, much much better than it was in the cold winter weather. It was way too sharp and citrusy in the cold weather but it’s been 55 degrees Fahrenheit and it’s much nicer now. I thought it was the dry down of Pink sugar lolli pink but it’s London dream 💗 I love it now

Burberry Her London Dream to my nose is a fresh, citrusy, powdery, and musky floral fragrance. It smells like a youthful, fresher, and lighter version of Twilly d'Hermes Eau Ginger. (I find all Hermes perfumes too mature and strong.)

Ginger in a fragrance is not what I usually go for. But when I tested both perfumes, Her London Dream spoke more to me even with just moderate projection and longevity. Actually, I used to smell this type of fragrance from older people back in the day. But to my nose, Her London Dream was tweaked to smell younger and trendy. Overspraying this however brings out that mature vibe so I avoid doing that.

Some days I like this but some days I don't. With that said, I'm just going to enjoy my bottle until its empty. 😊
It's a sweet and piquant amber scent that is warm which has a similar vibe with Nomade Chloé.
Not my cup of tea. This smells very cheap and generic to me. I'm going to scrub it off. It smells like it should be $20 at a chemist. It's not often I actively dislike a fragrance but I dislike this.
Smells earthy, fresh and clean. Very noticeable ginger note gives me Olympea vibes. Interesting. Safe blind buy.

Eeew, No. it stinks— it’s a mix of Burberry the Og, the one rose, and Eros— it’s gross. No! I prefer Her Blossom and Burberry Goddess over this. I will never buy this again.
I’m on my 3rd bottle of Her Blossom and my 3rd bottle of Burberry Goddess. I’m not a fan of Burberry Her or Og Burberry, and not a fan of London Dream now either. If you fancy Versace Eros, The One Rose and the Originsl Burberry edp then you’re more than likely going to like this one too— I despise all of those.

this shit smells awful and boring terrible performance too this instead you can choose her elixir or edt
sillage:5/10
longevity:6/10
scent:8/10

This is a very perfumy-perfume and a very typical designer fragrance. It's not bad but not that good either, it's ok. Nice office scent, not offensive at all. I like the lemon and ginger opening and dries down on my skin slightly sweet. Doesn't last at all, I would say 2-3 hours then becomes skin scent. This smells nothing like the original Burberry Her so if you don't like that fragrance because of its sweetness then you might like this one as this leans more unisex in my opinion.
This is a fresh and bright floral scent. It’s personally one of my favorite fragrances in the Burberry line, and my husband loves it on me also.

This is how I hoped “Bubble Bath” by MM would smell like. Beautiful lemon musky scent that dries down very soapy and clean. The sillage and longevity are not the best but the great thing about this fragrance is that it is not offensive at all, because it’s so clean smelling — you can wear this anywhere that you want to wear perfume but may be alittle apprehensive because you don’t wanna offend people with sensitivities : I.E a plane or office. I’ll throw this out there too, great fragrance for that time of the month also as our sense of smells are thrown off. My favorite fragrance from the Her line, easily.

gorgeous gorgeous scent -- even more on paper. I wish it smelled as good on the skin as it did on the paper but I really like it nevertheless.
On my skin I find the sharp beautiful brightness doesnt last as long.. instead it evaporates shortly and the dry down gives me a ginger scent combined with a powdery skin scent closer to L'air du temps.

I love to wear this fresh out the shower because it makes me smell extra clean.

I don't like the original Her and I love this. Spicy fresh opening dries down to a soft rose within a few minutes. Sillage and longevity aren't amazing but for the office I do prefer that so I don't overpower anyone.

Lovely day to day/office scent that works across seasons. If you don't like Her or the other flankers, this might be the one for you!
I loved the scent, cause it reminded me of an ice tea. Unfortunately, the longevity and projection were very poor, bummer.

Love this!! It’s the first perfume I ever bought, and I was at Sephora and all the other perfumes seemed to be missing something. Don’t get me wrong, they were nice, but this one really is my passion. Obviously it’s a hit or miss, but if you have yet to find a signature scent that isn’t too heavy, check this out!!

I regret buying this! It definitely smelled better in the store and on paper. Opening is so sharp and it doesn't grow on you and the smell doesn't get better on the skin after some time. I have a full sized bottle unfortunately...now I'm experimenting with layering...so far it's more bare-able when layered with Gardenia from Zara. Don't buy it!

Burberry Her London Dream is my default work fragrance. The bite of ginger and the sweetness of peony give this fragrance a fresh 'morning' feeling. The musk makes it warm and inviting. To my nose, this is a fresh, citrus, musky delight. I do overspray to increase the sillage but it does not bother others. On the contrary, I receive compliments on this fragrance every time I wear it. It's such an easy reach and the price point is reasonable. Although I do gravitate toward niche fragrances, Burberry Her London Dream meets all of my daily scent needs.

This was the least favorite of Her and flankers I’ve tried. It lost the fruity part of Her that is delicious and became floral heavy. I personally am not a big floral fan so this to me was like a bathroom air freshener due to the lemon/ginger mixing with the floral notes. I gave it to my coworker and she fell in love (granted she never smelled any of the Her scents before) and it absolutely radiated from her when I walked by her in the hall. So I can see it working well for others

I love this perfume with a passion. It's insanely addictive to me!

Nothing like the original Burberry Her. I dislike the orig. Burberry Her but this one, Burberry Her London Dream, is absolutely lovely.

A newly bloomed rose with morning dew on it, fragrant peony and a slightly soapy undertone. Ah! Beautiful.

Very bright and refreshing but not in a sharp or citrussy way. So addictive I start to crave it. I tested this in the store and I wasn't going to buy a new perfume for a while but after trying it I couldn't get it off my mind and had to order it the same day.

I don't think the beige bottle really suits the vibe of this perfume well, I think it should be another pretty pastel color like the EdP and EdT Burberry Her bottles have.

Upliftingly clean and fresh!
very weak..
it reminds me of lancome idole intense..
I like it. Reminds me of the perfumes my mum would wear in the 90s. It’s happy and not too loud. I wouldn’t wear it myself but I’d be happy to smell it on someone else!
This is a very fresh, safe blind buy. It does not have the sweet fruity BH DNA but it is very nice. Good for everyday wear.

I’m honestly surprised I love this scent. I usually am not a big fan of lemon or ginger notes but I think they’re done so well here.

This scent is fresh but still sexy and a little creamy to my nose. This is seriously the last flanker of the Her lineup I thought I’d buy and it was one of the first. 😂

Not an unpleasant scent overall but it has a somewhat disjointed feel to it. The base notes smell similar to the original Burberry Her EDP but the ginger and lemon feel completely detached. It is very clean and subtle, it has moderate projection and longevity but it's never terribly strong. I'm not typically one to assign ages to fragrances but London Dream does feel very 'young'.

I saw this perfume sold for a very discounted price (60$CAD for 50ml) so I blind bought it. Burberry perfumes are a bit difficult for me but I like this one. It does remind me a bit of Olympea, I think it's the fresh-but-warm general feel of it, although London dream is creamier than Olympea.
It's not groundbreaking, it doesn't have monster sillage (unless you overspray), it's not incredibly sexy, it's not too floral, not too sweet...
But it is a simple, nice, well blended, easy to wear perfume that you reach for when you have no clue what to wear that morning but you want to just smell good without being offensive. Perfect for the office, people at any age can wear this easily too.
A nice mix of ginger, musk and a bit of flowers. I like it.

I thought I would have left a review on this but I went through them and I don’t think I did, strange because I LOVE LOVE LOVE this perfume. I had once got the viva box from SDM a few xmas’s ago and got the original Burberry Her and I don’t know why I had exchanged the coupon for the full size because I hated it lol so I went and smelled the rest of the line and I love the fresh smell of this. Fresh perfumes are my vibe and this is right up there with my fav coach poppy flower , very close second to that. If you like fresh scents like straight out do the shower than you’ll love this. If you like the original Her you will likely not like this. Her Blossom is also nice, but that’s more floral and this is clean zesty fresh.

I like this zesty sweet fragrance due to the strong ginger note. However it's what I wear when I have a boring outfit on because it doesn't fit a particular mood for me. I bought a travel size of it and only have a few sprays left. I don't see myself getting a full bottle of London Dream unless I start missing it.

For a lemon and musk fragrance, I much prefer Yellow Dream. For a ginger kick, I much prefer White Tea Ginger Lily. However, this does smell really nice!

Warm floral with citrus punch. Not fresh in my opinion actually can give a headache when over sprayed, but when used right very beautiful winter/autumn scent.
Used it a lot this winter. Very comforting and as I mentioned before there’s something warming about it (mostly because of ginger). The only actually interesting her IMO.
PS the only problem it doesn’t last more than 2 hours. Not on anyone, but this problem of all “her”s.

London Dream is nice but very perfumey and unimaginative. The lemon and musk make for a smooth, clean blend. I can’t really think of who would wear this though. It’s hard to describe. Boring is the first word I think of, but I also can’t see a boring person wearing this because… it has a little bit of personality I guess? The lemon and the peony is its saving grace. The longer I have it on the more I think it’s not terrible (the amber emerging?) but still, not a must-have. If you like clean fragrances, give it a sniff, you might really like it.

Floral, oriental (from the ginger I think), and slightly fresh. It reminds me of what the perfume samples inside of magazines smell like. The fresh note in this makes it smell a little masculine to my nose.
I already did my review on London Dream but in short: inoffensive, uplifting, easy reach.

So I got this scent as a sample and it is no where near as good as burberry her...like not even close. I get the ginger, lemon and amber most on myself, then it just starts to fade away as if it was never applied. So disappointed...I had high hopes for this and was just totally dropped on my head. But If your sensitive to fragrance and want a light, fresh, summer scent, then this is most def is 100% for you. I suggest sampling 1st if you can though. It smells great while it last btw and it's a decent value.

This reminds me so strongly of Kilian Princess ("I Don't Need A Prince By My Side To Be A Princess By Kilian") with the powdery lemon and ginger notes. It's a somewhat lighter, even more feminine version of that scent but very, very similar. As with the Kilian Princess, it verges on too powdery for my personal taste, but there's something really interesting and warm and a bit sensual about the scent.

This smells like the green aftershave my dad used when I was little. I used to splash a little on myself too and it was cool and refreshing. I can't say the same for Her London Dream.

Didn’t remind me at all of London. I just wanted it off.

I'm a guy here, spraying a 1 ml tester on my right arm and smelling it. The first thing I think of is Miss Dior blooming bouquet. The reason? My mom uses it. I'm not a pro in female perfume but this is very mesmerizing. Delicate evolution from a super fruity scent to a soft rose and rose fading with vanilla popping out at the end.

I like this perfume. It's likable and easygoing. A good daytime perfume office friendly and clean. I think it is a lovely perfume if you want to feel clean and fresh. It is an excellent fragrance to wear when you feel like not wearing that much perfume. It is not overwhelming or anything; it's just...there.

Burberry Her and Her London Dream are definetely different scents but when I sniff Her London Dream from the air the smell is OG-like.

For comparison: Her London Dream is the watered down and less fruity, cleaner version of Her Edt. Edt is the transition between the OG and London Dream in terms of intensity.

Overall I love the scent but I wish I didn't go noseblind to it after 30 minutes. As others mentioned it is office friendly and the perfect work fragrance for me. Clean but neither like a plain bar of soap nor a shampoo. I agree with the review that said this smells like luxury hotel sheets.

I already appreciate the fragrance but I am pretty sure that more sensitive and trained noses would appreciate it more.

I am very surprised about how its perfumers formulated Burberry Her London Dream to have a fresh and light opening without any single trace of the dense ambery floral during the heart and base notes.

There is more to it than it seems. Definetely deserves more hype but I decide to gatekeep it.

Final note: Dear Burberry, please don't discontinue it!!!

i'll start off by saying i love this scent, but i think i'll love it even more if i could smell it all day ://// very clean and safe, its not offensive at all. good for office settings as it sits close to the skin.

Fresh shower smell! Nice and clean, inoffensive scent -leans slightly unisex in my opinion. It’s a shame it isn’t very strong and doesn’t really last so that in mind, I wouldn’t say it’s worth a purchase at full retail price.

I tried this out at últas a few days ago and instantly fell in love. For the most part I got the rose and the lemon, the perfect combo in my opinion. This is such a fresh scent. I’m in love and I may have to make this my signature scent soon!
I really liked the fresh lemony scent, but unfortunately couldn’t smell it for very long.

Kinda safe, boring. A fresh watery citrus floral with the robust whispers of ginger. I think it’s a calm chill fragrance it wasn’t sharp at all IMO. It’s not the same but it is in the same family as D&G light blue. The difference is in this the citrus lemon bite isn’t as tart and juicy as LB lol. The dry down is pretty. It’s where a soft pleasant musk settles. Very boring overall though compared to the original.

Selling a 3.3 oz bottle about 75% full.

I prefer the original and made a mistake of blind buying this huge bottle. It’s still a pretty good scent just not my favorite.

Just used this for the first time from my tester and I’m actually thrown off by how much I love this. It really does encapsulate London. Smelling this reminds me of going out in London and definitely a familiar scent. Im loving this and the original right now

Very fresh & clean. But also very generic, it’s nothing special. Still a very pretty scent that’s very wearable for everyday. Makes a good grab and go scent, you really don’t have to think about it much! Not similar in anyway to the original Her, so if you love the original do not blind buy this!

I like this a lot. This is such a dainty feminine scent. It reminds me of a woman going to work in her nice office. The lemon ginger opening is done right and it isn’t screechy at all - very subtle and fresh. The peony & rose is lovely. I bought a travel rollerball. If it lasts long, I’m getting a bottle

update: I adore this scent. It’s my favorite out of the Burberry Her line. Gingery & lemony rose but the peony makes it a little sweet. It also lasts pretty long. I wore it at 8am for work and could still smell it on myself at 5pm. It could be a springtime signature everyday scent. I love wearing this for the office, school, and daytime events.

One word: Oldish. Old soap covered in a dusty box hidden in old aunties bathroom. Soapy roses, lots of musk and the only good thing about it is that there is something powdery. Not youthful. After an hour it gets sweeter but it remains very very soapy. There are quite a lot good Burberry scents out there (Body and Black are my favs) but this one is just not for me.

This is really nice if you give it a chance, on the strip I got strong ginger and citrus and it was meh..but on skin it turned to this just really nice musky soapy-fresh laundry scent. Definitely think this office safe and very nice for warmer spring summer days, wasn’t a love but I likes.
It is pretty generic and boring... and sometimes that's okay because this fresh rose is done right! It isn't unnecessarily powdery. It's light, delicate, and "feminine." Great for work.
I’m not a fan of the original Her, but this is worse. The opening smells exactly like the ginger that comes with cheap sushi. I could not get past that.
Very fresh and floral. Reminds me a bit of RL Romance or something by Chloé. A rather safe, inoffensive, albeit uninspired flanker. Bears no resemblance to the original Burberry Her.

I just tried this in store earlier today. It wasn't really what I was expecting based on the notes. The opening smelled mostly like ginger to my nose, with just a touch of lemon. I didn't smell the florals that much at all, but the amber and musk in the base came through fairly quickly and lasted for the duration of the wearing. I own the rest of the line, but I won't be purchasing this one.

I tried this in a Sephora sampler in the fall, and although it didn’t stand out enough to use my scent certificate on, it was memorable enough for me to buy a travel rollerball of it later. I’m trying this again on a gorgeous day, it feels like spring and this scent is just so clean and perfect. I really love the lemony ginger top notes, and the soft beautiful floral heart. The musk and amber base notes are present through the whole performance. I feel like once the top notes fade away, you can smell the peony and base notes all playing together, I don’t really pick up the rose, but they’re having a lovely time. The drydown is a little powdery but not overly so. This isn’t a groundbreaking scent, and it’s a like rather than a love, hence me not buying a full bottle, but it really is an easy reach for a sunny spring day. I don’t usually go for something so musky, but the amber note rounds it off beautifully, making it more wearable for me and less “old lady-like”. Projection and longevity are moderate, and I think I prefer this kind of scent that way.

I can't stop thinking about this perfume! I blindly sprayed it on myself one time at Sephora and was surprised that I liked it so much. Went on fragrantica when I got home and was surprised to see rose as a note as my nose does not pick up on it at all. I went to Sephora again the other day and tried it on my skin again. The dry down was delicious. Musky and almost laundry-like. I wish they had a travel size, I want to try it longer before I commit.
This perfume took the love out of the original her. Its sooooo generic smelling. Like a weird off brand perfume from cvs. The otiginal is lovely but this just doesnt cut it.

I love this scent a lot, but I cannot get it to last more than an hour or so; granted, I have a diminished sense of smell, but there are plenty others that I am able to smell for longer durations. I'm also a fairly conservative sprayer.. usually only 1-2

tried as part of the 2021 sephora favorites perfume sampler: i was surprised to see rose as the top note because I didn’t get that at all. to me it came off immediately fruity and clean floral, with the spice of ginger and musk right after. wore close to the skin. after about an hour of wear it did smell pretty generic, kind of like walking through the fragrance department of a mall when everything blends together. it’s nice and unoffensive, and i felt comfortable wearing it during the day to class, but I wouldn’t buy the full size bottle.

This is quite inoffensive and is essentially what you would expect it to be from reading the notes on here. A little fresh, a bit zingy from the addition of ginger, softly floral and cleanly musky. The lemon in the opening is very nice! 

I realize people dislike the word "generic" (people hate everything lately, I give up), but this really is and I believe it's a decent way to describe it. Still, there's nothing wrong with that sometimes, and it's absolutely OK to have an easy-reach. For instance, I wore this to church this morning and it's nice for situations like that.

I can see how people are saying it's unisex, but I do think peony tips it into a femme trajectory as it dries (I don't care, wear whatever you like, the gender thing is asinine). Peony is listed as a heart note usually, but I personally always find that it endures and becomes a base element too.

This fades into the intimate musky drydown pretty quickly (rapidly develops), and stays that way for a few hours before becoming a true skin scent. It's summery and pleasant.
As a man I comfortably wear this. My wife gave to me because it’s too soapy, spicy, & masculine
smells like dove lotion

Devastated to say I need to retire this one from my collection. In just a few months, it turned on me. The liquid is cloudy and smells sour, not in that beautiful lemony way but in a vinegar way. I’m heartbroken since this is my signature and I love it dearly. I’m going to buy a travel size in June so that I can keep wearing this in the summer, but until then, adios Her London Dream :-(
i don’t know what to feel about this :// when i first sprayed it on all i could get is air freshener, but as it dries down somehow it reminds me of miss dior blooming bouquet

Opens soapy, dry, kinda metallic, a bit iris and violets. Turns a bit stale on my skin, no sweetness but a tiny hint of citrus.
On clothes its a bit like a new car smell - the metal and cleanness.
On my skin it sweetens up by the midnotes into a cool creamy vanilla and the final drydown is sweet, smoky and dusty.

Her London Dream is my favorite kind of floral - it's not powdery or too intense, but fresh and lovely with support from fruit (lemon) and musk. Burberry fragrances are usually wins for me and HLD is no exception. This is classy, this is sophisticated, but it's not too mature. I love the zesty, but sweet ginger note. This fragrance is full bottle worthy for sure. Adding it to my wish list.

I like this kind of scent, even though my husband keeps saying that they smell like teenagers' perfumes, lol. I like every phrases of this perfume, from the opening to the dry down.

The dry down (at least on my skin) smells just like the opening of Gucci Envy Me which I adore so much. It's clean, bubbly, and playful.
Smells like original her, but more lemony . Nothing special . Too floral

Not the typical Burberry Her. It lasts really long on me. Around 6hrs on my skin and days on clothes!!! Sillage and projection is moderate. If you spray like 6-8 times projection could be beast. This starts off fresh and kinda unisex but it turns more feminine after a few minutues. Then this turns sweet and powdery as its base but there still its freshness into it, probably the ginger and lemon is still a little bit in the background. I love this. For me this is not soapy. It doesn't smell like generic for me too. I smelled a lot and owned several perfumes, and this really is designer quality. Perfumes nowadays are gourmand, I love how different this is from gourmand, for a change. It has depth and I like how balanced the citrusy freshness, floral and sweet it is. This is love at first sniff for me. I tried this at the mall and I thought at first that this is the OG because for me this has the OG qualities and the OG being the flanker, but I was wrong. This is stronger, fresher and more long lasting than the OG. I love both Burberry Her and London dream but, I'd choose this over the other. 💖

This is one of those fragrances that kinda smells different as it dries and fades away. It starts as a bright scent, with strong notes of ginger and lemon, then once it is dried, it smells more of peony and lemon with notes of rose, and by the time it is fading, it smells faintly of white floral and of musk. It is fairly feminine, and it is warm yet fresh too.

The performance is not the greatest, but good enough for the value. It has an intimate-to-moderate trail and lasts for about 3-5 hours.

7/10. Great zesty and gingery scent, performance isn't the best but it's not too bad either.

I wear this almost every day. It goes on bright and zesty, but begins to dry down to a powdery floral, and in the end it’s a straight up unisex musk. It doesn’t project much at all, and since I live with somebody with chronic migraines and allergies, that works out very well for me. This is also a great layering perfume to any scent that needs a bright lift, but I love it so much that I often wear it alone. This is great for the office, the classroom, or anywhere else you need a practical, versatile, won’t-trigger-headaches-in-anyone scent.
Lovely fresh, easy to wear scent. Perfect for the office. Like others have observed, it doesn’t last a terribly long time, enabling respraying or switching to a new scent halfway through the day.
To me it just smells like an ok soap. Definitely not remotely close to the original Her. Just a rose peony soap

This is so generic and meh- it smells like an adidas perfume I had as a teenager in the 90's back when adidas didn't really do perfume. A generic boring floral that smells nothing like Burberry Her, which I own and find quite special. Why it's called Her and put in the same bottle as if it's intended as a flanker I have no idea.

Fresh, a little sweet and perfectly pleasant.

The opening blast for me is warm amber, fizzy lemon and light florals. I get the musk and ginger in the dropdown, but it fades really quickly on me. I don't think this flanker has much to do with the original though, they don't compare at all. When I first sprayed this, I imagine I'm sat outside in a linen sundress sipping a light, fruity tea, the breeze carries the scent of laundery detergent from the clothes and whe washing line and cut roses.

Is this groundbreaking by any means? No. I also think the bottle doesn't really match the juice. This perfume reminds me of a light, breezy summer scent. Reminds me of an Eternity Summer flanker, but I can't for the life of me remember which one.

Overall, London Dream is a pleasant, easy scent that's effortless to wear. I like it, but I wouldn't purchase a full bottle.

This one is pleasant. It’s the least like Her, and most like Her Blossom. There isn’t any of that salty beach accord that is in Her. The initial freshness from the ginger and lemon goes away in about 5 minutes leaving a pretty cozy light floral. If rose is in here, I can’t detect it on its own. Maybe ever so slightly peony. But for the most part it’s an unrecognizable light floral with an Amber musk that stays for 3 hours. I actually appreciate that as re-spraying gives that freshness again, or it allows me to put on something else entirely. I really want to try Her Intense.
This goes great in California weather it was 113 degrees out the other day and it made me fell super fresh. This is now my go to on super hot days

I absolutely LOVED this perfume when I smelled it in Sephora. I immediately got this citrusy, gingery, borderline gender neutral laundry fresh musk. It just smelled like a person who smells really, really good. You know? It seemed like the perfect scent for a more androgynous woman like me. Unfortunately, when I took it home and tried it out on myself, I was way less impressed. It definitely smells better on paper than on skin, and pulled way more feminine on me (maybe I’d gone a little nose blind while going thru samples at Sephora? No idea why I originally thought it was a little masculine). While the opening was still beautiful and very likable, it rapidly faded into this really boring, average joe, could-be-any-old-perfume generic floral. I kept trying it hoping it would grow on me, but it didn’t. I ended up returning it. I’m bummed that it didn’t work out, for a second I thought I’d found my signature! I’d recommend this for, like, someone’s nice mom or as an inoffensive first perfume for a teenager.

A fresh opening but immediately lots of floral too. When I sprayed this I thought Gucci Flora! They share the citrus/peony/rose and smell very similar. This one is a bit softer and sweeter, but low projection and sillage.

Enjoying this! It is one of very few peony have frags that I can get on board with. I was kinda hoping it would smell like a ginger lemonade, but it doesn't. It is still very nice, clean, and those notes are detectable! I could see this being someone's signature very easily. It doesn't speak to me in that way, but I can't really imagine a situation where it wouldn't fit and be appropriate to wear. A fairly unique, versatile, easy grab.
Love this scent so much. Suitable for the weather in Thailand.

I agree with DarlingNikki and Kai_11 - this an odd one and I have had conflicting feelings on it. I've decided that on my skin it can have a salty sweet feeling - similar to Olympēa but it can change depending on the climate/weather/humidity.
For me, I can tolerate it better on my clothes rather than my skin, it smells sweeter that way and less masculine. It is an OK scent, I like the fresh vibes from the lemon and peony whilst the spice from the ginger is ok. I wouldn't blind buy and I won't be repurchasing after I try and empty the 50ml bottle I have .

I think DarlingNikki said it, but this one is definitely a head scratcher... not that it’s very complex, but I was initially so excited about what I got after first test. Immediate ginger, rose and a light vanilla- gorgeous and warm, but bright and clean- I was in love from start to finish. I thought I’d test once more before buying a full bottle (which has been a bit difficult to find at a decent price)... aaaand nothing like the first time- generic light floral. Meh. So I tested again today and realized it’s definitely my body temp and the weather/seasons. First test was in cold weather, cool body temp = beautiful crisp, notes clearer, emphasized. Today is hot and humid, and my skin is obviously warmer = a generic floral, pretty but nothing like what I got in cooler weather.
Overall it’s nice, and easy to wear, but only works beautifully for me in colder weather.

If you could bottle the Easter holiday in a fragrance, this would be it. Top notes are a burst of sweet florals under the church pulpit then upon the dry down you get a basket full of mellowed candy & cotton bunnies. I don’t know how else to describe it. It’s just yummy!
Smells like bubble bath to me. 🤷🏻♀️

1) Watery, rosy
2) Nivea cream
3) A bit of fennel

Lovely, light and not very long-lasting. Completely different from the original. In fact, it is closer to Burberry Rhythm for Her Floral than the original Burberry for Her. A great option for those who enjoy clean and easy-to-wear florals. I suspect this will get some dislikes for poor performance but I don't mind it. In fact, I'll take that over those strong ones that stick to my skin and clothes even after washing.

Is it just me or does anyone else smell wintergreen with the initial spray? I'm guessing its the ginger? but I definitely get a blast of breath mint wintergreen! Bizarre initial spray, but the drydown is a sexy floral musky amber. I'll give it a second chance because once the initial weird ginger? scent wears off it's quite lovely.

This one is a head-scratcher for me lol. I first smelled it from one of those Ulta paper samples and was immediately intrigued by the fresh, sexy dry down. Got a sample and hmmm... This is really nice, yet confusing on my skin. It smells like I sprayed on cologne that a guy in his mid-20's would consider an easy reach type of fragrance. I almost washed it off because the amber note in the base smells more like ambroxan (an aromachemical I despise) but I wanted to see how it finished and yeah, this one is a no for me because I end up smelling like a 25-year-old British guy with casually good taste lol.

I love this scent but just a warning to Burberry her lovers thinking about blind buying it DONT DO IT. This is nothing like Burberry her it is more of a fresh laundry detergent smell sitting in a bowl of wood with one single piece of fruit in it. That being said it is my favorite scent lmao

I got a sample of this , and it is a basic pretty perfume. Feminine, floral , mass appealing . Non offensive . A safe buy to smell like a put together lady . Soft peony and rose with a slight citrus . This could be used as an everyday type of perfume .

Oh, this is really lovely, but as others have mentioned, the longevity is very poor. Clocking in at a bit shy of 2 hours is a huge disappointment as the fragrance itself is divine. I received this free sample in a Sephora order and chose it because I love Burberry Her. But Burberry Her is a beast for longevity on me, whereas this is lacking. Also worth mentioning, this is really very different from Burberry Her - Burberry Her on me wears with a synthetic strawberry note which is oddly enjoyable, but Burberry Her London Dream is far more floral with just a slight bite of citrus. It's a very delicate rose fragrance, and to be honest, I wasn't super thrilled about the option for the sample because I normally don't like rose, as it often wears very overpowering on me. However, this is delicately rosy like PDM Delina and Givenchy Irresistible (I don't consider these dupes, just that the delicacy of the rose reminds me of them slightly). A bummer that this is a pass.

Does anyone smell the original Herbal Essence shampoo in this? Especially in the opening. I really liked it, but got a headache 5 minutes or so after I tried it so it’s a no for me. To bad because Herbal Essence smelled so good.

So as strange as this may be, I had bought the original Her, when I tried it at the store I loved it. Got it home and after I wore it a few times it made me smell like cat pee-NO JOKE!!! It was putrid. I did actually swap with a gal pal I met on here :) and then I bought the newest Viva Box from SDM and this was in it and it’s actually beautiful m. What the actual hell??? I don’t get it? Why does this smell so food but the other he so disgusting on me? I just can’t figure it out-any ideas I’m all ears!!

Does anyone else smell watermelon jolly rancher????? Well that's exactly what it smells like on me along with rose but it's like an alcoholic rose. I smell some faint boozy or alcohol very faint but there... I like it 3 ppl have said you smell good so that's always a plus ...its Autumn and I smell it on myself when I'm outside and I really like that.. the silage is moderate for me but I spray 4 good ones and it stays... ill say 8.5... also I layered it out Kkm Kardashian Glam and that really is a fresh girly smell !!

Like the other reviewers said, this has nothing in common with the original Burberry Her. In my opinion it would fit better as a My Burberry flanker, it has a similar lush, dewy texture and some notes remind me of it, mainly the rose and something about the base. I like My Burberry better though, this one is a little harsh.

Her London Dream is a tomboy-ish, sporty version of a light peony and rose floral. Especially in the opening I get a borderline screechy 'blue shower gel'/'fake woods' note, no idea where that's coming from - it doesn't smell like lemons or ginger. Later the scent turns a little warmer and creamier thanks to the amber and musk. It's nice enough and not offensive, but not very special. I think Burberry has many better fragrances. A dreamy, hazy lighter version of Her with additional florals would have been perfect for a flanker called London Dream, this scent should rather be called My Burberry Sport instead.

London Dream has nothing to do with the DNA of the original Her and Her intense, which are nicely done nowadays gourmands (obviously inspired by Baccarat Rouge and Delina;-)). LD is a quite fresh fragrance (though not aquatic) with a dominant sharp synthetic fruit note. Could be a younger cousin of melon scented Escape by Calvin Klein.
This is a winner.. shock because I have not been impressed by Burberry parfums but this is nice and sexy and from Burberry maybe we'll see ..it smells very very nice.london cute name

I received a sample of this. Nothing special about it. It's a floral scent that borders on sweetness, but not quite. I agree it has a tea like quality to it. I find it too sweet for my liking as a summer scent, but it's not overwhelming in hot days.

I found this to be a very pleasant fresh sweet and floral perfume. Perfect for summertime!
Smells like a refreshing fruit-flavoured tea with some added sugar.
The only drawback is longevity and projection.

I love this fragrance. I find it a lovely fresh fruity floral. The lemon and ginger are the top notes for me and as it dries down the the Rose comes through with just a hint of musk. I’m not getting any amber but I’ve only wore it once. I also found the sillage to be better than the original Her. After a couple of hours it was still a lemony Rose but I detected a hint of a green note (wet grass). More than happy with this buy and expect I will wear it often. ❤️🍋 🌹

@viarya: nope! Not even a little bit!!!

I got a sample of this today, and thought it was "Burberry Her", which I love (I also really love "Her Intense".) So, I couldn't figure out what was wrong, because (on me) this is intensely floral, and kind of a weak tea, smell. But mostly overwhelming flowers. Now that it's drying down, some musk is definitely coming out.

I realised that it was actually "Her London Dream", and came to read the notes. I definitely don't smell any amber, ginger, or lemon. And, I don't really smell the rose; I would say the floral that is so strong is the peony.

DEFINITELY don't blind buy this thinking that it'll be like "Her" or "Her Intense"!!! It's really completely floral.

Also: very weak sillage, and faded after a couple of hours. Personally, I really don't like it, and will give the rest of my sample away.
Somehow it smells like a bad knockoff of Chloé Nomade EdP.
I feel sorry for all the releases during coronavirus, we cant even test the perfumes.....
I am not impressed. not terrible but nothing new and not well blended. smells like a bad copy of coco mademoiselle

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Very underrated and forgotten gem! This perfume smells little bit old school and reminds me of some shaving cream/aftershave lotion, but in a good way. Also smells very clean, masculine and energetic. Really love this one. Sometimes men's should smell like that and not like some dessert (although I love them too).

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Legendary MFK fragrance that lasts ALL day. I have a large collection and I have objectively received more compliments and performance that easily 80% of my collection. I am shocked that the rating is this low. This stuff is classy, masculine, and inexpensive. It was my signature scent for years and I used to pay $140 a bottle.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I feel like this another fragrance that's gotten flack do to influencers. This is such a lovely masculine and unique smell that is as well; crowd pleasing. It's one of my favorites of anything that I have.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Such a classy and inviting scent , I love it i wear it to work , could use a performance enhancing, other than that it's fantastic and inviting

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Its very manly and i would say classy on some way... its not my cup of tea anyway. If any interested e-mail me to: jacintomolina2@gmail.com 95 ml bottle

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Well i feel this is the most versatile version of Mr burberry 🎀 , its elegant & Classy , its carry fresh and woody kind of Aroma around you which makes it so good for evening night out or casual coffee day ☕️

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Safe & very masculine aromatic spicy scent. I can use it anywhere anytime but I prefer to use in the summer. Performance is below average lasted around 3-4 hours with soft projection from the start. I wish it lasted longer to improve the experience.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Sad to say but this is the worst fragrance I’ve ever tried. It is too synthetic and it smells like rubber mixed with harsh chemicals. I will give it the benefit of the doubt and say that it might be different on someone else’s skin and with that in mind go and try it beforehand, it is definitely NOT a safe blind buy.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: A little generic for my tastes, it's well balanced but it doesn't excite me, I'm sorry!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Smelled beautiful when I first sprayed it. Green, woody, warm and minty. Then, a few minutes later, I thought it was sharp and bad. Then, thirty minutes later it was even better than the first few minutes, and it stayed that way for the remainder.

I've noticed some green scents have a sharp, bitter smell towards the opening. I guess that's what threw me off. I get the same from Dolce & Gabbana Pour Homme, which I also like.

Performance is on the low side of average for me, which makes it good for the office. Smells modern without falling into the current super-sweet trend.

This doesn't blow my mind, but it's a solid, masculine fragrance that would suit most occassions.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Mr Burberry edp instantly captivated me when i first smelt it in 2022. Its a very masculine fragrance which will definitely get you compliments especially when you wear it in hot weather. The only issue with this one is the average performance. I get 6 hours max.. 2 hours of projection and then a gentle skin scent. I recommend at least 8 sprays.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
So glad I bought this fragrance. Burberry has yet to disappoint. Holidays, winter, christmas cookies and hot cocoa in a bottle

Of course Francis Kurkdjian is the perfumer. No wonder this scent rocks my world.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Timeless, affordable, versatile, and mass appealing but retains a unique twist—a master piece to be enjoyed by anyone and everyone.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Safe blind buy, just a good masculine scent for any occasion. I wouldn't say its weak like other people say but I wouldn't say strong either. It has the performance of a normal edt. Safe Lind buy tho. Just a pleasing generic masculine scent that everyone will like.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: More intense version of the EDT, thought it was gonna last longer since it gave that feeling within the primary sprays, vanished after 3 hours or at least lost the sillage. Safe buy tho.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
This is a stunner. The absolute definition of underrated! This was my signature scent for years and is easily my most complimented fragrance out of my collection of 50 bottles. It lasts all day, projects, and has an awesome sillage. I honestly can’t believe the price and the rating AND it was created by one of the best perfumers in the world.

I’m in the medical field and have had staff and patients ask for the name so they could buy it for their men.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Such an underrated fragrance and at under tweny bucks for a 30ml bottle you cannot go wrong. It's an aromatic warm spicy scent and on me it lasts about 6-7hrs.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Was going to say doesn't bear resemblance to any of my fragrances but then... Bogart Silver Scent strikes back, out of the blue! Only for a short moment luckily.

Overall my first impression is it's low key, mint-lavender-patchouli mostly dominant to my nose. I was after a nonchalant, somewhat generic but pleasant office friendly scent that was more geared to mature taste. I believe this is it.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
not synthetic, quite the opposite actually. very all-round great everday but mostly office fragrance. the citrus notes really pop off as soon as you put it on, but it will weaken over time. when it comletely dries down, on my skin it smells identical to a steam sauna, although i wish the projection of the drydown and general fragrance were much longer (3-4hrs for me), the sillage isnt great at all either, but you cant have everything

honestly a very still 8.5/10 for me.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Don't listen to others, this is a wonderful fragrance made by famous and super talented Mr. Francis Kurkdjian from MFK. Trust me, he wouldn't produce something "terrible", "medicinal", "weak". Like oh my god where do you people come from? If you are a nose blind or just a slump don't expect miracles after just buying the bottle, it requires something back from the wearer as well.
You pay designer and want something niche in return. And no this fragrance cant make you young and beautiful, it is just a fragrance and for the price this is AMAZING FRAGRANCE. Yes, just like I said Mr. Burberry is for the young Mr.businesses man dressed in Burberry trench coat and don't expect wearing puma sport pants and think you can pull this off. This fragrance like many other before it requires style, mojo character, a special event etc then you'd understand it.
Did you see Bleu de Channel fragrance commercials? Yes a guy like that would wear this fragrance and you would bend your neck while passing by him on a street, capish? For the rest of us, buy it, wear it, and imagine you are that guy from BDC commercial you might get different results from the rest of people 😀

Fragrance 8/10
Longevity 6/10
Price 9/10

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I had the OG years ago, and get the masterpiece Indigo, and then I found a good offer on Rexall and get this one ...


Oh my god this one is terrible ! Is not fresh enough to use as signature, but all the spices fades away in 5 seconds and you became with a very, VERY WEAK sillage! I was really expecting way more from a Eau de Parfum, is kinda a joke this fragrance!

If you want to have some office safe, I mean really SAFE maybe it works for you, but you can definitely get a way better fragrance for the price tag !

Go for the original or the indigo and you will have a way better quality !

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Perfect of office. I don't get why many people hate this fragrance, but in reality it's a beautiful masculine scent. Spicy green notes with patchouli makes it far better and unique than Dior Sauvage. The only down side is that the juice is too weak for an EDP and this thing doesn't last that long

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Very masculine scent and perfect for office

Compliments getter and good performance but not that’s strong

8/10

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I’m not sure what it is , but Mr Burberry EDP to me def has IT.. it’s almost like this cologne was made especially for me and my skin chemistry, I get massive performance, and have gotten prob more compliments from total strangers wearing this more than anything else I’ve had in my collection..at one point around 6 months ago I had 150+ bottles on my shelfs and told myself I was going to keep 20-30 and put the rest on eBay and this was one of the 1st bottles I reached for to keep.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Can someone please.. please recommend me something on the same ballpark of this mr.Burberry edp?

Its amazing sexy dense masculine warm comforting.. everything..
Not your everyday daily driver, but something you can reach to when you want to be the showstopper in any event .

But all this just for one hour.. after that its gone. Its so weak and so watered down, that its such a shame to happen to such a masterful scent.

The similar perfumes listed aren't worth as well..
Please someone please recommend me something which is not an exact clone. But something in the similar genre with good performance.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This is amazing scent! a great oriental floral mix that combines so classy. The performance is not as bad as people say. its average projection and longevity. I bought a bottle and use this quite a lot. Receive plenty compliments. Great work Francis Kurkdjian

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Masterpiece. Great perfume. It smells fresh dry spicy herbal woody. Very clean soapy scent like just out of shower. Very good for both office and a casual weekend. Versatile. Moderate long lasting 5-6 hours. Give it 10/10.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Mr. Burberry EdP is a fine offering. Justin Copeland called this "a designer version of Masculin Pluriel". I can see where he's coming from with that, though the extra class and quality that MP has is exactly what makes it good. So the emphasis on the "designer" part shouldn't be neglected. This edp is far more interesting than the edt, which I found a run of the mill cologne smell.

I'd like to draw attention to user scottgiles86's review below and his words: "This is a "dad version" (that's a good thing) of a blue fragrance with more focus on woods and aromatics versus ambroxan. Smells much more refined and not as sharp, screechy, or metallic as Sauvage or Dylan Blue, neither of which I enjoy. ... I generally don't like "blue" fragrances, but this one is alright."

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Flowery, Lily of the valley. Nearly unisex. A bit intrusive. Maybe headache inducing to some. Not my style.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Off the top I smell Mint, a plesent root beer accord some patchuli and a “dark herbal” accord in the vein of anise, wormwood, or absinthe but not entirely any of those, just that character. Smells slightly daring compared to many designer offerings in a department store. Masculine cool weather leaning, mysterious. To me it smells very “English”. To my nose this is very much in The ballpark of YSL La nuit De lhomme LE PARFUM,
Which is a great scent however cost wise it’s not much more than mr.Burberry parfum. Mr.Burberry is lacking that French style of perfect proportions and is missing some of that “date night” scent appeal. A 3.3 oz bottle of Mr.Burberry can be bought for $59.84 while a 2 oz La nuit de lhomme le parfum can be bought for $66.14- both from fragrance net. If it wasn’t for this I would hold Mr Burberry in a higher light but regardless the rating for this is far too low and I think this is more of a 4.00 rating and up. Best Burberry I’ve smelt.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Very soapy and clean, which is typical of Burberry. Very versatile as well for any occasion!! I love it!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
This is a sexy mysterious scent but sadly ruined by awful performance.

Tiny splash of citrus up top, but the main notes are the spicy cardamom, mint, and although its not listed I get violet in the mid-dry down. Ultra classy and despite all the heavy notes it doesn't feel sharp or aggressive.

The performance on this however is horrible. The scent bubble is small from the start. Maybe if you go heavy with the sprays you could get some attention for an hour or so, but it's a skin scent after that.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I was so taken aback by this, enough to completely re-evaluate my initial boredom with the brand. Sure, I love My Burberry Black but that one is super bold. However, when I purchased a 30mL of this in a panicked hurry for a date I forgot to wear a scent for... my world turned around. It's eyes rolling back in your skull good, coming from a guy who generally prefers more feminine and unisex fragrances. A pleasant spicy citrus with a fun little minty twist. I don't have many grapefruit or mint scents and this really fills the void. Very masculine, lasts a long time, projects well, cute bottle... who can complain?

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Smells lovely and high quality but the performance, for the price point and being an EDP, is just not acceptable and is a massive let down. It performs a lot better on clothes.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
EARTHY-GREEN FRESH SLIGHTLY SPICY WOODY CREAMY

it's not sweet like most of the offerings these day (which probably why it doesn't get much love and also because of the sharp opening),
opens with sharp Mint+Grapefruit+Cardamom+Tarragon+Lavender+Patchouli mostly, but smooths out and develops as it dries.
in the mid it gets earthy & green fresh woody & warm,
the full dry is the best part, creamy sandalwood kicks in with the earthy-green clean slightly-spicy freshness (like an earthier Azzaro Visit, which is underated as well)
I'd say it's a versatile, classy/sophisticated, masculine, 'Modern Fougère' fragrance but has a faint woody powderiness that adds a softness to the composition. there are better projecting & more 'mass appealing' offerings at the price point but not many which are as unique, distinct & deep.

Projection/Sillage': LIGHT, arms length scent bubble for the 1st 30mins to an hour but mainly an intimate/in-close scent.

Performance/Longevity: GOOD, about 7-12 hours (on fabric), it's an intimate fragrance mainly but stays a good while.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
A nice, albeit forgettable fragrance, opens with a very zingy citrus leads to an amber and nutmeg drydown. There's something that has an almost sour note in there.... certainly at the beginning, whether it's the grapefruit mixing with something I don't know, but it's different. For an EDP it's not particularly long lasting.

Do I regret buying it? No.... would I buy it again? No

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Let's keep it simple.

I like the smell, Ill agree with the notes above, I tend to think it's a little zesty and peppery (spicy) at first but it really just dies in the arse, the ceder stays for a couple of hours but no more. I wore this at a concert, and it was warm and strong at first but really just dies. My parter loves the smell, but also agrees that you cant smell it a few hours later.

I'd love to love this, but I payed like $80AUD for a tiny bottle, and I need about 6 squirts to get anything decent.

I work a 12.5 hour shift, so I want it to last as long as possible. For me, Mr. BURBERRY just doesn't do it for me. Longevity just isn't there for me... maybe for others it seems but for me... I can't justify ever buying this again.

I feel a woman could wear this without an issue, but it isn't femme. I think it's a smart smell, and perhaps a stronger female or a female in power such as boss, manager could really pull this off.

Day or night use in my opinion.
More suited to spring and autumn.
Not strong enough for winter and not vibey enough for summer.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: The absolute best fragrance on the market from Burberry period. Burberry Touch had always been my favorite until I put my nose on this one. Performance is phenomenal and it's dirt cheap on discounters.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This is not to my taste. Smells very synthetic. Get a household cleaning product/shower gel vibe off it. Bland really and doesn't smell like quality. Decent longevity though, and may suit a younger guy looking for a fresh, clean and spicy blue fragrance

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Unique... gives me dark vibes. A good signature for sure.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Opening has a lot going on, after about 5 min I get mostly cardamom mint and grapefruit, very nice. Mint isn’t toothpastey, reminds me a bit of menthe fraiche, but with a warming cardamom. Don’t get nearly as much patchouli.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
not for me, way too sweet

4/10

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Mauboussin Private Club is a sweeter stronger alternative.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
