Undeniably a great fragrance that receives a lot of compliments but lacks greatly in performance. For this reason its an often underated fragrance. A lot of people tend to go for it due its value for money but are then disappointed by its performance, not something I would blind buy unless you test to see how it works on your skin.

It opens up with with fresh and spicy notes before developing with a slight warmth kind of vibe. Its not something i would wear during the day. More so suited for evening/night or winter occasions. The strength of it is mediocre, once the scent has opened up and evolved, it becomes very bleak and lifeless. Becomes very much like a deodorant in all honesty. The overall performance is poor, skin scent for myself after 1 hour. Almost nothing after 3 hours!

Scent - 8
Sillage - 5 (1-2 ft 1st hour)
Longevity - 4
Value - 9

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Mr. Burberry EDP is criminally underrated. I tested the EDT version from a friend of mine and liked it, but it was missing some elements I would consider in a fragrance. I did more research on the EDP and figured why not.

The price is amazing for the value you will be getting from this. Honestly, it has a premium smell and aura. I wore this to work for a week so far and got so many compliments from my female colleagues. They wanted to buy some for their partners and kept sniffing with their eyes closed, in content of the scent.

This stuff is great, I really believe that if it was released by Francis Kurkdjian in the MFK line, people would rave about this. No, this is not groundbreaking, but it won't break the bank either! It's appealing and a safe buy. If you're looking for something bold then look elsewhere, this will not meet that expectation.

Performance wise, I am not sure why it is so poor for others, but on clothes and skin, this has lasted me every work day (8 hours). This is by far the best bargain buy I have had in a while. Bought the 100 ml tester version for ~$45.00. Only strange thing is the batch code says '0056', which dates to the year of 2000, but this was released in 2017.. Anyways, I do recommend this, especially on a budget. Ultra versatile and price friendly. Personally worn as an office scent and for casual days.

Personal Rating:
Sillage: 7/10
Longevity: 8/10
Scent: 9/10
Versatility: 10/10

Overall Rating of: 8.5/10

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This is a "dad version" (that's a good thing) of a blue fragrance with more focus on woods and aromatics versus ambroxan. Smells much more refined and not as sharp, screechy, or metallic as Sauvage or Dylan Blue, neither of which I enjoy. Projection and longevity aren't great, but they don't need to be if you just wear it to the office or on a date. Sometimes you want to smell nice without the fear of choking anyone out, and this one fits the bill. I generally don't like "blue" fragrances, but this one is alright.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: The nose behind this scent is Mr. Francis Kurkdijan. I think he is simply artistic and very creative with his fragrances. Just because he’s the nose behind this scent I will blind buy it. I’ll review it at a later date. But just because he’s behind the scent is good enough for me.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Great fragrance but the for me performance is very poor. After 1st spray the sillage and projection are low, after about 30 minutes they drop to zero. All trace of it has gone completely after about 2 hours, not what I’d expect for an EDP.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Wow. This stuff is heavenly. First off, I’m a huge fan of these kind of fragrances: a simple, clean/fresh opening and a warm, woody base, wrapped together by soft, green, floral spices. This one is nearly perfection IMO. I also love Mr. Burberry EDT. Some people call that one boring, which I can kind of understand, but still, I think it’s a fantastic fragrance that is super fresh, classy, and versatile.

The EDP version is significantly better in my opinion, as the EDT did suffer just a bit from an underlying bitterness, and I felt it needed something more warm or floral to balance things out and tie it all together. This EDP does that and then some, significantly improving it in the process and making it even more inviting and smooth.

The opening is fresh and citrusy, but not quite as bitter and green. It adds more spice to it, which makes it feel deeper and more complex immediately. The addition of cinnamon is exquisite and kind of genius IMO, it adds warmth and complexity. The scent overall still feels fresh, a bit cool/slightly aquatic almost, but the added cinnamon and patchouli blend together beautifully and bring out the zest of the grapefruit and the warmth of the cedar and sandalwood. The lavender is beautiful and rounds out the green notes and cardamom.

In my opinion, this is a masterpiece designer fragrance. The quality of the ingredients is surprisingly good and blended together so beautifully, Francis Kurkdjian really knocked it out of the park here. I think for daily wear, this is better than Sauvage, BdC, Aventus, all of those. Not every fragrance needs to shout your arrival from the rooftops. I prefer something deceptively simple and blended to perfection, and Mr. Burberry EDP absolutely nails it. Plus, everyone else will be too busy wearing those other, more popular scents, and you’ll be the one who stands out when it matters most :)

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
This is like MFK Masculin Pluriel - designer edition.

Im a huge fan of Masculin Pluriel and been wearing it since 2015. I first sampled this last year and was surprised how similar it felt to Masculin Pluriel. It seems like Kurkdjian made MP in a designer bottle for Burberry with some small changes. Just a more modern. Its as if they merged Masculin Pluriel with something like Chanels BDC edp.

Its a fantastic scent and for me it screams summer holidays at night.

9.3/10.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Class and sophistication in a little black bottle. Blind bought the EDP. Even though a lot of reviews weren’t glowing for this fragrance, I had a feeling that I was going to like it. Am so glad that I did purchase it, and boy was I right. Need I say more. Those around you will completely agree. Again, class and sophistication in a little black bottle. Trust me on this one.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: It's the drydown that wins me....

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I adore this juice. No surprise knowing the perfumer... Right when I smelled it I knew I had to have it. I impulse bought this, but it was worth it to me. Recently wore Mr. Burberry below the belt, wearing another frag up top. I was in the club restroom and I smelled someone I was like man some dood got a killer frag I wonder what it is... then I realized it was my crotch 😅

This juice suits all occasions, all weather. It’s classy, neat - a proper gentleman. It’s fresh but spicy, green and blue at the same time. Great fresh out the shower scent. Reminds me of Polo Blue, but a bit darker. It can be dressed up or dressed down ,but the bow tie on the bottle should tell you what this juice was intended for...

Update: the tube to the atomizer will not fit a Trevalo.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Classy & reserved. This is a Gentleman’s scent for the modern day man. I say that knowing that this isn’t a groundbreaking creation nor does it have to be to have it considered as a good fragrance. On me, I love the woods with its warm and semi sweet drydown. You get a light kick in the beginning with the Cardamom & Grapefruit that is accompanied by the mint note. It has a soothing lavender with a slight spiceness from the nutmeg & tarragon that is warm yet clean smelling, almost as if one is standing in today’s contemporary barbershops taking in all the ambery and fresh cleanliness of the environment. In the end it’s a nice patchouli, vetiver with a subtle cinnamon and sandalwood finish that is nice and simple that honestly won’t offend a soul. It smells like a man who’s got his shit together. It’s professional, manly and yet has a warmer side to it. It has garnered a few compliments every time I wear it. The weakness of Mr. Burberry eau de parfum is its projection or, lack there of and the soft sillage. It resembles D&G The One edp in performance, not in scent profile as The One has the Tobacco, Ginger and Orange blossom to give it a sexier and richer body. After a couple of hours someone really has to be close to you to catch a whiff or two. I use 5-6 sprays, one behind each ear, three on the chest from shoulder to shoulder and a quick spray on the under shirt and I’m good to go for a full day at the office. It transitions easily to the evening for a night out for drinks with friends and colleagues. This is good for almost all year round wear and can be ones signature scent except for maybe the real hot & humid days of summer. There are better scent elixirs out there indeed that offer better performance to boot but, this is not a bad scent at all and for the low price (I paid $45 US for a 5oz. bottle at a discounter) just spray a little extra on. Solid juice, period.....

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I have read a lot of reviews and I'm pretty shocked to find that most of you do not have any experience with fragrances. Mr. Burberry is an absolutely women killer perfume with a unique smell, it's modern, luxurious, sexy, and a strong compliment magnet. I have a huge collection of perfumes from big houses like Creed, Mancera, and other cheaper perfume from Dior, Chanel and so on, but this cheap fragrance from Burberry it's a f***ing steal and a beast that kills many many types of fragrances from big houses. It is not a perfume for any person, it just for a real gentleman who has tasted it, for somebody with that likes quality and for somebody who wants to impress. It's for somebody who wants something unique. It's a very mysterious fragrance that will bring questions from all sides. Maybe because the nose behind this perfume it's Francis Kurkdjian, and after knowing that, you should know that everything that I mentioned above, makes sense! I never thought that I can find a such gem fragrance for such a price. It was initially a blind buy and i never regret it. Rather than Bleu de Chanel, Dior Sauvage, i would use Mr. Burberry without even thinking twice! This cheap fragrance deserves a place near Mancera and Creed without any doubt! Try it and you will see!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Amber woody (patchouli-vetiver) with fizzy zesty fruity (grape beverage vibe) undertone.

Another review mentioned Bvlgari Man, but I feel more similarity to Bvlgari Man Wood Essence, but this Burberry is less medicinal.
I might also mention D&G The One Gentleman (similarly spicy lavender with fennel in place of tarragon).

Dupont Signature Men is like a more smoky balsamic + coumarin version.

Ferre In the Mood for Love Man shares some similarities but with more prominent coumarin and orange blossom, it performs better than the Burberry.

Where the Burberry excels in compared to the ones I mentioned above is its versatility and easy to wear quality. A safe, pleasant scent for the 'nice guys'.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Mr. Burberry Men EDP opens with a low projection of spicy and woody accords. The cardamon and tarragon are the most noticeable opening spices, both create a green herb, anise-like accord, the tarragon is more prominent with its anisic touch; the mint is a brief tone, it comes up just for a moment and then it dissipates; the grapefruit is also very soft and it is almost unnoticeable. The opening is all about the spices and everything else is far behind. As the fragrance commences to dry-down, the woody, benzoin, and nutmeg accords join the blend, once again their projection is very low, the combination of woody accords and benzoin creates a soft resinous touch that adds depth to the fragrance. The lavender is a faint distant floral note. The patchouli and vetiver add a soft green touch; the cinnamon joins the cardamon and tarragon enhancing the spicy accords. The most noticeable changes from the opening to the dry-down are the dissipation of the mint, and grapefruit notes, and the development of the very soft green and vetiver accords. The spices come up at the opening and continue into the dry-down. Once Mr. Burberry Men EDP has reached its full dry-down, it can be summarized as a very low projection, spicy (mostly tarragon), and resinous woody fragrance. The fragrance feels classy, earthy, faint, formal, light, masculine, mature, modern, nocturnal, resinous, inexpensive, warm, weak, woody, and pleasant.

BATCH REVIEWED: 2020.
WOW RATING: 4/10. The spicy accords are fantastic; the fragrance’s potency is very poor.
DISLIKE RATING: 1/10. The fragrance is spicy; some people could find the spices unpleasant.
UNIQUENESS: 3/10. Spicy fragrances are very common.
MASS APPEAL: 4/10. A basic spicy fragrance with low mass-appeal.
PROJECTION: 1/10. Low, about 1 foot around the wearer.
SILLAGE: 1/10. Low, almost none.
APPLICATION: 6 or more atomizations to compensate for poor performance.
LONGEVITY: 3/10. About 3 hours with less than 1 hour of low projection.
SEASONS: Fall and winter, or colder nights.
OCCASIONS: Formal and casual. This is an office-friendly fragrance.
VERSATILITY: 4/10. Limited to the colder months and, casual or formal wear.
GENDER: Masculine. The spicy and wood tones lean it to the masculine side.
AGES: 30 and above.
RECOMMENDATION: Mr. Burberry EDP is a great scent, but its performance is below EDT, very disappointing. Not recommended.
SIMILAR: These are examples of similar fragrances. Bvlgari Man (no the Black version) EDT includes softwood and fruity notes; Cuba Gold Men EDT is an affordable woody, floral and spicy fragrance; Guerlain L'Homme Ideal EDP By Guerlain includes softwoods, almond, and other notes; Hugo Boss - Boss The Scent Absolute EDP features woody, ginger, and rum notes; Terre D'hermes EDT Spray, is orange and grapefruit based but it contains soft/sweet wood tones as well; Prada Luna Rossa Black Men EDP is a mostly peppery and woody fragrance; Tom Ford Oud Wood is a very pleasant, soft woody fragrance, however, very pricy; Acqua di Parma Men Colonia Quercia is a great woody, and spicy fragrance; Pasha de Cartier Edition Noire is an elegant and versatile, slightly sweet, ambery, aquatic, and woody fragrance; Mr. Burberry EDP is a spicy and woody fragrance, pleasant but very weak.
SUMMARY: A very low projection, spicy (mostly tarragon), and resinous woody fragrance. The fragrance feels classy, earthy, faint, formal, light, masculine, mature, modern, nocturnal, resinous, inexpensive, warm, weak, woody, and pleasant.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Gone in 60 seconds...ain't just a movie. It, like this might be an ok movie, but sadly, the real flick lasts longer than the duration of this. Dislike. You'd need a vat to dump on you and everyone around you to notice and they still might not. :O

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: My bottle is made in Germany and it's weird. Anyone here got the same problem?

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: A decent all around fragrance for men. I understand why some people deride it as being generic. It's not offensive, nor is it likely to inspire devoted fandom. It's all around decent, with some floral tones, some spice,some fruitiness, some freshness. I've gotten plenty of compliments on it from people who aren't fragrance "connoisseurs" like many of us on this site. Longevity and sillage are average, but it's a nice scent overall. Its longer lasting and better smelling than the EDT in my opinion. A very classic scent that doesnt do anything too crazy but also doesnt offend.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I am not satisfied that I bought it. In the first scene, I fell in love with it, it seems it is really nice, but after an hour I understood it smells like any other deodorants or cheap classic perfumes. I believe it is not valued, and I never suggest

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Bear in mind this was a quick test today. This is an extremely pleasant fragrance, I found it much fresher than the note pyramid would suggest. There's even a slight soapy element at a certain point in the dry-down.

Alas on my skin this didn't last more than a few hours which is a shame but I have a brand new bottle of the recent CK Eternity EDP which would serve a similar purpose for me, ie a versatile easy to wear scent for almost any occasion. Maybe Mr Burberry EDP performs better for others though.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: If you looking for a common designer nice smelling fragrance it's not that one! That one is really well balanced unique fragrance! It combines herbs citrousies with cardamon and cinnamon! Francis kurkdjian made really good job! From the first sprays until dry down it has so many changes! Perfect complexity! I love it! Great for a gentlemans night out in suit! Sophisticated compliment getter!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
A green, citrusy fragrance.

Herbal & fresh. It smells as if you are outisde a green, wet park on a cool day.

Mr. Burberry EDP is a green herbal patchouli scent, with spicy cardamom, & minty grapefruit zest. The green herbal patchouli almost smells the freshly cut grass.

Very likeable & inoffensive scent. Not a stand out scent but a crowd pleaser for sure.

"Like"

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
If Bleu De Chanel had a flanker that was dark green, it would smell like this.

It's got freshness, with some spiciness, greenery, and a woodsy base. Very masculine and people pleasing. Projects great for 3-4 hours then becomes a nice skin scent. Overall really nice fragrance with a nice presentation and can be found really cheap. If you like fragrances like Bleu De Chanel but want one a little different and cheaper definitely check this out.

Although I will say it's more synthetic (but not overly) and gets cloying in heat. Best for cool evenings when there's a breeze

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Got a tester size bottle for fun from Tj Maxx.... regrettable, smells like that generic old cologne smell that you pulled out of your grandpas closet when you cleaned it out, or that smell like when you smell a cologne from an antique mall from a bottle that was from 1968... That smell like it had been sitting there in the closet for 35 years and only about 1/3 was ever worn, thats the smell I get from this... I've worn it about 5 times and come to the same conclusion every time unfortunately. Granted, I LOVE Burberry scents (London, Touch, Brit, Original), but this is not for me... Can see it being a great signature scent if you were born before i'd say 1975, it does have pretty decent longevity around 5-6 hours for me, with about an arms length projection for about 2 hours of that.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: It's quite heavy on patchouli and cinnamon + slightly sweet also, too much in vein of Boss Bottled in my taste. Original is much brighter and maybe better in my taste but it lacks performance. EDP certainly is much better in longetivity. Somehow I get some smoke or incence, might be patchouli.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Tried it multiple times at the mall.. initial impression its very fleating. Not a good performer.. but than again after few hours i kept getting this slightly sweet woody scent from the back of my hand.. i smell this fragrance directly but it seem to have dissappeared but i do get the smell intermittently.. its probably a good office scent since its not very potent but always present.. opening is nothing to get excited about but the drydown is kinda unique and pleasing.. i dont know what to think of it for now.. but definately will try again and make my final decision wheather its worth my money to buy.. simply put its a dark but fresh n very slightly sweet scent.. and no it does not remind me of other blue scent like sauvage or dylan blue or bleu de chanel..

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I began with an open, even hopeful mind when I first tried MR B Parfum. I wanted to like it, so please understand this is as objective as I can be in a review- I have no axe to grind here. You know that guy who is pleasant to be around, but you just can't remember anything about him that stands out? He's probably nice, calm, and strives to please, but that's exactly his problem. He withholds his opinion if he thinks it will ruffle anyone's feathers, tries to be cool at times, but the attempt usually fizzles and results in mild awkwardness. This is Mr Burberry EDP: the feckless nice guy in your social circle. It has modest sillage. A melange of light spicy/musty smells that just fails to evoke much emotion at all. Now, if your situation calls for a mildly masculine, trepid, slightly beta fragrance that will never insert itself, here it is. It will linger on the fringe of excitement, far from the center of fascination.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: @Doriandinu You shouldn't do that with any fragrance ;)

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: First thing! DON'T SPRAY AND SNIFF IT RIGHT AWAY! My first reaction was not good ,it felt harsh and somehow like a juice for old people,but that's just the opening! After 1 hour you feel it's smoothenes,Mr.Kurkdjian made a great job, very different from the ambroxan mania of today releases,it's fresh balsamic warm but very manly. I see it more for night time when you dress up and go out for some drinks in spring or autumn. AND who ever says this does not last should check they're noses, I felt whisps from my chest all day, and my pillow on my bed which I have sprayed the night before still goes strong after 24 H ,I think you just get use to it but others still smell it on you. In todays ambroxan world you really smell different with this very good Eau de Parfum!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Ok. I get it now. I fully understand the 3.54 rating on this fragrance.

First, do I like it? Yes it's a good fragrance. For an EDP it's a little above average. I'm getting 8hrs...with 8 sprays. Yikes! Not good for an EDP.

Second, it's very pleasant and non offensive. The scent is somewhat linear to me. About 10mins after you spray that's the scent you get till it fades.

I smell cardamom, tarragon, patchouli and light sandlewood. It's nice but quite middle of the road.
Is it worth buying. Yes, for a super discounted price. I would not pony up full bucks at Macy's for it. I got it cheap at TJ Maxx.

If your looking for a quality frag, non offensive and great office scent then this clicks all of the boxes.

If your looking for the next best thing...then this isn't it. 7 out of 10. Good, but average.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
This is such a beautiful perfume! My husband has a 100 ml bottle and he's almost out. Considering his bottles last for years sometimes, I think it says a lot. I just sprayed it on myself to see how my skin reacts to it.

It is a well-balanced perfume, appropriate for office work and for going out. I think that both younger men and men past 40 will like it, because it is non-offensive and it makes you feel fresh and put together.
I think I have a thing for patchouli, because I noticed I like a lot of perfumes containing patchouli (So elixir, White patchouli etc.)

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I purchased this fragrance for my husband simply because I have all af the My Burberry collection and fell in love with the lot of them. This fragrance is nice and wearable, but feels like it shouldn't be linked with the MB collection. Aside from the black botte being, quite deceptive just as mine is. It is a nice wearable fragrance that surely wont offend, great for the office. It doesn't project as well as it should, and can very well be a unisex scent. It is more minty and fresh as opposed to the manlier, deep, spiciness we adore from most men's fragrances. Nothing dark of alluring in this bottle. Just a safe, inexpensive purchase. I probably won't be blind buying the Indigo version, but I'm not disappointed either.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
لا اعلم سبب تجاهل الناس لهذا العطر
هل لم يعد لدار بربري اي قيمة في هذا الزمن ..!!
..
عموما
بوجهة نظري الشخصية هذا العطر رائع
و يستحق الاقتناء .. انا سعيدٌ به جداً
..
العطر ربما يوحي لك بضعف الاداء
الا اني أراه بغاية الرضا في الثبات
كذلك السياج العطري ملفت و هادئ
و مريح و غير متوقع .. لا يكاد يختفي حتى يظهر
مرة اخرى مع كل حركة ..!!
..
و لسبب ما ذكرني بتحفة سان لوران
اوبيوم .. لكن بشكل انعم و اكثر عصرية
..
عطر رائع و حالم
مكونات تستحق النظر والتوقف
..
تقلبات العطر رائعة و واضحة
ارى ان العطر حميمي جدا في مرحلته الاخيرة
..
فرانسس كاردجان
انت عطارٌ رائع .. شكراً جزيلا

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Overall a pleasant scent. Doesn't smell like anything new. Good to have in your collection but not necessary.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I don't normally like spices like cardamom and cinnamon, but I must say this is pretty well-blended! None of the ingredients are too piercing to my nose; this scent smells warm, aromatic, and slightly vanillic on my skin. I imagine this would smell great on a confident, smartly dressed young man.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I'm currently wearing this scent and i Love it for sure. Fresh, elegant, masculine yet it could pass for Unisex scent as well.

Performance is good, i still smell myself after several hours and after taking a shower , however it dries down to a very generic scent, nothing headturning.

Love it but won't re-purchase once i'm done with it. For now, i'm enjoying this beauty..

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Very dissapointed. As mentioned this is like a £1 shop fragrance. Initially it is strong and then after 30 mins whooosh gone. It is a bit like a Mr Adolescents first sexual experience, cant wait to try it and rampant, then over and done with. You think what was the hype? Is this all its hyped to be? A very poor quality fragrance, given its an EDP it dissapoints even more. Miss Lady of the night just made the easiest money she is going to.(well Miss Lady of the night in this case is Mr Burberry, So disspaointed with this fragrance. I was not impressed with Mr Burberry (orgininal) EDT, they all smell so cheap like a European nightclub. This should not have a ribbon tied to it but should have a tag like one finds on the deceased.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: smells like a blend of those ysl pour homme , versace eros and few other avarage frags. and it smelss cheap avon or moschino something. poor quality versions of notes might be given to the kurkdjian

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I was initially unimpressed with this but then it became a strong like! For me it has all the qualities to be a versatile/all-seasons/signature type scent veering towards formal and maybe smart casual, in a similar way to Bleu de Chanel, although I'm not suggesting they smell alike as they don't to my nose.

A fresh, woody, spicy, masculine aromatic fragrance nothing incredibly new but it's very decent.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I get mostly patchouli, cardamom, cedar and grapefruit. Theres also a slight hint of mint in the background.

This is a very fresh, dark scent. It's not necessarily dark, but its a heavier fragrance, more well suited for the colder weather.

You can tell it's a designer fragrance, but it exudes class and confidence.

This is not entirely suited for high schoolers, but it also isn't suited for 40+ businessmen. It's mainly for a younger/middle aged, clean-cut, smooth individual. Definitely for the modern man.

Class, confidence, sophistication - Modern, fresh, dark, sexy.

I've worn this out once and it was a great experience. Performance was above average.

Love this stuff!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
mint, patchouli, woody notes and nutmeg...cold weather night time sophisticated gentlemanly fragrance....yes its simple but for a cologne worth 50 usd or less its fantastic bargain.great longevity but projection was better in edt, i like it a lot....need to try the indigo now :)
8/10
not similar to sauvage or bleu de chanel in any way, better

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Nice and spicy but not manly enough in my opinion

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
This cologne has its own clientele of noses It is generally a good smelling cologne but you have to time in your application. At first sniff you will feel it has some spiciness and manliness in it, also it tells you that it has a potential and a character of its own. Sadly the scent does not hold it After the 1hr time frame to me it becomes just a scent you have smelled before nothing unique it doesn't draw me into it.

how did I get a compliment? I just got lucky that I put this on before approaching a superior of mine who is a very classy woman and perhaps she prefers that spicy manly not over powering scent that looks to smeel unqiue and that's it the "you smell good" sentence was given I always wear colognes whenever I will interact with her and this is the only one she complimented me with

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I’m surprised by the average reviews here, I get a lot of compliments on this one. The opening spray is similar to the EDT but the drydown is deeper and darker; the cinnamon and patchouli come together very nicely. The original EDT is pretty linear, it reminds me of lemon infused water over volcanic rocks, which is fine if it’s hot out. But this is more like cinnamon herbal tea over volcanic rocks. Adds another layer.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Got a sample vial of this. Sooo mild..not gross but smells like something I smelled before, but I dunno what. Is the regular one as mild? For an edp this is some faint stuff...a bottle would probably alert a room, lol.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: weak on me and forgetful.oh well. generic in alot of ways as well.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: My 5 years old daughter love this perfume so much. She keeps come close to me, hugging me, sniffing my neck & telling me that I smell so good. LOL

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This is a great little scent: it opens strong with well-balanced spicy wood freshness that has a lovely dry down. Solid performance with moderate longevity (at least 7-8 hours) without too much sillage - I get compliments throughout dry down and aging. Great for work and casual occasions.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Someone tell me why this smells like one of those “if you like (insert bougie fragrance), then you’ll like this” fragrances LOL. Disappointed at myself for buying this

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Not bad as masculine fragrances go, although with 4 sprays you hardly get anything. 7 to 8 sprays on skin and clothes is what I would recommend if your tastes are for fragrances that exude a very clean, soapy, casual fragrance. This is great for work, studying in a library or running errands. This is a different fragrance, but not stand out stature. Best suited for rainy or slushy spring and summer days.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Underrated fragrance.

Clean sophisticated citrus patchouli with minty touch. Dark fresh scent and very masculine.

Complements getter, cheap. In the same genre of bleu de chanel.

It exceeds versace dylan blue and dior sauvage in terms of quality. Smells much more natural without the annoying ambroxan note of these two.

The only drawback is the poor longevity. Performance is ok in the first half hour only.

Great deal for the price.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Mr Burberry EDP smells very modern, masculine yet elegant, but also uncharacteristic and forgettable. I don't mind spraying it here and there, but it's not worth a purchase at all.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: After testing this, I can see the case for the dislikes. The main/prominent note here is Patchouli. I personally don't like patchouli but I own Tom Ford's Black Orchid EdP which I love and patch is a main player. The patchouli in Mr. Burberry is of low quality and makes this fragrance smell like sweat :( The bottle is nice though. Burberry was trying a shower gel like fragrance like BdC. This is a total fail!!

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: All the negative reviews are just not justified. You can get a 1.7 oz bottle of this now for $30, which makes it an absolute steal. This is some seriously high quality juice that does not smell like Bleu de Chanel edt or edp, as a lot of you are saying. This is not so incensey, not so ambery. This fragrance is verging on gourmand territory because the patchouli mixed with the cardamom produces a savory sweetness, but thankfully the grapefruit holds it back from being too edible smelling. It really is well blended and took me by surprise after i read all these negative reviews. Plus the bottle is beautiful, and the name is awesome if you're known for wearing Burberry clothing. The only criticism i could have for this fragrance is its poor performance, but i don't really care because that makes it even more versatile, and i can over-apply since it's so cheap. This will be making best cheapies lists soon enough, i have no doubt

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This smells amazing. Sadly, longevity is abysmal and sillage is very faint. Just wish it had a stronger punch.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I have a small sample of this from when I purchased Dior Homme Eau. Simply put, this has parts that I like and parts that I dislike. It opens fresh and colorful, then quickly transitions into something halfway between LB Roma Uomo (old school spicy sweetness!!!) and JPG Popeye. I'm a huge fan of Roma Uomo and I detest JPG Popeye so that's where I stand with this thing. It's honestly pretty boring to me and doesn't have the attractiveness or mass appeal that other generic/boring fragrances do. Pass, for me atleast.


Edit: After spraying my small sample again and giving it another try it is starting to grow on me. Not a favorite or one that I would purchase for myself but it definitely is pleasant smelling. Bottle still looks ugly though.

Edit 2: Definitely grew on me a lot. Very pleasant fresh mint/grapefruit based scent with that old school Le Male DNA. this is what JPG Popeye/superman thinks it's doing. Can't see myself getting a full bottle as the bottle itself is atrocious, but it definitely smells very very good.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I'm glad I gave this fragrance a chance, it has not disappointed me at all. Patchouli is one of my favorite notes and this stuff has it in spades. The grapefruit adds a nice fruity vibe to it and of course the cardamon makes it a bit spicy. 12+ hours of longevity and 4 feet of projection, go easy on the trigger because this juice is quite potent.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: This is a fairly nice scent, but it's nothing special or that different from the original Mr. Burberry. I wasn't blown away by that scent either, so I am predisposed to not care for this much. It is somewhat elegant and proper, but kind of generic at the same time. I wish there was a bit more to this that made the scent a bit deeper and more complex.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I bought this on a 50% sale . I don't know why so much hate as its actually a very nice classy quality scent.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: i tried this today. it smells great. just like the other releases of burberry (you can tell there's a similarity) they smell kind of alike in a certain way. it's a classy fragrance. you can actually use this at the office or formal functions.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Totally agree with the person below me, not amazed by the smell and performance of this frag, longevity is pretty legit btw, but why so much hate before even giving it a try.
If this juice was put in a high end bottle like Dior's, Chanel's etc. probably everyone would've gone crazy for it in my opinion.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: It's a nice scent to smell. Fresh spicy, mint, fresh water are things that come to mind when I smell this. I don't know why it's getting so much hate. It's not trying hard. That's what I like about it. You can wear this to work, get complements, and you won't offend anyone.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
It's good. But I guess if you love fragrances and tried and tested many perfumes, you won't get overly excited.
It's warm and masculine. It has a sort of wet and humid quality.
As I said, I like it but at the same time I know this fragrance can easily transform itself into a generic/boring male perfume.
It is well executed, you can tell there's knowledge behind it but at the same time...meh.
I guess I should wear it and see the reaction.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Not gonna make an in-depth review because is too late, just wanted to contribute my 2 cents because I see it has a poor review, probably because the longevity and sillage as I see a lot of people rated it poor. I read the other reviews last week but I can't remember them now so...

·I would definitely rated higher than a mere 2.42, at least as the scent goes.
·I can feel very clearly the citrus, given the notes I would thought it was gonna be more discrete. I think it mixes well with the other notes.
·I understand what the description means when it says "more suitable for evening occasions" but I could use it for daytime too.
·With just my first sprays I felt it was too weak, so I sprayed some more about 5 minutes later(I'm testing it and I like to be able to smell them easily and for my wife to be able to smell it at a distance) and it went to weak mode again after 5 minutes or so(maybe is my nose getting used to it, but it doesn't happens this much as with other perfumes).
·At this rate I would say the longevity won't be that much but its being an hour and 15 minutes and I can still smell it (skin scent and outside in the balcony with some draft I could smell it a little bit in my surrounding air), which beats Gucci perfumes.

Conclusion for now: I like the smell but I don't like the strength, for my taste is somewhat weak even for a safe perfume, but you have to do your own test for this as my perception of it might be different from yours.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
First impression, I Like it a Lot! :)
I will update soon..

Update

This is one of those fragrances that put smile on my face whenever i sniff :)
So, Wow!
This is more of a night time fragrance, it has perfect balance without being overly dark and not too bright either. Also it's not too sugary or not too citrusy.. It's modern, but without Ambroxan, major ingredient in this days fragrances.

It has spices and flowers that is my impression, i can sense the flowers in it, this notes gives this fragrance freshness, not to fall into the dark.
Longevity and silage is moderate, not too strong, just perfect!
In one word, Lovely.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
What -- A -- Shame

Been testing this for a couple days now, and I just can't get myself to like it. To me, the patchouli is obvious, along with the nutmeg and cinnamon, with maybe some amber and lavender in the background. It's more elegant than anything and possibly meant for formal occasions???

But no matter how you spin it, I can't help but feel that THIS SMELLS CHEAP. Something along the line of Avon or a celebrity frag. Don't get me wrong it's not bad or awful, but it does seem incredibly generic in a powdery sort of way. Believe me, there are MUCH better and less expensive options out there.

The bright side is that it does get a little better after the initial spray, but not by much. Longevity and sillage are below average on me. Oh yeah, and my 60yo mom liked it. LOL. BURN.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Im not saying that this one is not good,but eau de toilete is far better
Here are some changes that make this fragrance more matture,i dont see this perfect for a young men

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Just tried it today. If you own the EDT and I do, do not buy this. EDT has a better silage and more pleasant scent.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
Tried it today, didn't love or hate it, wouldn't buy it, it's quite different to the original in smell

Still waiting for something from Burberry to blow me away, it seems whatever they release always falls into the meh category for my taste

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
The EDP edition of Mr Burberry is
a lot stronger on me than the edt,
the first 2 hours it projected like a
beast, its still notable after that
too but it calms a bit down, i like this
scent its more mature than the edt,
stronger a bit darker and of course
longer lasting.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
I sprayed this fragrance last night and it has been over 26 hours and the smell still very strange on my necktie...
Very classy, unique, I love it so much...

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: Can't even find this in any store yet and people are talking about it. How do you already know everything about it lmaosmdh.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: sweet spicy, unisex- i love it

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I wore this today and I find it thicker and denser than the eau de toilette but it lasts only a couple hours longer than the edt and doesn't project. the bottle looks good in black but I was expecting better performance and on me it just doesn't last.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
It's that common grapefruit-cedar-shower-gel type of smell again. On me, the longevity is still less than desired. I get about 1 hour of projection.
[Yes, I am talking about the EDP]

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
STOP PUTTING DISLIKES PEOPLE! It's not released, you can't know if it's bad or not. Don't be fools.

I honestly believe it should be good!
The original EdT was good, I personaly like the scent. Yes, nothing special, but same time not offencive at all, very pleasant smell. I even like it much more then L'homme Ultime by YSL which was too boring for me. The only issue with Mr.Burberry was the performance. If the longevity would be around good 6-7 hours - it could be super fine ! But it wasn't.

I hope this time they put attention and listened what people were talking about and made a homework.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: @lou6 but why do they not review it? Whats the matter of rating a fragrance without any comment or statement? Sure some people have early access to it but everything is rated bad, for example woth Hugo Boss Iced its the same. Maybe it is because they think that because Mr.Burberry was "bad" this will be too and thats why they rate it bad without even testing...

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content:
How does a fragrance that wont be released for 3 months have 20 ratings and 80% of them being "weak" - as an EDP?

The original smelled nice/mainstream, but was terrible in performance which was surprising because I will try anything done by Kurkdjian - top 3 in the game.

So with that, I will definitely try this being an EDP - with added notes of Cinnamon and Amber.

That said, why would Burberry keep on ignoring what was clearly their biggest ever men's fragrance "London" - want to drum up excitement for your brand again - come out with a London Intense (EDP) or London Parfum, or London Noir - instead they come out with the Brit Rhythm line? Maybe the most boring line out there. Mr. Burberry is kinda cool, love the bottles, done by MFK - but go back to your roots and do something modern with London or maybe even the original Brit.

product_name: Mr. Burberry Eau de Parfum Burberry
review_content: I own and really like the original release. I will keep waiting for this.

I haven’t really been into floral scents or ”clean” scents earlier, and this was very meh to me when I first got it, but I decided to try it now for November when I was rushing out the door for a meeting and I’m SO happy I kept this one! I catch myself thinking ”what smells so good? Oh it’s me!” All day with this perfume, I see others saying it doesn’t last long for them, but one spray lasts me all day and even onto the next day, and on clothes it still smells fresh the day after. I actually appreciate this one very much nowadays.

very fresh juicy slightly sweet floral. enjoyable on this breezy cool fall afternoon. good sillage. doesn't disappear on clothes like other scents that i forget im wearing. glad i kept this in my collection. i would consider it safe for work. doesn't bother my sinuses. its a keeper
This scent is very tied to that time period (early 2000s) but is so good I'd say it's a classic. Fresh, floral, sweet (in a floral sense) and clean (yes, like laundry!). Perfect for work.

Breaks my heart that such a promising combination of notes simply smells like an unpleasant powdered laundry detergent on me. I don’t get floral or citrus or anything resembling the brand description or user reviews. Just a linear, everlasting, beastmode Dollar Tree soap scent. I spray this on the curtain that hides my washer and dryer to freshen up the bathroom for guests. Bring back Burberry Brit Rhythm, I say!

This is what I imagine a 'mom perfume' is. My mom is 62 and she loooooooooved it! It's very mature, elegant, feminine, everything you would want in a perfume for a idk, work/ office perfume. It's really good and I got a bottle too, though use it rarely because the smell is indeed, mature. And unfortunately, it does not last long, for us it's hmm.. Maybe 3h MAX MAX MAX.

Burberry London is my go-to “safe bet” for work.
It’s a fragrance I wear when I don’t want to draw too much attention, but still want to smell fresh, clean, and professional, with surprisingly good projection. I even got a compliment from two random older ladies on the street after I thought it had already faded!
London may not be groundbreaking, but as a polished, reliable perfume for the office, it does the job.
forgetable
Smells so good especially on the dry down really safe blind buy for girly clean girls easily wearable leans more summery spring weathers but can be worn all year round if it fits your vibe

Got this for $38. I had low expectations but wow am I impressed! This is a staple fragrance, appropriate for any occasion. I think it really shines in warm weather but I’d have no problem wearing this in the winter. This is an inoffensive fruity floral with just enough musk and sandalwood to deepen it. You really cannot go wrong with this. For the price it’s really an easy blind buy.

Two hours at Gatwick waiting for my plane to take off and a wonderful duty free full of fragrances I can't find in my country, all for me. A perfume lover's paradise, right? 😍🥰🤩😜
And that's how I got to know Burberry London. From that day on, I couldn't stop looking for this fragrance in my country, I had an incredible need to have it in my collection!!! I smelled it all the time on the plane, floral and a bit citrusy at first, a little bit shampoo-like, more creamy as the minutes went by, and floral-musky-woody at the end.🌸🍊✨️🫧

The most prominent notes for me are honeysuckle, tiare flower, and peony, mixed with a delicate and cozy musk. This perfume smells divine! Perfect as a signature fragrance because it is very versatile, not too intense, which makes it wearable all year round. Very feminine and sophisticated, an unique and a very beautiful scent!

With this one, I declare myself an unconditional fan of Burberry fragrances, I want them all!!! How can they make such beautiful fragrances? 😍😫🥰

Really disappointed. Love the scent but it wears off so quickly. I don't want to say it's an old lady scent, but it reminds me of mall fragrance departments in the 90s. Personally I like that scent. It smells mature and brings to mind gold lipstick cases with the ridges. But it's gone in an instant. Paris Hilton Fairy Dust is in the "reminds me of" list and I would agree. Fairy Dust is a much better price, lasts longer, and doesn't quite have the 90s femme fatale scent down, but close.

Despite seeing this scent for years, I finally dabbled into the Burberry world with this bottle since she was clearanced at TJ Maxx for just $50 for a 3.4oz edp…and my very first thought was “Dang, why did I wait so long?!” It smells divine, light yet opening to more depth, serious yet casual and mature yet feminine. All of these things weirdly made me think it would be a great graduation perfume for my daughters once they start looking for their adult jobs. It’s a scent I likely will wear to the office, then layer on something deeper and darker on top of for evening.
However, I do think this is an agreeable smell of lovely florals for those that understand Burberry’s line usually do still have a threaded scent component across all of their perfumes, and I do still get just the minor hint of rose soapy smell in the opening but to me it’s not bad… it doesn’t smell like my grandma’s shaped soaps she’d keep above her toilet. It smells like elegance, yet focused. Debating going back to see if I can get another bottle at that awesome price.
Glad I took the leap into this first Burberry scent but I am not seeking out the entire house collection.

I enjoy this scent a lot! It is the middle of a hot and humid summer and this is so perfect for this time of year! The citrus and soapy top makes me feel a bit fresher even though I’m literally sweating! 😆 Then it starts to morph into a beautiful more elegant earthy jasmine patchouli scent! It’s such a pretty scent that wears well for any occasion! I usually enjoy a Dominique Ropion creation so it’s no surprise I like this! Although I find this would wear best in the warmer months, I think it could easily work any time of year!

I first discovered this scent in 2008 in San Francisco, and I've been in love with it since. This is the perfume that has gotten me the most compliments. It is a strong and mature scent, perfect for cold days. It smells expensive. As a lover of white florals, this is like an opiate for me. I can't get enough of it, and it never gets old. Huge bravo to the creators of this masterpiece.

I did not like this at all it smells like desitin cream. I tried giving it a few tries but its just really not good. I'm a burberry fan. I adore burberry her and love burberry brit sheer much better smelling perfumes and would reccomend them over burberry london anyday. Unfortunately I will not be using this ever.

It's a classic. I always have a bottle. I wore it heavily around the 2009 to 2012 era. I wore it as a night time, going out fragrance. Crazy, because the notes don't suggest that, but it was my sexy evening scent. Loved to wear it in winter, too. Again, not what you'd think.

Very pretty perfume. I love that tangerine in the opening is so divine and unique. I know it’s not a new perfume at all but def a goodie. My gave it to me because it was given to her and she didn’t line it and I happily took it off her hands. (Im in my 30’s) I where it all afternoon came home and took a shower, and I can still smell it, which is very rare with a lot of the perfumes that I have. One of the previous reviews said it smells like glam jasmine by Michael Kors and I can definitely say that is 100% true it reminds me so much of that perfume which I owned back in like 2012 or 2013 when it first came out . The Jasmine note definitely coming strong after about two hours and a whole lot during the dry down .

Everyone is saying jasmine for this but I feel like rose is more prominent, which surprised me as I have always thought that I do not like the scent. Maybe it is the citrus freshness accompanying. It is comforting, sophisticated -- not bold however shows that you put effort. Can easily be a day to day perfume but not much. Would I purchase? Maybe. Is it good enought to be a signature scent? Maybe not.

Ahhhhhh as a pure poison lover… this is not what i expected.. The tuberose here reminds me of the tuberose in gucci bloom that rotten flower smell and this is not what the notes say… i get a minty tangy rotten tuberose no jasmine for me honestly i really wanted to like it but that is not my thing… 3/10

I dont careeeeee, haters can hatee! To me this smells amazing! Love love love it all the way from the opening to the dry down. It used to be my “everyday” running errands/mall perfume😅 im a floral girly and this was a great compliment getter.
I have an unopened 100ml bottle for sale of Burberry London DM for inquiry 💖

Wow, this really is a jasmine bomb. I keep going back and forth with this one. Sometimes I like it a lot and sometimes it’s just too much for me, too sweet, indolic and dense. But just when I think decluttering, I smell it again and notice it’s too nice to declutter. 😏
It reminds me of Flora Gorgeous Jasmine. But that one is lighter, fresher and greener. And FGJ has mandarin instead of clementine and tangerine. Clementine can be tricky on my skin and I think it is the note that sometimes bothers me a bit in this frag. But fortunately it fades away rather quickly.
I love this! a sweet, feminine jasmine bomb

London is a cool, dewy floral, with zesty mandarin for a touch of freshness. Stays pretty much the same throughout its 5-6 hours wear with arm's length projection. The packaging is simple yet elegant with a square bottle wrapped with a piece of Burberry fabric. Safe, simple and unassuming so should be great for work, but for more special events you might want something with more character.
Almost identical to Gucci Flora Gorgeous Jasmine.

I’ve gone back & forth with my opinion on this fragrance a lot. I love the main notes - Jasmine, Honeysuckle, Tangerine, Musk. But there’s something about this that is just too mature smelling even for me (I’m 34). There’s a sharpness to it too, which I personally do not mind but I’m aware that something like this could very easily give those around me headaches & that makes me apprehensive to wear it.

It is woody, but not in a creamy way. It’s very dry. I don’t get any brightness or juiciness in this except for maybe the first 5 minutes. It eventually transforms into a dry sharp woody jasmine with some muskiness. I love Jasmine but I wish this had a bit of sweetness. Overall it’s just okay & definitely only suitable for fall & winter.

OH ok...first impressions: I'm running through the forest by my house as a kid. Im going to see if the honeysuckles have bloomed yet and I think I already smell them blooming off in the distance. I run by a freshly bloomed rose bush on the lawn as Im heading into the forest and I pause to smell the one new rose thats bloomed, then I keep running. I immediately pull the snack I brought in my pocket out and start to eat an perfectly ripe orange/tangerine as the juice runs down my hand. I run by a field of jasmine and like Dorothy does in the field of poppys, I pass out in the jasmine. When I wake up I finish eating my orange, but the honeysuckle vine is calling my soul. I then get up and keep running...that honeysuckle was the reason for this whole adventure in the first place. I finally arrive at the honeysuckle vine. I spend hours upon hours pulling the honeysuckle flowers off and eating the one drop of honeysuckle juice in each one. It smells beautiful. It tsstes beautiful. Then as I walk home covered in the smell of honeysuckle juice I pass a freshly fallen sandalwood limb that has ever so slightly disrupted the dirt when it fell (this is the patchouli, and I despise patchouli unless its Chanel's patchouli, but not to worry because a master perfumist like Ropion knows women don't want to smell like a headshop and obliques us with just a touch of it to round this vision out).

This scent reminds me of my childhood (though by no means a child's perfume), running wild and free through my parents lawn and then into the forest next to their property. Paynight below me is right. For me, honeysuckle is the dominant note. Then orange and Jasmine then a hint of rose/peony (my nose picks up peony as just a sharper, fresher rose) in the back. This one reminds me of when I'd shove my face into a vine of honeysuckle towards the end of summer as they're falling off the vine they're so ripe. This is a piece of art...this is a Dominque Ropion. Must love flowers, the olfactory fragrance pyramid, and very well rounded perfumes as opposed to the random ingredients for baked goods spilled on yourself all at once to form a linear gourmand. I love both. But when I want to smell like the queen of the forest fairies🧚🏼? I'd wear this. I'd put this firmly in the "wifey", MILF, elegant, classy, sexy, grown woman category. I'd wear this all year around, day or night.
Edit: compared to perfumes today? The longevity is eternal and the sillage? My husband can smell me across the room (and he likes what he smells). It's been a LONG time since I could spray a perfume in front of me and walk through it and that last me all day but this is one. This 3.4oz will last me so long it'll probably be passed down to my daughter when I die it performs so well. Most perfumes today have to be oversprayed directly on your person for them to last til the end of dinner. Even the super expensive ones. Not this one. I do not remember the girls wearing this when it first came out in 2006. Hell no. I remember Juicy Couture, Britney Spears' Curious (if you couldn't afford, or didn't know about, the far superior Ralph Lauren Blue for women in its hayday before reformulation), Victoria's Secret Love Spell body mist, so many other VS body mists, and if you were a prep with a lil money, Clinique Happy. But, not this...a newly released Burberry by Ropion may have been too expensive for the teen girls in my public high school. It doesn't spell like something a child/teenager would want to wear though. Not sweet like food enough like JC and not aquatic enough like Aqua Di Gio at all to put it in that era's fragrance fad. Save yourself the $140 they're charging for this 19 year old perfume on Amazon, and by God use an outlet fragrance retailer like perfumelux or The Perfume Fragrance Empire on eBay, FragranceNet, and pay $30USD. Trust you will get the authentic product those 3 retailers. They have been in business about 20 years, have over a 1.5 million reviews and sit at an over 99% satisfaction rate.

TLDR: a Burberry is a Burberry and Dominque Ropion is a master artist at his craft.

Say no more. A Dominque Ropion is a Dominque Ropion. I'm gonna blind buy this and update. Ropion has done so many of my faves. I'm sure he will not fail me now. 😊🙏 Euphoria, Pure Poison, Carnal Flower, Portrait Of A Lady, Armani Code, Acqua Di Gioa, all of the L'Interdits, all the La Vie Est Belles, Tresors, etc etc.

I remember liking this years ago - so when I saw it at Nordstrom Rack for cheap I bought the full size. Turns out I do not like it. Too sweet and synthetic smelling for me. It smells like gummy bears in a nauseating way.

I have a full 3.3 in the box if anyone wants to trade.

This is my first women's fragrance review. I bought this for my mother for mother's day, and she loved it. I find it to be safe, warming and sweet/fresh at the same time. This is what a confident and busy matriarch would wear. It's how I imagine Queen Elizabeth would have smelt like.

Its soooo good . The honeysuckle is strong so if you like the flower youll like this. I like it for summer , Light blue is the most famous for summer but i don't like the lemon in that … burns my nose . It’s fresh and cool. The longevity is like 12 hours but the silage is good too. You can count on it. As someone else mentioned Its hard to dislike this.

This is my hidden gem.
I have Burberry Goddess, and am well acquainted with the rest of the range. I love most Burberry fragrances, and understand why they're so popular - however, nothing can beat London for its relatively inexpensive price point.
I've had it for years, and will never grow tired of it. On first application, it seems a little synthetic or chemical, but if you allow it to settle for a minute, the beautiful honeysuckle note will emerge and the fragrance will begin its transition into something much more refreshing. Notes of jasmine and peony are very prominent. London is a very sweet, very floral fragrance, but I do not find it overpowering, even despite its strength. Rather, I think it's sophisticated and refreshing. It's perfect for a date or a night out.
If you're a fan of sweeter scents like me (think Giorgio Armani My Way Nectar), I think there's a good chance you'll enjoy this. For what is a very low price for Burberry, it's not a tremendous risk either way.

Hm, it’s hard for me to imagine that someone could hate this scent. I think it’s very safe, inoffensive and classy.
For me, it’s mostly jasmine with a hint of rose and citruses. I expected it to be more sweet than fresh, whereas I got the latter. For me it’s better :) but it also has a hint of sweetness in it if you’re into it, it’s just discreet:)
Nothing groundbreaking or super original, but I can’t deny that it’s elegant, feminine and probably liked by many.

My signature scent. It’s smells amazing. Jasmine and fresh. Best for winter and fall but I wear it year round.
I’ve gotten most of my compliments from Burberry London. It leaves a trail but isn’t at all overpowering.
I haven’t ever smelled a perfume similar to this. It’s unique.

Such an elegant, classy and sophisticated perfume. Some people say it's boring, to me it's not at all. I loooove the combination of florals with a hint of sweetness, and something in it almost gives me wild strawberries vibes. I'm not getting tired of it, can't say it's overpowering. I really enjoy it on myself and I'm getting whiffs of it throughout the day. I'd say it's long-lasting with a decent sillage.

enormous floral perfume. peony and jasmine is very intense. almost headache inducing. one of my most floral perfumes of all my white floral scents. and they have more flowers in the notes than this. vintage scent. not for people who dislike flower perfumes.

one spray is enough. good for being outdoors so its not so empowering.
I get nothing but cold jasmine. Quite uninteresting and borderline offensive.
Love it! It is so beautiful! but lacks longevity and sillage.

Immediately you smell jasmine, and it smells of white, powdery floral....I think it's quite uninteresting and nothing to write home about. It seems alluring since its Burberry, but honestly as I experimented with the gifted perfumes this wasn't my favorite...I would wear it though, and everytime I decide to take it out of my storage box and sniff it it brings me back to the days when I used to wear it...So I guess it is quite memorable. But I wouldn't purchase again--its not too girly, not too sweet, not too warm, one of the commenter's said it would smell good in cooler weathers which is true...Again I feel this perfume doesn't have a personality
This is one of my early favorite scents. It's very classic and worthy of being a signature scent of mine; although I prefer to experiment with new scents.

This perfume made me rethink how I label perfumes with styles or appropriate ages.

When I first got it I thought it seemed dated and like it's for someone older. It reminded me of the jasmine heavy perfumes used by my lovely grandmother and her friends. But my daughter, who was probably 10 at the time, got a whiff and was delighted by it. She said it smelled perfect on me and that if I didn't want it, she'd like to have it. It occurred to me that she'd likely never smelled anything like it before. She'd of course have none of the associations I have with it and her feelings about it are independent of any bias. I tried to sense it with her fresh nose, and she was right. It is so sweet with such a round, floral beauty.

It's not my style - I prefer a more soapy floral and this is quite honeyed - but it is something I reach for occasionally when I'm looking for something different. I'd love smelling it on someone else.

I highly disagree with the comment two below- this is green and watery for sure with light wet lush florals. It’s fresh and bright and just all around pleasant. Smells best in cooler weather. I think it’s delightful and very feminine. It’s well blended and dewy. It kind of smells like ink. You know when a pen leaks? It has that smell but more spring floral.
The dry down is musky candy. Florals always turn to sweet candy on me so I like it. I might keep a small bottle around cuz florals go very well with my chemistry.
Nice scent but very old and very traditional, not unique. Performance is weak

Cheap and obnoxious smelling low quality jasmine.

So insistent, sticky, and tacky. And lingers on for HOURS. HUGE BLIND BUY REGRET. Nothing, ABSOLUTELY NOTHING, masculine or gender-bending in this as others here for some reason proclaim. It is not respect-evoking, nor is it a photo-realistic jasmine. No green or watery quality to discover here that should be associated with jasmine and/or London.

No citrusy brightness. No rose of any sort. No woods anywhere to be found.

And it allows absolutely no room for betterment by layering it with this or that... it would only compromise and contaminate a better perfume or olfactory blend.

Smells NOTHING like Pure Poison or Boucheron Jaipur Bracelet. Lacks the coldness, green quality, milky smoothness, and the polish of those two exquisite masterpieces. And Jesus del Pozo in White? Not even in the same galaxy. Now THAT was a masculine-leaning cold-as-ice barbershop white floral that I miss dearly.

In fact, the drydown of this mess is identical to the wretch that is CK Beauty. Hate this juice when it gets called 'CK Beauty'; hate it when it (apparently also) gets called 'London'.

Basic rations as a cheesy abhorrent white floral.


PS: If you absolutely MUST own this abomination, at least buy Beauty. Its sculptural sublime bottle is truly a work of art. This one is a glass block wrapped in a poly-something rag...

I was very much not-a-fan of this upon first spray as a blind buy. However, returning to it after a couple of months, I don’t have the same repulsion.

It’s a pleasant tangerine-y jasmine. Not as strong as the (not similar but same family-ish) L’Interdits I own, but nice all the same.

It’s quite a quiet performance so I think it may end being an office or workday scent for me.

I think I’ll happily work my way through this bottle but never repurchase. Pleasant, unremarkable, nice.

Strange no one notices that it’s better and very similar to super expensive and overhyped Ella K Camellia. Check it out. Camellia seems more screechy and rougher from the start. Drydown is identical. Burberry London doesn’t seem to have lost its relevance and ultra femininity over the last 2 decades. I will repurchase the bottle to have it again as I did in 2007.

Is not one of my favorite but surprisingly every time I wear it it gets so many compliments.
The scent is ok,not something different.
Will I purchased again?
NOO

I’m not really a fan of Burberry London. Since reviewers compared to PH Fairy Dust, I decided to compare the two. FD is more sunny and bright, more youthful and cheerful in my opinion. I’m guessing due to the peach. Burberry London is more serious, a little bit melancholy and matronly, in my opinion and definitely a hair spray vibe. It’s mainly honeysuckle, jasmine and musk in London. I do not recommend blind buying, I think Fairy Dust and Juicy Couture are better than this and more affordable.

Smells nice, fresh and slightly sweet.
I already have Gucci Bloom which is my favorite.
12/28/2024 - no longer in my collection
Krásná - jaro, léto. Cena super.. Během dne několikrát aplikovat, což pro nízkou cenu tolik nevadí.

I really wanted this to be my signature, since I love jasmine so much. But it feels like a boring blend, I don't feel it shine much. I mostly got the tangerine and jasmine, the rest being too blended together. I would say it's a safe blind buy if you like florals and don't expect sugary sweetness. The poor longevity and sillage are disappointing.

Best honeysuckle ever!

Burberry London begins with the tender sweetness of honeysuckle, like the first kiss of sunlight on a quiet morning. But just as the warmth of spring unfolds, a sharpness lingers in the air—a cool breeze cutting through the floral sweetness, reminding you that beauty is never without depth. As jasmine joins the delicate dance, it layers a richer, more sensual note, enhancing the elegance of the honeysuckle without overwhelming it. And as the scent fades, musk and sandalwood wrap around you like the evening’s embrace—soft, yet unforgettable.

A fragrance that dances between softness and strength, timeless yet always fresh.

Quite likeable jasmine and tangerine fragrance. Nothing bad but was not interesting enough for me to keep it after wearing it a few times. I’d say it could be a safe blind buy for someone who enjoys jasmine. I can see why it is still around after all these years.

♣ MBTI ♣ ESTJ 💼 – Confident, put-together, with a touch of nostalgia.
♣ Character ♣ Regina George 👠💅 – Sharp, polished, with a hint of sweetness.
♣ Wear Style ♣ Office to weekend 🏙️🍸 – Best for a woman who can balance work and play with ease.


London Burberry for Her is like a nostalgic trip back to the early 2000s—a mix of 2000s grownup fragnances and Alien with a sophisticated twist. It reminds me of a woman working in finance during that era—sharp, stylish, and always ready for a girls' night out afterward. The fragrance has that same bold sweetness but with a dry edge that makes it feel a bit too sharp for regular wear.

The standout for me is the honeysuckle note, which adds a lovely, sweet, floral touch, softening the otherwise dry composition. It’s pretty, and I can see why many enjoy it—especially if you're into bold, honeyed florals. But it’s definitely not an everyday fragrance for me; it’s too dry and almost makes me want to sneeze from the sharpness at times.

It's great for a night out or special occasions when you want to stand out a bit, but wearing it regularly might be a bit much. Overall, I’d rate it moderately positively—definitely a good pick if you want something reminiscent of that *early-2000s finance boss* aesthetic, but it might not be the best for all-day wear. 💼👠

It’s a nice perfume. But even though it’s kind of fresh and sweet, it’s also quite dry and sharp to my nose so i didn’t enjoy it that much. It’s more like a classic perfume. I decided to make it my work perfume to use it up and got quite some compliments, so definitely work (and office) appropriate imo. Will not repurchase.

This takes me straight back to my hedonistic days of yore gallivanting around London. I never had this perfume myself; my signature scent was Armani Code back then, but someone that I was close to must have worn this as when I smelt this recently it was like I had been transported back in time to 2007. The sense of nostalgia was so strong that it actually unnerved me. It’s mad how fragrance can do that to you.

I love the combination of the floral and citrus notes in this and I think if you like these types of notes (especially jasmine) chances are you will like this. It’s bright and sexy and just gives off good vibes. Definitely full bottle worthy in my opinion, even if purely for nostalgia purposes!

This is a jasmine bomb! But the sweet kind, not the one that turns into pee when it dries down.

I am a jasmine fan, however, I can see how most people find this type of white floral scent disturbing/too mature.
It is not that the perfume itself smells stale, old, vintage or anything like that.
I believe it is the stereotype we have regarding strong jasmine scents.

If I would care less about what my husband and people around me like, this would be probably a great everyday perfume for me in spring (and maybe even the colder months).

I tested this on paper only and can still smell it 24 hours later (it is faint, but it is there).

I find the bottle kinda ugly, that is the only reason why I am hesitating of buying this.

Really getting Tide Detergent from this one. Not a bad thing, but very on the nose if you're going for Clean Girl aesthetic. Think I need to try a few times before I make up my mind.

EDIT: I really like this! Definitely powdered detergent to me, but so comforting and soft. Clean and put-together. Feels very adult, very self-assured, sort of reminds me of staying in someone else's home, bundling in clean sheets and taking a bath with foreign floral soaps. On the dry down I get the honeysuckle and citrus. I think this would make a great addition to my collection, it's unlike anything I own!
I meant to buy London for men but accidentally ordered this one instead

My boyfriend bought this for me when we first started dating and he loves it. It's one of the only scents he actually likes on me except maybe Prada Paradoxe. He hates everything else I wear unless it's some kind of floral or light citrus body spray. I like this scent but I don't love it. It's a safe bet for the office or for people who don't like musk, spicy, or gourmand scents.

This is interesting. But I don't think I will buy this. The Burberry scents seem to come quite close to me. First it is sweet, then something spicy. I feel intrigued. There is something in here that smells unwell, rotten. It is not unfamiliar. It is a note I smelled before in my life. Interesting. But a pass for me. I think the weird note is the smell of cold cigarettes.

This has a burst of citrus in the opening more than any of the florals listed in the pyramid. On my skin, the drydown is a fresh floral- I mainly pick up on the jasmine and peony. I had high hopes for the tiare but I don't get that note at all. Overall, this is a nice classic fresh floral scent and good projection for about 3 hours. The drydown is barely noticeable as a skin scent and I would say it's like a fresh musk. I get the addictive creamy floral in the air but it just doesn't come across that way on my skin. On my skin, this has a similar vibe to Pure Poison which has better longevity on me than this does.

very strong headache inducing screechy floral!
(but smells nice on other people after a while)

My mommy's old signature scent that was passed down to me. I always loved this on her. I smell it and it reminds me of her everytime.
To me this reminds me of Pure Poison's younger, more liked, sweeter and better younger sister. Unlike Pure Poison, this is so much better and it has more depth than just pure jasmine. Definitely also a night time scent for a little drink. It's a very good mixture of all the notes listed above. Such great value for money! As for sillage it's very strong. It's a definite like for me!
Very strong, the guy at the store sprayed this on my arm, big mistake, this is awful 😖 headache inducing, this stuff smells like medicated dog shampoo, never again.

The honeysuckle note is almost addictive. I think of this as a sweeter D&G Pour Femme (without the vanilla). I’m especially liking this as a more sophisticated “sweet summer” scent for those days when I have to take a break from vacation and actually do something adult.
Orangy, floral and soapy, like a really high end soap, feels like a very sophisticated bubble bath, love it.

The smell of happiness on a sunny day. This perfume is one of the most underrated perfumes on the market. It's giving timeless; it's giving joy; it's giving jasmine bomb; it's giving fresh and funny. To my nose, it's an exciting and unique mix of jasmine, honeysuckle, and citrus with depth, and I guess it's the patchouli/sandalwood combo? It's sweet, but honeysuckle sweet with a fresh twist as I do not perceive tiare flower. It's not a linear scent; sometimes I get jasmine; later I get the clementine, and somehow, if I focus, the honeysuckle; it's never the same feeling at each sniff I get throughout the day. A bright and happy perfume for a colourful and happy day, a mood lifter, a best friend you giggle with and is hugging you all day long. Versatile as long as it's used in good weather, I do not see myself wearing such a bright and pleasant perfume on rainy days. This is sunshine during the most pleasant weather day in a bottle. Long lasting on my skin and with huge projection according to the people around me, with many compliments, I wear it on days I want to be as bright as the summer sun.

Absolutely fell in love with this perfume. It’s floral, fresh and very feminine 🩷 I’m a big fan of Burberry perfumes in general, but this one might be my favourite. (don’t tell the others :P)
It lasts pretty long on me, but that might be different for others. also a huge compliment catcher for sure.

I was 12 when this perfume was released. I remember when it was available in stores. My mom and I went to the Macys at the mall down the block from my school one after school and she purchased this perfume. To me, this was the epitome of an elegant, grown woman, but not in a dusty grandmotherly potpourri kind of way. I still have my mom’s first bottle because I loved playing with the fabric around the bottle.
Classy, sophisticated but I would recommend this to a lady up to 50 years old more or less. I don't know, It s really good but I think It suits more a mature woman

Back to the basic and gorgeous scents of the 80's, 90's and early 2000's. They last, they are different, they are memorable, they are distinct.... there are so many today that smell the same. I'm opening the old stash in the back of my closet and bringing those older babies to the front line now. They need to be cherished and shown off for their uniqueness. :)
