Burberry London is one of those babies. Just amazing....still, after all these years.
I love how this smells. The very authentic honeysuckle is gorgeous, however it fades really quickly on me. Maybe good to layer with something that has a vanilla or smokey dry down.

My favorite inoffensive work scent. This is what I would imagine a rich british lady to smell like. Smells like generational wealth. It’s an easy go to although on my skin it lasts 4 hours. This is perfect for people who are not into gourmand scents and just want a fresh perfume that could be worn everyday and anywhere.

I gave her so many chances, I forgave her over and over. I wanted to love her, she's named after a city that opened my young, innocent eyes and left me with a lifetime of fond memories. I wanted her to take me back to Primrose Hill and those days of disposable income, weekends in Paris and meeting my Sloane girlfriends on Sundays in Covent Garden. I wanted to relive it all. Instead the only memories stirred were of a cheap toilet spray my Nan used. The disappointment. The heartbreak. I will probably give her another chance to prove me wrong.
Suburban, classy, british, posh, sophisticated. A good work scent, but wont bore you.
Juiciest tangerine ever in the opening; very pretty but a little boring.

Sweet as a candy and very pleasant. It's strong enough but not too strong and it lasted on me all day (it disappeared quickly from my skin but I smelled it all day from my hair, actually I could still smell it after washing). I'm not sure about the right season for this perfume, at first I thought it's suitable for spring/fall but I'd like it in summer too. Price is great, I'll think about buying the whole bottle.
Floral and classy! I don't think the silage is great though and I feel like I have to frequently top it up... that being said, definitely my favourite ever

Usually when I smell a perfume it takes a while to decide whether I like it or not, but this one was WOW. Sniffed it, bought it. How can you not love the smell of honeysuckle? It has such an unique smell, classy, a bit tangy and vintage but not overwhelming. It does hit you slightly as the toothpaste smell does, but not in a bad way (its not minty). Id say it can be a pretty safe blind buy for those who love white flower fragrances. I wish i could wear it all the time but its a bit bold for summer and spring, i associate it with a chill theater night, wearing a long cozy coat and enjoying the smell of honeysuckle around the city gardens.

Funny, others feel that jasmine is dominant. Not me, it's much more Peony! Soft and lovely. I get reminders of fresh bubblegum, I guess from the Peony. It reminds me a touch of Jo M's Peony and Blush Suede .
My big sister’s Signature scent … i always try to make her love other fragrances too but she wont leave this one..

Extremely similar to Police To be born to shine. Both have a strange toothpaste smell to my nose when i first spray. After about 1 h the scent is quite lovely on the skin. For me this fragrance is quite messy and I can't really tell the different notes apart. I also find this fragrance very strong and long lasting. Have gotten headaches too. Overall just an
OK scent.

I hate the new formulation. Smells like mens' perfume. They threw out oakmoss from it. No longevity. Not at all sexy or feminine. It used to smell complex sophisticated sexy feminine multilayered. Now is just a boring one note men's perfume. Urgh.

This makes me feel lika a sophisticated british lady, in a good way! The scent feels classy but not too mature. It’s a strong floral but the rose really hides behind the jasmin so it doesn’t get that old vibe. Would recommend that you try it first though, this fragrance might not be for everyone. But I like it!
EDIT:
I sprayed this before going to work and when my stepdaughter came home a while later she asked her dad ”who smells lika an old lady here?!?” hahah… But I love it so it’s going nowhere!

This perfume transports you down a long avenue lined with honeysuckle trees, at 10:30 in the morning on a late spring day. You find yourself in a charming suburb, with rows of tidy houses and well-kept gardens. The rain is tapering off, and you're out for a stroll, wearing your Burberry waterproof trench coat, a silk scarf, and a coordinated umbrella. It's a weekday, but by some strange circumstance, you're not at work that day. Perhaps you're running errands, or maybe you're investigating something that didn't sit right with you in the past few days, and an adventure awaits you.
It's okay but nothing special. Does remind of Rare Pearls but not as sweet and faint inducing. Imma pass on it.

I’m a huge fan of florals and have recently been coming to enjoy white florals due to some Elizabeth Taylor perfumes I recently got. While I love them, they do have a kind of dated feel to them. However, London by Burberry manages to feel so sophisticated and modern. I’m absolutely obsessed with it. The Tiare flower in the dry down is so gorgeous. Truly such a clean, feminine scent thats perfect for everyday. I might have just found my new signature scent. i love it that much

I almost bought it, luckily I waited until tester dry down on my skin, and sincerely it was like a male perfume on my skin. I don't know why, maybe because sandalwood with musk. I just didn't like it. I do love Burberry Her, but London is a bit sharp for my nose.

I never think that I will love it as much as I can now. It's the perfect combination of white floral, citrus and fruity. Classic but not old, sweet but not innocent, quiet but can speak louder from her smile, cheerful and lively. Look like Audrey Hepburn from Roman Holiday.

A lot more tropical than I expected. It's very pretty. Lots of honeysuckle and tiare flower. Feels like you're in a tiny little white beach house with the windows open on a nice spring day, letting in the breeze and the smell of fresh flowers blooming right outside.

Imagine jasmine wrapped in a hazy fog of tiare flower, and when your nose goes searching for the jasmine you knew was there (because you just smelt it, didn't you?), you find it disappeared in a licorice-y pool outside the English Gardens while you were drinking orange pekoe...

Clean, plush & opulent jasmine... I've come back to this one after awhile, and I had forgotten how good it is - another Dominique Ropion gem (signed by DR & Jean Marc Chaillan). I was craving a scent like this, looking forward to spring. The white-florals are blended so beautifully here - I'm a fan of the way Mr. Ropion blends white-florals. Opening with a bright burst of honeysuckle & tangerine with hints of rose, but already the buttery & succulent tiare-jasmine combo is swelling through. As it transitions to the heart, the white-florals come even more forward with peony adding to the velvety plushness & clementine boosting the fruity-citrus facets. At this stage it takes on a more opulent white-floral feel, and the tiare here is not quite beachy but still buttery, while jasmine is clean & citrus-y. This all rests on a sandalwood, musk & patchouli base that keeps the plush white-florals going for well beyond average performance with gorgeous projection. This isn't a dupe of anything, but at times I catch reminders of other Dominique Ropion white-florals. This is a must-try for lovers of white-florals, and a longtime love for me. Enjoy!

Update 07/20/24: sprayed this on the back of one of my hands this morning. It's just as beautiful as ever. Classic, gorgeous, multi-faceted jasmine scent that's at the same time traditional & contemporary. Beautiful, velvet-y sillage aided by peony. Still a love.

This is one of the first fragrances I bought as a teenager. It reminds of My Way, only much more pleasant, well formulated and cheaper. If you are into citruses and white flowers the good old Burberry London is a valid option.

I tried London a for the first time a few years ago, and it was love at first spray. :)
I'm not good at all in recognising the notes of any fragrance, however I know what I like and what I don't. Whenever I like a fragrance, turns out it has predominantly white flowers (especially jasmine). It was the same this time. Ever since, London is my absolute favourite and the only perfume I cannot stay without.
When I'm wearing it, I feel feminine, elegant and classy. I wish I were in the streets of London on a rainy afternoon, careless and relaxed. I hope Burberry never stops making this masterpiece!
Pleasant floral fragrance, though not the best for humid summer days. Finished a bottle / not going to repeat.

Opens with a lot of tangerine, honeysuckle, and jasmine. Sweet, clean and juicy.

Then as it dries down jasmine is in the forefront and you start to get the musk, sandalwood and patchouli. It is a little bit reminiscent to the original Juicy Couture fragrance.

Final stage is just a nice woody Jasmine with some warmth. I don’t feel too strongly one way or the other about this perfume. It’s an easy to reach for, put together scent.

Side note: This layers really nicely with Versace Eros edp

i got this as a gift and it'd definitely be perfect for someone who likes jasmine and florals and also maybe someone a little more mature than me! on my skin i get a lot of the jasmine and also a weird almost bitter note i don't know how to describe. i'll be giving this to my mom lol

I love this perfume! One of the best floral/jasmine scents I've encountered so far, and it's reasonably priced.

However, I recommend only wearing this perfume in humid weather as I have noticed that the dry down of this perfume tends to change depending on how much humidity is in the air. For example, in dry weather I really hate how the dry down ends up smelling, it makes me think of cockroach spray and poverty (if you're unfortunate enough to know, you know) and it makes me gag a bit. In more humid weather however, it smells more like what it's meant to smell like, which is a woody/musky/patchouli scent.

I guess it would make sense that this perfume smells best in humid weather as the UK is known for its year round humidity. I live in a drier climate so I don't wear this perfume as often as I'd like.

Such a classy and preppy girl scent. For those of you who liked Armani my way, but thought my way was too heavy on the bubblegum tuberose, try this instead! This is my way but makes it more mature and complex. Her older cousin wearing a brown trenchcoat, transparent umbrella on a rainy day in London. Very floral heavy and pretty.
I love jasmine perfumes. This one is very elegant and feminine. If the "clean girl aesthetic" trend was a perfume.

I finished a 30 ml bottle then moved on to other scents and forgot about this gem. I recently repurchased it in a bigger bottle after remembering why I love it so much. It's so, so well blended and you can now find it on sale easily (I paid around 20 euros for 50 ml). I'm currently trying to reduce my collection to under 10 perfumes, and I'm keeping London permanently as my fruity-floral pick, mostly because it's so versatile. I love the opening, the tangerine is so well-blended with the honeysuckle but I don't get rose at all. The body is also lovely, jasmin and clementine, wow! What a combo! I would have loved to smell more tiare but actually none of the notes stand out on their own, which is awesome. I get why people have said it's similar to L'Interdit, it shares some vibes and it's probably what Givenchy would come out with if they wanted to add a freshie flanker to that line (let's not forget that London came out over 10 years before the current L'Interdit version so who is copying who :D). If I were to compare it to something I'd say it's more similar to Boucheron Quattre but much more sophisticated and longer lasting. Another thing that made me fall for this one is that it does not go to the dry-down quickly. Surprisingly, it works great in colder weather, definitely not a summer scent but I love it as my autumn and also winter fragrance when I'm not in the mood for hardcore woody-vanilla-amber bombs, almost like a pick-me-up when you're missing spring too much :) No huge projection but you get 4-6 hours on the skin (more on clothes). I associated it with preppy chic outfits, some oxford shoes and a nude trench coat, on a rainy but not too cold autumn day. Feminine but not too delicate, girly but not immature (on the contrary, it has a sophistication to it that any similar crowd-pleasers don't), overall an awesome purchase and even a safe blind-buy I would say, for somebody who you would describe as "bubbly".

To me, this fragrance is like taking a stroll on a foggy, rain-filled day—evoking a sense of comfort and a home away from home. As my first-ever fragrance purchase, it holds a special place in my heart.
The clear white floral notes exude a classy vibe, making it perfect for simply being yourself.
It's a timeless beauty suitable for any time and occasion, always offering a touch of elegance.
longevity and sillage are weak :( but the scent is good.

I think this fragrance was created to be the perfect gift. It's super fresh and super bright floral goodness with minimal complexity in a good way.
(I thought it was tuberose.)
It has a very acceptable performance for the price, and it's almost impossible not to find it in the first store.
Oh, and when I say price, it's usually more expensive on the main website, but this thing is always on sale somewhere.

One of the freshest, most beautiful Jasmine - Honeysuckle scents I've ever tried.

A beautiful, luxurious floral scent with British style from Burberry. It's like a trip to London full of fog and drizzle, with beautiful White Flowers gardens behind ancient paths. Both classic and modern, I imagine this is a lady wearing an elegant white or black dress like Audrey Hepburn, holding an umbrella and walking through a flower garden in the rain. Wear Burberry London on rainy days, buy a bouquet of fragrant flowers, take a walk through the ancient streets and you will see how magical this scent is. The whole of ancient, beautiful London falls into your eyes, as if London on rainy and foggy days smells like this.

Rating: 9/10, although the longevity on my skin is quite poor, every time I wear Burberry London, people compliment me and ask “What perfume smells so good?”. This is my Signature Scent, I hope Burberry never stops producing it!!!
I like it but I can't see myself wearing such a mature and heavy scent. It smells like a woman over 45, in the best way possible , a classy London woman.

Easy to wear Jasmine that bursts open with citrus freshness. At first it was all jasmine, but still in moderation. Later, I got more of the citrus brightness which really balances out the heavy jasmine and keeps it from getting too intense and weepy (like, say, Gucci Bloom, which is just too much indolic jasmine). Very pretty.

A very successful blind buy. Saw this on offer in TK Maxx for £19 for the 30ml so decided to give it a try. I have many perfumes but I seem to always come back to those with white flowers and in particular tuberose. This is like a breeze of white flowers, a mere hint with a dash of citrus. There is something very comforting about it. It does have a bit of a fresh shampoo scent but in a good way. I am now going to buy the 100ml. A great every day fragrance.

I had bad memories with this fragrance...
It's remind me of bad time in my life

To me this is a concentrated, slightly sweet and citrusy Jasmine tea in a bottle. Such a nice scent. Extra enjoyable in autumn and spring.
Great protection on me, has a medium lasting power. But I really don’t mind

I have been looking for a feminine white floral scent similar to Ellie Saab for months but didn't want to pay $100+ for a small bottle. But judging by the positive reviews here and elsewhere, Burberry London fit my ideal vision of a multi-seasonal honey white floral which was elegant and professional....all without being offensive. This is beautiful. I will be taking this with me on business trips or meetings. It definitely gives off boss lady vibes.

One of my favorites!
I love this perfume so much. It gives me classy and playfull wibes at the same time. ❤️
This perfume is more powdery than I'd like. a disappointing blind buy.

Today mainstream notes that still make you feel very extraordinarily beautiful. I wore it once with a cold limiting my sense of smell. I randomly caught a whiff of the scent and fell in love all over again. The first spray delivers as much as the dry down. Very gorgeous everyday fragrance. It's a little more pricey but there are more expensive perfumes that don't deliver half as much.

Oh the sweet London Burberry, suits for every occasion any day any time! It gives me clear and classy London vibes, it's like one cannot ignore the scent and the presence of yours if you are wearing it. The sophistication and elegance comes with it and one can own it with confidence! Love the entire formulation and projection, outstanding fragrance and one of the best!

Ok first of all, I hate roses and jasmine, but for a perfume with both it surprisingly does it well. I'd say though it does feel mature, like a white woman in her older 40s/50s, so I tend to not reach for it much anymore. It is sweet, but for me the roses are kind of overpowering and I don't tend to get anything past the top/middle notes. Doesn't smell very citrus either, almost completely floral for me.
so sweet and ambery! such a great sweet blend of florals and citrus. This scent is so nice for anytime, any occasion!

I can see partially why people compare Burberry London for women to Pure Poison, since they are both white florals and they both have citrusy nuances to them. Burberry London for women though isn't as woody or as citrusy as Pure Poison is to me.

I mostly smell both jasmine and honeysuckle in this fragrance, with honeysuckle being the more predominant note of the two. I get a hint of citrus from the tangerine and the clementine in this but not a lot of it and I can't really smell the rose, peony or sandalwood in this at all. I also have to say that I've never smelt tiare flowers before so I can't comment if I smell it here or not, though I have heard people say it's apparently similar in smell to jasmine? This fragrance also becomes slightly more citrusy towards the drydown on me.

I find this perfume very feminine, elegant and youthful in an innocent kind of way. I could imagine a beautiful late medieval French princess in a wildflower garden wearing this in the spring while all of the flowers are in bloom and the sweet bees and beautiful irridescent hummingbirds are pollinating the flowers. The princess would be wearing a blue dress with a fleur de lys pattern and an ermine fur trim and she'd be plaiting her long wavy strawberry blonde hair, while decorating it with small honeysuckle and jasmine flowers.

I got about 8 ½ hours of wear on my skin and I had moderate sillage, giving me a very nice scent bubble. I got this perfume for a song and it was a very good blind buy at Chemist Warehouse of this discontinued perfume... there was no tester at all but I was able to buy it for $50 AUD! I really wanted a perfume that actually smelt like honeysuckle flowers and though not a soliflore, this comes fairly close to it.

Because of all of that, I'd give this perfume an excellent 9/10. It's a beautiful white floral and honeysuckle girl's dream come true!

Dear @ Lotte_Liese, thank you so much. Your explanation is truly helpful. Yes I believe that Burberry London gave me such a classy feelings, and it's much more elegant, that what I remember from 10 years ago when I tested it back then. But I needed a help to refresh my memory 😊 thank you again

Dear Rama Rama, believe me when I say that Gucci bloom and Burberry London do not share the same DNA, they are similar in that they both share the jasmine note, but they express this note differently.
Burberry London opens as tangerine citrus fresh and then the two main notes- honeysuckle and jasmine take centre stage. Pink floral notes from rose and peony make appearances but do not overpower the two main notes. The patchouli note is not noticeable until it dries down, but even that is pleasant as it becomes more musky, but still retains its white floral bearing.
Gucci bloom on the other hand is tuberose over done to the point it does not smell like a natural tuberose, there is jasmine, and it can be smelt, but to me it is often overpowered by the tuberose note. Gucci's Bloom was a solid dislike to me, but I very much appreciate the elegance of Burberry's London.

Please can someone tell the difference between Burberry London and Gucci bloom 🙏
I know how Gucci bloom smell, but as for Burberry London I had it many years ago I don't recall the smell but I remember tons of Jasmine which is the same vibes cross my mind when I hear Gucci bloom a Jasmine bomb so what's the difference?!

If I smelled this without being awate of the notes I could've sowrn amber would be part of its composition! This is a jasmie forward fragrance with a sweet citrusy opening. The clementine is so realistic, it's one of my favorite parts of the fragrance even if you only get it for a little bit. However, the most enjoyable part to me is definitely the drydown, SO creamy!

Because of that warmth I mistook for amber, I had the idea of layering this with casablanca from Swiss Arabian and oh my god, caramel pairs so well with it! It results in a comforting, classy, not too loud, but yet very interesting scent profile.

I get excelent longevity with this perfume, up to 8-10 hours with just 2 sprays. Projection however, I feel is not that great, and is probably closer to a more intimate kind of sillage.I live in a very warm environment (Mexico) and I still wear this during summer wihtout any issues!

All in all, this perfume is a 10/10 for me! For how divine this smells, you'd expect it to be a more expensive fragrance for sure.

I picked this up for a steal at local pharmacy. It is one of those interesting fragrances that smells different each time I wear it, especially with what comes across in the top. Sometimes it is the most delicious tangerine clementine citrus and at other times the very realistic honeysuckle is more prominent.

Ultimately to my nose it dries down to a pleasant jasmine fragrance. I think it is well blended. The citrus departs quickly for me so it is very much a floral dominant fragrance on my skin.

I lived in London for a time when I was a lot younger and I think there are other fragrances from Burberry that evoke the city a lot more. For example Burberry Brit Rhythm. Burberry London is much more, English garden in the summer sun, scent coming off the flowers, while sipping a delicious orange soft drink, kind of vibe.

I look forward to trying it in the really warm weather because it has poor longevity on me in the cooler weather. Still, a lovely refined smelling floral scent that is worth spraying, especially when it can be bought so cheaply.

In my opinion, this fragrance doesn’t match the male counterpart or the design of the bottle. It’s a simple but charming perfume that is very feminine. The jasmine notes make it elegant, but I don’t find them too overwhelming or oldschool. I wish the longevity was better.

Nice floral perfume without being over-sweet.
Projects moderately up to 4hs.
Review is not from my skin.

This fragrance is a lovely choice if you like heady white florals that gets tempered by a splash of citrus. I enjoy this scent in warmer months as I find myself looking for warmer scents during autumn and winter. That said, this is a lovely scent that dries down to a powdery musky scent over time. So if you like white flowers, jasmine, and powdery scent, this one is worth a try.
same scent profile of gucci bloom, l'interdit, my way, which is all over the place lately.
I love the smell, but why on me stay just 5 minutes? Even when I spray it I don' t smell it
your average strip mall perfume store scent. this is what comes to mind when i think ‘perfume.’ not amazing nor terrible, just a simple powdery floral fragrance.

Was just sampling a ton of fragrances at Sephora and this stood out. So much that I just ordered from micro perfumes to play around with. This is fresh, but far from boring. Opens with fresh and sweet honeysuckle, and has a bit of subtle flirtiness, while still being a sophisticated scent. The musk and sandalwood balance out the fresh and sweet notes. This could be worn any season during the day in my opinion, but I think spring - early fall would be best.

it is straight up citrus and jasmine in my nose. i didn't get any rose or sweetness. it's a fresh perfume and so unisex in my opinion, may give it to my bf. to have a good longevity, u need to spray a lot around 10 sprays. it may choke you at first but the longevity may be better

For me, this is jasmine bomb – on-the-nose, essential-oil level jasmine. Too intense. After a while I can feel honeysuckle and it saves the impression for me. Several hours later, it morphs into tiare with some powderiness from musk. This is a gift for white flowers lovers, and especially for fans of jasmine.

Maybe this one should be worn on rainy days, as many reviews here suggest. Otherwise, might be too sweet. It is elegant and timeless with lifelike representation of flowers, and I do want to love this scent, but I guess I’m not the biggest fan of jasmine – not in this concentration, at least.

London stays on my skin until the evening and lingers in my hair the next morning. With jasmine sharpness gone it’s a gentle and sweet impression. Projection is pretty decent too. I had a chance to smell this fragrance on a colleague, and I caught a familiar scent from across the room, as soon as she entered – sweet and clear, as if wind brought it from blooming shrubs.

Overall, beautiful, but not my cup of tea.

this is such an elegant and regal fragrance. i am getting heavy dark academia vibes from this one. it's something i can see a prestigious student wearing on a rainy day.

the notes are blended perfectly and it's definitely very classy, sophisticated and "serious" while still remaining feminine. ♡💌
This is one of the most beautiful perfumes I have smelled. The strongest notes are those of honeysuckle and jasmine, and overall it smells like sweet natural white flowers.

Clean powdery and creamy office friendly scent.

It is one of those fragrance that is perfect to be a signature office scent. It is elegant, creamy, powdery and long lasting one the clothes a little bit less on the skin, I always take my flanker with me if I wear at work to reapply it when needed.

The creaminess of the Tiare Flower, Jasmine is perfectly combined to the citruses such as the Tangerine and the Clementine, as well as the pink florals such as the Rose and Peony. Making it a girly woman's fragrance. "Girly Woman's fragrance" by the flowery tone to it, it is not a childhood reminiscent scent or a childish perfume.
Then you get a subtle depth and powderyness with The Musk, Honeysuckle, Sandalwood and Patchouli. The Patchouli isn't strong on the blend, which, once again, makes me enjoy it's presence like in my other perfumes containing a small and subtle patchouli note.

I highly recommend giving it a try, the overall design is simple yet really elegant with that signature Tartan pattern from the house of Burberry. It smells so elegant and feminine you'll be the talk of the office with such an effortless perfect blend.

It is a 7/10 because it lasts less than 3 hours on my skin, but good on my clothes. The sillage is really decent though.

I've been looking for an affordable white floral perfume for the warmer days of spring and I blind bought this based on the reviews written here. For me, though I smell some citrus in the first few minutes of application, this smells mostly of honeysuckle and jasmine and stays that way for the entirety of its life on the skin, which is 3 to 4 hours. I'm still on the fence whether I like this enough to keep the bottle in my collection. Sillage is great and people said they were able to smell me from a great distance but considering I literally dosed myself in London before leaving the house it would be unusual if it was weak

Imagine jasmine wrapped in a hazy fog of tiare flower, and when your nose goes searching for the jasmine you knew was there (because you just smelt it, didn't you?), you find it disappeared in a licorice-y pool outside the English Gardens while you were drinking orange pekoe...

I think this type of perfume is set for specific moods if that makes sense? It has something very sophisticated, classic and maybe more vintage feel to it? I usually wear Perfumes depending on my mood, and for this one specifically I enjoy it most on rainy days, fall afternoons, or trips to the library. It has something gentle yet very memorable about it, which is why I adore it a lot! However, I can understand the people who are not a big fan of it, as it is a very specific smell that might be too "old" or "powdery" for them. I personally adores it and if you are someone who enjoys sophisticated, calming scents I would 100% recommend it

I’ve been looking for a good honeysuckle perfume and bookmarked this to buy a full bottle at a later time. I just got into perfume collecting 8 months ago and have plenty of white floral perfumes like Tom Ford Velvet Orchid (magnolia and jasmine), Valmont Jazzy Twist (magnolia and tubereuse), Perris Monte Carlo’s Jasmin de Pays (jasmine), Zara Tokyo (iris), and DKNY Golden Delicious (Lily of the Valley). So I’m not sure if getting this would be redundant for now. I’ll wait until I’ve exhausted one of the others.

Honestly, I’m afraid that this will be a boring mash-up of Penhaligon’s Coveted Duchess Rose, which has rose and mandarin orange, with Velvet Orchid without the rum. But some Burberry perfumes like this one are extremely affordable, as a 50 ml of this goes for £23 on Makeup UK.

This perfume is very elegant and classy ! Perfect for night out
It doesn’t has a perfect longevity but it worths to be in my selection !!

It was a blindbuy for me. I love jasmine and this was on sale so I had to give it a try. It didn't disappoint me. Such a lovely jasmine bomb, sweet, mysterious and clean, almost soapy.
The jasmine is very pretty here, it reminds me of gucci bloom, mugler alien or dior pure poison. (Not the whole scent, only the jasmine, these are pretty different perfumes overall.)
Very long lasting, it lasts all day on my skin and the sillage is amazing as well.
It's maybe a bit dated, but in a classy, timeless way.
I wouldn't say it's a safe blindbuy, but if you like jasmine and stronger, sweeter and somewhat clean fragrances you totally need this in your collection.
It's also signature scent worthy as it has the perfect balance and it's versatile.

perfect every day perfume for me
10/10
smells lush and expensive

I love to wear this one during spring and summer. On my skin it gives an inoffensive scent of sweet tangerine. Which makes me think of a glass of lemonade during a sunny day. Together with fresh florals of jasmine, tiare flower, tuberose and honeysuckle. I always feel quite energetic and optimistic when I wear it. Defintely one of my "feel good" scents. It also has great performance!

If you are thinking it’s going to be anything like the pear dessert that is Brit, you are in for a surprise. To my nose, London has a heavy, vintage-y feel to it. It opens with tangerine and settles into clementine, and with having the citrus on top and the middle, you can catch it throughout the wear of the fragrance. Jasmine and tiare flower add a heavy, floral tropical vibe. Sandalwood and patchouli add additional depth. It’s complex for a designer perfume and I enjoy how the notes play out, but not my favorite.

Burberry London is such a safe, clean and feminine perfume for ladies. It is my daily going-to-the-office perfume because you only need two / three sprays and it will last ALL day long. Personally I love fresh white floral scent and this is one of my overly used perfume for going out (day and night). Some people hates it for being a granny scent maybe because of the white flowers but for me it smells very pretty & sweet (not sugary sweet which is a plus for me). Great quality for its relatively low price point (compared to other designer perfumes). That’s why Burberry London is a Love for me.
This smells so soapy, like Irish spring soap. And nothing else. However it does last forever and 3+ days on clothes but I can’t get over the Irish spring in it 😂

Me personally loved jasmine fragrance, and I loved this perfume so much!. The scent is beautiful, elegant, and classy. I think this perfume was unisex? since I'm a guy and wearing this. Totally worth to buy!.

I am not crazy about most traditional juicy white florals, like gardenia or tuberose, but I adore tiare flower. On its own this perfume is kind of a lot just because it is almost linear tiare with a sprinkling of musk and sandalwood, but that makes it stupendously good for layering. It can brighten up heavier scents or bring them to the tropics. It is pretty by itself, but for me in my wardrobe it really does a lot of heavy lifting to liven up other scents. The tiare note makes me feel very happy though, it is creamy and sublime, almost cloyingly so, yet it manages to stay on the safe side of that line.

Got myself a bottle recently as I had good experiences with blind buying a few other Burberry perfumes (except for Beat). At first I thought this was a little meh and boring, but I do find myself reaching for this before going to work when I'm not too sure what else to wear, but want to smell professional and polished. So I would regard it as my reliable and trusty work week perfume, with good lasting power and enough interesting notes to enjoy smelling whiffs of it throughout the day. I also like the fabric covering, it's cute, and feels a bit more secure when I'm handling the bottle after putting on moisturizer and won't smudge the glass too!

Quite simply, this is happiness in a bottle for me. Delicate fresh white flowers sweetened with a bit of juicy tangerine and clementines. The rose and patchouli are almost undetectable to my nose, so if you are usually avoidant of those notes I think this perfume will still work for you! The dry down is a soft floral musk and this perfume has great performance with moderate sillage.

I wouldn’t say that I feel particularly luxurious while wearing this, but it does make me feel classy, fresh, pretty and put together! I personally don’t find this to smell mature as some have stated below, but I could see how this might attract a slightly older audience; this fragrance has more of a classic vibe than it’s more youthful fruity floral contemporaries.

Burberry London is inoffensive, fresh, delicate, slightly juicy and well balanced. Suitable for most occasions and seasons, but really shines in the spring and summer. A little gem in my collection!
Very pretty scent. Floral with slightly citrus clean woody musk. I tend to reach for this when it rains for some reason. Great office scent as it's not overly powerful but still long lasting.
Most compliments grabbing perfume I ever wore .

Loved this scent, but lately I find it dated, old scent and a bit cloying. or this could be a problem for people who collect many perfumes… you find others your favorite not until a new one comes 😂 and some of the old ones doesn’t smell like they used to when you bought them. 😬

A favorite white floral of mine! It's classic for a reason- delicate and feminine, sweet and fresh. Opens very floral (emphasis on white florals) with a hint of tangerine, then it has a clean musk dry down. Longevity is amazing, lasts me for around 6-8 hours.
One of my favorites perfumes. Fresh, floral, doesn't give me a headache. Perfect for everyday use.
Somehow the floweral and citrus notes make it totally soapy to my skin, as if I just took a shower in a cheap hotel. I tried to like it but really just cant.

I so wanted this to be my new favourite, but it smelled like the cerutter/cigars my grandmother used to smoke, smokey leather. No honeysuckle just this salty smoky smell. Totally not what i expected. Smell stayed for a long time and stayed the same. Maybe just a bad chemistry reaction. So glad I did not just blind buy.

Burberry London is such a gorgeous fragrance!
It's bright and feminine, uplifting and lasts well. A wonderful harmonious balance of fruity and flowery . She's juicy, with the gorgeous sparkly brightness Tangerine brings to any fragrance, along with a very nicely rounded Clementine without the sharpness it sometimes imparts.
These citrus have a wonderfully creamy, almost cashmerian presence.
Playing an equal and oh so feminine part of the main show are the artistically balanced white florals. Good quality Jasmine and Frangipani like Tiare flowers of excellent quality are the lead sisters here, rich and sweet but by no means sickly.

The patchouli is absolutely muted under the rich blanket of long lasting fruity florals. I like patchouli, but for those who don't, worry not, as it is balanced well and plays fair with the sweet musk and rounded sandalwood, making for a fairly linear fade out, although the Rose makes a little more noise here than at the juicy start.

A beautiful fun sweet juicy white floral without being sugary, without being gourmand, without smelling done or generic, and is absolutely not cloying.
It's a bright happy go lucky fragrance.

I have it and love it so much I bought it for my niece, who also loves it.

I think Burberry London is a safe blind buy for a feminine fruity white floral summer/spring fragrance. A crowd pleaser with real character and uniqueness.
Definitely safe to buy for a woman with a bright youthful personality, and at a great price point.

Really lovely find. I feel like these days you don’t get too many straight-up floral fragrances (they’re usually floral woody, citrus floral etc) but this puts the rose and jasmine at the forefront. Very feminine, perhaps slightly mature but I’d say anyone 25+ can get away with it. Leans slightly more to cold temps but it’s pretty versatile; I could see it in summer or winter and day or night. Great longevity and sillage. Seems to be selling pretty cheap so great value for money.

Picked this up by accident, had I tested beforehand, I would have never bought it. Now I can say that I am happy for this accident as it definitely grew on me. For me this will always remain a winter scent - representing the anticipation of the spring and the times the sun grows stronger melting the snow. I don't like wearing it on rainy days though, somehow it feels too much. It is a veryyyy long lasting and mature scent :)

I tested Touch Weekend Her and Her Intense by Burberry and I liked all of them. Now I am eager to test London. Though it is an old scent (from 2006), the reviews show it is still popular. I will edit when I try it, the name London is kinda enchanting

Disagree with ppl calling it mature. It definately suits all ages and I remember the school corridor smelling like Burberry London in 2017. Every girl whore it!
The perfume is very inoffensive and powdery. You can sense the fruits in it, but not in a crispy clean way. I'd say the musk/jasmin/florals are the most outstanding. You don't really sense the citrus notes at all.
The best way to describe this scent is comforting, like a warm blanket.
10/10, this fragrance will forever be in my heart.

I really want to love this, but it's just so powdery that it makes my throat itch. It does dry down to let the white florals come through, but it has a bitterness to it that I just can't love. It might be the musk. Definitely not a delicate scent at all. Siliage and longevity are great though. An occasional perfume, not everyday.

I started wearing this perfume at 15 years old and still love it 6 years later. I know some people think its quite mature and more stable for 50+, but I wholeheartedly disagree. I think the patchouli and musk with the white florals make it wearable for any age. It's very versatile and inoffensive. This used to be my everyday scent for years. I have always gotten so many compliments whenever I wear it, people said it was addicting. Personally I'm into niche fragrances, but this is one that will always have a place in my collection. If you're thinking about buying it I highly recommend. Maybe do a skin test first, but it's simple enough to be a blind buy (in my opinion).

Powdery white florals with bitter musk and very little fruit. It's very mature smelling suitable for someone 60+. The silage is a BEAST and this is very long lasting. Will be returning because it ultimately wasn't for me but please note that if you are looking for a clean white citrus floral please consider Chanel Gabrielle because this is veryyyyy bitter

I may have reviewed this already, but I finished my bottle of this and have to have another asap! I’ve tried a lot of different fragrances since buying this last year and it’s one of my very favorites.
I mistakenly bought this, thinking it was Brit, but the reviews were good so I tried it. At first, it was a strong like. Then I wasn’t sure. It was different than most fragrances I had or had tried. As time went on, I grew to love it. It feels classy and elegant to me. It’s the perfect scent to spray on a scarf or cozy sweater. I think it works for an everyday scent but would be very appropriate for a wedding, dinner with the in-laws, etc. It’s slightly sweet and fruity at first, but not juvenile. It’s cold, but approachable. I thought it would be a spring/summer scent until I read that it shines in cold weather. And it does!
The longevity is about 5-6 hours on me. The silage and projection are moderate. The value is excellent though. Sephora sells a 1.7oz bottle for $85 USD, but you can easily find a 3.3oz bottle under $60. London and Miu Miu led me to discover that I prefer floral woody musks over gourmands.

This is a sharp sweet floral and a classic one too.
Good for going out on the crowd not to offend people with your perfume. An office, teachers enclosed space scent. Classic Elegant for me same as the burberry brit edp and edt; an old all time fave.

I had a vague memory of London as one of those pleasant crowd-pleasing perfumes that I didn't need and certainly didn't crave at the time. My opinion was positive even if somwhat without definition. I like sunny happy perfumes full of creamy white and yellow flowers and I'm preparing myself to the grey cold weather ahead. So I got a bottle of London.

There is a great possibility that it was shaken to oblivion in transport and probably reformulated too. I didn't recognise it at all. I'm still quite in chock, this smells like bubblegum to me. You know those big, pink, sweet ones that are a mounthful, perfect for making big obnoxious ballons that pop loudly an drive parents and teachers insane. You can not behave in civilized manner whith those in your mounth, no matter your age, you feel insolent and bratty and the need to exercise your jaw nearly to dislocation is overwhelming. Yes, those bubblegums. Nothing to do with today's politicly correct spearmint flawored sugar free little, hm, gums.
Tangerine and clementine are lovely, I'm not sure I recognise any honeysuckle or tiare. Slightly animalic and plasticky jasmine adds another layer of irreverence to the mix. I like it, it makes me feel young and punk, but I don't know if I can stand to wear it. I'm not that person anymore. There is still a possibility that all this screechiness will calm down and enter more stirred than shaken state of existence.
A wonderful jasmine scent. At times, I also detect notes of white tea, even though they are not listed. Perfect for office wear.

The scent itself is my favourite, I adore jasmine and rose, but this perfume is a huge disappointment as it doesn't last longer than half on hour on me. My previous Burberry perfumes lasted whole day, this one makes me very sad.

My first musk love!! I remember being obsessed with this fragrance when it came out. I would go to the mall often and smell all the fragrances at the department store and this one always made me stop in my tracks. There is just something scrumptious and cozy about this white floral, citrus, and musk blend. It smells divine to me! I wasn't able to get my hands on a bottle as a teen, but did get one a few years ago from fragrance(net). I love wearing this scent in cold weather. I think Burberry London for her is often overlooked nowadays. Don't sleep on this super affordable floral musk!

This is a light sweet floral, with a clean musky finish, like a more innocent and less sexy Narciso Rodriguez for her. It lasts well on my skin, doesn't project much, so it would be a very safe scent to wear to work or travel with.
Really cozy but fresh and balanced.
A little gem.

Learning to love this, it’s really pretty and (as a 22 year old) feels nostalgic for some reason. Maybe some older girl wore this when I was young. It’s the first white floral I have in my tiny “collection.” I love everything in it except maybe the patchouli? I’m still learning what I like / don’t like. But like someone said below I love really love it when I pair it with a vanilla.

Floral Petrichor

On my skin it smells softly floral with a watery petrichor accord. I didn't expect the petrichor smell or watery notes at all. I don't get any honeysuckle and the citrusy notes are very faint. It is the kind of perfume you wear in summer when you want to feel fresh and miss rainy days. An inoffensive delicate floral perfume suitable for a day at the office.
Good jasmine-centred fragrance. I find it a tad bit sharp, but I can't complain for the price!

I wore this perfume in high school, and I remember getting compliments all the time.

A very soapy white floral, this is definitely a fall/winter scent, but it is beautifully soft and timeless. I think almost anyone could pull it off! Not too casual, but still good for everyday wear. This is a perfect signature scent - I don't know why it isn't more popular! To me it is very old Burberry - lots of plaid and khaki colors, classic, almost old-fashioned. I could see someone loving this if they were into that sort of look.

Beautiful . You must like florals to enjoy her. Bright, white floral, that has sharp edges (which I enjoy in this) and there is a detectable juicy citrus undercurrent from the tangerine and clementine. She’s very mature, with a light vintage quality. However, I may not keep this one. Only because I feel this would wear me. It would have to be a special occasion, like college graduation, formal wedding, anniversaries at a five star Michelin restaurant. In conclusion she’s bright, juicy, mature and EXPENSIVE.

I tested this a few days ago. It's so good that I decided to buy it. Now I´m waiting a package to arrive. On my skin I get mostly tangerine, clementine, tiare flower and some woody notes, in the backround also other flowers. I can smell coconut, I think that comes from tiare flower. Not everyone mentioned tiare flower, but I can smell it clearly. This can be worn every season and every time of the day. Some years ago I didn't like it, but I guess my taste wasn't so developed then, now this is love. I think it will be one of my favourite scents. I have also Burberry Brit for her, it's also very good, but this is better.
This is so pretty for a floral (I’m not a floral girl). I get honeysuckle and peony with a little musk and citrus. It smells expensive and slightly mature

A slightly citrusy white floral that reminds me of body spray. The tangerine/clementine note is the best part, as it is very realistic, but the rest of the scent is a tad generic. It gets better as it dries down. This would make an absolutely amazing room spray.

Okay so...

I ran from this originally because I've been running from London, because I've grown bored of it after literally growing up there and spending weekends right in the centre.

I'm a Londoner but I'm also pretty extra.
And that's why this fragrance is perfect.

The obscene florals, and almost cheeky tangerine... honestly it just plays with you, flowing through and around the honeysuckle.

What people don't realise is that London is pretty humid, so you need something light and breezy to carry you through.

Combined with some linen (linen suit if we're going to work), this is a blast of refined British elegance.

You can dress this fragrance up and down.
It can be trashy sweet, like the old 00s Indie scene, or refined enough to go to an Oxbridge Ball or formal x

This perfume gives me preppy chic vibes. Old money (maybe long lost) and sophistication that sometimes comes with it. When I wear this I feel put together and professional. BUT only 2 sprays for me, this perfume is strong! The scent is light in spirit but has a strong presens.

I get honeysuckle, tangerine and jasmine. For me strong jasmine can be difficult (turns indolic) but in this the strong jasmine stays beautiful. Tiare I don't get, but I think it gives body to the fragrance.

I LOVE this perfume and I will always have it in my collection. I often notice that I smell some white floral scent and start thinking what I would change in it. The result being Burberry London. <3

My first bottle of London is soon finished, and will definitely be replaced. I like to buy a new perfume for every new summer vacation of a certain length, and this one was the one I bought to be my companion to Vietnam in 2019 with my husband and kids. I used it every single day, and thus it became The scent of Vietnam. After the holiday I would give the perfume a short break, and use my other fumes again, and when I after a while pull it out again, I get transported to the holiday destination immediately! You should try that. Anyways, London is for me this ultimate happy, carefree, adventurous, smiley scent. It gives me immediate lift-me-up, and the days when I use it, always become brighter and sunnier.

Burberry London will always have a place in my collection and in my heart.

London was my signature scent some 13 years ago. When I first sprayed it on I just knew we were meant to be a couple and that was that. I used it exclusively untill I ran out of my bottle.
A few days ago I saw it online heavily discounted so bought it for old times sake. Note to myself: never do it again! I remembered the scent all wrong. I thought it was patchouli heavy - instead it is flower heavy. I remembered it to be spicy - it is sweet instead. Now I find it too mature and don't understand why was my 33 year old self so smitten with it.
Well, I will try it again when the weather turns cool in autumn as it is mainly a cold weather parfume. The performance is still outstanding tho, London lasts long on the skin with good sillage. It is a pity I don't really like it now.

Starts like a less nauseating Scandal. I tried to spray it three times on my skin to see if the floral notes would appear upon drydown but nope, it's just honeysuckle with sweet citrus growing faint every time.

Ok, I wrote My first review after I first Applied “her” and was overwhelmed by this sharp masculine scent.
Once it mellowed it matured into a pleasant modern floral with lasting power and a hint of fruity sweetness. This is a complex sophisticated thoroughly modern fragrance. Ideal for daytime, maybe at the office or just hanging about.
Don’t judge this fragrance without giving it a chance to mellow. It releases its warmer notes, like musk, sandalwood, patchouli, it becomes quite pleasant.
And a little goes a long way. I can see purchasing a larger size
I can’t get past the honeysuckle.

I'm a huge Burberry fan and liked this at first. I love strong floral perfumes. I had the oddest experience the 2nd time I put it on, I started to pick up on the honeysuckle and couldn't un-smell it. I despise sticky florals, and honeysuckle can be one of them. From that point on I couldn't stand this perfume, all i smell is heavy, cloy, sweet tackiness. Hard pass on this one, it's the only Burberry I dislike this much.

Terrible. I cannot agree with the notes. It smells synthetic kind of gasoline.
Im sorry, i dislike it completely.

Fragrance for classy, confident and carefree woman, but more 40+ than for someone 20+. Passed to my mom.

They are long lasting. Honeysuckle and tangerine gives the "younger" vibe, but middle notes prominent with jasmine make the scent for someone just a tad more experienced with life than me. Carefree-ness comes from jasmine, too - from my perspective it has tendency to "invite" you to smell the perfume more. It does not have the "suffocating" phase, like Alien has for me.

I think I just found the scent of my life! Libre is currently my signature for work but I think it’s about to be replaced with this. I’m definitely getting the honey suckle, the musk & the tiare flower. I also just received narciso edp(white cube) these two together are magical!

This is the third fragrance from Burberry that's gone in my regular rotation in the last 6 months and I have thoroughly enjoyed that they're very much different from one another. The first was Brit - sweetly punchy and unassuming. Then came Weekend (seems like I'll wear anything Nathalie Lorson created) - herbaceous and rainy. Now there's London. Dominic Ropion has a well-earned reputation and London does not disappoint. I can't speak for how well the name suggests the city bc I've never been, but if this is what it smells like, I'll be moving there shortly.

I adore honeysuckle in perfumes and London begins with a hefty dose accompanied closely by some citrus that keeps things from venturing too far into "heady" territory, but it's a struggle. Gentle rose and peony wander in to lift things up a touch, but it's the jasmine that runs the show as the base notes start to become more noticeable and ground the florals in a damp, loamy garden that somehow reads creamy. London remains pretty linear from there. It has staying power and I'll enjoy it as a light floral musky skin scent at bedtime. I'll smell it again when the warm water hits my chest in my morning shower.

London is a keeper bc it's a wonderful, well-formulated, white floral beast and it lasts, without choking out your companions. It's a great value and has also been endeared to me by the compliments my children always give me when I wear it. I find it suiting our cool SoCal mornings and warm afternoons very well this spring. It lifts my spirits and lightens my heart so it'll be a permanent resident in my fragrance cabinet.

Very impressed with this perfume. It's a very sophisticated white floral fragrance, clean fresh soapy, lasts all day long and great projection. If you enjoy lanvin rumeur and white diamonds you will like this one too no doubt. This will go on my repeat buy list

I Love tiare flower and I think it’s good for spring. Fresh and sweet (not like sweets) perfume. It might be coming from smell of orange and other flowers…The scent is well mixed fresh flowerly, fruity scent with musk. I love it. It rests on my skin long…maybe around 5-6 hours. The price is quite reasonable. I got it at pharmacy. Up mood smell 🤗
对比所谓的“仙女香”ag忍冬，我觉得无论是气味表现还是价格，这只伦敦女都能完爆她。大大方方的湿润白花透着橘的甜美一路芬芳。虽然尾调是普通花麝，也比那支留香贼短中调开始变植物根茎，尾调全是黏腻吲哚的货色强。

Beautiful fragrance! It reminds me of everything I wanted Byredo's ***** Water and La Tulip to be. I will not buy that perfume since I am Romanian and the use of that word is not OK in my culture. This lasts a good 6 hours on my skin and longer on my clothes. Fresh, floral, and citrus all at one time. It is really beautiful and can be found at discount stores quite often.

This is a beautiful perfume to wear. It's such a delicious honeysuckle, jasmine scent, but it's powdery like sherbet at the same time. The only bugbear I have with this is it's name... To me it is far from London as a city. It's springtime in Sydney with jasmine dripping over fences and bougainvillea climbing up walls. This will be a forever favourite of mine.
On the paper, at first sniff it smells really similar to my way Giorgio Armani. Something 🍇... Not my type of perfume 😕

This is 1 of my fav perfumes ever, I love jasmine and jasmine scented fragrances, this perfume is predominantly a jasmine perfume, the jasmine note in this is beautiful and floral and prominent but not too overpowering at the same time, with a hint of citrus. I find this perfume to be very versatile, suitable for both younger and older women, you can wear it day or night, wear it every day or for special occasions, it really doesn't matter with this particular perfume. Overall this is a beautiful and elegant floral fragrance that's not too overpowering or intimidating, it's 1 of my absolute fav go-to perfumes to wear!

This was a blind buy that I desperately wanted — and tried — to like.

It starts off smelling like a pleasant cup of tea with hints of white floral and rose. The jasmine note comes out soon after and stays for the entire duration. It becomes a beautiful and soapy fragrance; it's potently powerful in florals, with just a hint of fruity. And yet, there is something about this perfume that smells somber.

This is what I imagine Lunafreya from FFXV would wear — a woman who conceals her fears and despair with a confident façade. London is the embodiment of a seemingly delicate and kind, yet ambitious and powerful leader who readily makes calculated and convoluted decisions to reach their end goal.

It has a large sillage and is extremely long-lasting. It's fitting for anyone who wishes to wear a strong and powerful, attention-catching fragrance. This is certainly an attractive fragrance on others. Unfortunately, the abundance of white florals is nauseating and headache-inducing to me. I still find it beyond cloying in cold weather. So while I appreciate how well the notes of this fragrance blend together, I cannot stand smelling such a robust fragrance on myself for hours.

Timeless scent. Masculine, aromatic , spicy, woody fragrance (I also get a whiskey accord)
Recent batches are a joke, I get 3h longevity max.
If you have an old bottle keep it; new bottles aren't worth the.

Let me do a big mea culpa right here. My initial impression of this was lukewarm and downright dismissive. I very nearly got rid of my bottle, but wore it the other night and I was completely captivated. It’s creamy and fresh and masculine without being overly macho, not that that’s a bad thing. Timeless is a word you’ll see associated a lot with this one. I do think this would be cloying if oversprayed or in very high heat though. This will most likely become a staple of the autumn/winter rotation. Pure class.

I am shocked that this fragrance isn't talked about more. Its super fresh, spicy, citrusy, woody - reminds me of a barbershop or what a "man would smell like". Is it the most modern smelling fragrance? I wouldn't say so, its a bit dated, but it still smells amazing IMO. Great projection, lasts about 6 hours on my skin, and is great value for the price.

This is a fragrance that I will be restocking on for the rest of my life.

Signature-scent worthy, versatile, masculine, cheap. This is really a dumb reach scent that hardly fails for the 6 hours it lasts. Good on skin, very good on fabric. I liked it at first snif, but I've been falling in love with it the more I use it.

Timeless quality scent. It's hard for me to discern any single notes, but overall the blend is fantastic. Moderate longevity with fairly decent projection. This is a "dumb reach" scent for me, as I can use it for virtually any occasion. Fairly cheap (price wise, not the quality) too
Its a classic. Far superior to Coach. Multi-Seasonal. Good price from a good house. Very good smelling and sexy but not ostentatious. Appropriate for most occasions.

This is by far one of my favorite scents of all time. It’s classic and timeless and yet doesn’t smell like anything else. It’s sexy, classy, and not the least bit offensive. It may not grab you the way other scents may, but I think that’s why I love it. It’s just a great, classy, scent that can take you from work to an evening out with ease. It has a warmth and at the same time, some of the herbal and citrus top notes are a bit cold. At today’s price, this is a great blind buy for those who have never had it, in my opinion.

The lynx/Axe Jungle fresh is the perfect dupe of this scent. Haven't worn the Burberry in months but got a nice bathroom gift set of bits and bobs for fathers day and immediately thought of this when sprayed the lynx. Awesome deodorant that goes perfect along with this for casual daytime wear! The things that excite you when one gets into their 40's lol.

Such a classic men's scent. Burberry have some crackers.

By my estimation, this is one of the most tastefully formulated masculine classics on the market, and I genuinely struggle to find any circumstance where this fragrance would not be appropriate.

It is decidedly masculine — the lavender, mint, and vanilla notes put this squarely in classic barbershop territory — but not overwhelmingly so by any stretch. I am certainly not opposed to these sorts of fougeres, lavender bombs, and traditional superdude fragrances — I am a Drakkar Noir, Fahrenheit, and Polo Green defender as much as anybody else — but this fragrance is more a tweed sports coat than a leather biker jacket, if that makes sense.

There really does seem to be a timelessness with this one that fascinates me to no end. It unquestionably presents like something you would have expected to smell thirty years ago, but by no means does it feel dated like some of its other designer peers (Obsession, I’m looking at you and shaking my head.) They aren’t on the note breakdown, but I feel like you do get a little bit of this tobacco/cinnamon/grapefruit trio that seemingly defined the 80s and 90s — but it is masterfully balanced with a sharp bite of bergamot and fresh florals that keeps it eminently wearable today. I genuinely think any man of any age can pull this off convincingly, and given how rare it is for a man to even wear a scent these days, I actually think it could have some surprising affect as a date night fragrance, too.

It is as safe a reach as there has ever been, but without compromising in complexity, which is nice to see compared to the ever-increasing trend of shorter and shorter note breakdowns from newer releases these days. I find myself picking up different characteristics throughout the day if I smell my wrist — and at least for me, it does in fact perform well enough to do that — and if you’re one to care about such things, I’ve gotten a compliment or seven from wearing this at work, at family dinners, and even relatively serious formal functions.

It is a truly legendary scent in the more moderate, temperate weather that you might see in the spring and fall, but the amber, vanilla, and sandalwood give this a surprising amount of punch as a cold weather performer, and at least for me, the bergamot, jasmine, and mint easily keep this from being overly sweet in all but the most oppressive of summer days; I might not reach for this on a July day in Arizona, all things equal. Anything under 90 degrees, though, and this fragrance stays very, very fresh on the nose.

Performance is not beast mode by any stretch, but at least on my skin, I’ll still catch whiffs of it every now and again at the very end of a work shift (this is easily on my Mt. Rushmore of inoffensive work reaches), which is pretty good for an EDT at this price point. It never projects more than an arm’s length, but it doesn’t disappear all that quickly either, and it lasts about as long as you could expect a fragrance at this concentration and note makeup to last. I almost don’t want this to be a performance monster; I almost think it’s part of the charm of this fragrance, the fact that it truly holds fast to the timeless cliche that a fragrance should be discovered, not announced, and accomplishes this goal without being a total ghost, either.

It might seem strange to wax this poetic about a fragrance that is, by my own admission, relatively average, but it is a representation of my philosophy on wearing fragrance condensed into liquid form — the most common male fragrance is body odour and you do not need to douse yourself in eight sprays of Ultra Male (love that fragrance, by the way, not slander) to bring attention to yourself when you walk into a room. It is vintage but holds up over thirty years later; it is masculine in a way that signals competence and intelligence more than flash and sex appeal; it is a dumb reach that does not come off like one whatsoever.

I think any young person starting a collection should have a bottle of this, honestly. I think that highly of it. It is fresh and warm all at once, and for a novice fragrance enthusiast, maybe one who is hoping to be wallet-conscious and get year-round performance out of it, I can’t endorse it enough…and I’m not even sure it’s my favourite men’s release from Burberry! (I swear they’re not paying me for any of this, I just might be one of the world’s most vocal Burberry Touch truthers of all time. Review incoming for that when I have time to write a novel about it.)

Classic, timeless, versatile, reliable. Love this one to death. 10/10.

Definitely fougere vibes. I get the hate from young people here, they're so passionate on hating that you can tell they're probably going back to this profile in 10 to 20 years. Id never wear this before my 35s or 40s.
Some things are just not for you, and that's ok, you don't have to hate on them.

I am not a fan of Burberry fragrances but I got this at a rack store for a ridiculous price and I am totally digging it.

Elegant, well put, classic manly scent.

Very uplifting after that morning shower.

No, not groundbreaking or "banger" as the kids like to say.
Smells like english Gentleman.Timeless classic i prefer not for office its very minty.But for outside its perfect
A nice fresh fragrance for summer time if its at the right price.

It’s not bad but I find it to be more suitable for older men. I really don’t expect anyone here to be familiar with the traditional romanian elderberry juice socată, but this smells exactly like that stuff to my nose.

This the second best summer fragrance ı have right next YSL MYSLF ı got so many compliments on this and its just a generic fresh citrusy scent. it lasts long, projects well (at least on me) and like ı said the smell is the generic citrus smell that everyone likes.
The scent is being dominated by some dirty weed note which makes it repulsive. Shocked to see so many favorable reviews. Even a garbage bin doesn't deserve to contain this atrocity.

Love this. Just got a 10 ml. sample to try and I'm quite happy. I get a nice barbershop slap to the neck with the after shave feel. Tobacco, conifer, and super clean. Appropriate for my 57 years. After my sample is gone I may consider this for a full bottle. Nice job Burberry.
generic scent with fresh citrus notes. my go-to scent for daily use in fall-spring season.

An excellent creation. Better for cool weather. Outdoorsy scent. Lasts a good 5+ hours, moderate to heavy projection. Lasts on clothes for a week or more.

Only but the authentic brand as I believe some may be knockoffs. The real brand is great.
Doesnt project nor last at all, but love this scent.

Very nostalgic scent for me, one of my first fragrances. Minty woody smooth fresh scent. Cheap these days and inoffensive. Weak-moderate performance. Not much to say, this smells like a cool early autumn day and night. Bonus points for my nostalgia, I love it. Objectively a good (not great) scent that I have very fond memories with.

9/10
Fantastic frag!

My dad’s cologne. I love it. I’ve veered away from fragrances marketed towards men in the past, but ever since I caught the perfume bug, I’ve been more open to smelling and even wearing them.

This is mild and refreshing. It gives an off-the-shower scent, but not the traditionally super musky or “masculine” kind that traumatized me for years. This draws me in, and I want more.

I absolutely CANNOT believe it was launched in 1995. It still smells modern and fresh. Although I need to get my nose on more men’s fragrances, this one is timeless.

Fresh, herbaceous, and delicate, with an almost frosted, mint pear-like sweetness. Not overly masculine, not dated or old school, just simple, beautiful and classic, in a clean, zen sort of way.

I first tried it in ‘07 and was fascinated with how different it was, compared to the mainstream fragrances I had experienced up to that point (was in my early 20’s at the time, have loved fragrances since I was 10). I bought a bottle in 2012 and still have the same one, though I’ve worn it a lot more in the last 5 years than I did previously.
I have a vintage bottle. Very underrated and beautiful!

Very aromatic, but has a slight synthetic smell and not very unique, and a very average performance but good as an overall everyday cologne but if you are into a sweet herby smell this is perfect for you.
Classic timeless citrus fragrance with a bit of woods. Newer batches smell sour
Masculine, barbershop cheapie that doesn't get enough love. Distant cousin to Platinum Egoiste. Any fans of classic masculine fragrances need this in their collection! 8.5/10 price considered.
Great cologne, smells like you just got a fresh hair and great all season fragrance. Projections is a solid 4 hrs but you will have to re apply.
Great blend, but overly synthetic - comparable to something like CK Eternity in terms of it being synthetic. Longevity is average at 6 hours. 6/10.

I've been picking up sample vials and decants of all sorts of fragrances these past few months looking for something new and exciting. I keep thinking that my next "signature" scent will be something niche. Something that, not too long ago, would have been outside of my price range. I keep coming back to Burberry, though. I wore Burberry Touch for Men for years. I still love it, but it's started to become overly cloying to my nose after the first hour or so. Burberry London for Men is my go-to scent for fall and winter evenings and nights. And now, Burberry Men is my versatile go-anywhere, do-anything scent. The opening is bracing and refreshing and reminds me of stepping outside on a cool spring or fall day when the sun is shining and it's just barely cold enough for breath to condense in the air. I think this scent is particularly suited to those transitional months, but I don't see any reason why it wouldn't work well in summer or winter, too.

Out of curiosity, I picked up a 10ml bottle of what I believe to be a 1991 version of this, which has the same (but miniaturized) bottle shape and a very similar smell, but with the old branding - it reads, "Burberrys of London for Men." I assume that it, at one point, smelled more or less the same as the modern incarnation of this fragrance, but in the small bottle I acquired, that phantom apple scent so many people get from this is less green and crisp and more brown sweet, and not necessarily in a good way. I figure the bottle I have just hasn't aged well, but it was an interesting difference.
This one doesn't have apple but it always reminded me of apples and woods.
Really good after a nice shower, it’s refreshing but not strong enough for my liking. I just like it to feel fresh.

Mature gentleman's fragrance. Brings to mind words like "dapper" and "debonair."

I think you can wear this one year-round. Good longevity and decent projection as well.

Lavender and citrus are prominent coupled with a lightly minty, green vibe and a subtle powderiness.

Not sure why this isn't called an "aromatic fougere," but it is similar to scents like Eternity for men and Dolce&Gabbana Pour homme.

Fresh, slightly soapy, sweet and slightly citrusy lavender bergamot with a hint of wood and musk, the rest of the notes are faint. "Versatile" yeah yeah but mostly masculine. Very poor longevity and sillage with smooth & juicy notes. The drydown is is vintage masculine and it is sooooo good. I might just get it. Very interesting. One of the most interesting fresh spicy scents i have come across.

One of the most versatile men's fragrances ever. You can never go wrong with this classic. Optimal for cooler daytime wear, but can be just as effective for a night out. Strong without offending, lasts the entire day, and has the perfect sillage. Will always have a bottle on hand.
Mature, autumn-friendly, and woodsy. Sweet, creamy, and smooth. This is a classy & luxurious scent for those on a budget.
A timeless, classic masculine fragrance. Very versatile. It's a shame that the performance is just average.

This was a great find for me. Really nice, classic cheapie; very pleasing combination of barbershop elements with some honey-sweet floral aspects. It can sometimes come across a little soapy, but not to the level of some other old-school frags I've tried. Not overly aggressive performance, but the longevity is pretty good.

And yes, Montblanc Legend Blue is almost a dead ringer for this..... and as they say, being copied is the highest form of validation.

I think Burberry Men is a perfect fragrance for work, and also super classy for daily wear. If you're into old-school masculine classics, you really can't beat this for the price.

NOTE – The older formulation in the red box and larger cap does project a bit more.
There's something magical about this fragrance in autumn when the leaves start to turn yellow and the first truly cold winds come. Timeless scent.
This is my favourite fragrance (scent alone). The performance is very weak sadly. Also it brings me such a nostalgic feeling

This scent is so inviting. Compliment magnet for me. Its something about this fragrance that keeps me coming back. Already done with my first bottle. Personal love from me

9/10 Scent
6/10 Longevity

Stay with me because this comparison may sound a bit off-kilter. But this fragrance has always smelt to me like stepping into a time machine and being transported to the peak of the print magazine era in the 90s. This scent is reminiscent of walking into a store in 1998 and opening up the crisp, freshly printed pages of a glossy color magazine or the satisfying moment when you peel the plastic off a newly printed purchase (not that this fragrance smells 'plasticky' at all).

I know printed magazines don't really exist out in the world in large numbers like they used to, so that comparison may be a bit lost on half the people who read this comment. But as a Gen Y this always reminds me of the smell of glossy, freshly printed magazines in the 1990s.

The new reformulated modern version is "okay", but trust me, if you really want to experience this fragrance in all of its glossy print glory, go hunt down one of the older bottles packaged in the red boxes.

Man, this also, for some reason, makes me distinctly think of air travel as a kid in the late 90s. Back in the days of 747s and being able to go up into the cockpit as a kid, perhaps I smelt it a lot around that era when I'd fly from Sydney to London to see family. Happy days, an extremely nostalgic scent.

As an aside I have always much preferred this over CK Eternity.

Smells Like: 1960s-era Michael Caine wearing a Mac Coat walking down a London street smoking a cigarette. Effortless swagger but very much in a "British" way, more restrained, confident but not American "brash". I feel like this fragrance was very much so purposely made for the Square Mile/Canary Wharf "new money" set of London finance bros in 1995, possibly in response to Platinum Egoiste being released two years earlier (though to my nose they smell nothing alike).

09/01/24 Edit: I recently reunited myself with the old Red Box (Tartan strip) formula. It's as good as I remember and FAR FAR, FAR superior to the current formula, which was my most recent bottle (I previously owned the Red Box formula in the early 2010s). Guys, go on the grey market and find the Red Box formula with "Burberrys Of London For Men" printed on the bottle NOT the current one that just has "Burberry For Men."

It didn't seem as drastic between the two as I hadn't smelled the old Red Box original formula in over a decade, but the two versions genuinely DO smell quite different from each other. The Red Box formula has SO much more punch and depth and smells much more smoother which is absolutely insane considering the ancient batch code on the old bottle I acquired. I hate to say this, but the current modern formulation has definitely been butchered from what this fragrance originally was. Testing them both side by side, one on each arm is night and day. If anyone comes across this comment, trust me, go pick up the Red Box batches before they become extinct.

This is one of my all time faves. One of my earliest purchases & the first true love fragrance I can remember. I bought this at Macy’s when it first came out. I was broke. I had to have it. I had just enough money to get a small bottle. That bottle turned into many more bottles. I still love it to this day. Clean & classy is what this scent exudes.

I do see some small elements of Platinum Egoiste in this like some have said, but they’re definitely completely different. Burberry is smoother & a bit softer. The cedar pops a little more & has a sweeter tone. Platinum Egoiste is crisper, a bit more sharp, & soapier than Burberry. They both smell like pure class & can be worn with a suit, or a t-shirt & jeans. They’re both very versatile scents so they have that in common.

I will always have a bottle of this as long as they make it. If I ever had a signature scent, this was it. Everyone back in the day knew what I was wearing. I even had cousins who bought it for their boyfriends because they loved it on me lol. It’s funny, but I almost feel like as I got older, this fragrance helped become a gentleman, because it was always there with me. Man, the memories this gorgeous fragrance brings back…

Came here to review this as one of my all time favourites. Just clean fresh, 'manly', tobacco note (at least I've always experienced it as tobacco, maybe it's musky ambery oakmossy lavender or something), some very clear bergamot in the beginning. It is honestly not obviously razzle dazzle clever, but I always feel good when I wear this, so perhaps it is. In my head it is a 90's image of what Michael Caine smelled like in the 60's or a Burberry Mac if it were a scent.

With those images in mind, it might be getting a bit old school now, but then stuff in this bracket - like daytime, work, clean, professional is (currently) trending sweeter or more obviously citrus in this kind of area of scents, or kind of WTF like all the blue clones, so this is cool with me, it's not overblown or heavy.

I just realised that it was created by Michael Almairac, so feel good for liking it without knowing, as Zino is also one I love, although that is more like undead Michael Caine in a velvet cape.

I was very impressed when I sprayed it at Sephora and went home. Afterwards, when I ordered it at home and smelled it, I was disappointed. It smelled very spicy and oldschool. There's something bothering me but I can't figure it out. Does anyone know?

For the price I paid at Marshals, this was a steal. Doesn't last long but it smells good while it lasts and honestly gets me compliments still. Office safe, friends and family safe, too subdued for special events but for someone more conservative it might be perfect

Its an ok office/everyday use fragrance nothing special.

7/10
Smells like McDonalds sprite

Good Basic Fragrance, Fresh, Woody, Minty, and floral. Good for spring and Fall.
6/10
