The more I write my reviews, the more a certain inevitable truth regarding this entire industry and community reveals itself to me - and always by happen stance. It's the strangest thing, and to be Frank (where has he gone??) my reviews suffer for it. They've become ramblings innay.

This wasn't going to be a full fledged review, but since I cannot get more out of Burberry London, since it's so basic, the review has written itself.

It's a very nice and warm, wholesome scent. But as you probably have read, it's not what I'm particularly after. In fact I don't know what I'm after in scents. I'm constantly exploring, I'm looking for something and I don't know what it is. Though I long to seek something deep and rich like the old days. But I don't want a long lingering dry down of oakmoss that easily cloys like the old days. I sense my tastes changing.

OK let's not be hard on ourselves, just the wallet ((WILL YOU PULL OUT THAT BLOODY VIOLIN) calm down John Cleese, you've never said that though a viola would suffice).

They've destroyed all our old favourites to function/perform like anything new. Reformulations are done for a reason, they're not just to cut costs but to obviously keep up with the changing landscape of this unbelievably expensive enthusiast's hobby. They make them more user friendly and welcoming to the latest generation whose balls will never descend, whose chest hair will never see the light of day.

The people who do not understand that society used to be amazing, brilliant and polite - much like Burberry. Now it's if you're rich you must be an arsehole and let it be known you're rich, ergo an arsehole. Seriously could use a violin now.

But mates, I wish somebody had informed I needed this years ago - 8 or 9 years ago in particular.
A man simply does not brag about Burberry London, though it's another tool in his shed. You must own it and if you don't know why you're missing something from your set of tools, it's the Burb. Ramble on.
8/10

I am extremely happy with this! Blind bought it on clearance for a great price at a local shop before a night out, only having read some reviews online and seen the notes. It smells phenomenal... IF this sort of pallate is what you're seeking.

It has this very deep, masculine scent, filled with tobacco and darkness. Not overly smoky, not super spicy and peppery either. A very smooth and elegant trench of darkness coating your presence. As for performance, it opens with what felt to me like a strong sillage (3 sprays neck, 1 chest, 1 each wrist.) However after 30-60 minutes it died down to a more intimate projection, which I think is more suitable for this scent anyways. It's strong, it's potent, and I could totally see it getting too strong if overdone, so I like the smaller sillage honestly. The longevity is slightly above average for an EDT. I'm still catching base notes about 4 hours later, which is nice for a night out. Not crazy, but certainly not bad.

Overall, great purchase. Especially if found on sale. If you want a very dark scent, well suited to nighttime and colder seasons, this is an excellent grab for budget buyers such as myself.

My personal rating is 6.5/10; however, my girlfriend finds it highly appealing, and it consistently garners positive feedback.

Navy Cut Symphony

Burberry London unfolds like a seafarer's story: a bold opening of tobacco leaves steeped in rum and molasses, cut with black pepper and cinnamon. The scent evokes the intimacy of a well-aged navy cut tobacco, dry yet intoxicating, drawing you into its spicy warmth and port wine undertones.

Then, like waves calming after a storm, it transitions—soft mimosa glows beneath supple leather, reminiscent of old taverns and worn jackets. Resinous opoponax and guaiac wood add depth, mellowing the spice into whispers. Finally, it lingers with an ambered glow, not shouting but quietly enveloping, like fading sunlight over the ocean.

Elegantly composed yet accessibly priced, this fragrance offers a timeless dance of sweetness, spice, and nostalgia—a modern ode to age-old adventures.

This is a true gentleman's fragrance a timeless classic that exudes elegance and warmth. From the moment I first sprayed it, I felt transported to a cozy evening in the heart of London.

The opening is a burst of spicy cinnamon, perfectly balanced by fresh bergamot and calming lavender. As it settles, the heart notes reveal a delightful blend of leather, rich mimosa, and hints of port wine, which feels both sophisticated and comforting. The dry-down wraps me in a warm embrace of tobacco leaf guaiac wood, and a touch of sweet opoponax a balance that’s both masculine and soft.

The design of the bottle deserves its own praise. The iconic Burberry check wrapping gives it a stylish, British flair, and it looks fantastic on any dresser.

What I love most about this fragrance is how versatile it is. Whether I’m dressing up for a formal dinner or enjoying a quiet evening at home, it feels like the perfect companion. Its longevity is impressive, lasting several hours while leaving a subtle trail that invites compliments.

For me, London for Men is more than just a scent, it's an experience. It captures the essence of sophistication and coziness that feels like a warm scarf on a crisp autumn day. Highly recommended for those who love rich, warm, and slightly sweet fragrances!

Looking at a majority of the reviews, this gets an unfair amount of hate. You can't expect much out of this, usually sold for under $50, you get a nice, spicy, warm fall (designer) cheapie that really, you cannot go wrong with. Of course when this came out it was probably better quality, but reformulations exist fellas. I was lucky to get my hands on a bottle for free, however it is the new batch and needs maceration pronto. I will agree, it does have the Christmas in a bottle vibe happening, the longevity isn't impressive, but you gotta love this stuff. I find it to be slightly similar to Mugler Amen (1996) crossed with CK Shock. Not a bad scent profile for it's time. It is incredibly spicy, in fact this was once my most hated fragrance ever, I had referred to it as smelling like a "spice cabinet" As time went on I grew to appreciate older frags, given this isn't that old, I decided to check it out once more. Needless to say I enjoyed it. I definitley see more Burberry fragrances being added to my collection.

To Felixthreeone, it's "suffice to say" not "suffice it to say".

I agree with hamid666, fragrances ought to perform. It is ludicrous to applaud a fragrance for "not being too loud" and so on, given that we have the agency to control the number of sprays that we administer. If a fragrance is powerful, one can spray less if one wishes. However, if it's weak, it's a different story. Nobody wants to spray twenty times so that they can be smelled, and even for those who overspray, the scent will dissipate near enough all the same.

I don't even own this fragrance, nor have I ever smelled it (that I know of). I just came here to applaud @hamid666 for saying what I have been trying to articulate recently with fragrances and the mindset these days.

*Suffice* (thanks Fred) to say that if there was a fragrantica review writers award, he just won it by saying what 97% of fragcomm has been trying to say for years now.

Bravo, sir. Bravo!

It lasts for at least 3 hours on my wrist despite being in very dry country. But I noticed the scent persists for over 8 hours if sprayed under the collar. This scent performs well in hot summer (currently going through heatwave at 34c~39c as I write this review) - which means this would work much better in winter. Christmas night in a bottle

Burberry London for Men is an absolute masterpiece that often gets overlooked in the fragrance world. If you’ve ever wished for a scent that perfectly captures the warmth and nostalgia of winter evenings, this is it. The opening hits with a bold, hot tobacco note, rich and slightly spicy, immediately making you feel like you're wrapped in a cozy scarf on a cold night. As it settles, a smooth sweetness emerges—an addictive blend of woody, leathery, and amber tones that’s both comforting and sophisticated.

This fragrance doesn’t just smell good; it tells a story. One whiff takes me back to childhood Christmases, sitting by the fireplace with a mug of hot cocoa, toasting marshmallows over the flames. The crackling fire, the soft glow of amber light, and the joy of waiting for Santa—Burberry London somehow bottles that magical moment.

Despite being such a gem, it’s criminally underrated. Nobody seems to talk about it, yet it rivals some of the best winter fragrances out there. It’s warm, inviting, and perfect for cold days when you need something that feels like a hug in a bottle. The projection is moderate but intimate, like a secret you want only those close to you to know.

If you’re looking for a fragrance that feels personal yet luxurious, Burberry London for Men deserves a spot on your shelf. It’s more than just a scent—it’s a memory, a feeling, a winter wonderland captured in a bottle. For me, it’s a favorite that I’ll keep coming back to, year after year.
Nice soft spicy. Similarities to Pure Havane by Mugler

I think every man needs this, 30 plus for sure. To me, it's not just a Christmas scent. This is one I am wearing in this cooler weather and even to bed because of how warm and masculine it smells. My wife says I smell like a sexy ginger bread man which is hilarious, but those spices, wood and tobacco make it a great universally liked scent. There is nothing else in probably 100 plus scents I've sampled that smells like it. Now, it does not smell like Calvin klein obsession for men, but I feel that it is a similar wheelhouse of the setting the fragrance is aiming for. It's probably liked far more than obsession for men (which I love), but it's worthy of some love all through fall and winter. Cheap to buy at discounters, even at Ross or Burlington it is reasonably priced. Longevity is good for price and an EDT. Projection is good enough, it's not beast mode but you don't really care while wearing it bc it puts you in a good mood! Get it, just order it. ForeverLux I got a 100ml for $37.

Christmas in a bottle

10/10

2 Sprays And This Cologne Will Take You Back Years. Reminds Me Of A Beautiful Bag Of Old School Potpourri. The Ones That Are Incased In A Net, With Cinnamon And Smoky Tobacco Rose Petals. Firewood Laying Gently Next To The Fireplace, Woody And Aromatic.

Imagine Wearing A 15 Year Old Leather Jacket, (Not Brand New) While All Of This Is Going On. Not Off Putting, To Say The Least.

The Initial Opening, Blasts You With Cinnamon. Reminds Me Of Spicebomb 80% Initially. The Middle Notes, Of Soft Lavender Kicks In Making It Slightly Baby Powderish. You Get A Little Tobacco And A Little Leather As The Cinnamon Eases Off. The Bottom Notes Are The Only Aspect That I Really Enjoy TBH. Smooth and Soft Leather/Mossy/Tobacco/Baby Powder With Just A Light Hint Of The Cinnamon Left.

The First 30 Minutes, Will Light Up The Room. Fair Warning. Overall I Would Give The Scent A “Winter/Fall/Night Time” Rating. Good For Colder Weather.

Overall: 7/10

Nice Bottle To Have As A Beginner Collector. Any Age Can Pull It Off Though. It’s Not Offensive After 1 Hour IMO.

A underrated fragrance, smells exactly like Christmas, sweet cinnamon and tobacco, but not sickly sweet. Only downside is performance, I get around 5 hours with this.

7/10

I agree with all the other reviews here. The scent is great—100% Christmas vibes—but the performance is poor. Projects well in the opening but fades pretty quickly.

I don't really mind that, though. I'm happy to wear this one when I'm relaxing at home on a cool day, just enjoying my own scent. Perfect to wear to bed too since I usually fall asleep before the scent disappears.

It's cheap, and if you search around, you can find it on discount for even cheaper.

If you're looking for a signature nighttime/date night fragrance, I'd say look elsewhere—but I'm glad to have it in my collection.

I cant deny it, i looooove this stuff. Im pretty much a vintage snob, and when people talk about "modernizing" old school fragrances, this is THE apex in my opinion. I dont typically like sweetness, but this is perfectly sweet and it works amazing with the tobacco and cinnamon.
This is very masculine, but not macho. Think of literally sitting in front of a fireplace with a girl on a winter night. shes snuggling up against you and youre both falling asleep with a smile on your faces. Thats the exact picture i get from this. There could certainly be a Christmas tree in the corner of the scene as well, and indeed even with all the fancy or rare stuff i own...i still wear London on christmas.
So weve all heard the main drawback...performance sucks. Its not a lie, although i get better performance than alot of people are claiming, and thats with the newer formula too. But...for those who are saying "when this came out it was much stronger and long lasting"...you arent imagining things. In fact, even though this came out in 2006, for a couple of years there was REAL oakmoss in this. Not an oakmoss accord or a bunch of synthetic evernyl, but actual oakmoss extract. If you find boxes with evernia prunastri actually listed, then you have a bottle from the first few years and it will perform alot better. Even those arent "beastmode" but it projects better and longer than the new formulas, youll get a day out of it.
In conclusion, this is one of my favorite fragrances on earth. Antoine Maisondeau created a masterpiece of modern perfumery in my opinion, and the fact that this is ~$30 is incredible to me.
Merry Christmas everyone! You picked the perfect fragrance for the occasion

I love this cologne, the first spray I smelt a great mixture of fruit punch, tobacco, and sweet vanilla, with some citrus too.
Great Christmas scent! There are warm spices that are just too good to explain. 9.6/10.

I am going to echo what many have said - the scent out of the atomizer is GREAT - cinnamon, nutmeg, potpourri in a bottle. Wear this on a cool Fall or Winter day. ALSO - I swear, it's almost like spraying on water. That wonderful initial smell out of the bottle, then 30 minutes later it's gone. As in, no trace of it. Sprayed pulse points, hair (I never like to spray on clothes for fear of staining), and it just gone shortly after. I don't need all my frags to be BEAST MODE, but this guy is there one minute and gone the next.

As the scent is out of the bottle, I would not buy this again and struggle to wear it since I can't even enjoy it for myself.
It's just my idea of the perfect Christmas scent - rich, warm and comforting without being loud, perfect for the holidays.

I keep this one for use around the holiday season.

Sweet, cinnamon-tobacco and warm spices. Longevity is moderate, not a projection beast and not meant to me, methinks.

Someone said it smells like those potpourri Christmas pine cones...

I agree, and I love it.

This fragrance smells like an antique store. The bottle is low-quality, the atomizer feels cheap, the cap doesn't seem to stay on the bottle very well, and, after a minute or so, you can't really smell the fragrance. I hate to be negative but I really can't find anything positive to say about this fragrance. Don't waste your money on this.

2.5/10

Longevity : 5 seconds
Sillage : Yeah no.
Price : Oh yeah.
Verdict : LOL BYE.

I really enjoy the smell but it simply does not last at all and doesn’t project. ZERO PROJECTION or sillage. Really such a bummer. It’s like the bottle is 90% water. I put 14 sprays on and couldn’t get this thing to perform or project. So performance is garbage, but the scent is very nice, cinnamon, pine trees, vanilla. Going to give it away to a friend because the performance is so trash, but it’s inoffensive and would be good to give as a gift to someone.

Alright, I do get the cherry cough syrup too in the opening.

However this is the weakest cologne Ever made.
It is water.

Here's the lifespan of Burberry London, regardless of sprays, opening: 20 seconds of cherry syrupy medicine, a hint of wood, maybe some hemlock. Immediately settles down to base notes of hemlock and pine boughs and sap for about 30 more seconds.

And that's it. It's gone. No one will ever smell this on you.
I am glad I got it for a discount.

A warm and pleasant fragrance with mass appeal that can easily be blind-bought.
Manly but not masculine, more gentlemanly and refined.

It seems Americans associate the smell with "scented pine cones", and thus Christmas?
I had never heard of or smelled scented pine cones before, so I don't get any 'Christmas in a bottle' association from this...

It is a very intimate fragrance, meaning projection is not great if that's what you're after.
It lasts about two to three hours. You will not smell it on clothes afterwards; it dissipates completely.

Easily wearable for any man, or boy at any age.

I know the sub types mean more to the more advanced frag heads but this is not what I would call oriental nor spicy.
This is a burst of fresh pine with a hint of wood that is nice and not long lasting. Refreshing and brief fragrance.
Absolutely smells like Christmas.
although im not a man i find this perfume incredibly attractive, to me its a smokey vanillas and cigarettes if you hate the smell of cigarettes you prob wont like this

I hate those perfume reviews that try and paint some kind of evocative picture by making up a metaphorical story / lord of the rings plotline you’re supposed to spend 15 minutes imagining - “you’re walking through the woods, there is an incense burner, crisp oranges are falling from an adjacent tree as the breeze blows cold mountain air…”

Anyway, this smells like the sweaty inside of a children’s rubber Halloween mask - the odours mixing with condensed remnants of the user’s breath, who, it seems, may have been sampling a non-alcoholic mulled punch. Also there’s an unlit cigar in there.

This fragrance revolves around a single chemical called Guaiyl Acetate which is an acetate of Guaiacwood, which is strange that Guaiacwood isn't listed in the notes. Its much warmer and cozier than Guaiacwood which is usually quite smoky and is sometimes compared to bacon. Guaiyl Acetate isn't used often in large amounts in other fragrances which makes this somewhat unique. Its supported by patchouli, and a few other things in trace amounts like lavender, coumarin and Verdox (the apple smell). It's a great unique smell, prefect for winter nights and occasions with friends and family.

I find on this rainy, cold, gloomy Autumn day in Chicago, this is the perfect scent for me. Hints of cherry, tobacco, cinnamon and leather give this fragrance a rustic, masculine, warm feel for me. It is an affordable fragrance that has a distinct place in my line up.
I was excited to buy this perfume for its classic tobacco scent, but it smelled more like cherry, which I dislike. I put it in the closet and have no intention of using it again.

I've only recently started my fragrance journey and I'm so happy to have found a hit so soon! It smells like going to Thanksgiving or Christmas dinner at your wealthy aunt's house, going to the study, and relaxing in a big, real leather chair that's been passed down through generations. I rarely like the initial notes when applying a fragrance, but this one just instantly sent me to another place altogether.

I think it might be a little masculine for me, but if I can get my husband to start wearing it.... Let's just say he'll have trouble getting me leave him alone lol
In the middle of my bottle, and as much as I like the scent. I can not get over its poor performance and projection. I love how aromatic and sweet it is. Such a shame.
Those saying this smells like or similar to shaving cream...please get checked for Covid.

A walk in the Yorkshire in a autumn sunny day.
The enchanted forest.
The fireplace on a pub.
A cheapie trip to England in the best season of all

8/10

The breakdown is missing wine!!

Couldn’t quite place my finger on the freshness I’m getting for the first 20min, then 🫰.. The Bergamot + lavender reminds me heavily of ADG Profumo..
Add cinnamon and tobacco, Take away patchouli you have Profumo holiday edition. Kinda does smell of shaving cream too.

This is a very much fall/winter fragrance for me. It smells like tobacco with some cinnamon and sweetness and its not overpowering. It feels a little on the aromatic side to me (especially as it dries down) but it honestly makes this smell great. It unfortunately doesn't last long but it's easy to find it on sale or at a good price so I don't mind reapplying.

Scent: 8/10
Longevity: 5/10
Overall: 7/10

Smell : Gorgeous
Tobacco shaving cream lol
very classy
more masculine
all rounder imo
Mousse à raser d'une terrible banalité genre fougère. Père Noël sans barbe en slip au milieu d'un salon de coiffure des années 80. Bof bof pour Noël.
HOT

This is my cheaper winter fragrance this year (more expensive one being Tom Ford Eau d'Ombre Leather) and I'm really satisfied with it.

Opening is heavy of lavender and begamot, then the cinnamon joins in, this is where I think people get a 'shaving cream' type vibe, it's kind of similar to Quorum Silver, although Quorum is heavier on the woods and is a bit more versatile. But then, the leather, woods, and moss develop - it's very smooth, warm, attractive, and inviting. I get that it smells a bit too 'clean' for some people cause of that opening, but to me it just gives it a more mature feeling. It's not too overpowering or heavy- those notes lighten it a bit, and keeps it from becoming something like Spicebomb Extreme.

Like, you don't smell like a Christmas candle, but you do smell clean and put together, but with that undercurrent of the spices from the cinnamon and tobacco to warm you up. This would go great with your classic twee-jacket professor outfit.

That being said, 100% a cold weather scent, but suitable for basically any occasion within that.

Silage is relatively strong, and it lasts for quite some time. IMO a safe blind-buy, and a staple of any guy's winter collection.

8.2/10
Great for cleaning glasses ...

blind bought this fragrance, of the opening the lavender was very strong after about 5-10 minutes the tobacco and leather started to sear through, lasted about 7-8 hours on skin and 14-15 hours on clothes

SMELL: 8/10
LONGEVITY: 7/10
SILLAGE: 6/10
OVR: 7.5/10

blind buy safe....imo
lasts really long, not that expensive, smells spicy, good for any age but best for those approaching their 30's - 50's
Smells like shaving cream, that’s all I get from it. Freshly lathered shaving cream from a can.

A very elegant fragrance. Suitable for the office and with a shirt or casual style. Pleasant, masculine but not aggressive. Non-conflicting. It slightly resembles some shaving foams.
I personally prefer the Givenchy Gentleman line, but this is very good.

Opening smells like alcohol and pine treeish.
Dry down is a little cinnamon, mossy, and a tiny amount of tobacco and Leather. Also maybe some spicy stuff like black pepper.
Smell imo: 6.7/10
Longevity: 5/10
Sillage: 6/10
Overall: 6/10. It's alright, some better options. This would be a good gift for a guy. Id say most ages could wear it.
A quintessential winter holiday scent, utterly wonderful as it evokes feelings of comfort and coziness, no cons whatsoever, it is a special fragrance to make special memories with
the bottle looks like a minecraft torch

Gorgeous fragrance, i must be the only one that it doesn't remind of Christmas though. To me it smells like shaving cream, but a really nice addictive one. Classic. I remember it being warmer smelling though, reformulated? still a lovely masculine fragrance non the less

I can see why people compare this to CK Shock but London is vastly superior. It's much smoother and has a more quality feel. I actually sold my bottle of CK Shock after getting this. 8/10 very nice fragrance!

I don't think anyone has mentioned it yet, but this is Christmas in a bottle ...

... only it isn't. Not to me anyway. What does remind me of Christmas is the smell of fir needles and fir resin. The smell of a Christmas tree, in other words.

London for Men smells nothing like that. It has the scent of the potpourri used to perfume a quaint bric-a-brac shop in the Cotswolds. I do think it is most suited for the colder months, just not specifically for Christmas.
Why is the bottle clear now and the cap is silver? Please don't tell me it got reformulated.

I’ve had this scent for as long as I can remember—it was one of my first fragrances, and trust me, it’s truly masculine in the best possible way. It’s not overpowering or offensive but rather has the vibe of a rich, sophisticated, and smart gentleman. It’s definitely a compliment-getter!

The only downside is its longevity—it only lasts around 2 to 4 hours. But considering the price, you can overspray without hesitation. The opening is noticeable, but it’s the drydown where the fragrance starts to weaken, which is why overspraying helps.

In terms of ingredients and how they’re blended, it’s top-tier. The quality feels almost niche, especially considering the creativity behind the composition. The tobacco is beautifully mixed with cinnamon and lavender, creating a balanced scent. There’s also a hint of leather, but it’s soft and inviting, not too intense—just enough to keep things interesting and pleasant. Can be worn for both teenagers and young adult men.

Excellent fall season scent. I don't get it why people associate this scent with Christmas. The opening of the bottle is absolutely fantastic. I get some warm cinnamon, powdery lavender and cozy leather. In the dry down I get a sweet cherry tobacco pipe note with a medicinal opopanax resin and oakmoss. The dry down on this bottle reminds me a little bit of Ralph Lauren Polo green with a cough drop vibe to it. It smells great but it doesn't last long. I usually carry this bottle with me to reapply. I sure wouldn't mind an eau de parfum or a parfum version with a stronger backbone to last longer and cut through the cooler days and evenings.

I am consistently wow-ed by Burberry fragrances when I try them. They are all so fresh and clean and cool (temperature) feeling. They capture the essence of the holidays like no other house I have experienced. This fragrance in particular would be my Christmas in a bottle. You can't go wrong with the Burbs. Safe blind buy (imo they all are)

Coat and cape, umbrella and boots; a few sprays of London for Men, and you've got someone ready to take on the world and smell divine. London for Men is an ideal fragrance for the months when the cold gradually starts to set in. I want to try it in summer, but it brings to mind scarves, stuffed coats, warm chestnuts, orange leaves and turtlenecks. The colour of the fabric on the bottle is a real clue to the concept of this fragrance. My nose perceives an addictive blend of cinnamon, bergamot, tobacco and wood. It reminds me of a fancy cigar bar and trench coats. It's fresh but deep, cold and warm, spicy and sophisticated, can be worn on many occasions during the cold seasons, and is, above all, timeless and ageless. Perfect for work, but also a drink with friends or a dinner party, it can be worn anywhere and anytime by anyone, in my opinion. The blend of all the notes I perceive and their good balance makes it a fragrance that will never be too much no matter the situation.

I'm just not a big fan of its performance, which I find very average, if not mediocre, and have been for years - my first bottle was bought in my teens, around 2008, and I thought it was a bit weak even then. But it doesn't matter; still purchasing it when I am running out and I love to overspray on because it smells so good and its not expensive at all!! I wish Burberry would come out with an EDP or EDT Intense version…
Am I only one who thinks this smells a bit like Naxos?

London is definitely "Christmas in a bottle". I get a lot of notes that reminds me of Christmas time, from a piney-fresh Evergreen Tree to the Tobacco leaves of a Cigar and even the sugary cinnamon from Christmas treats. I typically don't like Opononax or Oakmoss in a fragrance but it works great in this. I can't complain about any note or ingredient in London it's pretty perfect to my nose. It's an easy 10/10 for me.

Such a classic. Has aged in a good way. Perfect fragrance for the cooler holiday months. Still better than most of the higher priced offerings and draws loads of positive attention. Not too loud but enough to draw people to you---if that's your thing. To me, it's a better version of spicebomb.
It's a man walking through the forest on a snowy morning and then immediately entering a bakery making fresh cinnamon rolls.
*Just purchased a new bottle and it lasts on my clothes until I wash them--For you conspiracy theorists who think Everything has been watered down.
This must be the safest buy for a man. It’s soo delicious, comforting and clean.

Highly rated, but still underestimated. I Never smell this on anyone, and i feel spesial wearing it (note that i mostly have niche fragrances, and still, this is a easy pick).

The main notes i get is: Cinnamon, tobacco, Bergamot, and lavender. I pick up a cherry note, but it's not listed.

At first, it's all tobacco and cinnamon that catches my nose, but after only a minute or two, the lavender and bergamot shines through, and makes this a beautiful autumn/winter fragrance. The bergamot keeps lighter then it should be with that note list, and the lavender gives the clean "out of the shower" feel. Tobacco and cinnamon makes it warm and cozy, without being too Chrismasy. You seriously can't go wrong with "Burberry London Man" on a chilly/cold day. Warms the heart and pleases the nose.

It's a autumn/ winter fragrance for sure. Night time, with possible daytime wear. Probably not a perfect work scent, but i wouldn't complain if my colleague wore this all winter. Casual - semi formal.

Personal score: 9/10. If you haven't tried it. Get your nose on it. It's pretty cheap, smells of nice quality and is a joy to wear.

My favorite scent to wear in the cooler season. It smells manly to me. Sophisticated, refined, respectable and oddly familiar (even though it is quite unique.) It smells of the cooler seasons. It reminds me of a gentleman sitting near a cozy fire, sipping bourbon, just reflecting life on a rainy night in December.

Such a classy masculin scent. Tobacco leaf, boozy, a little sweet, green pine forest scent. Very nice for a night out and foe the cooler months.
Price is very cheap if you consider how good this smells. A must have in every male collection in my opinion.
I want to like this... I love the idea of 'Christmas in a bottle' but all I'm detecting is potpourri with insect repellent.

Amazing scent!
This fragrance is -a walk at a Christmas morning, when out there is cold fresh air from the snowy mountains, and you pass by a bakery where they making pastry for gingerbread- in a bottle. Yes there is some pine in it but that whats makes it special, wearable for a mature man. This will be my fragrance to go from October for sure alongside with Bentley for Men Absolute. Two fragrances that, if made by houses like Creed or Parfums De Marly, would now be referred to as Top Top one of the best perfumes ever made. But hence its Burberry it flies under the radar and remain relatively cheap thank god. I bought a 100ml version for 45$ so I would say its damn cheap too!
I say this fragrance have some old school vibe, I really love "christmas" and cold weather parfumes like TF Noire Extreme, Althair, Angels Share etc, but this have something in it, it must be the lavender / oakmoss combo which reminds me of "Pine" but its just different from all of the other cold weather fragrances. Amazing for sure and for this price its a 10/10

Piney, warm cinnamon, cozy. This doesn't smell distinctly young or old. It doesn't smell unprofessional, however it's just so goddamn cozy that it tends to be a scent for relaxing times. Going to a cafe in the snow, date night in, nighttime after shower scent, etc. I often find myself spraying this when I'm getting comfy before bed even in the warmer months.

Idk what it is about Burberry's masculine scents but they always just work for my nose. Which is great considering how cheap you can grab them. This one is timeless and rock solid.

Mature, sophisticated, and well balanced. Very much a cold weather scent. Not very versatile, I don’t see this being worn for many occasions that don’t call for it but I believe it can be an absolute superstar for the right time, place, and setting (in a cafe getting coco or around the Christmas tree opening presents)

Beautiful spicy, sweet, cinnamon/tobacco fragrance. Many of the reviews call it "Christmas in a bottle" and that's spot on. It smells festive and warm, but I don't think it has a grandpa smell, though it's probably best on the 35+ crowd. Performance is just so-so, but the price is so good for something that smells this great that it doesn't bother me.

Scent 8/10, longevity 4/10, sillage 4/10.
A MASTERFUL MASTERPIECE BY A MASTER PERFUMER!!! Burberry can you please bring this back in an EDP OR PARFUM VERSION PLEASE 🙏🏽 PLEASE 🙏🏽 PLEASE 🙏🏽

I fell in love w this scent. A love affair. I can smell this scent in my mind like I just sprayed it. Wore this as my signature for a few years and all seasons. Mass compliments. THERE IS NO PINE in this frag. Rock this w a leather jacket and a flannel underneath and you couldn't ask for a better combo ....sit back and watch the compliments roll in. Longevity could be better...spray on clothes...you can't go too heavy.
My all time favourite perfume for cold days.

Couldn’t really describe it until someone said “Christmas in a bottle”. Yes, that’s exactly what this is.

Light sweet cinnamon, pine, wax and oddly, rather shower gel vibey.

Reminds me of those Christmas 10+ years ago when I still had the fortune of having my family close and everyone being able to gather.
The cold fresh air from the outside, the warmness of home, all those presents right next to the pine tree and the smell of bread in the air… the memories.

Takes me back, but even then, this fragrance isn’t an absolute love for me since it is pretty linear and it can get rather annoying.

I love to smell it from the bottle but not precisely use it on me.
For anyone who likes sweet musky piney wax warmer scents you will love this. smells like making homemade cinnamon rolls during christmas.
Sexy shower gel
This is what I feel like Santa Claus would wear during the day. Fresh but there is also tobacco and cinnamon to warm it a little. I also smell a pine tree note. Very nice.

What an amazing, classy fragrance, with great value for the money ( 30-40euro per 100ml ) but sadly average longevity. No matter :

Lavender with mimosa and a weird leathery note of tobacco-like wood with some sweetness thrown in there combine together to make an intoxicating lightly sweet flowery warm spicy fougere that lingers around you like the festive aura of an aromatic burning candle. It no longer smells like tobaco/leather/flowers, but simply, london burbery, the same way fahrenheit doesnt smell like violet and leather, but just fahrenheit, you know ?This is a smell that gets strongly in your face, remains fairly constant throughout, fills a bubble around you and warmly welcomes people in, perfect for colder weather.

This is my signature scent for the colder months, I hope to wear this until old age.

Smells like it should be a LOT more expensive than it is!
Surprised with the comments about poor longevity - I got about 8 hours from 5 sprays (which is a fair few but I wouldn't say massively overspraying?) the other day, mid-winter here.
Lovely ‘Christmas/spice’ and cooler weather frag as others have mentioned but for me, longevity is about 4 hours or less on skin and clothes. Be prepared to over spray if you have the newer version.

One of those fragrances you might buy again once you run out, that says a lot.
Best of the best for colder months. Performance is real bad, maybe 3 hours if you overspray, but all is forgiven because it's so daaamn gooood.

Notes of Cinnamon, Lavender, Bergamot, Leather, & Mimosa Flower hit you all at once & makes for a very unique opening.

The Leather adds a bit of darkness, but overall Its opening smells like a Potpourri that doesnt know if it wants to be a late Sumer Potpourri with its dark Citrus, Lavender, & dried Leafy Woody-like nuances. Or a Fall Potpourri with its dark Honeyed Cinnamon, & dried Leafy Woody-like nuances.

The Mimosa Flower adds a mild Floral Dusty, Honeyed sweetness.

Many people claim to pick up on a Phantom Note of "Port Wine". I do not.

I cant pick up on this fragrances Tobacco Note either. Or should I say that the dried "Leafy Woody-like" undertone that I do pick up on isnt discernable to my nose as a note of "Tobacco".

It smells more like dried Pelargonium to my nose. Which is why this fragrance smells so much like Potpourri IMO.

What I smell in Burberry's London is pretty straight forward.

I get strong notes of Cinnamon, Lavender, Leather, Mimosa Flower, & a dried fragrant Woody Leaf that smells more like Pelargonium. Which makes the overall composition of this fragrance smell like a Potpourri that can be used to transition from late Summer into Fall.

Nevertheless Burberry's London is a true classic. A love for myself & many others. One that will no doubt be around for a very long time.

Yes, this smells like London. But the dirt on the sidewalks, that have been stood on. And then a cigarette has been dropped in it.

Genuinely disgusting. I'm not sure if this is a fragrance even, just watery dirt. Very horrible. Maybe it's just me, or i would never wear this.
my bf wears this 🤌🏼 delicioso

I was tempted by the fragrance gods again, this time to purchase a 30ml bottle of Burberry's London for a very reasonable price. A familiar voice inside reminded me that I have over 70 scents already, what do I need another one for?

I haven't even smelt London, but I know it's often described as the definitive Christmas perfume. So I did a mental inventory of the scents in my collection that could claim the title as the ideal partner for Christmas.

My personal perfect companion is Potion EDP from DSquared². This Annick Menardo creation is a spicy/woodsy melange that totally fits the occasion. When that runs out, Bentley For Men Intense could step in with a more boozy/spicy spin on things. Then there's Givenchy Pi, Tom Ford's Noir Extreme, Viktor & Rolf Spicebomb, Comme des Garçons 2 Man, Dior's Eau Sauvage Parfum...

Common sense has prevailed, no London just yet as I'm sorted for Christmas options.

But if you were to ask me what I'd like for Christmas, I'd probably tell you I'd love a new fragrance.
I smelled it at the duty free and it was love at first sniff. I think it's not versatile enough so I recommend you to buy ck one shock if you want to use it more often
This smells like my favorite Christmas morning.

This is a fragrance that stands out alright. It is really nice but I just can not like tobacco or alcoholic fragrances. They make me feel goofy and just because of the tobacco
8/10

Initial spray is incredibly good. But, BUT, after about 15 minutes; YUK, YUK, YUK. Sorry guys, but that's my true response.

Christmas fir galore, then it becomes like playdoe, only worse. It must be my skin chemistry.
The tartan blanket outer covering makes for a good, stylish finger warmer. Or a scarf for a small man.
did they change the bottle? i got a silver cap and clear bottle

Wife gifted me this some time back and its still going strong. Love this fragrance, she bought is at a bargain and has to be one of the best buys i've had.
Guess mine is the original as the smell still lingers on my pyjama shirt the next day.

This reminds me allot of my dad, lavender, bergamot, tobacco, cinnamon, that’s it.
7/10 i wish it was stronger.

A sweet white men fragrance. My bf wears it, it smells more mellow on him, on me it smells juvenile.
I dislike cinnamon here cuz it reminds me of white holiday season.
It has a bit saltiness and animalic warmth in it.
Enveloping, atmospheric, cuddly.

This fragrance was so weak on me that I'll need to wear it again (in a greater quantity) before I can review it. It just vanished almost immediately.
Update: I'm trying it again, and this time I've applied 3x as much. It does smell nice, though not Christmasy in my opinion. There is a pleasant nutmeg note, but that doesn't equal Christmas.
Unfortunately, even from the start, it's only a skin scent, and even that is completely gone within about two hours. There is zero projection and zero longevity. I don't understand how no one else is having this problem with it. I couldn't even properly evaluate the notes because the fragrance is so weak and disappears so quickly.

Cheaper, sharper, version of Pure Havane, It's so damn good. A worthy blind buy I've been wanting to try this one for years and now it's finally mine. Great silage, smells like walking into a cigar room during Christmas on a snowy evening. Delicious! 5/5

It's good. Christmas in a bottle, honestly - gourmands and pine needles. But I forgot to even bring it back to school with me after winter break, and subsequently forgot about its entire existence, too.
This gives me happy Christmas vibes
Very warm and cosy. Smells like a tree and sugar. A great option when it's cold. 10/10 when worn with a coat.

This is an autumn dad in a bottle, haven't smelled anything like it, its a great Tobacco leathery dry woods scent, I recommend gett8ng the 50ml from notino they have it for like 21€ which is an incredible deal when retail stores have the t0ml for 70 something euros. This is a must have in ur collection

This was in my drawer, idk when or how it got there but hey, it’s mine now so yeah. I probably stole it from my dad’s collection and he didn’t care abt it or knew i had it. This is a scent that almost everybody will really like, but that not many will go to bat for as an all-star player. I know that may sound like a knock, but sometimes a fragrance's value comes from how reliable, comforting, and mass-appealing it is. Cinnamon, tobacco, and leather notes are all smoothly blended and well-proportioned. There is indeed a festive vibe to how the spicy, cindery sweetness projects from the skin. Sillage is pretty decent, and a few sprays will last you for the better part of the night.

This fragrance is one among the few I compare other fragrances against. One of the all time greats. The presentation, the unique scent, the value, the brand, the performance... A solid 8 out of 10 overall, but a wonderful benchmark in terms of all of the dimensions mentioned.

i do a lot of blind buys, always based on the notes and history written by others. this is another one i bought and ended up being highly pleased with the results. the price is excellent for such a quality scent. the tobacco is mild compared to a true tobacco fragrance. the leather is super mild which is great, i do not like the heavy leather hitters. the cinnamon is a a good mild hit on this one. would i buy it again ? yes., the bottle presentation is very good. fragenceix review is spot on with this one.

I smelled this once about 7 yrs ago before this week and at the time, I was getting too much of a strong smoky tobacco scent on my skin and that was my main thing about not re-visiting. Years later and with a varied palette for fragrances, I gave this one another try for about $22 for the 1oz. online.

This fragrance is not nearly as much of a situational/holiday time scent as often described imho. Yes it does have a brief ornamental tree like vibe in the first 30 mins on me but even then I don't think that is very noticeable in the air.

The mimosa soft candied like note is present throughout the fragrance and it's coupled with the sweeter side of lavender while not reminding one of a clean type of scent or even an overly sweet one. This smells to me like a cherry, cinnamon tinged Black N' Mild mixed with Stetson cologne's nephew who's 15 yrs younger an not nearly as intrusive and won't attach himself into your memory like uncle Stetson. It tips its hat to an old-school styled fragrance while not smelling like a dated fragrance. The leather in it is blended well. As far as ages who'd probably appreciate it, I'd say more of a 35+ scent.

The scent itself is not spectacular but it also is not a turn off. It's like it could be more interesting but neither is it dull. There's nothing strange or gross about it really when smelling from the atomizer which is the case with many fragrances. It doesn't smell cheaply made. The musk is present for sure but it's not necessarily musky and it carries the fragrance while also adding to that older vibe that it gives off. I like the opening and think it could be more interesting along the way but it's a pretty good scent overall and I think it's worth it for what I paid. I'm neither in a rush to get another bottle nor am I upset that I have this one and will probably be wearing it as my main scent for the rest of Winter and early Spring. Besides heat above 65 degrees, I think this can be worn anytime and no I don't think you'll smell like a Christmas tree, you'll smell like a grown man with just a slight nod to smelling mannish but not in an in your face way.

This sits pretty close to skin after an hour or so but it does last even if you're a bit nose blind to it. It's not something you refresh with, just let it do its thing for the life of the 2-5 spray (depending on situation) and wear it again the next time you get dressed.

A solid, moderately pleasant smelling, sweetish and warm tobacco, ambery, mature scent.

It was worth what I paid for what I got.

Still to this date this is the best fragrance for men from Burberry IMHO and Hero would be the worst. It’s very unique and distinctive smell, it has always reminded me of Christmas tree. It’s a classical, sophisticated fragrance with a good price.

Fragrance -Hawthorn Bloom Burberry
Bottle from - 2017

Hawthorn Bloom reminds me of a charming woman in love wearing light purple dress,waiting on the white bench in flower park for her man to join her.
It is a floral,sensual,romantic,moderatly sweet,powdery and enchanted by the master Francis Kurkdjian fragrance.I think it is more feminine than masculine scent.Hawthorn Bloom opens with rich,natural and romantic floral notes of orris and violet,followed by jasmine in the middle.Than as it lingers on the skin,it slowly moves to a little bit passionate,woody,musky,powdery floral scent,with a hint of patchouli,and a wisper of love.

Longevity - 7/10(7+hours)
Silage/Projection - 7,5/10(nice projection and silage for the first 2-3 hours)
Weather - autumn,winter and spring
Age - 20+
Compliments - 9/10
Scent - 9/10

Main notes according to me - orris(orris is the root of the iris flower),violet,jasmine,musk,patchouli.

The drydown is powdery and i get some -
floral notes,woodiness,patchouli and musk.

Emotions - sensual,natural,romantic flower garden,charming, passionate,woman in love.

Occasion -for more or less any ocasion.

If you like floral notes,great for signature scent.You'll get compliments and LOVE with this fragrance.
As expected, it's fresher and more floral with the lighter concentration, and darker spicy-green-woody with the heavier concentration; pretty good, my 4th choice.

I had an opportunity to pick up an unopened mini bottle of this recently. I very much enjoy the 1995 Burberry for Men and thought I'd give this a shot. There's definitely some continuity between the two versions. I don't get the mint nearly as strongly in this 1981 version (hard to say whether it would have smelled differently 40-odd years ago), and the lavender, musk, and amber hit me much more heavily in this 1981 release than in the 1995, but the resemblance is there.

To me, this smells like a man in the 80s who spends his time wearing a suit (sans jacket, much of the time) sitting in a well broken-in oxblood leather executive chair at a solidly constructed, dark-stained black walnut or mahogany desk in an office with vertical wood paneling. He might be an executive type. He might be a crime boss. The office, chair, and desk may or may not be his - I won't ask questions, he smells like he probably belongs there, one way or another.

I find the 1995 release light, fresh, versatile, and well suited to daytime use in both casual and formal settings - very work appropriate, but just as easily worn with a t-shirt and nice jeans. This 1981 release is, by comparison, much darker, heavier, and, if you're not in the 1980s and the kind of person who sits in the office I describe above, probably best suited to nighttime use, or use in non-work contexts - perhaps a classy cigar lounge, or maybe a not-so-classy strip club (to give two extreme examples).

I like this a lot, but I can't really think of how or where I'd wear it in my life / with my lifestyle. I'll hold onto it anyway, just in case I happen to find myself headed somewhere this would make sense to wear.

For nostalgia's sake and a rare treat of this sort: I recently scored a full bottle of this, which appeared to be in good shape - even including the box and insert that describes the whole line of products.

It smells almost like I remember, but not quite exactly. That's okay given how much time has passed.

It DOES however, smell like a close cousin of my bottle of Gres Homme (1996). The Gres is greener and being an EDT, is stronger. But the two could be flankers smelling them side by side, with some slight divergence in the later drydown.

About the strength. This is an EDC but it's an EDC like Aramis. It packs a wallop!

Burberrys is absolutely worth searching for if you're a fan of this kind of scent. If no success, Gres Homme (1996) would be a great alternative.

Was it Keat's "soft-dying day" or Yeat's "October twilight" that was preferred by this man in his walks in the Autumn sunset? Did he wear an Ivy cap to really warm his head or to appear well-read? Is he always cultural and clean or secretly damaged and sometimes mean? So many questions, so few answers at the "other end of the telescope" as Elvis Costello sang.

He wore Burberrys for Men, redolent with marjoram, that one herb that is the question mark among exclamation points. Mild and sweet, much like his demeanor, like spearmint-scented oak wood, more intensified when the herb is dry, much like his sense of humor. Its smell reminds me of a walk in the Vermont woods, when you can almost smell the fauna among the flora, the smell of warm sheep's pelt, and then tang of juniper berries can be made out among the lash of mugwort bushes.

It simmers down to a soft round patchouli awash in musk, firmly planted in the twilight comfort of a leather base. It is a welcome relief from the strain of dialectics, as this man takes off his cap and undoes a couple buttons of his Oxford shirt to just feel comfortable in his own human vulnerability for a while.

This gem was only on the market for about ten years, subsequently replaced by an entirely different Burberrys for Men in 1991. Sadly, it's become quite scarce and is therefore a treasure in my collection. For those who may want to seek a similar sensibility, there is also the lovely original (not new) version of Perry Ellis for Men cologne, which lies in the same vicinity.

An Executive´s scent of the early 80s. Sitting long office autumn days as a fairly succesful head of a top management organization in the construction business while dreaming of scenic golf rounds in Spain with fellow business collegues requires a scent that goes with a dynamic but mature international aspiring personality. Only a few perfumes can impersonate such an 80s character but this Burberrys for Men is one of a few. A top choice.

I concur with ismellfine -- this one's closest cousin is (the original) Perry Ellis For Men.

Pine and artemisia -- two of my favorite notes!

Bracingly masculine yet exceptionally elegant

For the price the vintage stuff fetches nowadays, maybe I should just stick to (the original) Perry Ellis For Men.

I was fortunate to score a NIB mini bottle. This stuff is amazing. Old school 80s: rich, dark and mossy. Performance is excellent. Scent reminds me of V.S.O.P. and Brownstone by Paul Sebastian (both almost as hard to find as this original Burberrys). Honestly, if you already have one of those two PS fragrances, you should be all set. UPDATE: just found and purchased a 2 ounce EDC bottle!!

So I'm writing this review because I find myself gravitating towards vintage men's fragrance. I find the 70s and 80s men's fragrances to be the most well-blended and having a depth that has been missing in men's colognes for a long time now. Burberry the original 1981 version I was able to acquire and I must say the first thing that caught my attention was the true seamless, masterful blending and superior ingredients. This cologne starts off as one might expect with that dated Macho old man smell. I don't mean in a grandpa sort of way but definitely vintage. However within 30 minutes it settles in to a warm rich smooth sent that indeed is all man. I find it very sexy yet calming. I would think this performs best in cooler climate and vintage or gated or whatever you want to call it there is no mistaking that it is a masterpiece. If you've ever had the pleasure of smelling Perry Ellis signature from 1985 you might think these two were cut from the same cloth. The similarity between the two is really interchangeable between the apapa max in Perry Ellis and the murderer in Burberry. Make no mistake although it might be an investment to acquire a bottle of Burberry the original it is so worth it. Is it something I will wear everyday know. Is it something I will wear frequently? Absolutely! It's very hard to come across these days but even if you can only score a miniature version I say go for it because these vintage fragrances like this are we coming harder and harder if not impossible to find these days and it is well worth having in a collection and certainly a true pleasure to wear as well.

I had been on a quest for this classic. Back in the 80s, someone gave me a gift pack that included stick deo; shower gel, and generous-sized bottle (probably after shave; I wasn't paying that much attention back then). But OMG, I never forgot the rustic, yet sophisticated/animal-magnetic sense from the original Burberrys. I just got my hands on 2 oz. of EDT from Ebay. It was in a plastic bottle, authentic to how this classic was packaged over 35 years ago. It is the fragrance that I remember, although there has probably been some "shifting in transit", given all the time that has past (not claiming an expert schnazzola). It did take my sense of scent back in time, nonetheless. I wonder if there is anything else really close to this fragrance, being that I'll tear through 2 oz. pretty fast, and I ponied up for what I have.

Impression: conifer, but not pine, fir, or spruce; dry and just a little sweet, with a peppery hint, and good staying power.
Finally got a bottle and what do you know, it’s actually a chypre!!! Full review coming soon on the front page under the First Fragrances category ;-)

I remember when I was about 11 years old, walking in the department store with my folks after church on a Sunday afternoon in the winter. A pretty lady asked me if I wanted a sample of this new cologne. It was the best smelling men's cologne I had ever experienced up to that point and to this day I remember how good it was. I held on to that little towelette sample as long as I could, careful to fold the pouch it came in to tuck in all the fragrance. That thing lasted about a year or more, stashed away in the upper drawer of my dresser.

I never forgot it.

I have owned and smelled lots of amazing fragrances since then (including a couple from Burberry), but very few made an impression on me like Burberrys did. I am sure nostalgia and the pretty lady made an impact, as well ... but this was just a great symphony of notes, period. My young nose knew it then and my old-ish nose knows it now.

Thankyou perfumecritic for making sense of this confusion. I knew the bottle in the main picture wasn't the one I was looking for. The Burberrys for Men that I wore and loved from the early 1980s was the vertical oblong bottle (as per the picture on the right). I haven't seen it for a long time. It was very popular and is yet another much lamented absentee (Ted Lapidus PH and Charles Jourdan un Homme).

Update 9th May 2015.
If like me you came to this site looking for information on the much loved 1981 original, then check out M Generation by Mauboussin. Some resemblance unless my memory is playing tricks on me.

In 1981 there was a fragrance called Burberry's for men. In 1991 Burberry's launched Society for women and a companion fragrance also titled Burberry's for Men which was not the same composition as the original 1981 version, nor was it the product shown on the Society for men page, a fragrance which was launched by a different company using the same name once Society for women was no longer in production.

And if all of this wasn't confusing enough, in 1995 after the apparent failure of Society for women and the 1981 & 1991 versions of Burberry's for men, the company launched another set of fragrances with the exact same name, "Burberry's", however this time the word London appeared underneath the company's moniker. Of the three versions from 1981, 1991 and 1995, the 1995 product is the only one still in production. This is now sometimes referred to as Burberry's London for men, which is even more crazily misleading because Burberry's did indeed launch a Burberry's London for men just a few years back. These two fragrances have totally different bottles and totally different compositions.

When fragrance licenses expire and change hands we consumers witness all of this confusing naming business. Both Versace and Dior have suffered from the same problem with numerous fragrances launched at different times with slightly different compositions, or even wildly different compositions, but quite similar or exactly the same names.

This review is for the bottle pictured above. I can see the comparison to Tiffany for Men, though not as much to Chanel pour Homme Concentree. Here the myrrh/vanillic quality is obvious, as is the vanilla in the Tiffany, but the patchouli is much less obvious. Perhaps it is closest to Caron's Third Man, though (that one is a bit more cloying than the Burberry, which is more herbal than Third Man). What I think I like most about this one is how there is great contrast between the aromatic elements and the sweet, syrupy oriental one. Spice seems to connect the two and prevent an irritating clash from occurring. There is also a kind of woody background hum which supplies some "structure." This is the kind of scent that recent designer attempts seem to fail miserably at, and my guess is that lack of ingredient quality is the key problem (though in some cases there is another issue, such as being overly sweet). Of course some don't perceive the "synthetic" qualities of them, but that also means they probably can't appreciate the richness and depth of scents like this one. This is really well balanced and should be ranked very highly, IMO, even when compared against other vintage greats !

UPDATE: If you can't afford this one or just can't find it, I suggest trying Mesmerize for men by Avon. No, I don't think it's exactly the same or that the ingredient quality or blending is as good but it may be close enough for you, all things considered. Heritage is another in the same general range as this one.

UPDATE #2: I have now tried the "original," from 1981. Apparently, the bottle (and formulation) pictured above is from around 1991/1992. In any case, the 1981 formulation smells a great deal like Vetiver de Puig, though perhaps just a bit smoother. First impressions: Lactonic, strawberry milk. Reminded me of powdered strawberry milk drink mix made by Nesquick. I thought it was safe enough and inoffensive. Girly yes, and easy enough to wear with a touch of powdery sweetness.

However when Husband smelled it, he hated it and didn’t find it special…

We didn't vibe 😩
I've had for more than a year, never reached for it.
Had to declutter
This is elegance amazing supper strong and long lasting 1 Spray will last the whole day

@SadieS

Check your pm for the original one :)
I need this, I’m obsessed with this. Please, anyone, is there any similar perfume or dupe out there? So sad it’s discontinued. The dry down is to die for.

Honestly, I absolutely hate this perfume. I blind bought based off of a recommendation and it was a mistake. It is so sickly sweet in a fake fruity cough syrup kind of a way. A really really thick cough syrup. My husband loves it, unfortunately, but it actually nauseates me when I wear it. It’s not sexy or sophisticated at all in my opinion. It’s young, obnoxious, trying too hard.

i'm truly obsessed with this. the other flankers from the her line just don't do it for me. she's an urban, young professional headed straight out to the bar for a few drinks after work on a friday evening. so young, yet so sophisticated and sexy.

I really like this perfume. It is sweet, but not overly so, spicy & sophisticated and I don't really get any "medicinal" vibes when I wear it myself. To me personally it is the definition of cozy. I feel like it is appropriate for both day and night, but definitely not a summer fragrance. As you put it on you get strong, sweet (but unfortunately not sour) berry notes, and as time passes the balsamic notes begin to shine through. Definitely a very feminine fragrance. I really dislike vanilla, so after my purchase I was glad to find out that this fragrance does not contain it - probably the reason I liked it so much.

The best quality of this perfume is that it's EXTRA long lasting! At the end of the day I still feel it even though I don't apply any lotion underneath. On clothing it is borderline eternal, so use with caution haha. In my opinion the silage is moderate, but definitely not overwhelming. I definitely recommend it and even though it is discontinued I will probably try to get my hands on another bottle x
Sophisticated amber and florals greet me and remind me of a classy lady wearing Armani. The benzoin is lovely and conjures the image of a perfect hair day. I liked this a lot more than I expected.
This is my favorite version of Her. It’s still sweet but tart than the original. It has a tinge of benzoin to it. It’s what I expected the elixir version to be and I’m bummed it’s discontinued.

This thing was a jumpscare for my nose I don't know what got lost in translation from Her EDP to here but the DNA in my opinion is entirely absent and this honestly just smells like something my doctor would present me with when I've got a bad cough. Oddly medicinal and I don't pick up on the berries at all.

Lots of berries with a good base of benzoin.
I can smell Jasmine like a guest in the distance.
A cozy and welcome guest.

Unfortunately, the fresh scent of berries quickly disappears, leaving me with a benzoin and Jasmine scent that has a dusty/powdery undertone.

I like the scent and enjoy its sweetness.
But it's not a scent I will miss in my collection when there's no more left.

Nice to get to know it, and that's about it.

Just blind bought Dark Cherry & Amber by Banana Republic and after the first spray I immediately knew I already have something alike in my collection. It is Her Intense. I tested them and they are almost identical. So, for those, who crave Her Intense, and cannot find it, I suggest you to try Dark Cherry & Amber as an alternative.

I absolutely love this scent!! It smells sooo goodd. It’s so sweet, so nice, so syrupy, personally I adore it!! About the longevity I can smell the perfume all day especially on clothes, but about sillage I’m not sure what to say I don’t have an idea how it perfoms. So bad that it’s discontinued, I really loved this scent.

i love the scent of this so girly it def does have that sort of medicinal kinda scent to it tho which i dont persoanlly mind but others might not. i do get the regular compliment that i smell super sweet from time to time but i notice it mostly happens when i hug people so the sillage isnt that great. i usually layer it over a body oil to make it last longer but still dont last that long i would say only 3-4 hours x
Its the familiar DNA with a heavy dose of raspberry flavored cough syrup. Sometimes I get a menthol accord which makes it smell like raspberry cough drop. Others don't perceive this on me.

I do not get the medicinal/cough syrup quality that other people are getting. I'm actually very confused. I was expecting something thick and syrupy, but this actually smells a lot like the original Burberry Her except this is less sharp and slightly deeper. This smells a lot like bubblegum to me.

This also smells different on skin than it does in the air. I smell more berries on my skin, but my scent bubble is more airy and similar to bubblegum.

Huge performer! It lasts and lasts. Projection is heavy! I really like this and it’s one of the few berry scents I can stand. It has the same DNA as the others from the line of course but I find the Intense version less immature and more deep, complex. Totally recommend! I also have the Elixir version, which I consider fluffier and more youthful.

If you have Her Elixir, which 'replaced' this as an "intense" flanker, you don't need this one. I agree with the medicinal notes others mention, I think due to the benzoin-berry blend... and it is more amber-y than I prefer. But, if you know you like Her *and* you prefer amber-rich scents, this would be worth it. I'm glad I tried it but I'm going to stick with the more lactonic and less-medicinal Elixir.

I really like Burberry Her even though I tend to like more intense scents so I thought this one would surely be a winner. Unfortunately, this combination is very medicinal on my skin, almost like cough syrup, so I'll stick with the original.

I originally bought Her after I received one of those mailers from Ulta. I didn’t try it on in person. Just ordered it and had it shipped. It wasn’t the same and I didn’t care for it. When I went into the shop to see if I’d mistakenly ordered the wrong item, I found Her Intense.

This is so much better on my skin! I wore it off and on for a few months, preferring YSL Black Opium but then one day on impulse, I wore it. I e worn nothing else sense. Lol. The more I wear it the more I love it. I am crushed it is discontinued. I do still have about 1/2 a bottle but it’s only the 30 ml size. I wish they would bring it back for a second run.

It's a discontinued fragrance so i wasn't expecting to get my hands on it but thank god i managed to get it on a duty free. When i first sprayed it on i couldn't understand why they discontinued it because it's truly one of the best perfumes i've ever tried. It's quite long lasting, it lasts on me for 8-9 hours without applying any type of lotion. I wasn't gonna talk about how good it smells because y'all already know but i can't help it, i have to. It smells heavenly, like you are in a field of strawberries.The sillage is also amazing, you don't have to spray much because it'll do the job itself. In my opinion, it's much better than Burberry Her in every way even though it's a flanker. Don't think twice about buying it if you can find it!

tested this a while back and I liked it! the mix of red fruits and blackberries was delicious and this flanker is definitely more complex and interesting than other versions of Her. almost as if original Her got a degree from a proper university and dyed her hair dark from blonde :)

the sillage and longevity were also great - put on a couple sprits and could still smell this on my clothes after 6+ hours. however, after a while benzoin and jasmine get very intense which almost gave me a headache. maybe this would work better during autumn or winter, but during summertime you won't miss this. maybe I'll still buy this if I spot this somewhere - it's hard to come across!

This is my favorite fragrance ever. I cried when it got discontinued and could cry just thinking about it too.

This is literally Burberry Her’s more mature, sultry, sexy and intense sister. This is everything a woman could want in a perfume. Alluring, comforting and sweet.
The sillage on Her Intense is 10/10 and I received compliments from everyone around me including store assistants, dentists and colleagues.

I used to carry the 15ml sample bottle around with me as a lift me up as the scent never failed to make me smile.

I had this perfume x2 and finished both bottles right to the last drop. I wish they would release it again even it’s just a limited run.
It is sad this fragrance has been discontinued. It was a great flanker, rich and fruity and gorgeous.

Sweet, syrupy berries with a slightly sharp, medicinal opening that develops into a warm benzoin. I can't smell jasmine in this one at all! This is truly magical on my skin and it somehow works perfectly for every season. It does share a similar DNA to BR540 but it's not a dupe whatsoever. It's also quite fresher than BH Elixir and more berry-forward than the original BH. It is heartbreaking that they discontinued this, thankfully i have 5-6 back up bottles that i plan to cherish.

On my skin chemistry this downright smells like cough syrup, onboxious medicinal scent in me. Could not stand it. I think in other skin chemistries must smell good because of all the hype, but for me, it’s a no-no.

It's... nice. I guess. Not memorable. I literally forget how it smells if I'm not wearing it. I was disappointed after hearing that it's sweet. It really isn't, at least not in a way that is significant. The strawberry just doesn't do much for me. It smells like I'm wearing a perfume fit for... someone else.

Edit: I came back to this fragrance after some months now. And honestly, I don't know what I was saying. After having smelled other kinds of perfumes, I realize just how uniquely elegant and moody this perfume is. I am fortunate to still have it considering that it is probably discontinued. It also holds sentimental value for me because it was the first real perfume I have ever had, given to me by my dad. How stupid of me to have wanted something generic or obvious in it's DNA. At the time I had wanted a fruit smoothie kind of fragrance. But BHI literally smells like a sparkling gemstone. Like a garnet or ruby. I have worn this perfume to so many special events: Shen Yun, Riverdance, the Brigderton Ball Experience, etc. And I now realizethat it was the perfect scent for all of those moments. Now when I think of those moments, they all smell like Burberry Her Intense. It will forever have a special place in my heart!

Smells like cherry cough syrup. Fruity but medicinal. I think I'd prefer the Elixir version (which I haven't smelled yet) that apparently is more creamy and doesn't have that sharp medicinal vibe!

7/10

This one of the Burberry line blew my nose/head off!
Nough said
I like this the most out of the entire Burberry Her line.. it’s a jammy berry vanilla scent…but the benzoin in the base is too strong. So I’m not getting it

Synthetic and sweet red berries with benzoin. On my skin it is actually not that syrupy sweet. Instead the notes of jasmine and benzoin comes through which gives it a more clean vibe. The notes of red berries are still there but goes softer with time. It definitely takes me to carefree and sunny days during spring.
I also get some nostalgia because of its synthetic berry notes. It reminds me of this soap bar from LUSH that is called Rockstar which I used to love around the early 00's. That has a similar synthetic scent of red berries.
But I also get the similarity of how some barbie dolls used to have that sort of synthetic and sweet berry scent.
It is a kind of nostalgic smell. Reminds me of a box of Barbie dolls somehow. It is not a terrible smell by any means, but just not a contemporary execution of the berries trend.

Dark cherry incense. Smoky, deep, fruity. It reminds me of Hot Couture by Givenchy, but this fragrance has no tobacco note, just sweet smoke. I don’t particularly like this fragrance but it is very interesting and I appreciate it in my collection (received as a gift.) I have asked quite a few peoples opinion on this one and they all said something along the lines of it being very classy, but for a much older woman.

I love Burberry her, but in the intense the mix of benzoin and blackberry smells sharp. I understand they were going for a syrupy version of the OG but just like in Armani's Si Intense the heavy dose of benzoin was a mistake!

Cotton candy with blackberry - my husband says. Does it smell like cotton candy? Yes! But in a very delicate and elegant way. Not overly fruity neither cloying just a brilliant mix of dark sweet fruits covered in a powdered cloud. Works perfect in winter. Don‘t miss that beautiful bottle, colour looks gorgeous and it feels so good holding it.

By the way: has nothing in common with HP Dior.

This is a dark red cherry. It’s gorgeous. After about an hour the jasmine blooms and the mix of jasmine and cherry is lovely. This scent is pretty linear and a little basic but it is nice. It would be a really good office scent that is a bit unique.
not the best. i'm guessing i don't love benzoin ?

On paper it smells exactly like the og but stronger (strawberry version of BR540). But on my skin, it starts out smelling very medicinal mixed with strawberries. The longer it sits, it’s just straight up cherry cough syrup. The cherry smell is dark and sweet but it’s so artificial. It projects like crazy and lasts all day which is great! I highly recommend you test this on your skin first or you may be disappointed!
This is deeper than the original Burberry Her. For some reason, I pick up a heavy cherry scent. It's a nice sweet deep fruity fragrance.

If you ask me this is a fruitier version of Dior Hypnotic Poison EDT! At first spray it smells like some sort of fruity cocktail or a mixer; I can't really put my finger on what it is but it smells like an alcoholic drink (that probably has contreau in it, for some weird reason).

There's a lot of boozy red berries and, it takes a while but, cherry takes center stage. Once it completely dries down there's an almost plastic quality to it - it reminds me of the playdoh note in HP EDT but it's not quite the same. Some people say it's that of a plastic doll and I guess that's not totally wrong.

It's also as powdery, warm and cozy as HP EDT. It kind of makes me think of christmas evening after one has left church. Like there's still myrrh or some incense on your clothes and after you get inside from the cold, make a fire and sit down with a fruity alcoholic drink. The benzoin gives it this incense base, that turns sirupy together with the berries and gives a smoky feel. Boozy sirupy, still after a few hours on the skin.

I like this fragrance; I think it's much more complex than the notes would suggest and it has some sort of mysterious aura to it while also being approachable. When I first sprayed it it was a bit too harsh; too loud and boozy for me. In the drydown it is much more elegant and sophisticated, but, for me, way too powdery (same with HP EDT) and too heavy on the cherry. But, while I overall like it, it also gets reeeeaaally timid after only a few hours, at least on my skin. It doesn't project at all and is much more of a skin scent - which surprised me after it started out so loud. I just thought I'd like it way more than I do now after wearing it for half a day. It's a nice scent overall and there's definitely occasions where I'd still wear it, but personally I won't buy a bottle.

This is definitely not a safe blind buy (yes it's discontinued now but it's still available in many stores!) except if you know and like Dior's Hypnotic Poison EDT but want something less vanilla and more fruity.

I regret buying this fragance.
It's discontinued so I panicked and bought it.
Not worth it - At All 😐
It's not a bad fragance, maybe it was reformulated already, since mine says made in Spain ....
To my nose this is very different from the original, to my nose this is more ambery and Cherry chapstick like, whereas the original is bright 🔆, 'girly' and 'fruitier'.
I find no BR540 vibes, at all.
I don't think this withstands cold, rainy and windy weather either 😩

Don't understand all the hate. Had to come here and say this is one of my favs ever.

Everyone is absolutely CORRECT it smell like cough syrup, cough drops, leaked vape juice, you name it. But that is why I love it. I love to smell like a medicine cabinet at the candy store. Gone through almost 3 bottles. Burberry needs to sponsor me.

Love this version of Her and I’m sad that it was discontinued. It’s everything I like about the OG but deepened with dark juicy blackberries and amber. It’s sweet, syrupy and rich.. it’s almost gooey sweet but also has an airy freshness about it as well. Great sillage and longevity too!

For me, this is suuuper sweet and sticky. It smells like that cheap strawberry ice cream sundae sauce, that’s really syrupy made with corn syrup. I find it very cloying and because the longevity is really good, I find it suffocating. It has great projection and is long lasting, but sadly not for me. Also, I don’t find any resemblance to BR540.

On me, this is a combination of scented stationery and cheap laundry detergent. Very, very synthetic, somewhat nauseating and slightly juvenile. Sadly, it also is a powerhouse what comes to lasting and projection.

I agree with @hellebelle. Really smells like a collab of Pfizer and MFK.
Thanks to the hype, during the lockdown I got Burberry Her and Her Intense. Wore them for days, weeks, tried to like them.
I just cannot with this scent profile. EDP was okay, but the atomiser got congested and started leaking. So I began using Her Intense. Smells like cherry cough pastilles :(

Love the first burst of this scent! Lovelylovely berries and sweet freshness.

The middle can be a bit too much, I would suggest spraying somewhere lower than the neck, that way you'll get wifs of the scent but won't be overwhelmed by it. I suspect the benzoin makes the middle quite heavy. Still, on me the Intense is less cloying than the original so I prefer the Intense.

Returns into freshness before fading away.

Lovely bottle; beautiful colours that are quite appropriate for a fall scent.

I own Coach Wildrose as well and these too are similar copying one another at different points as the scent developes. Intense is - as the name suggest - a more intense version with better longevity and depth. Wildrose is the more lighter version, more approrite for everyday use or to be used on a day off. Personally I like them both and think that is useful to have them both.

I have only tested Baccarat Rouge 540 once and being almost anosmic to it cannot really say anything of how Burberry Her Intense compares to it, except of course that I can actually smell the Intense and like what I smell.

Lucky to have found a bottle at a reasonable price, this scent seems to be disappearing fast. Also, quite content with my 30ml, I only need two sprays (on clothes) to be sweetly scented for a full day.

Burberry Her EDP is a berry sweet juicy spray with some musk. It's extremely fruity. Did not like it enough to buy a bottle.
