Burberry Her intense is berry and sticky sweet with a bit more warmth from the amber.
To compare the 2, I prefer the original EDP.

If it's any comparison at all, I have not smelled BR540 before so not sure of the similarities. But I LOVE Ariana Cloud scent profile and I have now concluded I don't like Burberry Her and the flankers.

I love Burberry Her, but the intense version is not worth it.
A saleswoman recommend this version of Burberry her to me because she thought I would love it based on my taste in fragrances so I tried it on my skin for the rest of the day. From the first 15min and for the following 5 hours that I had it on it smelled like synthetics,plastic bag or cheap fresh fruity chewing gum. Plus , it gave me a headache. Please just go straight for the original Her , ignore this!

**** Based on my experience, but maybe in another's woman skin will smell nice. Just try it first.
Smells like VS Vanilla Lace and the bottle reminds me of one of the versions too

This used to be my favourite scent in grade 10. It's a pretty light, powdery, strawberry scent. It's somewhat clean and after I bit I don't really smell it on me. I like it though, lasts me a couple hours and it's a crowd pleaser. So, there's nothing really to hate about it, but I just wish that it lasts better on me.

It’s like Pfizer hired Frankie Kurks to compose the flavoring for a batch of new and improved Robitussin®. Awesomely odious!

Discontinued? I’m positively shocked!

I really enjoy Her intense. The opening has a very sweet, almost medicinal, cherry. To me it's a very dark and juicy cherry. I also get quite a bit of blackberry on my skin. Then the jasmine shows up but it's definitely in the background. It gives it a slight creaminess. Once it dries down the benzoin really makes it beautiful! It becomes this warm, sweet and creamy cherry with a slight hint of juicy blackberry. I love this during fall and winter. The original Her is the one I reach for in spring and summer. It's a bright, fresh berry and is also very sweet.
I'm so sad this is discontinued. I don't like Her, but Intense was just perfect.

Stunning. Juicy fruit opening and then a sherbet fizz before ending with a cloud of Baccarat Rouge 540.
Another gorgeous Kurkdjian perfume.

CoffeeandScents:
I too struggle with wearing any of the Burberry Her lineup. I have Burberry Her edp and the edt, and I totally get what you mean about notes smelling artificial. Especially the strawberry note in Her. I just got the Burberry Her Elixir today, and it's just "okay", but I'm still getting that artificialness that is so off-putting. I know the Intense version has been discontinued, and I'm definitely too afraid to blind buy it. Your review made me realize it's not a safe blind buy feeling as I do about the rest of the Burberry Her lineup. Ironically, I enjoy Cloud by Arianna Grande.

My love... I have returned to wax poetic about her because she's being discontinued. You bet I stockpiled two bottles I never want to be without it. I've always thought this was delicious, but in an ambivalent sort of way. My love for this perfume is INTENSE and has grown and grown over the time I've had it. When you catch it in the air it's like a trail of the most saccharine, fruity EXPENSIVE bubblegum. Sooo delicious, sweet and warm. If I've gone a little while without smelling it, and use it - I fall in love all over again!

This is the pink ruffles, pearl necklaces, satin bows, ruddy blush, rococo kitten heels in perfume form. Once I run out I am going to miss it so much.
This is on FragranceNet.com, if interested :-)
WTF am i getting fakes this was a powder bomb on paper and on me. I couldn't wash it off

This was awful for me, smelled great on paper, as soon as I got it on skin it was just a less sweeter version of the EDP which I didnt mind, but as it dried down it started smelling as playdoh so much I couldnt take it and had to scrub it off.

Was hard to scrub off, so it is pretty strong in that aspect
Fresh fruity blast at the beginning. Drydown is ambery, sweet and still floral. 8/10

Sprayed it on my wrist in the store, first sniff I didn't like it at all, thought I would never buy it, smelled like strong cherry alcoholic drink. I put it down and went trying other fragrances, but as it dried down a little on my skin it turned into something mesmerising and I fell in love with it. This perfume is like a good wine, the longer it sits the better it gets. On the very last drie down i did get that BR 540 vibe so I can understand why people find it similar, but to me this is completely different scent and not a dupe of it. It's sweet,feminine fragrance that warms your heart 🙂

This is my favorite from the Burberry Her line, this is the thickest and creamiest and sweetest. BUT there is still something artificial in all of the Burberry Her scents that I can’t quite get past to wear it.

I'm already a sucker for the original, and I don't know why I didn't try this sooner. This is honestly a gem for the colder days when you feel like the original would be too light. The addition of cherry really elevates the fragrance and gives it depth, but the familiar "airiness" from the OG is still there, and I really love that. I honestly think it's worth owning both the original and the intense.
Like a bag of lollies 🍭 In love 🥰
This is simply the BEST perfume ever !! Think cherries with caramelised butter and sugar. I also cannot for the life of me understand it has been discontinued. What a calamity !!!

wow, immediately, straight up candy. i already think that burberry’s her line is rather juvenile, not in a bad way but in a young teenager-y way so for me to wear them i would need to be in a certain mood. i get the juicy berries without losing the candy aspect. burberry her in the background but the main character is that extremely chewy candy with jam filling inside. if you’re into such scents this is a match! it stays longgg and has great projection, with every movement of my arm i got a whiff of sweet candy.

So far the only one out of the bunch that manages to find a balance between the sweetness and the aspects that in BR540 translate into wet band aids and industrial sanitizer. Don't be fooled by the notes listed here, as some of these notes are simply approximations (red fruits isn't an actual note), and the list is definitely incomplete. There's clearly a core idea that Kurkdjian has enjoyed working with and developing throughout the process of creating these fragrances as there's an obvious correlation between BR540, BR540 Extrait, Burberry Her and Her Intense. Her and Her Intense being reimaginations of the original idea into something with more mass appeal. Out of the four it's in my opinion Her Intense that manages to find a balance between the things that Kurkdjian set out ot express without going too far in one direction.

The perceived saltiness in Her Intense remains only strong enough without it becoming too metallic and wet-smelling. Similarly the sweetness is such that it can be perceived as salted caramel, rather than a thick sugary syrup. Smelling this, floral and fruity definitely aren't the first words that come to mind. Takes some getting used to, but I find that it can be oddly comforting. I'm beginning to really like and enjoy this. Longevity is extremely good, and on fabric lasts for several days. More of a cold weather fragrance definitely.

This is a strawberry bubblegum version of Bacarrat 540.
Opens with a strong liquorice note (maybe the benzoin) then softens out to be more powdery.
It’s not my usual type of scent, but I bought a discounted damaged bottle and I do find myself reaching for it for certain occasions for something fun and girly.
I smell 540 and dupes everywhere I go recently, and I think this is a nice variation without the metallic vibe
Not great performance performs like a body mist

I got this because I’ve had my eye on it for a while and heard it was about to be discontinued. It opens very spicy and warm on me, it took some getting used to to be honest. I don’t get any fruit or berry notes until some time has passed, it gets much sweeter and a little powdery during the dry down (which I love). I don’t get much of the jasmine, just sugary spicy amber. The benzoin is very obvious so if that’s not your thing stay clear. I wanted something sweet but more adult and this is it! Feels like I’m swept into a warm amber cloud of fruit and spice. 8/10
Yeah, this is cough syrup. No thanks

This is the coziest scent I own. So gorgeous, mixes perfectly with my skin.
To me, this is a feel good scent. More of a fall, winter type of scent but generally works well on days that aren't too hot and rather 'stay-at-home' days.
Personally, I love putting on two sprays of this after I shower at night and lay in a freshly covered bed.
Immediately gets me in a sleepy, wholesome mood. Feels like a hug in a bottle.
This is also office-friendly, and an absolute compliment getter. The longevity is insane, I smell this on my clothes for weeks.
All in all a 10 out of 10 scent in my experience, and if it really got discontinued I'd be SO sad, because sadly I cannot stock up on as many bottles as I would like to!

Soooooo similar to JPG black male body !!!!

Very manly .

Sweet, warm and cozy berry perfume for a good price. For me longevity on the skin is about 4-5 hours (smells better on the skin) and I would say sillage is intimate-moderate, but it could be better if you overspray 🤔 but I just can't do that, because then is tooo sweet 😬 I have Bacarat rouge, and I would say it is not a dupe...but Her has that MFK vibe, maybe it's because of benzoin.
This is just one of the best perfume ever. Very similar to BR 540. Soo much more better than Burberry Her.

Will never understand how the Burberry Her line is soooooo hyped but My Burberry is just not understood by the masses. It’s sooo much better, the blend is beautiful and My Burberry Intense is one of the most perfect fall/winter scents ever made in the designer realm.

Hype those deserving of it. Not those that influencers talk about.

Well, it happened. I got a compliment from my husband. He hasn't commented on my many different perfumes in probably years. But this evening, as I was washing dishes, he came up behind me, buried his nose in my neck, inhaled deeply and said, "You smell nice." Lol! It might not seem like much but trust me, it's huge. I think he truly dislikes all my favorites (Mon Guerlain & flankers, L'interdit flankers, etc.) but Burberry Her Intense is a winner. It's growing on me, too. It's cold and rainy today, and this fragrance developed beautifully in this weather. Looks like I'm keeping her!

Opens with POWERFUL Cherry jolly rancher/cough syrup.

Specifically cherry, NOT strawberry.

I HATE cherry scented anything. I’ve hated it since I was born. I’ve hated it since I was in the womb. (However, I adore strawberry)

This is a beautiful fragrance for those who love cherry.
It’s objectively good. Especially the dry down, which even I like, despite my detesting the lingering cherry.

But no way, for me. Nope.

Blind bought this when I heard it's getting discontinued. I sampled and liked the OG Burberry Her, but not enough to buy a full bottle. It felt too youthful and girly. There's too much of a strawberry shampoo vibe going on. I bought this in hopes that it's a warmer, deeper, more mature version of Her. I'd say it definitely is. But, all the criticisms in the reviews below also apply. It certainly has a strong berry cough syrup scent in the opening. I understand the Redbull comparisons too. That does fade away after awhile, and becomes something more powdery. Not "baby's diaper" powdery as one reviewer stated, but definitely powdery. The OG Her does not smell powdery to me. The smell of berries is still prominent in the midnotes of Her Intense, just more "berries and cream" and less cough syrup at this stage.

I'm not sure yet if I'm pleased with this as a blind buy, but I'm going to give it a chance. Waiting to see how I feel about the drydown, which was my favorite part of the OG Her. I sprayed this a few hours ago and the fragrance is still in the middle stage (berries and cream and powder). This smells nothing like Cloud or BR540 to my nose. This one does remind me a bit of D&G The Only One. Not that they smell entirely similar, but that they both have a very thick, syrupy-sweet opening and a powdery undercurrent in the midnotes.

Update: I do like the drydown. I get little whiffs of that BR540-ness in the air, like I do with the drydown of the OG Her. However, you have to wait a long time to get there. Like 6 hours. So, if you can stand smelling like a jagerbomb for the better part of your day in order to get to the delicious base, this perfume is for you!

I really like this perfume. Nothing groundbreaking but well done.
When first sprayed I get a bit of fruit notes but its fleeting. On dry down I get mainly a warm cashmere/vanilla with a bit of floral--similar to all the fragrances on the market right now. Its very well blended so its difficult to pick out the notes in this fragrance beyond vanilla/cashmere.
A good candidate for a blind buy. Reminded me of LVEB when I first sprayed but not as overpowering and not as sweet. On dry down it reminded of bare vanilla from Victoria's secret--warm cozy classy. As for performance it lives up to its name. Good but not overwhelming sillage and lasts at least 4 hours on my skin when applied normally.

Better than the original. The original is too playful, too much berries but this one has more depth and not as sweet as the original. For me, this is more versatile as i can wear it anytime from day to night.
Too bad it's discontinued.
panic bought this bc i heard its being discontinued 😩

I personally love this more than the original. You still get that warm fruity scent but this one is more... Well... intense. It doesnt last long on me unfortunately or else this would be my signature.

Bought this in 100ml because its being discontinued. I already have and love the original version of Her. Biggest difference is Her original has a strong strawberry smell upon spraying it, while Her Intense smells like the fruits in the 4 red fruits tea mixed with freezing cold air.
Her intense also has a stronger baccarat rouge vibe on immediate application than the original has. The original only smells like baccarat after you've worn it for 4-5 hours.

Her intense isn't as sweet as the original, but only by a little bit. So don't buy unless you like sweet and fruity fragrances. My mother and grandmother find these sickening, but I love them so it's all down to what you personally prefer.

Yeah, no. I would never wear this in public. It low key smells like a freshly powdered baby diaper🤷🏽♀️

**also, I don't know how in the world people are getting BR540 or Cloud out of this. My nose must be broke🤣
I prefer the og Her much more. Her Intense smells dusty and mature the way Hanae Mori edp or D&G Pour Femme smell. Like fr, dusty, y'all.

This is a little more deeper than the Her. Neither one is a fragrance for me tho. I do not think Her, or Her Intense smell anything at all like BR540. Having said that, it is pleasant enough, and I did pass the Her onto my daughter. She hasn't commented yet. I kept the Her Intense. It's a good fragrance if you like it. No disses, just not for me. It doesn't make me sick or give me migraines which I suffer from w/o fragrance. So that's a plus point if you would like to try. I love gourmand fragrances too, and sadly this one was neither here nor there for me. I'd add that to me this is a winter fragrance. Get a sample first, I know better.

I absolutely love the original Burberry Her so I thought I’d automatically love the Intense version. Unfortunately that wasn’t the case. Though they are both very sweet, but the intense version was just too syrupy sweet smelling for me. Theres not too much difference between the two to have both in your collection. I’ll continue with my original Her and layer other fragrances if I want a little more depth

This is sooo good and waxy

The opening I have to say is a bit medicinal like some people say, but then it quickly settles into a sweet waxy and berries syrup, later on it becomes more of a sweet lipstick scent, it is soo good ❤️👌🏾

This perfume promises so embotle London rainy days and it somewhat does. I wear it on rainy days, it's like a routine for me now. However I must say that once I finish it, I'm most likely not gonna re-buy it, it's sweet but the benzoin adds a weird ending that I personally find too strong and doesn't allow me to embrace the sweetness of this perfume completely. It's a good, strong, long-lasting perfume perfect for women who like to play the ''I'm sweet but at the same time hard to get so I become strong'' type of game. I'm not that kind of girl, therefore, this perfume ain't 100% for me.
Also, someone told me it reminded them of their mother's perfume which happens to be Carolina Herrera Good Girl.
So delightful and playful. Just love wearing this fragrance. It's over priced I think though

Unfortunately I didn’t enjoy this perfume. I adore the original Burberry Her so I thought I would enjoy this version but it’s just not for me. Initially it smells pretty similar to the original, but the berry on the initial spray is much darker than the strawberry in the original. After the dry down though it was really warm and spicy to my nose which is just not something I’m looking for in a fragrance. I will say the projection and lasting power in a single spray is impressive, much better than the original. I think if you enjoy spicier florals this would be a good one to try, it was just a little much for my nose.

It is true about it being discontinued 😔

Burberry her intense is a gorgeous fruity scent. Such a good compliment getter. I thought this would be better in the winter months. How wrong I was. This shines better in the warmer months.

All in all, a beautiful perfume. Lasting power and sillage is moderately strong.

unfortunately this did not work for me :( i enjoy her & her blossom but the intense just smelled like a floor cleaner that was scented with a cheap caramel scent............this scent went in the nasty category for me lol also its very heavy & musty smelly with a thick lingering caramel scent (i know caramel is not in it but it does give that vibe) (oh & it kind of reminds me of viktor & rolfs bon bon but in the bad girl way - bon bon is the sweet girl going on a fun date while burberry intense is the bad girl hooker trying to pick up a date lol )

I’m torn because I like the opening of Burberry Her, but the dry down of Intense better. In the end I purchased a bottle of Intense.

Like others have said it is reminiscent of a cherry cough syrup at first but that quickly goes away and you pick up on the berries. A boozy berry. In the eventual dry down, it becomes warm and caramely and addictive. I don’t reach for this often as it’s a little heavier than what I usually enjoy, but I do like this in my collection.
I smell a lot of cherry in this. Smells like a tacky musty cheap hooker. The original Her is much nicer, less syrupy, more well rounded. This is yuck. I sold my bottle immediately.
The best thing ever, so sweet and delicious on my skin, I’ve received SO many compliments about this fragrance.

Beautiful, sweet. Smells like expensive candy. Coquettish and sexy.

Not a blind buy at all, especially at that price. Try it on your skin before you judge it - smelled just okay on perfume paper, but delicious and warm on my skin. My friend couldn't stop gushing about it!

I am not a fan of this. I smell a weird creamy plastic rubbery note. This strong plastic smell never develops, its on the top and stays with me for hours until washed off.
I can smell berries but I couldn't pick out a specific berry. Zero jasmine, in fact no florals here at all. IMO no similarities between this flanker and the original which I quite enjoyed.

This is the original, with more mixed berries and benzoin added to it, even more sweeter and warmer than the original and it last just a tad bit longer. I preferred the intense in the beginning, but now i´m absolutely in love with the Burberry Her and its my favorite of the two.

It ends up giving a fluffy spun sugar vibe after a while (similar to Baccarat Rouge 540 & Cloud 2.0). The nose behind this perfume tells you all need to know! I see no reason to own this if you already have one of those two fragrances. However, this price point is better than MFK & this bottle is more chic than Cloud.
Very sweet. Smell like berry, bubble gum and scented eraser. Does not smell high end or sophisticated to me personally. Can be a bit coy and lack of personality. But not a bad smell.

First blast of musky sweet vanilla with bright clear berries and pink pepper. It feels very sweet and turns juvenile after a while, like a Bath and Body Works spritz. Something a teenage girl would like. Not necessarily a bad thing if you're looking for a pleasant breezy sweet summer fruit scent with no depth or weight. Feminine and best for hot weather.
Smells like someone burned Miss Dior Cherie. I might like it, might not. I dunno.

Walked into sephora to smell this and WOW! out of all the fragrances I smelled today this one left a print. It's fruity amber. A little on the warmer side. Now that I've smelled this I definitely understand what red fruits means because I get that with a warmer jasmin. It reminds me of Christmas with the red fruitnote but also remindsme of a really nice vacationon an island in the evening. Not sure what benzoin is but I get all the top and middle notes. Its SO simple in terms of notes but its sooooooo good! Definitely evening wear but im sure you could pull it off in the morning too! I'm definitely purchasing this for Christmas.

A bubblegum explosion a first then dries down to be quite musky with the berry smell accompanying
So so similar to the original just more bubblegum/berry smelling
I think the strong berry smell may become nauseating over time because its so intense and reminds me of shisha

I was initially supposed to buy the original one, Burberry Her, however I'm ecstatic that I bought this Intense flanker by mistake, since it's definitely my new favorite fragrance!

I straight up got the berry top notes at the very first spray. But about 5 -10 minutes or so in, it burned down to this combination with berries and a sweet, deep vanilla, which is most likely coming from the benzion. An hour later, the berry scent is somewhat gone and you're left with this beautiful and delicious vanilla fragrance.

I'd also say that the longevity is long lasting, as 3 sprays lasted about 6-7 hours on me. After that, I'd have to get closely to my wrist to smell it.

The only "con" I'd have to give this perfume, is that I wasn't able to smell the jasmin. Which really isn't an issue for me, considering my username ;), since it already smells soo good.

Overall I'd say Burberry Her Intense smells like a naturally deep and sweet vanilla, topped with some fruitiness and will therefore be given a 9.5/10 by me. :)

Unfortunately not for me. Literally had to scrub it off as soon as I got the chance. Straight up smells like a candy store. Too much of the sweet syrupy smell that u get in the candy store of sugar in the air.
And it is headache inducing.

For me this smells like powdery strawberry and bubblegum. It's really sweet. It lasts all day and projects moderately for me. The dry down smells very similar to Cloud by Ariana Grande. They both have this plastic or newspaper like quality that I can smell underneath all the goodness and it's slightly weird but it's perfectly tolerable for me. All in all I would say I like this one better than the original Burberry Her, as the oakmoss and masculine aspects of that one are stronger for me. Though I do think they smell almost the same. BH Intense just feels sweeter and more bubblegum-like.
Sweet sugary berries drenched in herbal balsamic delight... I want to bathe in it, it's so good!... oh dear...

I already wrote about this perfume but I want to do this again. Yes it starts off syrupy. Yes it's mega sweet. And yes, it's one of the best perfume I've ever smelt. Lingers for hours, smells like vanilla cake, Haribo packs, money bags and sex. It lasts on me, like most amber-based perfumes do. The dry down is my favourite part, it feels safe, soft, seductive, the hoe melting with the wifey. My favourite smell.

So this might sound weird but this smells like a seductive, sexy cough syrup 🤭 it's syrupy, sweet, and sexy. BUT, this lasts maybe 30 minutes on me. My husband hates perfumes but smelled this and said "whatever you're wearing smells good" and he NEVER compliments perfumes lol so I'm very bummed this doesn't last. Its expensive, so for the price of this I need it to last long.

This smells like syrup! I kept thinking it smelled familiar, like some kind of lollipop. But then it finally hit me, Luden’s cherry cough drops! I used to pop those like candy when I was a kid lol. The memories. The perfume has excellent longevity and projection though. It’s a much thicker, denser scent than the original Burberry her. The OG is an airy sugary sweet strawberry, this is syrupy sweet cherry/blackberry. They don’t smell alike to me at all. And not even close to br540 in my opinion.

This perfume is super syrupy! At the beginning till the end you can smell the red fruits and the benzoin. Those two notes are the dominant ones. Very very sweet. To me, it smells kinda cheap. Not a safe blind buy at all. Sillage is super strong. Appropriate for winter and autumn only. If you love sickly sweet perfumes then this might be the one for you.
Smells wonderful right up to your nose but it doesn't pack much of a punch for me. Starts out fruit my but mellows down to a subtle soft sultry scent. I can smell it on my clothes the next day.
On me this is strawberry-vanilla-bubblegum lipstick. Grown-up girlie at its best. Linear and irresistible.
I love this scent but i can only wear it to bed. Because it does not last. Ive had 540 and this smells very close. But dont waste your money. Thirty minutes to an hour and its gone.

After reading comments about Burberry Her original version, I'm glad I'm not the only one who thought of Lush store scent when I smelled this. I guess the soapy aspect here reminds of the overall smell of soaps and baking-soda-based bath bombs. But because of the prominent sweet-fruity notes, I guess it's similar to... Snow Fairy scent from Lush? Maybe some other fruity product from there, I haven't visited it in a while.

I used to hate this scent till I smelt it on a hot summers day and had to test it, I don't enjoy burberry her as its like a really synthetic strawberry air freshener, but this I like and out of all the br540 dupes I much prefer this.
On my skin it doesn't last long maybe 3 hours but on clothes it lasts a very long time, I would wear this in the autumn in the daytime in the UK but also on warm days In the summer.
Off to purchase a 100ml bottle.

Compared to Burberry her, this is more masculine. Her is a happier and sweeter scent at the opening, though they both dry down as beautifully. I prefer Her to Her Intense, but they layer very well together to get more dense and longevity. A sophisticatedly sweet treat.

I do love the BR540/Cloud DNA, I'll be clear. And this has a bit of that going on in the drydown, but you need to wait a good amount of time.

A cherry cough syrup accord really envelops the opening experience until about an hour after application. It's very medicinal to me, and is thickly dense fruit, not a fleeting set of top notes. I really dislike artificial and super sweet cherry, and so I found that this isn't my taste. If you do like cherry though, this could be your bag of chips! :) I expected more of a berry scent, and so this disappointments me.

After an hour it does settle into the original Her/Cloud/BR540 thing that some of us enjoy, but I find that this is less so, and almost has a spiced vanilla thing happening as well (maybe that's the benzoin in here, but it doesn't smell like real benzoin to me). It's not annoying to at this point, but it still maintains a bit of the cherry note and I very much prefer it's cousin fragrances over this one, even including In The Stars, and that "dupe" is far, far more affordable.

I think this is fine if you're into cherry, and want some like the original Her, but less like BR540. The longevity and sillage is great. I just don't personally care for it.
Gross, smells like a grape cough syrupy bubblegum mess. No thanks, couldn’t wait to scrub it off my hands

Pink bubble gum,that's it.Lasting power is extremely poor for intense fragrance,on my skin it last 2 hours .
Big No from me.
Yes! Strawberry air freshener and quite medicinal smelling
This smells exactly like a strawberry car air freshener.
my go to scent!

Just amazing! It is sweet, but refreshing and dreamy at the same time. I was looking for ages for the scent like this, I tried D&G Pour Femme Intense, which opens with berries but after a while it's just sweet... With Burberry Her Intense even after 7-8 hours I could still smell those berries. Jasmin and benzoin, which develop over time, definitely give it more feminine character, so I wouldn't say it's girly. More like - charming.

I tried it out of scientific curiosity, as Francis Kurkdijan has a very special place in my heart and although BR 540 is not my favourite fragrance, the comparisons intrigued me. So is Her Intense a more high end dupe than Cloud?

Not in my opinion.

Don’t get me wrong, they do have a similar vibe, I’m guessing it might be the jasmine that is present in both. However while BR 540 is very much unisex, Her Intense just reads extremely feminine. Or girly to be exact. The fruitiness makes it extremely young to me, the initial berry blast, though juicy and pleasant, reminds me of something I’ve worn as a child. Naturally we shouldn’t judge the scent by its opening so I let it sit.

After around half an hour I felt a strong urge to wash it off. It started smelling oddly familiar, not necessarily nice. I started getting stale redbull. I asked my coworkers and they all said the same thing. The berries turned into a cheap energy drink on my skin and I couldn’t wait for the fragrance to fade into oblivion.

As this one is the Intense version I expected quite a good performance, but the longevity was rather moderate, around 4 hours. The projection was very strong throughout those 4 hours though, I’ll give it that.

Baccarat Rouge gives me brown sugar and wood. The wood, vanilla, jasmine and amber harmonise beautifully and create the most perfect balance on your skin. Burberry Her Intense on the other hand just screams strawberry and to my nose, doesn’t even come close to the sophistication of BR 540 and is not a worthy dupe. Cloud smells very similar, a bit sweeter and less “expensive”, but a good replacement if you love the scent but not the price.

As a stand alone perfume, without comparing it to Baccarat Rouge it’s still not my favourite. I enjoy the original Her much better. The Redbull dry down was extremely weird, but I guess that’s on my ph levels.

Intense is a little bit sweeter, less tart. Still very long lasting. To me this smells more like cherry chapstick or something artificial from childhood. The original smells like artificial strawberry/blueberry from childhood. I had a make up pallet when I was little with finger paint eyeshadows and they smelled like this. The original is still my favorite but this is really nice and different enough to keep. Intense is more powdery and yes there is something more mature in the dry down but I would still consider this a very playful fragrance. There are no fragrances that smell exactly like this. Maybe in the same family but still..it's really unique. Intense does not smell like Baccarat. Baccarat is more masculine leaning. Cloud smells like Baccarat.

This smells delicious!

I bought this on a whim (blind buy) as Burberry fragrances never let me down and I was so glad I did. The fruity berry smell is prominent in the first 15 mins on my skin then they quickly dry down to jasmine and benzoin. On my skin, it smells more like a mix of creamy vanilla and some woodiness but I guess that can be attributed to the benzoin.

Luckily for me, the dry down is my favourite part of this fragrance. It's not a boring vanilla scent, it retains some of the floral freshness from the jasmine and has a faint woody scent which separates this from a lot of other vanilla based fragrances within my collection.

This lasts a good 8-9 hours on me but I spray on clothes as well as skin. It projects nicely for about 4 hours, I have had compliments passing by people at 9am though I sprayed it at 5am. Despite this, it is never overbearing. I occasionally ask people around me for feedback when wearing a new fragrance as I wouldn't want to offend anyone and there were no complaints regarding the strength of this perfume. Personally, I think it is best suited for autumn and spring. During these seasons, I seem to get the best performance.

This was a surprisingly great release from Burberry and is definitely worth trying for all ages.
i feel delicious wearing this, i can't get enough of it. such a gorgeous, sweet, yummy smell. my favourite perfume

I don't see the connection with Burberry her. This is only a creamy somehow fruity sweet thing that is inoffensive but I don't find any baccaraty style in it. Very good fragrance but somehow generic and dry down I am not a big fan of.

Sweet and airy and light and comforting, but at the same time I don’t think I would repurchase because it just doesn’t thrill me, it’s so inoffensive and innocent. This wouldn’t be amiss on a 10 year old girl. It really reminds me of something that I cannot put my finger on, feel like it was something from my childhood. Overall a pleasant scent, but I think there are better offerings from Burberry.

I was initially supposed to buy the original one, Burberry Her, however I'm ecstatic that I bought this Intense flanker by mistake, since it's definitely my new favorite fragrance!

I straight up got the berry top notes at the very first spray. But about 5 -10 minutes or so in, it burned down to this combination with berries and a sweet, deep vanilla, which is most likely coming from the benzion. An hour later, the berry scent is somewhat gone and you're left with this beautiful and delicious vanilla fragrance.

I'd also say that the longevity is long lasting, as 3 sprays lasted about 6-7 hours on me. After that, I'd have to get closely to my wrist to smell it.

The only "con" I'd have to give this perfume, is that I wasn't able to smell the jasmin. Which really isn't an issue for me, considering my username ;), since it already smells soo good.

Overall I'd say Burberry Her Intense smells like a naturally deep and sweet vanilla, topped with some fruitiness and will therefore be given a 9.5/10 by me. :)
I haven't played around with this one enough to write a legit review, but it's worth mentioning I tried it on in Ulta the other day and was complimented within 5 minutes of leaving the store.

I purchased this from Ulta yesterday and I am obsessed. I am not big on fruity scents but this is fruit with a hint of marshmallow. I think it sits pretty close to the skin but I love it. This will be my go to day time scent.

Just like the original Her, it’s missing something. You will probably like it if you enjoy the ones it’s being compared to. Still on after exfoliating in the shower and left behind a woodsy scent. I’ll be passing on this, but that’s just personal. I would recommend this to someone just getting into fragrances, though.

I think it would be nice to layer Her with Her Intense.

Update: Can serve as, “I don’t want to scare him off” perfume.

Update 2: wore on a night out and had a guy friend smell my wrist. He said he smelled that on a few girls the night before. Which would probably mean he smelled a mix of BR540, Cloud and Her. There’s an uncanny familiarity between those to a untrained nose— that is nothing to deny.

So far, this is my favorite fragrance. When shopping for my first perfume, I smelled this one and instantly fell in love with it, as well as my partner. It smells strongly of berries (mostly blackberries to me) with a nice hint of vanilla from the benzoin.

At first, the smell is strong enough to perfume the whole room. The first time wearing it, I got in a car right after and had to open the window a bit. It will smell strongly for quite a few hours, but I can still faintly smell it on my skin after 12 hours.

It's a solid 9.5/10 from me!

This is way better than the OG Her, London Dream and the Blossom. Her is more fresh with the strawberry, more youthful than this, but I need something more syrupy, deeper and decadent. To my nose this escapes the Cloud/In the Stars/ Baccarat Rouge vibe in the opening. Yes it has that DNA, but I detect it later. Its very potent also, even after a shower I can smell it, but thats when I smell more of the Baccarat Rouge side of it. This is alot like a tanning oil scent, very beachy and deep. In my opinion its opening is very reminiscent of The One by D&G due to their balsamic, syrupy and deep sweet character. It is lighter than The One tho (which is heavier and with the vetiver it smells kinda like a greek church to me). Not dupes, just same genre.
Her Intense smells like there are more notes than the ones listed on here, as if theres mandarin orange here just like there is in Burberry Her, and in The One which also contains jasmine, and the ambery balsamic base is kinda similar to the benzoin here. After 1 hr on my skin its projection is fresher like Her and BR 540, but when I smell up close I still detect the beautiful resin sweet benzoin. Its opening is expensive, balsamic, syrupy and with intense red fruits, I absolutely love it, wish this was the essence of the entire perfume. Its benzoin (my fav base note) adds an oriental decadent touch to it in the opening and for the first one hour which I wish lasted longer.

I forgot to say that Her is already better than Cloud imo, more dimensional, more feminine, and its opening brings me images of a retro outdoor setting by the pool and tanning beds, so Her Intense amplifies this feeling and the ladies sunbathing wear big white elegant hats, gold earrings and their skin is shiny and tan like this bottle's colors. If I'm gonna have something like Baccarat Rouge 540 it better be this one! I have a tiny bottle of Cloud that I never wear anymore, and I own In the Stars which comes off more herbal with the borage so I like In the Stars more than Cloud. I wore Her Intense today in 93 degree weather while doing heavy yard work and it still smelled amazing. It actually made me buy the whole The One line (EDP, EDT and L'eau) cuz I realize how much I like intense sweet balsamic scents. Her Intense is
Love.

To the poster Anastasia Ag from Swizterland. Unfortunately, under bright lights, body heat from being in so many peoples hands and finally so much oxygenation of the perfume from so many testers using can change a scent. Sometimes just a little, sometimes, like you've just experienced ~ a lot. If it's an expensive perfume that I'm going to invest $300-$500 or more in, I always ask for a new tester to be opened. It's about 50-50 as to who'll do it, but if they don't, I won't buy. A less expensive perfume, salespeople never will. Not that whatever you paid was insignificant, no amount of money spent on a nonessential item ever is, but some people don't think the way I do. Usually though, your scent will eventually match what you remember, if nothing else than with the introduction of oxygen when you spray each time. When I get a new frag home, I take it outside, spray a few times on my hand just out of curiosity and then put it up for a couple weeks. That usually does it for me. My son, a chemist, explained it all to me in very technical terms, but............I can't remember and the way I explained was the only way I could get it.🙃

This...is...incredible! 😍❤️I’m so glad I went with my gut that I needed something of this structure in my collection. I won’t disagree with the cough syrup consistency (though the scent is not medicinal to my nose) this is the definition of syrupy berry, thick, rich. Nothing getting in the way of it either. It’s straight to the point. It stands in such contrast with my natural smell I can identify it ALL DAY LONG! Hallelujah! As much as I love those “your scent but better- scents” they get lost in my natural smell of cupcakes and daydreams (kidding of course). But truly when I think of this scent- it’s the texture of a wax letter seal- its a liquified syrupy texture, then hardens and becomes sticky. This is a super sweet, warmed berry smell. I can see people saying it smells artificial.
But no human truly smells like cupcakes, or bubblegum, or honey, or grass. That’s the whole idea behind perfume, right?
If you like natural smells, move to Brazil, don’t pay your utilities, and throw away your deodorant.

It has the silage and longevity that I need. The problem is, I hate this fragrance. It so sweet and syrupy for me who generally likes sweet gourmand perfumes. I
The smells reminds me of an older woman who’s a heavy smoker and who likes to overspray heavy perfumes. This is the perfume that she would choose. I tried it twice and I washed my hands immediately afterwards. Yet the smell still lingers and only then it shows the BR 540 DNA.
Baccarat rouge with red cherry/energy drink accord over it.
This just smells synthetic, i tried liking it but it was just so unpleasant ... the black berry was just sticking out on the most plasticky way.

This smells like a hooker. No but really, like waxy from cheap lipstick and plastic trash bags with dirty panties. All covered up by a cheap synthetic body spray from the dollar store. Just smells like mistakes 🤣

Although it performes really well, the fregrance is sweeter than any cough syrup. I love sweet perfumes such as Ariana Grande Cloud, Prada Candy, Poison Girl... this one maaaaaybe one spray in the air. 🤣 But, I will give it another try.

Ahhh I love this one. I tested this in last summer all day fully wearing for few days in really hot and humid place. At first try on my wrist I thought it smellled lovely but wouldn’t be great wearing on full body bc it gives syrupy vibes and somehow feels something you shouldn’t put on to your skin bc it wouldn’t match with skin chemistry I don’t know if it makes sense. However after putting fully I loved even more. It’s sexy sour sweet cherries also got me compliments and never was cloying even in that hot-humid weather.

I was skeptical when I read it, but after testing this fragrance for a few days, the review below comparing it to the chaotic contents of a 20-year old's purse is actually spot on. Don't mind having experienced it; wouldn't purchase it now.

But maybe it's not quite as unattractive as that sounds...this scent is a young, fashionable Londoner after a night of clubbing and drinking at a high-end nightclub, where the surroundings and levels of inebriation gradually deteriorate over the course of a night. Or maybe a late teens / 20-something rich girl slumming it somewhere she wouldn't usually be. The scent seems too young to be properly chic, but it's an exact match for aspiring chic dabbling in a bit of early adulthood debauchery. The syrupy berries and benzoin remind me of a rite of passage: alcohol, make-up melting under the club lights and random hookups, with an inevitable nauseous hangover in the morning.
smells like cherry cough syrup.
It's nice but it just doesn't last. I prefer the original BH to Intense.

Berries n musk in a cheapo room spray or car air 'freshener' (they never make a car smell fresh do they? Just bleurgh. If your car smells nasty have it valeted, those things are pointless.) kind of way. Also does veer into that cherry cough medicine vibe others have mentioned. No ta.

Burberry Her Intense is the grown up, more mature edition of the original EDP. The kind of synthetic 'strawberry'/cotton candy vibes become more of forest berries. The floral middle notes become less complex and the classic musky base is replaced by benzoin. For sure a more dressy perfume that is more medicinal as most of you mentioned, (sorry but I love medicinal smells as a medical doctor) more sirupy than airy without being something completelly different than the very first edition. Finally a perfume that is what it says it is! (You know the story of EDP & EDT with the same name but totally different composition). All in all, if I had to choose only one edition by a quick sniff, I am 99% sure this would be the Intense one, but as time goes on, I think that the silly-playful-fruity character of the original is unique. The creator-Francis Kurkdjian said that Her is a signature, yes I agree but at the same time is so similar to thousands of perfumes out there, though sillage & lasting power are 10 times better.

imagine your purse after you left it in the car in the hot sun for half the day. you’re 20 years old and your purse is a mess. broken loose cigarettes, vape juice, various cheap lipsticks and glosses. a few crayons. tissues. smashed breakfast bars. some drugs. receipts. condoms. a dried rose from an old corsage. cards from your grandmother you haven’t opened. the whole disaster of your life all tossed about in the bottom of your bag in the car in the heat. that is what Burberry Her Intense smells like.

Just in case this is of use to anyone.....

Having now smelled a majority of the "Reminds Me Of" scents, I will say that (to me) the similarities are to the original "Burberry Her" (except heightened benzoin + muted strawberry in BHI), and "In the Stars" (except tangelo + woody notes instead of berries in ITS).

It holds no resemblance to either the "Baccarat Rouge" EDP or Extrait, nor "Cloud". It's even further away from "Lipstick Fever".

I really enjoy this scent, but I also adore benzoin-heavy scents. If that's not a note you care for, you might want to step away from this perfume. :)

[BTW, if you were thinking of picking this up as a dupe for one of the BR 540s, I would recommend that instead you check out Al Haramain Amber Oud Rouge.]
Smells sickeningly sweet to me :/ cough syrup vibes. Lasted for only like 1h 30min. Dont recommend blind buying. Hit or miss

Burberry Her Intense is one of the best, widely available designer fragrances marketed toward women. Yes, it smells like berry-scented chapstick mixed with perfume, but it somehow works as an everyday fragrance, possibly a signature scent. There have been some comparisons between this fragrance and the popular (yet pricey) BR540, also by Francis Kurkdjian, and I would say that these fragrances are in the same family, but Her Intense is not a dupe for BR540. BR540 is leans floral-aquatic and has a sense of space, while Her Intense is densely-packed. The burnt sugar note is turned down in Her Intense and I’m not picking up any woody notes.

Performance for Her Intense is excellent! I easily get 12+ hours out of one spray. The spray mechanism is one of the best I’ve tried with a fine mist and a wide distribution. Partial sprays are an option, so don’t worry about over spraying if you plan to wear it to work. Sillage is enormous, and I received compliments from one big spray.

If BR540 is a landmark fragrance that will continue to influence popular fragrances over the next decade, then Her Intense is one of the most accessible examples available. Excellent!

4.5/5

I can barely smell the original in this one. The original is stronger on the strawberries and definitely a lot fresher. The sweetness and amber in this one make it more generic. There a lot of similarly sweet fragrances that are better.

I am very disappointed with this perfume. For £105 I have much better perfumes with longer lasting power. It's not worth the money. I applied it on the skin at 8am in the morning and at 10am I already didn't feel anything on the skin. A very poor performance! Not happy at all Burberry !

I very much like the original Her and this one. I will say, I do like this one better, though. This also lasts longer than the original Her, and better sillage. This is more dark fruity. To me, this has a strong, juicy blackberry note, black cherry, with sensual warm amber and soft woods. I don't get much floral in this, and that's partially where it differs from the original. The other difference is this Intense slightly deeper, and stronger.

First impressions are that this is strong. I don't get any berries but a rather harsh old fashioned "perfumey" smell. It's kind of boozy. I don't know if this is the benzoin as it certainly isn't berries or jasmine. Will update as it progresses.
Edit: Just not for me. I didn't get any berries although it did soften slightly to a vague sweetness. There is a note in it, possibly the benzoin, that is just too harsh for me, it hurt my nose and throat throughout. A case of clashing chemistry unfortunately.

On paper this is not bad! Definitely BR540 with dark berry/cherry syrup. So maybe it's my skin chemistry because it is a MESS to wear! It instantly becomes almost bitter and definitely medicinal. It's unfortunate since I hear others have an awesome experience with Her Intense. Would not suggest to blind buy for sure!

I am absolutely in love with this fragrance! I have about 8 perfumes in my collection, but this has definitely become my signature scent!

It’s not for people who prefer light, easy fragrances, so be careful and don’t blind buy this, better test it out first! Also, I have read that many found it appalling at first, but then fell in love with it - the same happened to my husband. We went together to Sephora and smelled it. For me, it was love at first sight, he hated it. I ended up not buying it then, but I have to admit I was extremely disappointed because I loved it. Decided to buy it a few months later and he loved it right from the start.
Beautiful fragrance. Not what I expected but I do love the scent. Oddly the dry down on me smells very close to Twilly D’Hermès.

The first time I tested this perfume I thought it smelled warm and sweet but strong, over powering even, it stuck in my nose and smelled like medicine. I threw the test strip in my purse and thought that was that, until I opened my purse throughout the day, and the next day, and the next day. My entire purse, my wallet, mask all smelled like this perfume but the scent cooled down and smelled less like medicine and just like cherry, strawberry, vanilla with a hint of floral. I caved went back to the store on day three and bought it.

I highly recommend testing this in the store before buying, the red fruits will either be too much for you and remind you of medicine or you'll love it. It does smell different to me dried down, it holds on to skin and clothes, not something that stays in my face but if i put my sweater to my nose I remember it's there. I saw another comment about it being addicting like it kept calling I felt the same way. I will say I understand the comparisons to cloud but this is more mature and solid with dark red fruits, where as cloud smells fluffy like whip cream and juvenile (not in a bad way I have both and love them).

The bottle is simple, it also has a lengthy spray if you push the nozzle all the way down. Have you used those new Flairosol style spray bottles? Yeah just like that.

On initial spray, I do get cherry cough syrup that fades into jasmine. It becomes strong jasmine for a while, then I'm guessing the benzoin comes in to kind of warm it and eventually it morphs into a cherry-vanilla sweetness. It does last on me for awhile. I would say this is stronger at the end of the day than the original Her, however I think I prefer the original for it's youthful, brighter qualities. I do like this one, even with the weird cough syrup thing. Definitely try it if you're interested in it. If you already have the original, I do not think it is worth also getting this one as they are kind of similar.
Update: I find my tastes to be changing and I do not like sweet or "gourmand" fragrances, therefore I don't really like this one or the original Her. They are too youthful, too sweet, too "cheap body spray" for me.

I absolutely love Burberry Her Intense and it is quickly becoming one of my most reached for perfumes. I have a 50ml bottle and I will definitely be repurchasing when it's finished. I've seen a few reviews mention it is like sickly cherry cough syrup, I personally don't get that at all - on me it is like mixed berries with a lightly spicy warm vanilla and I think it's absolutely beautiful. Great sillage and long lasting - it is one of my most complimented perfumes (particularly by men) and seems to be noticed hours after spraying. I find it very classy and whenever I wear it I feel good. I think it is most suited to autumn or winter as it carries very well in cold weather and has a warm vibe - I bought it in September though so am yet to try it in really warm weather. Highly recommend for anyone who likes a rich fruity gourmand!

This is tons of cherry on me and almost nothing else. No resemblance whatsoever to Ariana Grande's "Cloud". I actually like it very much, the cherry is very pleasant and feels sophisticated which I would not have expected a cherry smell to be.
I'm very disappointed. It smells like cherry cough syrup to me then remains medicinal.

This is sweet. raspberry lollipop with a touch of cherry sweet... but wealthy. This smells like sugar and money. Burberry always have this posh feeling - my sister said it smelled disdainful and pretentious 😭😭 - with their fragrance but this one is special. Playful, fun, it’s a scent for someone who enjoys each day to their fullest, knowing the world is theirs. Effortless and beautiful.

Edit: got it for xmas and it's addicting, i'm obsessed! sweet, enveloping, hypnotizing. it's fruity the way i love: sexy, edible, rich.

I have been using this for a while and I have to say I prefer it over the original Her. The strawberry note was too much for me but this blend is more rounded to my nose, lighter but still very long lasting and easier to wear.

I also have to say that I hated it when I first sprayed it out of the bottle it smelled like what people mentioned it to be a cough syrup. But it was gone quickly and next time I used it it never smelled like it at all. It has little sourness to it as well and I really love the benzoin here. I hated Burberry Her’s dry down, it was very masculine and it didnt match the scent at all. How A strawberry candy scent could have a drydown so masculine. But Her Intense is smooth, the benzoin compliments the scent and gives a clean vanilla effect and it is a good soft blend with slightly sour berries.

It also feels like you dont wear a perfume so if you cant tolerate heavy scents and want something light, easy going but still long lasting and not headache inducing this could be your gem

Love the perfume, purchased it brand new and sealed, but there was quite a lot missing from the bottle, so that's a bit sketchy.

Her Intense is refined and elegant, nothing medicial about it.

It was love at first sniff! This reminds me of a berry cake (in a very gooood way). Burberry Her Intense is the most elegant, classy, and chic berry scent i've ever smelled. There's something so comforting about this fragrance. I can't put it into words. When I sprayed this on me it transported me to a place and time that I don't want to leave. The feeling of dejavu is so strong and it gives me so much comfort. I love this perfume!
This reminds me of pink PEZ candy. I can't really smell much else, it's powdery fruity sweet and a bit tart, no benzoin, but it might be just my skin (or nose). Burberry her is better in my opinion.
On me definitely its the vibe of baccarat r and I love it soo much then its becom much gentle ...after hours an even more baccarat r and on the end the benzoin and light fruit and again I love it

This is definitely one of the more interesting experiences I’ve had with any fragrance.

I blind bought this and hated it at first. It gave me a medicinal cough syrup vibe that made me nauseous and gave me headaches upon headaches. So screechy and synthetic it felt like my senses were being attacked.
But somehow that bottle kept calling my name, asking me to smell it. I hated it, but at the same time it was so addictive and I couldn’t stop smelling it.

And so in about 3 days time this went from being a hate to becoming a solid LOVE.

A musky, berry, benzoin BOMB.
Also, the atomizer on this? Perfection.

This was a blind buy. Turns out it was a good blind buy. This to my nose is not a dupe for Baccarat Rouge but instead it reminds me of Paco Rabanne Black XS in the good old days when it had good longevity and good sillage. Having just bought a bottle of Black XS and being disappointed by the performance these days, I'm more than happy to have this little beauty.

Ooh, this one is interesting! Delicious red berries, juicy and playful. I was worried at first, because berries usually turn foul on me, but this one doesn't.

I do think it's geared more towards younger audiences and I will probably only be able to enjoy this in the privacy of my home. I'm happy to use this sample up, but I don't think I'll ever purchase a full size, as cheerful berries aren't what I go for usually and I wouldn't feel in my skin wearing it out.

I find myself constantly sniffing my wrist with this on, though. A fun little guilty pleasure for sure! :)

edit: after wearing this for a couple of days, I can say I quite like it! It's unlike anything else in my collection currently, and I would say it's very modern and unexpected in current trends. Yes berries have been around forever, but something here stops it from going to that juvenile fruity zone and although playful, stays professional and even almost classy. It's the kind of fruity-floral that rich people would wear, it doesn't smell ordinary or mainstream to me. I might consider purchasing a full bottle when I run out of the decant I have, which is a first for me in fruity scents!

Medicinal smell or like a cough syrup..
I prefer the original one
6/10
The original one is better. This one smells like cherry cough medicine.

Girls Just Wanna Have Fun: Burberry Her Intense is the perfect Gal Pal

This is a rather linear scent, and l think it is well blended. The fruity aspect is most prominent. This perfume reads as fun, youthful, but not frivolous. It has a level of sophistication to it, but it's not terribly complex either. She's uncomplicated, informal and easy to be around. Always a good time! Do you have someone like that in your life? I sense the the colours white and red when l smell it. A vision of Strawberries and cream.

Imagine a layered trifle pudding sans cake and macarons. Base layer is a small amount of creme brulee (with nutmeg and no yolk) with lots of fresly whipped cream, topped with powdered sugar and/or marshmallow. Next comes a thin layer of berry juice Gelee with many fresh Indian Jasmine petals (jam like concoction). To top off everything, fresh JUICY berries. I think strawberries is most obvious. What to do with this? Take your finger, poke it straight through and smear it on your skin. You might think this is very heavy, or thick sounding, but it's totally not.

There is an underlying Powdery, musky smell l find similar to Body Shop Libertine White Musk. There's a strange mentholated vibe to it as well, when merged with the berries it smells like black currant. I totally get the cough syrup analogy, but the scent is decidedly more powdery and resinous than syrupy.

All in all l enjoy it. I think this works as an everyday casual scent going into to semi-formal occasions (outdoor picnic, luncheon, dinner). Any season this technically works because this is neither too heavy or too light.
Though during the fall and winter l prefer something richer, decidedly more heavy, something in the Oriental family. I admit the fresh fruity aspect might be out of place in those months. I admit if you can get fresh fruit year round, why not just go with it?

I like that it still smells somewhat substantial, I'm definitely wearing a scent here. Approachable, friendly, kind of cute and girly. Has a sweetness to it that's not overbearing. The tartness of the fruits cuts through it.

I am reminded of the House of Givenchy, because a fruity berry accord is their signature in perfumes. However the effect they go for is more dark and smoky. This perfume is more fresh and subtle. Berry theme makes a lot of sense for the brand, BUR-BERRY. The perfume bottle is really quite pretty, like a drinking flask. There is a nice gradation of colour in the glass, from Rose to maroon. A pale beige pink cap and gold accents. This color scheme is quite chic. This perfume is a bit special because l received this as a gift when Corona virus was raging. I find it amusing that the packaging reminds of that time, because the health authority would cordon off communal areas and plaster caution tape over public amenities like chairs, swing sets and the like.

I glam this scent up by first dabbing what remains of this beautiful scented candle Yoshiwara Gardenia which has Gardenia and Tuberose in it. Who can resist a proper floral bouquet ?

Seduced by reviews, I blind bought it. Opening is interesting, on the cute side, not bad at all, but developing, after first 30 mins, and dry down is bad, it smells like artificial berries sprinkled with watered down petrol. I think this is a totally synthetic fragrance. Lasts extremly long.

The fruity amber wood!
.
“Burberry Her, as a Gourmand fragrance, steps out of the traditional gourmand family as it is not sticky nor thick. On contrary, it’s airy and light in a unique way. Red and dark berries are at the heart of Burberry Her fragrance family. However, Burberry Her Intense is intensified with notes of blackberries and cedarwood for a subtly intense scent. The Intense version of Burberry Her fills the airy side of the scent without adding any thickness or heaviness” Francis Kurkdjian said.
.
Sweet & savory start by blackberries then burberry’s special floral sign as Jasmine in heart. Finally a woody, amber base. This part has some similarity to MFK BR 540. The image of burnt caramel inside a pan and the sensation of an overaly sweet dessert sliding down the throat, sharp but paradoxically salty. While he fails to charm us here, he is nonetheless innovative.
.
Well, I think burberry her intense is an easy wear choice for everyone that doesn’t like sticky gourmand fragrance. It’s really delicate meanwhile smooth & gorgeous.

Burberry Weekend is the perfume that my childhood best friend’s mother wore for years. For me, that fragrance evokes the image of a mature, composed woman — someone serious, who gets things done, dresses “sexy” (as I used to call it back then), and always makes sure she’s well put-together.

I came across it again this year at an airport shop, and the moment I smelled it, I was instantly transported back to my teenage years — when, at 14 or 15, I’d secretly spray it in my friend’s bathroom. Later, her mother would chuckle when she met me in the hallway and ask, “Did you spray my perfume again?”

I bought it this time because I felt ready to embrace that sense of being a “mature, grounded” woman myself, as I near thirty. But on me, it simply feels flat — a little dull, lacking personality. I realize now that I probably bought it more to reconnect with a memory, to be transported back to my childhood, rather than to feel like a fully formed adult.

I can't think of a nice way to describe this scent on my skin - it literally smells like the air freshener they use in public restrooms. Smelled nice when I purchased it 2 years ago but now it makes me feel nauseous and its projection is very weak.

As a floral breather this is dated if u are a modern floral lover u wouldn’t like this & i keep getting something like morning breath in this one it does smell outdated I don’t recommend blind buying it
3/10
too mature & floral. reminds me of one of my nona's old perfumes. maybe elizabeth arden red door?--not sure

Weekend for Women by Burberry holds a special place in my collection. It’s not something I wear all the time, but when the temperature is just right, it becomes absolutely magical. The floral notes bloom beautifully, wrapping me in a soft, comforting warmth that feels like a gentle hug.

There’s a calm, effortless elegance in this scent — casual but refined. It’s especially lovely in mild to slightly cool weather, when the florals really come alive and seem to radiate warmth from within.

It may not be my all-year signature, but when I wear it at the right moment, it reminds me why I love it so much.

My mom’s signature perfume, it reminds me of a bookstore & floral teas, which sounds weird but I don’t know how else to describe it, it’s very familiar. A good mature floral mandarin scent for anyone who’s finally taking a step into adult life and layers well with EOS fresh and cozy🫶
my mother has it. a pleasent smell but too basic in my opinion
Disappears in minutes. I was quite disappointed by the receint purchase
maybe the sample was off but this smells strongly, overwhelmingly of airport bathroom hand soap to me. with a touch of stale piss to really sell it.

Vintage frosted bottle. Feel-good fragrance that lives up to its name. Light, fresh, sunny and a perfect pick me up for spring and summer. The rose hip and sage notes keep it from being a typical fruity floral. Smells like ice cream.
I have the old bottle, and I adore this scent. It is sweet and floral, but at the same time, fresh and uplifting. It is still a current perfume, in spite of the formula beeing guite old.
Genuinely, this smells like cardboard and the sharpest edge of Chanel no 5.

At first, I agreed with the commenter that said it reminds them of florals soaked in piss. But after applying once or twice it grew on me. Initial spray still gets me a little bit, but after about 30 sec it calms down. Somehow plays well as both a vintage and modern vibe. I like it. It's a good everyday sent for women who dress bold or loudly. Hence the name weekend i'm guessing because that's the only time a office girl can get a little bold for with her outfits. last week i wore this with a lady gaga tshirt on that I customized and lots of silver and i felt like i was channeling her. My mom complemented the scent, which is rare. Probably not a safe blind buy, but price makes it reasonable if considering that. Lasts a long time, especially on the clothes ;)
¨Weekend is actually a fougere scent. It is not sweet nor flowery, but aromatic and bitter green. Great one!

I owned this years ago, it was one of those easy every day type of fragrances. I recently smelled this again, it was different, more cloying than I remember. I would not repurchase this, even though I went through a few bottles of these. I remember this as a soft sweet fun smell, there is something more intense and aggressive now and it lingers in a bad way, its a pass now.

A soft-spoken floral that feels like a warm hug from the ’90s. Powdery peach, violet, and a hint of grassiness transport you straight to the English countryside—think linen shirts, a quiet afternoon, and no obligations.

It’s sweet without being cloying, floral without being fussy. The peach blossom and blue hyacinth add a breezy charm, while the drydown of sandalwood and musk keeps it grounded.

If you grew up with this, I get it—this scent is memory in a bottle. If you’re new to it, it’s a gentle introduction to florals that wear effortlessly. One spray is enough for a clean, comforting presence that lingers all day.
This is a superb fragrance. Fresh, uplifting, and full-bodied.

I picked this up many years ago in a small supermarket in Spain when I was a teenager and the only reason my mum got it for me is because it was on sale lol! I believe this was the first designer perfume I ever owned and I was obsessed with it, I wore it everyday to school and I remember dousing my pineapple top in this before going out with friends on a friday evening after school. I still wear this scent to this day its one of my daytime scents and sometimes one that I wear on a weekend in the summer if Im popping out to the pub or for a sunday roast as its not offensive and smells very clean to me. I would honestly say that this is one of the only perfumes throughout the years that has grown up with me and I never got sick of!

I picked this up many years ago at a TJ Maxx or Marshalls as a blind buy, not knowing what to expect. The bottle I have is the 1.0 oz pictured, and I haven’t smelled the newest formulation currently on the market.

Although it is so different from most of my other perfumes, I absolutely love it. One spray is enough—too much and I can see this getting nauseating. On me, this smells mostly of fuzzy peaches and osmanthus, with some soft powdery iris/violet, greenness from hyacinth, and a touch of sandalwood. The impression it leaves is soft and relaxed, and I’m instantly transported to the English countryside to enjoy a quiet weekend.

As a huge fan of peach and osmanthus, it’s no surprise that I love this scent so much. When I want to lean into the fruity notes, I layer this with an osmanthus soliflore. When I want to play up the green, herbal quality, I might layer it with Miss Dior Originale to give it a chypre quality. Either way, this scent is well blended and plays well worth others.

I am such a big fan of this scent that I want to pick up another bottle of the same formulation. Unfortunately I haven’t tried the current one and am a little nervous it won’t be as good. Sometimes I just look forward to being able to spritz on this scent to properly start my weekend at home relaxation!
it smells like piss with flowers. Flowers soaked in pee.

Very sweet, pollen-heavy floral bouquet. The opening is juicy and sticky, think heavily ripened nectarines on a hot day. It's almost sensual but unfortunately the dry-down is a snooze. It quickly settles into a vague, powdery-sweet haze on the skin. It's cloying in most weather conditions.
Very cosy and hugging "absolute love" fragrance. 💛

It was my first perfume at the age of 17. It was a milestone in my life, a huge step to become an adult. Nowadays, nearly since 20 years I havent wear it at all. I guess I should smell it again, maybe I was too young for it back then. As I remember it was noticable longlasting. Really signatur scent worthy.

Got this perfume as a gift from an ex boyfriend. I am not a fan of floral scents at all, and do not typically reach for ones with prominent floral notes- especially rose. This perfume to me smells very old fashioned and grandma-ish. I love a powdery musky scent but I don't even really pick up on musk or sandalwood because all I can smell is flowers. The rose and old school florals scent is too much for me. If you enjoy those types of smells you will love this, but definitely not a scent I will ever reach for.

The first spray reminds me of my mom since she is usually found wearing exactly this type of perfume. It’s not bad, but it’s not good either. I get no freshness, I love a fresh floral, but it’s a little bit artificial- to me it smells like a scented marker that has been on the paper for an hour or so. An old perfume blotter you find in your handbag of a perfume you didn’t really like. Definitely getting bathroom air freshener vibes as well - fake cloying floral notes, like you want to hide something. Maybe it just doesn’t work with my body chemistry. If my mom didn’t have so many similar fragrances, I would pass this onto her.
The drydown is definitely more powdery, but I can’t get rid of the deodorant/air freshener note. I do not get any nectarine juiciness, nor any green notes.
I don’t see it lasting very long either (and I’m glad for that), reading the comments I have the new reformulated bottle which apparently has worse longevity.

A very very safe to blind buy! Citrusy.. pink floral.. it blends SO well, very feminine. It gives off the vibe of a kind young girl who enjoys hanging out at flower shop with her grandma! Fresh vintage I would say, so versatile and timeless (night n day, all seasons, all ages)

A perfume that has a lot of memories this was the first perfume that I bought . Reminds me of a very happy time nothing is similar to this so nostalgic .
A very nice floral scent it’s was long lasting

A rich lady in her 40s named Cynthia working as a receptionist at a natural history museum for a side hustle. A dense floral but i feel like i notice the sandalwood and cedar on my skin more than the fruit. Total old fashioned floral

The perfume is suicide floral x fruity vibe friends.
Top: Violet, Tangerine
Mid: hyacinth and Iris little bit
Base: Musk and Sandalwood
Nice good for fall and spring sometime Hot weather ... kinda OK little bit white floral more than fruity.
It stay around 3 or 6 hours depending on humidity and temperature.

This fragrance has a special place in my heart. I got it as a gift and fell in love. This is a such a feel good type of fragrance. It represents the 90s era of fragrance so well. It is a dense floral with bold fruity nectarine. This really develops well on skin and projects. I have the reformulated version and it does not have the best lasting power. I still get about 6 hours so not bad. These bottles are usually sold at a steal so that always helps. This is definitely a hidden gem.

In a perfume gathering Burberry Weekend sits at the same table with Lancome Poeme, Guerlain Champs Elysees and Fragonard Soleil. They're wearing white, yellow and green and smiling and chatting to each other. Everyone in the room can hear their carefree laughter bursting out every now and then. The sun beam from the window hits their table and makes this quartet glow like they were made of pure sunshine.
This smells like your mother is making peach jam in the kitchen, while you are waiting for her on the patio of your country house in spring.

@Nil3 there a womens weekend bottle that looks like the men's bottle as long as it says for women on the bottle it should be for women. I had a bottle in like 2008 and it looked different from both bottle pictured and the larger taller bottles lol it was like a weird combination of both bottle mixed together...

This perfume reminds me of my twenties when it was gifted to me at work. It was a mix of excitement and hesitation. I loved the bottle - yellow with white ornaments. The scent I would describe as nauseating and sweetly pleasant. Very strange mix. Years later I sought out this perfume again. I wanted something rich, heady, sweet, sticky. I remember being complimented on it a lot. In my life I had many perfumes but compliments I received only on Eden by Cacharel, Weekend for Women by Burberry and 540 BR. All three are VERY different but loud and all three I strongly disliked at some point. Overall, Weekend for Women is very strong and impressive scent with sickly notes

It says on a website retail packaging has changed since 2019.

Can FRAGRANTICA team confirm please 🙏🏻?

Help!
Someone help me with some info please !

I ordered weekend for women and received another shape of bottle .

Is it a new bottle ?

It looks like the bottle of weekend for men but it says eau de Parfum for women .
I love wearing this on a Monday.

Beautiful, juicy, fresh floral bouquet. Mood boosting, peaceful, and happy scent. Great for the spring and summer, suitable for the office or a casual outdoor evening with friends. It's youthful and delicate. It can often be found at a reduced price, it's a very good deal - affordable, good quality. Noticeable projection and long-lasting.
Absolutely beautiful summer Bouquet... I'm in love <3

In order to make sense, I would start by stating that I have the newer formula and bottle of Weekend. Not the bottle shown here on Fragrantica. Simple, similar to Le Labo style of bottles, produced in 2020, in Germany.
I have never had or tested the original Weekend version but like expected, that was the superior one apparently! Most likely, the 2020 reformulation has butchered the essence of Weekend, like it happens with most of perfume reformulations.

My Weekend is a powdery floral-fruity bomb type of scent. I say if you’re into peaches, nectarines, sweet mandarin oranges, Weekend is your scent. Very affordable as well. Slightly synthetic smelling, sugary sweet, like candy fruits would. Pleasant, sweet, fruity, feminine perfume.

Besides a ton of sweet, juicy fruits, I detect a nice, spring flower bouquet: peach blossoms, violet, hyacinth and iris. Rose hip and mignonette are two new notes to me, so I can’t comment on how prominent they are featured here. I would say that both have a honeyed, floral sweet smell after reading the description here, so I think they are well incorporated in the juice. Weekend it’s truly a a floral sweet scent! From the base notes, I think the sandalwood and cedar are much needed for some neutral, grounding notes because of the intensity of the fruits and florals.

It’s a nice, everyday, casual scent, better suited for younger people in my opinion. Season wise, definitely spring and summer appropriate.

If you can get it heavily reduced like I got my bottle, it’s not a bad scent. It has two noteworthy ingredients that I have not encountered ever in niche scents. But it’s nothing very unique in terms of how it smells. I know perfumes have to smell like perfumes, but this smells very "perfumey".

You are spending a late spring weekend in an English country manor and decide to take an early morning stroll in the beautifully manicured garden. The flowers are covered in morning dew and the smell of wet soil mixes with their beautiful scent. The sun has just risen and the golden light of dawn gives the place a dream like quality. You hear some rustling behind the hedge and know that some nocturnal animal is watching you. You wrap your pashmina shawl tight around you, take one last deep breath of the fragrant morning air and hurry back to your room.

This is all headache-inducing powdery yellow florals for me. I thought the nectarine and citrus would lend it a little juicy sweetness, but they are nowhere to be found. Sadly on my skin this scent does smell very old fashioned, reminding me of perfumes worn by various aunts and teachers--all born in the 1940s. When I was teenager in the 80s perfumes started to change and target a younger audience, and these older ladies summarily disapproved. My friends and I got used to hearing that our perfume smelled tawdry, loud, loose, and cheap; the stuffy powder florals from the WW2 era were the only respectable thing. A "good girl" smells like flowers, not something edible, and never draws attention.... 😂 🤣 No offense, but I can see those staunch ladies proudly wearing this.

Burberry Weekend is a great bargain scent, a powdery, polleny floral whose quality belies its price. At least, this is the case for the EDP in the squat circular bottle, which is what I'm reviewing. My sister received this as a present in 2010 as a young teenager, and I found her original bottle recently. I can't speak to the new taller bottle and any possible reformulation, but the bottle I have is beautiful. It is a slightly unusual floral - fresh yet sweet, bright yet powdery - but is an easy reach for everyday.
