At £295, it’s definitely a luxury buy—but one that feels worth it for what you get. It’s not hyped, not common, and that adds to its allure. This is a scent only true frag heads seem to know about—a rare, under-the-radar masterpiece that’s quietly disappearing from shelves.

If you love finding gems before the world catches on—or before they’re gone—this one is for you.

A contradiction in name, but not in nature. Ash should whisper of something charred, something brittle and undone, petals kissed by fire, fragile and smoke-stained. And yet here, there is no burn, no edge—only heat, unrelenting and syrup-thick, yet dehydrated and abrasive. It is dense, oppressive, it is the most sandpaper-like warmth that does not flicker but suffocates and scrapes, wrapping around itself in layers upon layers of sweetness that never break, never waver. There is no space for breath, no escape for air. The scent moves inwards, folding, smothering, cloaking... just unbearable.

This was a blind-buy. Burberry uses almond and peach in their fragrances so well, and this is the reason I wanted Ash Flower when I saw the notes.

Cool, aloof, introverted, powdery, it gives me orris root vibes from the start. It does smell ashy! Smells like both suede and leather too.

You're in for a treat if you like almond! There's an intense green almond that really isn't dessert-like. It reminds me of unsweetened almond milk, not almond cookies or pastries. It becomes creamier as it dries down. Probably tonka kicking in making it creamier, yet not vanilla. It's not lactonic like other perfumes with "milk" notes. The almond becomes a bit nuttier in the drydown and blends nicely with tonka.

Peach is barely there, just enough to uplift and balance the gloomy, ashy quality. Ash Flower isn't a fruity fragrance. It's mostly a gray, suede-like fragrance that is rather melancholy, kind of like La Pausa EDT (they are very different scents though--don't get me wrong!).

Ash Flower is truly unique and should get more attention. While I might not add it to the masterpiece category, there's nothing else like it, and that seems like quite an achievement for a perfumer nowadays!
Does not smell high end at all. Cheap designer-ish at best.

Don't know why this one isn't getting much love but it is such a creamy sweet airy almond with a twang of peach . The peach smells truly sophisticated. It's not your everyday bath and body works / Victoria secret type of peach. I do get the juniper berries which lends to the aromatic side. The saffron is beautiful it doesn't come off as too rubbery or anything. It's a creamy , milky , lactonic scent.

The packaging is top tier. Love everything about this. Seriously it's beautiful and so under the radar.

Bought the perfume for the scent because notes looked fantastic.

The packaging is really amazing stationary invite quality for a leather tie event. Then there is a leather tie that harmonizes with the note profile, a slightly nude bisque color, wrapped around the neck. Magnetic cap metal is etched with some art deco geometrics for a bit of a textural edge.

The glass isn't quite baccarat like Celine bottles, though it's squared up and substantial. Won't bruise a toe if it slips out of a spray session handling. Not prone to break either.

So, the initial few wearings were fresh cherry tonka intensivo. Gave it a chance. Took the lid off for a day. Left it alone for a week. Revisited it and . . . perfecto.

Delicate almond, smooth and soft lactonic. A hint of sweet, wild grasses, and a sunset golden peach.

Longevity is 6 hours or more on skin and days on cloth.

Burberry baci di dama bonanza.
Almondy sweet, sugary powder reminds me of so called Loukhoums, and caramelic scent that reminds me of Baccarat 540, with raspberry undertone.
Two words: Lactonic Saffron!

Tried this flavor the other day. I didn't even know it was new. I thought it was just not represented here.
In general, the most beautiful almond, if to describe simply. If to go into the essence, there is a brand dnk, which I adore. The association - gray haze over the water, from the opened door of the pastry shop comes the aromas of pastries and spices. Only the price of 200 euros stopped me from buying it. The flavor is beautiful.

Another Michel Almairac scent in my collection . The guy who brought us JOOP and Farenheit. I didn't know the perfumers until i got on this site and am always amazed how many of the ones I like are by the same people.

I shamelessly wear my wife's scents. Not all of them ofcourse but this one is just a nice classic vanilla that is conforting and a little boozy to me. It's enveloping and calming to me.

The bottle I'm reviewing is about 20 years old. It's pretty much full and the box says only Burberry. It's the same bottle as above but I get none of the fruitiness of the mentionned notes.

I get a vanilla powder that sits on a brandy like note ...to me. It's classic and not to sweet or cloying. I can see how this is a flagship scent although it's simple and uncomplicated. Burberry Brit is another Vanilla fave along with Burberry weekend that has a peach like note.

I don't wear weekend as it leans feminine but it's like catnip when the wife wears it.

Wear this perfume more than 20 years. Feminine, but not to sweet, charming, but suits business woman too...
It's just perfect. Love, love, love it forever.
Note: live in north, with high humidity climate. This perfume works really good when it's cold outside.

Unfortunately, this fragrance is overwhelmingly sweet to the point of causing dizziness. The biggest drawback, however, is its extremely short longevity—lasting no more than half an hour on my skin. That said, it does carry a certain mature charm, evoking the image of a woman strolling through autumn streets as rain falls and leaves scatter around her. It's a lovely concept, but the performance and balance just don’t deliver for me

I saw that it was compared to Ghost deep night and now I am wondering if my bottle is fake 😅. I like deep night as it smells dark, woody and fresh at the same time, but Burberry women is just a weak sweet scent with some slight sourness.

This one is not for me. Although I have to admit I am smelling this for the first time, 30 years after its release, and I don’t recall smelling anything like it. Although it may be original, it’s just not interesting or pleasant to me. I would describe this as fresh, slightly powdery, warm citrus, somewhat indolic. There’s no actual citrus in the notes but there’s a sharp freshness here that gives me that kind of impression. This scent seems more appropriate for a laundry detergent, cleaning product, candle, or hotel lobby. I personally would not choose to smell like this, but no offense to those who do. Fragrance is very subjective and there are so many to choose from nowadays. I would say this is not a safe blind-buy (as I regretfully did on clearance at Marshalls), especially if you prefer more contemporary fragrances.

I pick up a faint apple on first spray, then a woody note, then nothing. Had me wondering “is that all?”. It doesn’t feel like a complete fragrance. I don’t know what this smelled like pre reformulation but this is not wearable for me. Fancy Love does the fruity-woody scent profile much better.
New bottles have almost zero lasting power ): not even Bath and Body Works mist power. lovely scent tho!
smells like an old sheriff's office. there's a nutty/spicey note that i reallllllly don't like (maybe the apricot or pear?)

this perfume is so well-blended that its hard to pinpoint all of the notes. I get a very sensual, seductive nighttime scent that you'd smell in a hotel lobby or in line waiting for a play. this has a grandma profile to a degree but is so fresh and intoxicating. this is AMAZING in cold weather and lasts alllll damn day.

Even if the formula changes 20 times, I will continue to buy it. Even people who don't know me well say that this scent resembles me.I want to plan our baby's baby shower with this fragrance.I want to be a family with this fragrance and evade taxes

Fresh yet very versatile! Delicate yet present! It's not very fruity in my opinion, which is why I wore it all four seasons.

I don't smell the fruty top notes, my nose directly detects the jasmine, sandalwood and vanilla. It was my signature scent from 2012 until around 2020 since I can no longer find it at winners.

This is the perfume that I received the most compliments, and it stays on me all day but not a sillage to die for. If I have the chance to find it, I'll definitely buy it again!

If you enjoy the scent of crisp green apple and peach wrapped in a touch of vanilla, this fragrance might be for you. Unfortunately, its longevity is short — it only lasts a few hours. It doesn’t smell like an apple pie or dessert; instead, it’s a fresh, juicy green apple with a hint of peach, sweetened gently by vanilla.

It’s a versatile scent that could easily become a signature fragrance. It’s never overpowering or offensive, just pleasant, charming, fresh, youthful, and fun — without crossing into childish territory.
Instant boyfriend

this is a really solid fragrance.

The opening is what really blew me away, however. It smells like a bubble bath almost? but like a REALLY bougee bubble bath. I definitely picked up the peaches in the dry down. the projection is quite decent imo. most of the comments say it doesn't perform as well, but maybe the composition is different (?). im not sure which make mine is as it was my mother's originally, but that 90's vintage flair is certainly notable.
the note of the peach, while not being sickly sweet, definitely gives this frag potential to be wearable all year round! So it's extremely versatile.
it can come off as too powdery to some (almost like a hotel ladies powder room with air freshener sprayed all over) so just be cautious of that. its not TOO strong to be picked up on by other people, but once you notice it yourself, it can become distracting.

however, if you want to smell like a nostalgic (yet slightly mature), vacation in the Caribbean, def pick this one up! xx

This is one of my all time faves. It's so feminine and soft and just reminds me of a very classy woman. It smells a LOT like Jessica Simpson Fancy Love, but the Burberry is softer and easier to wear. It's very nostalgic for me, too. Magic in a bottle. I give it a 9/10.

it starts really strong but sits well. definitely a mature one, I don't recommend younger girls using this. My mom uses this so it's sort of my comfort scent now haha
The peach and pear smell is the ones that immediately get my attention. Warm, suitable for autumn. Elegant, mature. Very beautiful.
Sweet & floral not sure i smell the fruits

I am in awe how disappointing this is. It barely has any smell at all, and I’m a lover of light fragrances. This isn’t a “light fragrance”, it actually feels like a scam; lBurberry is laughing all the way to the bank on its sales. This will be my last Burberry purchase. I love Burberry Brit, and have since bought Brit Rhythm which I dislike, Touch which I dislike, and now this absolute joke of a fragrance. Burberry, you suck.
ETA: might as well mention, the whisper of a scent I can detect when I bury my nose in my arm (after 6 sprays on that single spot, mind you) is that musty-dusty smell some fragrances leave behind after the dry-down has worn off.
sayesinde birkaç kez iltifat aldım,tekrar denemek isterim.

before the reformulation this was the sexiest sweetest muskiest richest most expensive smelling fragrance i’ve ever worn. i stole it from a department store in college and it became my signature. recently i purchased it legally and it’s a shadow of its former self. much fruitier now. i couldn’t even describe the original because it was so beautifully blended. not fresh peaches but warm syrupy stewed peaches. had that elusive vintage smell dusty leather handbag red nails angora sweaters nylons. it was giving old money now it’s giving some money. still ok but nowhere near as deep and rich and complex as it once was. projection and longevity was insane, lasted for weeks on my unwashed clothes in the hamper could smell me across campus, now ur lucky to get 3 hours and it’s almost a skin scent

This scent is magic in a bottle, feels very reminiscent of 90s atmosphere, it has a hint of vintage in the best possible way. I love the beauty created with the magnificent combination of the notes, the peach, apricot and pear are an absolute favotite whenever they are used in a scent. I do not believe in a gender specific scent, but let's call this a female leaning, but anyone who wants to feel cosy, smell unique and nice can wear this. I love to overspray my perfumes, so having that in mind I love scents that are not overbearing, just like this one. Sadly I have never smelled the old formula to make the comparison, but what I can say is that the scent is a 100% out of a 100% amazing, with one drawback that it is very light and almost immediately becomes a skin scent. I love a good skin scent, but I wish this perfume would project and linger little bit longer before becoming a skin scent.

I recently scored a 1.7 oz unopened bottle of this with Burberry London on box and bottle. This is not what is made now. This is probably from early 2000s. It’s so pretty and 2 sprays lasted on my hand all day long. Very beautiful unique smell! Love it!

This used to be my winter scent! It’s been reformulated… It used to be a ‘love’, now it’s a ‘like’. It’s giving Obsession by CK, which is not a bad thing but not the same as it used to be, so I’m going to finish this bottle with the new juice but not going to repurchase unfortunately.

Surprisingly this reminds me of Burberry Body minus the soapy/ shampoo accord and with a tart peach not too different from the one in NRFH EDP. There’s also a hint of something fizzy lurking around in the base notes that I can’t quite pinpoint. It’s sweet but not overly so, although I could still see it being a bit much on warmer days.

To me this is a fruity, pear, vanilla, musky, mossy scent. It's slightly dank or stale? I owned a mini bottle of this as a tween and recently decided to buy a travel size to see if it would smell nostalgic. It is slightly nostalgic, but not as much as I was expecting. I love how it smells when you first spray: sweet, fruity, warm, a little creamy. I find the dry down to be oddly stale. I swear I can smell the moss throughout this, and it interacts with the fruit, vanilla, and musk in a way I'm not used to. I do kind of like it but will not wear it much.

My boyfriend smelled me spraying this and became obsessed with it. He has asked to borrow it several times. He even wears it just at home sometimes. I ended up giving him the travel size because he likes it better and I actually prefer the way it smells on him. Smells like cozy, sweet, worn clothes on him. He says it remind him of a vintage creamsicle smell.
Somehow this smells like champagne to me..not the sharp but more creamy kind...

Love at first smell😍It was 2012 and I went to the shopping center to buy a new bottle of Burberry Body and the shop assistant suggested me other scents and I fell in love with Burberry Classic for Women! My best friend said that it sounds like an old lady perfume on me))) but I ignored her perception and continued to wear my favourite perfume! And one day she asked: "Oh, what is that smell you are wearing?" I asked her why and she said it's pretty and pleasant and I answered that I wear the same perfume😁but new formula is nothing but a hint of what it was! My best friend presented me them in late 2019 and I thought she bought a fake one((( but I was lucky to buy a vintage version in the summer 2023: incredible, so warm, so rich and deep, my love😍nothing compares to this perfume, it's magical, the aura of it is so enjoyable!

I recognized this on a lady the other day. She was surprised that I knew what it was. She said she just bought a new bottle a few days before after not wearing it for 20 years. It's a comforting smell. It's a 90's vibe, but that's a good thing.

the drydown is VERY similar to All About Eve, which I really like, but I wish the opening notes were more prominent (except for the blackcurrant which smells great on paper, but once it touches my skin, it starts smelling like cat piss and stays that way for a solid hour). this is a little disappointing, but I still think this is a very nice perfume that just happens to not work with my skin too well. I can't see myself wearing this super often because trying to pretend I don't smell like cat piss for the first hour after spraying is not fun but I somehow still like it anyway and would love to smell this on someone who doesn't have this problem.

I picture a woodland nymph with flushed cheeks and a crown of moss. Winding her way barefoot through the forest, she visits taps on select trees to extract their gold syrup into her evergreen basket. She uses the syrup to make a magic pixie dust for enchanting anyone who wanders too far into the forest alone. Peaches & apricots on a bed of moss and evergreen.
Varsity jacket of the head cheerleader.

The original formulation from the late 90's was a wonderfully smooth warm peach and vanilla blend. Well blended quintessential English fragrance, Drydown was comforting and soft. Living in a northern climate, I've tended to prefer English houses, probably because the notes and blends are traditionally suited for colder climes,
I like this perfume, it's a sweet, cozy, kind of clean scent but if I spray too much it ends up reminding me of a public restroom that reeks of cheap air freshener.
Asked for Burberry Her for Christmas but got this instead and im actually delighted! It's very floral and fruity. Perfect for everyday use. Pairs amazingly with Cosmic by Kylie!

I have owned this fragrance since it came out and always have a bottle or two on deck in my collection. It is my signature fall/winter night out scent. It smells so elegant, warm and lush. I was shocked to see peach being a prominent note, because my nose doesn’t pick up the peach. This fragrance is so well blended I don’t even detect it. I have always received compliments on this fragrance, being told I smell classy, or sexy. I truly love this fragrance and will continue to wear it as long as I can! I have read that it has been reformulated and currently have two on order since my stash is gone. I hope it hasn’t changed much but will edit to mention my opinion if I find it to be different from what I have.

Oldie but a goodie. I forget about it sometimes, but just pulled it out and now it’s in my rotation again. It’s subtle, but more than a “my skin but better” scent. It’s a little fruity and a little cozy. Maybe slight boozy? Even the reformulation is worth it. Great value. Nostalgic scent. When you can’t smell it any longer, other people can.

somehow i don't think i have ever tried a burberry perfume. i have a vintage vial of this i am testing from. it opens softly fruity with some warmth from sandalwood and vanilla. it definitely smells familiar and i think it's quite pretty, back from the time when fruity florals were actually good. i get mostly peach/apricot/vanilla/sandalwood with some black currant and even less pear/apple which are just hinted at. a little cedar too. i totally remember this perfume from back then, or something similar so it's comforting in a nostalgic way. it's a bit sweet but i like it, i think it's cozy.

The vintage version is dense and the modern is airy. I used to wear this 15 years ago and while there's a noticable difference, it is still recognizable. Glad I stocked a few newer bottles, then stumbled upon a pure parfum, an old one. Smells fantastic. Jump if you find one.
I was gifted this 20 years ago and still have it pre- reformulation. Will have to smell it againp
This perfume is light, soft and fruity. It's perfect for family outings, or picnics, as the smell fits right in with the outdoors.

I never had the pleasure of smelling this before it was reformulated. However, this was a gift to me years ago and is still one of my favorite easy cozy comfort scents. It reminds me of being hugged by my mom, even though she didn’t wear this. I get apricot and something almost creamy caramel like? But not thick or heavy at all. Perfect scent on a fall sweater, it makes me think of how fall used to feel all the leaves and hugs from family. Classic.

Edit: For those who care Fancy Love by Jessica Simpson dries down to this exact scent. So if you don’t want to spend much there ya go.

Timeless scent, it smells like autumn to me. I plan on wearing this while I visit family in the East Coast of the US this year. I have just a tiny bottle but I am glad I picked it up at Marshalls some time ago. Not too strong and has a warm, cozy vibe to it. I like it a lot.

MY MOM HAD THIS AS A GIFT FOR 5 YEARS AND I DIDN’T KNOW!!!! it’s the 2019 batch and it’s so good. went to sephora to get it checked if it was original and yeah IT IS! the peach and apricot notes are exquisite. so glad that mom has her perfume and i’ll always cherish this as her scent.

I used to love this perfume , so comforting , honestly I never would have guessed it was peach and apricot . I just spotted a bottle at tj maxx and bought it . Something about it smells a little different. It’s almost fizzy or piney ? I got it ! It smells sharp like gin does at first until mellows out . It doesn’t smell as smooth as I remember. I now know why I love the Jessica Simpson fancy love ,because it always reminded me of this one ! I feel like this is a great at home comfy scent .

this used to be my mom's signature scent. because i have missed her a lot recently ( she is in heaven now) İ am considering to get one for myself if i can gather all my courage..to do so...

17 dec 2024 i got it!!! i need to tell you this: back in 90s it was so intense just one or two spray was enough for the whole day...4 sprays half an hour ago now it almost gone...

1 feb 2025- long story short sephora helped me change it with Light Blue by D&G. I am happy now and i was soooo disappointed with burberry. it is not what it smelled in 90s. it is just plastic now.

Fue compra a ciegas, me gustó mucho.
Su salida es muy alegre.. y el secado es muy sutil a vainilla cremosa,
Me parece que su secado es muy tierno y femenino.
Para mujeres con cierta madurez, porque no me parece gourmet. Empalagoso...
pero me da una nota a bombones.

I think I'm one of the rare people who likes the new formula the most. It's a soft perfume. I already think it is a delicate and sensitive smell due to its structure. It doesn't spread much, it doesn't nose hard. It's not disturbing. It's more like skin perfume, but I can smell it on my skin until the evening. It is vanilla musky soft feminine perfume. It is old perfume but actually it is really good one and never gets old I think. I really love and adore this one especially at rainy and cold weathers. Just take your sweater and smell bw then hug yourself. It is giving feminine self love cozy vibes to me 💛
Very peachy

The best version of this was called "Burberry's" spelled just that say. Not all upper. case letters. The box was cream and the bottom was the traditional red, cream, black and white Burberry plaid. When they changed the name to BURBERRY in all caps (somewhere around 2005) they changed the scent, but even then that reformulated version was way better than what they're shilling out nowadays...vapor water. It used to be much stronger. It was a peachy cedary mossy vanilla with an almost aquatic musk note, I think it must be some outlawed musk. Sometimes Another 13 reminds me of the base of Burberry minus the vanilla/amber.
Someone has to snuggle of fuck with you to smell this frsgrance or i cant smell at all but i love it anyways

I cannot smell the fruit at all, I'm getting the base notes and some jasmine. it's a fairly light scent, not my favourite but wearable since it isn't too strong. A little unpleasant over time. I dont think I'll be using this frequently. Definitely a more mature scent in my collection, which is probably why I'm not fond of it.

Second to my review below......
I have just bought myself another bottle of Woman as the picture online was of the pre-reformulated version.....the box is of the reformulated version but it says "made in Spain" on the bottom and not Germany!! My original bottle says France!!
Does anyone have any experience with the "made in Spain" version and how it compares to the pre-reformulated Woman?

My beloved peaches and cream snuggly scent.
I received a sample of this fragrance many years ago and fell in love the moment I dabbed some on my wrist and instantly bought a bottle! It is such a beautiful comforting, creamy, slightly fruity, musky, woody hug in a bottle! It feels like a cuddle from someone you love.

I have a pre-reformulated bottle with the stubby ridged cap! And I shall seek out another one to purchase too!

This opens with the most lovely mellow, fruity peach and dried apricot. Peach can sometimes be an iffy note for me, but here it is perfection. I don't notice any blackcurrant, but sometimes, depending on my body temperature, I can get a slight hint of tartness from the green apple. Jasmine is also not detectable for me.

The base notes are where this fragrance sings it's beautiful comforting Sonnet! The natural, unsweetened vanilla is heavenly (I am not the biggest fan of vanilla when it is too heavy and sweet, as it so often is in modern fragrances) the cedar and oak moss give it such a lovely slant, making this fragrance suitable for a man that is confident enough to pull this off, and the soft musk is what radiates the longest in this fragrance....the musk is what I can smell on my clothing 24 hours later....with just a whisper of the peach and the cedar and oak moss.

I will always have a bottle of this in my collection as it is so versatile and the comfort aspect of it makes it perfect for any season or mood. A truly stunning classic that smells as beautiful in 2024 as it did in the 90's. Simply timeless.
Lucky enough to have the old formula. Such a lovely warm fruity fragrance. Perfect for fall or a cool rainy day.

I had this perfume in highschool. It's the smoothest most comforting scent to me. It gives sitting in a Café in your softest sweater, during a rainstorm energy and its honestly addictive! Unfortunately they changed the formulation and now it only lasts about an hour. If you ever find a bottle of the og with the rounder cap, get it!!

This is a sweet, creamy, warm, cosy scent that envelops you like a comforting hug. It’s sweet but not juvenile and smells classy and elegant to me. I can really pick up the peach and vanilla notes in this. I saw a reviewer describe it as ‘melancholic vanilla’ which I think is a perfect description! It's like it gave me a strong sense of nostalgia for places I have never been and things I have never done; a past that I have never lived and memories I don't have. I think it's such a beautiful scent. The only downside is that it sits pretty close to the skin on me, which is a real shame, as I like my perfumes to project more.

I love this scent. It was the first perfume I ever got and I've worn it for over 20 years now. However, it doesn't last like it used too. I used to spray it on me and my clothes and I could smell it for days after on my clothes. But now, I don't know if they changed the formula, but I can barely smell it 2 hours later. I still love it but it doesn't last. Also, it is very creamy warm scent on me. I have never got anything fruity from it.

Omg this is indeed similar to Jessica Simpsons fancy love, wow
Great for layering

I miss the old and original version! It smelled like a golden baroque concert! Like a cosy theathre in a very happy night, with violins, cellos, red wine and a good company! A Bach's violin concert with someone you love to be with, to talk with... The scent of shared joy in a wonderful night, full of beauty. Elegance and cosiness in one fragrance: you're outside at night, in a classical theatre, yet you are home, feeling warm. Because you have who you love by your side... This perfume spoke about love... and taught how to share the beauties of life!

The new version is nothing like that though. Oh, Burberry 1995... you were my first perfume in life. You taught me so much. Good times! I'd wear you all my life if you still existed like before. Without you, I search for scents that remind me of those golden times you're with me.

I normally don’t review women perfumes, but this caught my attention..
This is more like a unisex fragrance with fruity notes like pear, apple, peach, apricots ..
This fragrance shall present you as a beautiful graceful lady who is kind, simple and cheerful.Unlike other girl fragrances which projects you like a female seductress .. or promiscuous girl sexually appealing ..

This one is completely an innocent fragrance which keeps you powdery fresh and adds warmth to your personality.

Wear this when some relatives or friends are coming to see you at your house ..

On my skin the cedar is very predominant, very sweet, woody, loud vanilla and a little powdery, i do not smell any pear or peach,this feels elegant and mature to me, I like it, but i don't see myself reaching for it in a daily basis, it feels like a ''special moment'' fragrance for me.

On fabric it's a little lighter, a little more fruity.
to me it smells much better than on my skin.

edit: turns out im wearing this every day since i got it, delicious!

OK people. After reading all the reviews, here is a quick tip to know if you're reviewing the old formula or the new one :

OLD SCHOOL ORIGINAL FORMULATION : the best Burberry women is the one in bottles with the low flat ridged caps like on the picture above, that comes in a pale, plain yellow box with a line of tartan/plaid at the bottom of the box only. The original says made in France on the box.

NEW REFORMULATION : the new reformulated version came out in 2020; it's the one with the tall and thin cap and the plaid covered box. That one says made in Germany on the box.

REVIEW OF THE ORIGINAL RIDGED CAP VERSION :
After years of wearing Burberry women, I still love it as much as I did the first day. The peach-vanilla-cedar-oakmoss combination is just beautiful, rich and juicy. The oakmoss is present and grounds the fullness of the perfume. It is stunning! It has a nice sweetness that comes from the fruits and vanilla but nothing caramel or cakey or anything baked goods, just a natural sweetness that doesn't overpower anything but plays nicely with the other notes.

Now because one person's "lightly sweet" is another person's overdose of sugar, I'll use my personnal Sweetness scale from 1 to 10 to put things in perspective, with Ralph Lauren Safari being bone dry and not sweet at all at a 1 and Lancôme La vie est belle being a gag inducing diabetes in a bottle level of sugar at a 10. Burberry women gets a 3.5-4 on my scale.

Longevity of the original is stellar, I get 8-12 hours without issue and the scent lingers on clothes for a long time with 4-7 sprays. I think anyone of any age could wear that one. Burberry women is sexy in a subtle and classy grown up way, like a woman with a messy bun wearing an oversized cream cashmere sweater that drops on one of her shoulders and showcases her clavicle. That woman knows that sexiness is about being comfortable in her own skin.

REVIEW OF THE NEW REFORMULATION : the richness, fullness and the juiciness of the peach is almost gone and the oakmoss is toned down to almost nothing, leaving the cedar note to be very present, making it a bit scratchy down the throat when you smell it. It's now more of a fruity green cedar perfume. People who have never smelled the original could actually like this a lot for what it now is. Lovely and wearable, very office safe fruity-woody perfume. Longevity of the reformulation is abysmal. I was lucky to get 3-4 hours out of this one on my skin.

FINAL THOUGHTS : original ridged cap bottle of Burberry women is stunning and very much worth hunting down on ebay for a reasonnable price (under 100$).

I don’t know if I got a reformulated version. But I hardly smell the fruity or vanilla. It’s very much a fresh, mossy and green scent. Well...maybe a bit of green apple.
Inoffensive, but nothing outstanding or unique. Perfect for the office.

I don't know why people are saying it's discontinued - it isn't! It is on Burberry's own website! £96 for 101ml though i cannot see the box pattern to see if they changed that packaging - if they have then the one i bought on Amazon is legit but literally has zero staying power. I sprayed it twice on the back of my hand and within an hour no smell at all!

Absolutely gutted they reformulated this and removed the oak moss so it has no staying power at all now! WHY do they have to make such changes?! Burberry still sell it on their website at £96 for 100ml! with the new longer lid but i bought one from Amazon and the box was also different (checkered) so i returned it as there are so many knock off's everywhere.
The original formula was lovely and strong and long lasting. Coty bought Burberry and I've a good mind to send them a stinking letter on behalf of all the ladies who love this original fragrance!
This is unfortunately reformulated. The new version with the long cylinder cap is a shadow of old rich formula. And it has very little staying power. RIP my lovely fragrance…

Its pretty and simple. It could be a firma perfum and is very versatil. Its a shame that only has few hours even on your clothes.

It smells like green apple and peaches with a hint of vanille. No. It does not smell like an apple pie. It does not smell gourmand is just kind of sweet.

my go-to fall fragrance! smells like a peach cobbler with vanilla but make it 90s ??

not exactly sure how to describe it but it truly is a beautiful scent!
Wore this to work today. Smells like a fresh, clean and soft woody vanilla. This would be a great signature scent, non-offensive and an easy reach.
Nice perfume. Smells classy. Could be a signature scent, as it has a distinct fragrance. Too bad it‘s also discontinued.

This perfume smells very fruity, has fun and bright vibes. It didn't last long on my skin, almost vanished within 2-3 hours. It might be reformulated. Its vanilla notes are very soft and lovely, not a risky buy.
Nobody is mentioning the distinct Vanilla - Peach Cake smell . Has this been R & R 'd ? (Ruined N' Reformulated) .
Peach and soft flowers, soft but long lasting, at least on my skin. Very feminine, elegant, classy, wonderful. Would i buy it again? Yes. Many times! I love it! Unique!

I don't know about other people. But on my skin you can feel the peach note, peach the fruit... but it disappears in the first 10 minutes and in the dry down you can only feel the sandalwood. For me a unisex fragrance. Does not last on skin. I would buy it again? NO

An extremely gentle, classic and elegant scent. It's not outstanding, but it's a safe choice when you want your body to smell good every day. Like a lady holding a cup of hot tea in her hand, walking around every ancient corner of London on a cold winter day.

This one is very feminine, soft and delicate. So delicate that I can only use it as a skin scent for bedtime.
It's beautiful but it lacks strength

Blind bought it - was cheap and I was sure it will be nice office smell.
Damn! it's fantastic. It's warm peach, moss and jasmine. It's cozy and sexy. Well blended and universal.
Smells like autumn to me, but I think you can pull this one all year round.
I am glad to have it and given the current trends in perfumery - it's really refreshing, yet it does not smell old or dated.
Love.
I received this as a gift 15 years ago and i didnt like it. To date iv smelt it once and it made me scrub it off. Ill continue looking at the bottle😬😬

I know quite a few women who wear this fragrance as signature scent for years and I can see why. It has that "something", it's not just a pleasant everyday scent. It's a sofisticated and versatile, interesting enough to make enjoyable company

This reminds me of those magazines in the 90s and 2000s that would have the perfume sample page that you could peel back and sniff. They all smelled the same to me lol. That’s what this remind me of, but in a good way. Very nostalgic for me because I would always rub my wrists on any sample I could find in any magazine. This is very crisp and refreshing with all those fruits in the opening combined with the jasmine. As it dries down, it warms up a bit once the vanilla and woods start to peek through. It’s a very classic, simple fragrance that can be worn year ‘round. Nothing special, but easy to reach for when you’re just running errands or when you don’t know what to wear.

This is all fruity cedar and moss to me. I love it on a crisp fall afternoon. I remember in my 20s my boss wore it and I thought it smelled too mature , but I rediscovered it in my 30s and bought a FS bottle. I love it to this day. Simple, clean and classic. Warm and crisp. To me it smells like autumn. I think that may be my personal associations …but what is scent if not personal.

This perfume has always been an easy, year round reach for me, especially in fall and winter. Reformulation ruined the longevity, which is heartbreaking since this once stayed around a good 10+ hours. I have lately taken to layering it with Reminiscence Patchouli Blanc, which is quite a stunning combination that I enjoy very much. They have a similar 5 hour longevity on me, but it’s gorgeous while they last.
Lady with a kick to it. Maybe the kick is all it has though.

I like the tartness of the fruit in this -- I think the green apple stands out for me. I'm getting some of the wood also, less so floral or vanilla, but I guess they're in the blend somewhere.
I was concerned when I saw the comparison to Fancy Love -- that one just doesn't work for me (I know lots of people are partial to it, but on me it's kind of flat with a salty undertone). But the Burberry has a lot more lift and so far no salt.
I do understand the idea this is somewhat shampoolike. I'm thinking pleasant and appropriate for any occasion, though more of a day fragrance than something for a night out.
Likeable.
Original Burberry is the absolute best
Extremely boring scent, sorry

Let me start off by saying that I'm a more is more kinda girl. To most people, this is not a clean girl scent, but it is to me. It smells like shampoo and clean hair. It's just barely enough to notice and an easy reach after a shower to keep feeling fresh. But that's it. It's shower fresh and nothing else. It's cute and clean and feminine. Nothing memorable in the least.

This was my first love, my first fragrance, back in 97. I don't get why some say this is mature, I wore this at 15-16, it was my signature scent for nearly 10 years. It was warm, fresh, fruity, and deep, an amazing scent. Very hard to describe, just delicious. It used to last up to 20 h on my skin, and forever on clothes and scarfs. Now, its a skin scent. Not sure if its my skin chemistry.
I went through many bottles, but my last one is not performing so well. I have moved on since 2006, I still miss this, but not sure I would buy it again, since its been reformulated.

Autumn in a bottle!

Thankfully no one I've ever known wore it and I'm able to form a clear understanding of it without my judgement being clouded by past memories as often is the case with perfumes from the past century. I have an interest in vintage perfumery as well and after smelling many simple and straightforward modern fruity-florals, it takes a bit to adjust to vintagies.

This is like nothing I've smelled before to be honest. I wouldn't necessarily call it mature, but it's heavy for sure. First time I tried wearing it I was a tad disappointed and washed it off after a couple hours but something made me want to go back to it anyway. There's just something tempting about it apart from the retro feeling.
It's very heavy on moss and cedar (or maybe musk, or both), so much so that at times it smells almost medicinal to me. Usually one of my pet peeves, here it's quite bearable. Peach and apricot are there, too, but they're bitter peaches and dried apricots, which is not to say that those notes smell bad - just not the way one would expect perhaps. I smell something akin to dry autumn leaves as well. Subtle vanilla note doesn't get to truly shine, although it barely evolves on my skin at all. I would say it's a woody fragrance with a touch of bitter fruit, yet it remains very feminine despite all that.

My personal feelings change from "I like it" to "it'll do" all the time as I wear it, I'll see how it goes from here on. Nevertheless even as a gourmand lover with a fragrant sweet tooth I can appreciate it. If I were to attach it to an image of a woman it would be a posh woman with a mean streak working in fashion industry.

Headache inducing. I don't understand why I can't like stronger fragrances, but I can't. Gifted so I just keep it in the lavatory as a toilet spray. Overpowering to me in a nauseating, vinyl smell way.
Still my fav from Burberry.

There's a common consensus that this is supposed to be similar to KVD Saint, one of my favorite discontinued perfumes, so I blind bought this yesterday to try. Unfortunately, I have to report the two are not at all similar. If you're looking for a Saint replacement, this is definitely not it.

This perfume reminds me a lot of my grandmother, someone who loves peach scents (my D&G The One was hers) and Burberry. Unfortunately, this is a little too mature for my tastes. I agree that this smells like a sophisticated older woman. Dry sweet peach and apricot with jasmine and some musky woods. This fragrance is extremely powdery to my nose and feels very unchanging with little variation. I feel like this is something I'd like to wear in 20 years, but for now I'm either going to return it or give it to my grandmother.
I like this fragrance. It gives the feeling of a composed and mature woman who always knows the right thing to do.

Soft and feminine. Safe every day perfume or signature scent. Lovely dry woody, musk with fruitiness that's not juicy or sticky sweet. Sweet jasmine doesn't overwhelm but just balances out the composition of the fragrance. Classic perfume that I will always have as part of my fragrance wardrobe.
Dry and sophisticated. Good for the office and lasts all day on my skin. An acquired taste.

""izLi12/29/22 01:08""

""I really don't get British perfume brands, among all those perfumes I've tried and owned, my least favorites are all British. (No offense)""

No offense taken. To the Brits, Burberry has been a bit of a joke since the 90's. Used to be a well revered heritage brand, now something naff we flog to tourists ( see also Penhaligon's, Jo Malone and the Cotswolds).

Also, made in France and Germany.
If you love Burberry but want something that lasts all day and has a similar woodsy/peach/amber theme try Ricina by V Canto. It's pricy but you can oftentimes find a good price online.

Burberry Women is pure joy. The warm peachy notes and woodsy cedar moss feel perfectly blissful when I spray and wear it. I just wish it had better longevity like it use to have and so I just keep a bottle in my purse at all times.

This became my signature scent, excellent balance between fruits, wood and vanilla. It is warm, soft and feminine, suitable also for summer. I didn't wear it in the 90s, but I decided to try it this year. I must have a big bottle, my bottle contains now 50 ml of this lovely juice. From fruits I get most apple but also peach.
Best scent from Burberry!

New bottle/packaging bought for a steal on FragranceNet. Wow!! First impression (<2 minutes) is a lovely one. This is very similar to Taylor by Taylor Swift (thank you to the astute reviewers and board members). Goodness, this is a great sweet peach with a kiss of florals. Candied in a way similar to Love Spell without being "too much." No weird crayon notes (sorry, Demeter Peach) in sight. We'll see how the drydown goes. Edited to add: I was genuinely having a hard time distinguishing this from Taylor on the drydown, aside from it being peach instead of apricot. I think it's lovely, and enjoy that it is lighter and a possible year-round scent.

I've noticed how Burberry is quite elegant but features a competitive array of juicy, youthful, sweet fruit notes. Examples: Sweet lime and candied almonds in Brit, MFK's Her featuring bubblegum strawberry, Blueberry and BR 540 type notes, strawberry milkshake vibes of Her Elixir, and the fruit-snack opening of Her EDT (green bottle-- sadly the drydown is not for me).

Recently purchased this and it smells amazing out of the bottle , but the performance is horrible! This does smell similar to fancy love, but fancy love has better performance! I prefer the actual scent of this over fancy love though. It's a bit creamier. I'm super bummed cause I really like it but the projection and longevity are very underwhelming!
Smells like the 90's, that was my first impression when I sprayed this.
I am selling my 100ml old bottle, pre reformulation, within UK only, £60
I love this scent!! 😍 Sandalwood, jasmine cuddly delicacy!! 🤩 I just can't get enough of it... ❣️

This fragrance was my signature back in highschool. The reformulation has diluted this so much that it's a ghost of its old self. Devastating, truly! The old formula was delicious and long lasting. All the lovely notes were strong and sustained. If you can imagine, this fragrance had a slight warmth and coziness that paired perfectly with the apple and peach. I got a bottle recently and it smelled crisp and watery without any of the depth and warmth. Not much like the version I bought in 2008 that lasted all day.

GOLDEN NECTAR in the FOREST...

Like jar peaches in a light syrup on a wooden serving board framed with wisps of forest. I've loved this scent since it came out, and I agree with MihelaN below that it's still lovely even after reformulation, only the performance is more moderate from what I remember. Signed by perfumer Michel Almairac, this beauty opens with a peachy-apricot burst that dries down into a sheer golden veil of soft woods and vanilla. With time, it's gotten a lot stronger. The woods are coming more forward now with that sweet peach-apricot on top. I love this a lot for some reason, although there's a simplicity here. Leaves an oily sheen on the skin that takes a few minutes for the sillage to wake up. It's the woods that make this a winner imo. Overall: Beautiful golden peach syrup & woods scent profile, and the moderate performance makes it versatile enough to wear any season. It's a longtime love for me, Enjoy!

Contrast to Fancy Love Jessica Simpson:
My first impression was that I'm smelling Burberry Women, and there are striking similarities, but these are different. Fancy Love has a faint sparkling quality and better performance. As with Burberry Women, overall I get a syrup-y apricot/peach, like jarred apricots & peaches in light syrup.

Update 02/08/25: Funny thing, when I sprayed this yesterday, after awhile I started to notice the oakmoss much more than I had before. I'm tempted to say this is the fly in the ointment as I have a love/hate relationship with oakmoss. Some people go crazy for it, but for me it's usually a challenge. Here I think oakmoss helps makes the scent what it is, fruity nectar with wisps of forest, but if I over-spray the oakmoss bothers me. Still love it, but next time I won't put as much on. Performance is gotten really good; it's still here on my hoodie the next day.

Batch No: 1211 (2021-07-30)

Still lovely, even after reformulation
A creamy vanilla peach
There is nothing bitter about it, just sweetness for many hours

After so many years I am still in love with it! ♥ I wear it more in the winter but it's good in the summer too; and every time i wear it, I am told from people that is smells wonderful and it also lasts a lot!

This was a great fragrance until about 2006 then it was reformulated. When it was released in the 90's as Burberry's for women it was rich and long lasting. Herbs, peach, jasmine, moss, woods, vanilla. It's a shadow of what it once was.

Take out the bitter smell, it would be a strong like.
Update: the notes made me think of fall, but I honestly think I like this one better in warmer weather.

Honestly, I'm not a fan. I just don't smell it, even when applied liberally. I find it has a very poor projection, it feels like a perfume that's just for me and only me, no one else is going to get a whiff because of how close it sits. Personally, I don't really find it that fruity, to me it just smells musty, dusty and dated. I could probably imagine my grandma wearing this, it doesn't feel fresh at all.
To be honest, if it actually had a good projection it would probably be toxic and would choke you out.
I feel like the notes are totally misleading, with a profile like that I would expect it to actually smell nice. Honestly disappointed and absolutely wouldn't buy from my own pocket.
Loved it at first. Now I feel like the fruity tones are gone and the powder and vanilla tones remain. Not quite right for me

I blind bought this perfume about a year ago, wore it a couple times to test it but I was disappointed. First, it wasn't fruity like I expected from the notes. Rather, it smelled boozy and bitter right from the opening. It's not a bad scent by any means, but it's not what I imagined after reading reviews raving about how it smells like peaches and cream.

After seeing my bottle gather dust for so long, I decided to give it another try, since my tastes have changed a lot over time. At first sniff I get a very sharp alcoholic blast, and what feels like the different notes in the perfume fighting for dominance. When it settles, everything becomes thankfully a lot more cohesive and enjoyable. Whoever said this gives academia vibes is completely spot on. It has a musty old book note from the musk and the cedar wood, which is more pleasant than it sounds. I still don't get any of the fruity top notes from this, but I get bourbon. (Probably what the other reviewers refer to as caramel)

While I do like BfW, wearing it gave me a massive headache around the 1 hour mark and I had to scrub it off, which is why I bumped it down to "dislike".

I'm still not sure how some of y'all think this is a light, crisp or fresh perfume? To me it's closer to the "cloying and heavy" side. I agree that it smells classy, but to me it smells like a warm boozy, musky, not-too-sweet woody-vanilla, which is enjoyable in it's own right but IMO too mature for me to wear (I'm 24). Not to mention, I don't want to risk a headache every time I wear it. It's also the first time I was anosmic to fruity notes, bummer.

5 Words - Crisp, light, apples, sweet, simple.

I’ve had my hands on this bottle for roughly 4 years now. I got it as birthday gift from my boyfriend. It’s perfect and compatible for everyday use.

I just tried & excitedly purchased this 1995 Burberry Women (BW) perfume release fragrance now, in Feb.2023, and I LOVE LOVE LOVE this scent. It is well blended - smooth and gorgeous - nothing sour ever, no bitterness or harshness ever, no fake fruity smells, no alcohol blast; it is a sweet perfume but definitely not sickeningly or juvenile-y sweet - it is softly sweet. Never loud or in anyone else's face (nose), so, very suitable for a work situation.

I have no clue what "sweet black currents" smell like in real life, so can't identify that as a stated top note, and also can't identify any of the other stated notes except nicely ripe peaches mixed with something divine (Sandalwood? Sweet Jasmine? Both together?) Then BW moves into a soft peachy & warm vanilla, with a soft creamy peachy vanilla powdery finish. Sometimes I think that I catch a whiff of caramel in the mix after worn for an hour or so - just beautiful. Gorgeous, in fact.
BUT very sadly, on me, Burberry Women has ZERO sillage & ZERO projection - to smell it on myself I have to continuously sniff my wrist, which I have been doing continuously every 5 minutes b/c I love this scent so much. This really disappoints me b/c I like perfumes that have at least some! projection & have at least some! sillage - both NADA for me. :(
On me this is strictly a skin scent, and surprisingly has decent longevity as a skin scent - 8-10 hours, but it needs to have much better projection for me to give it a 10 out of 10.

Given that i was a teenager in 2000' I always thought of 90' perfumes as mature, too serious, not my cup of tea. I never bothered to try one. I went to the store to try out something else, didn't find it that day, so I ended up randomly spraying stuff and sniffing. And then, BAM! The most divine smell ever! I couldn't believe it was Burberry. It's so different than today's generic designers. And just the right amount of sweet for me. I tried it one more time in store and bought a 100ml bottle straight away.
This could totally be my signature scent!
Can't believe the years I wasted not knowing about this beauty.
Can't really pick out the notes... It's fruity, sweet and fresh in the same time. I imagine the best time for it would be spring, but I will use it all year round.
Can't say about projection, but longevity is pretty good on me.
The price is a joke comparing to the beauty of this.
10/10 from me

This is my second Burberry perfume, I also own Touch, both have dissatisfied me due to sillage and longevity, their projection is very low. For an expensive brand as this I expected more, better quality. The scent is nice is fruity, I can definitely smell the peach and I love that, it just bothers me that the only way I get to smell it is by putting my nose close to the area I sprayed , if not I don’t smell it, NADA…
I remember stealing this from my mother; she seldom used it anyway.. this smells creamy and vanilla on my skin. I loved it so much.

This and Noa by Cacharel = 90’s naivity / internetlessness / walkmans and tapes / a certain and psychosocially objective kind of purity / a time where there was wonder for the present and faith in the future.

Just blind bought this at Costco. Knowing I went through a bottle of Jessica Simpson Fancy love and loved it as an everyday scent , I figured I’d give it a try. I think Burberry is not as sparkles champagne as fancy when it opens. I’m hoping this will last longer than Fancy Love as I love the scent. Not sure about the dry down it’s going a bit
Sour on me, maybe the moss? I don’t smell the vanilla, usually you get that a bit more on dry down. Perhaps it’s because it’s blended well? I don't smell musk either which is good because I don’t like strong musk scents. Over all I think I prefer Jessica S Fancy Love instead, as it so pleasant from opening middle and dry down.

Very nice smell, suitable for whole year. It lasts long, but in me feeling it's a skin scent and the smell is not really intense. Anyway, I will be using it with a pleasure because I love sweet powdery scents! It's powdery citrucy sweet just like Moschino Funny. Great blindbuy

I don’t think I will ever get sick of this perfume. It is a fruity fragrance but it’s not a typical one, it’s quite unusual. I could pick this on anyone at any time it’s a distinct scent. It sweet in a juicy kind of way. Performance is EXCELLENT and you will be able to smell yourself all day

I prefer the old cap (the one in the pic), not sure why they changed it.

One of the best scents on the market.

I really don't get British perfume brands, among all those perfumes I've tried and owned, my least favorites are all British. (No offense). This perfume is said to have a vanilla and sweet note, but when you don't get the warmth in these two scents, it doesn't do the job. That's why I can only wear this in winter. If I wear this in summer, it has a noticeable disconnect with the warm/hot feeling of summer.

This smells like a slightly bitter peach with fresh cream. Is sweet and powdery but is very soft. I personally love this, for all its elements i think this is free spirited and elegant. I can picture Rachel Weisz in The Mummy wearing this. Smells grown and from the past, yet modern and cool. This is a historian, a librarian, a museum curator, an archeologist or somebody repairing a piece of art. The adult version of wanting to go on an adventure, but the only place you are going is the office. Probably best for day and any season which isn’t summer… but all in all one of those perfumes which will be there for you through thick and thin.
Will buy 💘💘💘💘

unexpectedly sad vanilla, bordering on somber. a warm, honeyed hollowness.

i ordinarily don't like amber-yellow fragrances, but this hits many of the right buttons: comforting, linear, remote... burberry is 25% mall scent, 35% academia (this is a woody vanilla intensely proximal to lignin, an efflorescence of old paper and senile professors), and 40% miss havisham–– a forlorn maiden in denial. stuffy, british elegance with a hint of gothic fiction.

the "yellow" in this is a sluggish, fossilizing amber with an appetite for crystalizing time itself. a bruise-yellow adjacent to putrefactive purple, rather than sunlight. comforting and surprisingly deep, befitting an old fashion house, indeed.

This wax my signature scent for over two decades, but alas the OG version made in France is next to impossible to find, and when you do, the chances that it’s not turned rancid are slim. I find the new version made in Germany with the slim cap is just meh. Very similar scent, but much more alcohol and way less depth. Performance is crap. It smells just similar enough to make me miss my favourite. If anyone can recommend a great comparable fragrance with the same depth and performance, I’d appreciate it. I’ve been searching for years.

I fell in love with the opening - sharp, maybe even aggressive compared to the soft, vanilla, musky scent it quickly turns into on my skin. I wish it was stronger but still love it - classy and cheeky at the same time, great every day smell for colder months.

This perfume made me fall in love with fragrances altogether. As the years go by I came to the realization that a lot of random perfumes in my collection are made by Almairac. This is a feminine, evergreen, office-friendly, gentle, warm, cozy, classy scent. It doesn't try too hard, nor does it have to. There's a good reason why it's still loved by many almost 30 years later.

I must have gotten a reformulation and not the original bottle because I didn't smell any vanilla(and the cap is different) . This was very citrusy, almost similar to JS Fancy Love which is soo pretty and cheaper.

It's a full circle and I came back to this one. This was one of my first few designer fragrances - the others used to be Hypnotic Poison and Poeme. Yes, the 2000s in urban India. I travelled, wandered and meandered - through many others . Happy to discover some , especially Baccarat Rouge, Roses Vanille, Gentle fluidity Gold, Angel's Share ,Sacred Wood ,Kenzo Amour , Lost Cherry..the list goes that way and from Lattafa like Oud Mood and Royal Blends. Treasure every one of them. But for some unknown reason I started getting drawn to pure florals , of late . Pure Poison and Gucci Bloom. And then the craving began for this classic. Rediscovered my past self.Light, breezy, soft , happy !!
You may think what you like :) but I sometimes layer this with Million Cpo from Al Haramain. Floating among Sugared apples Peaches and Jasmines of coolness and comfort. Blissful.
peaches&apricot with the best combination of other notes... it is a classy, feminine and happy fragrance. i may use other perfumes, and i love some of them, but nothing compares to this one.
I layer this with Commodity Magnolia for a fresh bedtime scent: soft, clean and peachy. Wish it were stronger- I'd wear it every day.

This is my signature scent. I remember when i was in grammar school my mom used to wear this and i thought it smelled bad. Few years later in my early twenties I fell in love with it and it is all a wore for some time. Today in my early 30s I still have it and its a staple. Ill always have this in my collection. Clean, fruity and powdery its the perfect everyday scent and can be worn all year around.

this smells like fresh, ripe peaches on me! i definitely do not have a refined nose so i can't say for sure what makes this smell so realistic to me but i think it might be the moss that keeps the scent 'green' on me. to me, it's like smelling a box of trader joe's peaches and i love it! i don't really smell any vanilla, which i don't mind. i probably have a reformulated bottle as this doesn't last longer than 5 hours on me. i'm okay with that since i got it for relatively cheap at marshall's. since this isn't too heavy on my skin, i feel like i could wear this year round. it makes me feel pretty and put together.

Forgot had this and found it in my closet today. Brings back so many memories. At first it smelled harsh, screechy and I thought it had turned rancid. Then after washing my hand, it bloomed into the familiar spiced peach scent I remember. Maybe it had turned or maybe my skin was too dry to hold the scent. Nothing else like it

i just got it after i bought it blindly but i am not sure if i like it. i will update later after more wearings. i thought i have never tested it before, but now i remember i did and i didn't like it and i can see why. i smell lots of bitterness and i am not able to understand where it is coming from. why is it so bitter? it is almost like i smell cypress or wormwood here. similar kind of bitterness i remember from Burberry Body series, they are all so bitter to me, From this one i expected very sweet and fruity scent because of pear and peach, these are usually sweet smelling to me, but i mostly get powder and bitterness and just a very small layer of vanilla. not to say it is bad, it is not, it is kind of interesting, i just expected something else. i will try it more times to see how i fee about it. autumn/winter scent definitely, but so not what i have imagined from the notes and from the reviews. this is newly bought but the bottle is old type like the one here so maybe it is the older one and maybe it is the oakmoss that gives that bitterness to me. the bottle looks very cute really in real life. i just really wanted to love, i thought about it for months and i was so sue i will love it, i just hope it will happen any time soon.
I feel like this is a unisex fragrance I've worn it before smells unique

This is peach and vanilla. The opening is a very sweet, youthful scent, which reminds me of a young lady in her early 20s. After about 1 hour the scent settles down to a strong, uninteresting vanilla note. It is excessively sweet for me and I almost feel like being surrounded by candy + vanilla cream cakes in a not well ventilated dessert bar... I think this perfume will be more refreshing if the jasmine and fruity notes such as green apple stand out more.

Very clean every day smell. I like it but i dont love it. On my skin it smell like the smell of an iceberg. Clean fresh air on the top of an iceberg.. Nice smell for a modern woman. As soon as i smelled it i thought that scent is the scent of a city girl.Very very elegant! Not really my taste . I bought it blind buy. A very put together young woman in her thirties can easily pull this off. Very nice clean smell for every day use.Everyone says is an autumn scent but i say is a spring type of perfume. If i could say a perfume for autumn season definately i would go for Halston classic not for burberry. Office friendly but according to me not smth special. Anyway im glad to have it in my collection.
smells like my bitch aunt

This perfume is like taking a big bite out of a fat, juicy peach. I also get some kind of spice in the middle notes, but I can't quite put my finger on it. Maybe a mixture of the moss and sandalwood. I do definitely get moss from this, which balances super well with the fruits.

I blind bought this on a whim and I'm so glad I did, especially after my disappointment in London. Gives me the desire to try other Burberry scents. This is perfect for day time.

Edit: ok wow so after wearing it for a whole day, I find this is a perfect everyday scent, not overpowering at all, it kind of fizzles out into a soft, powdery scent, musky and mossy. Unfortunately it doesn't last very long, like 2-3 hours until it becomes a very light skin scent. To me this fragrance would fit any woman 30+ perfectly. But I would also consider it to be a unisex fragrance, there isn't anything too feminine about it, it just is. I wish it lasted longer and was a bit stronger, then it would be perfect!

Feminine, understated & elegant. I'm a sucker for anything sandalwood and jasmine. I never registered the fruitier notes if I'm being completely honest. I think its better fitted for the more mature crowd but I cant help myself but love it. Super comforting smell thats intimate - whenever I put it on I feel like I'm putting on a soft wool scarf because its a bit windy outside. I can see myself going for this again in a couple of years :)

I get that the top notes are fruity, but for me that dissipates fairly quickly, giving way to a powdery, woody scent. It's certainly not a beast mode scent in terms of performance and sillage, so this would be a good office scent (honestly, I think of Burberry scents in general as appropriate office fragrances).
I use this for the office, or rainy days where I just want to smell this cozy fragrance on a sweater.
It's Rochas Femme without the cumin and cinnamon. Looking back, I see this as my baby step towards vintage oriental-chypres.

In my opinion when reading the scent description on this site, it says Burberry women is a fruity floral perfume. I do not think it is. It is more warm and calming and powdery sweet with a woodsy note to it. Upon first spray yes you do smell the apricot and peach but it is definitely mixed in with the warmer notes. It is a delightful calming comforting scent all together and very classy and memorable. It's actually just how I remembered it smelling like when I first discovered this in 2000. I noticed it lasts longer if you spray it on your clothes. There's just something yummy about this perfume.
This is the scent that got me into fragrances, I love this. It smells like Christmas on me, Longevity and sillage is another story.

I'm on my second "vintage bottle" and all I can say is : PLEASE go and seek an older or USED bottle because the sellers on eBay and Amazon have no CLUE that collectors like the older formulas better on this one !
I can see a lot of the new reviews say "not as strong as it used to be". Well folks ; welcome to 2022: the year of crumbs and crumbling. I really love this and the original formula GETS BETTER WITH AGE ! 2 to 4 sprays lasts for MOST of a day (especially in hot weather) .

Oh the nostalgia! I just received my Burberry today. This one brings me back to the year 2000 when I first got this perfume. I love it! Still after all these years. I haven't owned a bottle since 2004. This scent takes me back and brings back memories. When I had this perfume, I had just met my husband. I sprayed it on right before he got home and he walked in the room and said, "Mmm something smells so good". I told him it was the perfume I wore back when we met and he said that was why he liked it so much. But anyway, it smells the way I remember. Only it seems like it's not quite as strong from what I remember either. But it also changed manufacturers so that might be why. Still smells the same and I am so glad I found it because I used to love this stuff!

Well I'm several decades late to the party on this one but I'm glad I found this! Burberry Woman is lovely! Reminds me of peaches with icecream. I might add that I own Vanille Insensee by Atelier and this seems like a softer version of it. I've only got a little 5ml sample of this right now, but will need a full-size soon. I love the way this fragrance softly wafts around me as I go about my day. Can't wait to see how this sweetheart performs in other seasons.
Update December 2022: I own a fullsize bottle of this now. And recently
had some Christmas shopping to do. It was a mild winter day here in Canada -6°Celsius. I wore this...sprayed it liberally on me. On my way to my car a woman walking behind me asked me what perfume I was wearing because I smelled really good. That made my day!
I pretty much only get the mid notes. It strikes me as a "shampoo floral", kind of even has a bit of similarity with tearless baby shampoo. It's not bad, certainly smells clean, but I wouldn't buy it

I would be curious as to whether any of you ladies out there who tend to dislike florals in general make an exception for this one as I do.

I was one of the first in my set to ditch things like Anais Anais and jump on the unisex frag bandwagon of the early 90s... although I did Dior's Eau Sauvage as I found CK One too soapy. Eau Sauvage ushered in for me a lifelong devotion to the unisex citrus; it's my winter frag in that vein, while Goutal's Eau D'Hadrien is my summer. I also have a few other eaux, a chypre or two, and a bottle of Arpege that I keep so I can occasionally smell like my Nana. No matter how much I might enjoy florals on other folks or how much fun I have trying them on at Bloomingdale's, I always come to the conclusion that they are not for me and end up regretting purchases and giving them away. Other florals would enter my life courtesy of a beloved uncle who would purchase bottles for the ladies in the family every Christmas. We would pass them around and sample and trade. I must have sampled at least fifty bottles of florals that way over the years! Generally speaking, I would let them go to someone else, though, knowing that I'd eventually find them too sweet, too overpowering, or too allergenic (I am allergic to about 80 percent of scents I sample as well as to fragrances in many household cleaning and personal care products).

One Christmas in the mid aughts, I claimed a bottle of Burberry Woman in the annual Christmas smell and swap. I figured eventually I would pitch it or give it away, but there was something in the initial spray that captivated me sufficiently to make it my own. I've gone through five bottles since!

Why does my olfactory apparatus make an exception for this one? I've no idea. I smell fresh peach and vanilla immediately upon initial spray, then the cedar and sandalwood emerge for a warm woody accord. Vanilla persists into the drydown after the "papery" smell dissipates and blends with an emerging musk. I don't quite get the green apple, and I do smell a hint of the jasmine, but fortunately not enough to trigger a major allergy attack. This fragrance gives me the overall impression of taking a luxury day off in the fall to visit a reasonably empty art museum, or perhaps arriving at work to find that everyone else took a sick day and I can get paperwork done while sipping a nice peach-vanilla herbal tea. It's quiet, feminine, non-allergenic, peace!

I'd welcome any recommendations from the board for other florals I might like, given that I generally don't like them on me and make an exception for this one.

I had a bottle in the 90s and I didn’t repurchase as I was going through a “fresh and citrus “phase.
I’m more open to any type of perfume now as long as I feel it’s nice scent for me. The small bottle fits nicely in my bag.
And I may pull it out every now and then. It’s a comforting scent.
Total blind buy…I like the scent…fruity, but also a little woody. Longetivity and sillage isn’t the greatest, but it makes a great after shower or bedtime scent. Smells fantastic in my hair.

OMG! I am in love deliciousness fruity peachy sweet heavenly perfume, I had no idea this was a blind buy. Perfect for the office the scent would not offend anyone one single spray lasted on me 7 hours. I will buy again.
Buy a vintage bottle or a tester !

I really want to like this, and perhaps I haven’t been particularly patient with it yet, or maybe this is not the season it wants to shine for me?
There’s a fuzziness to the powder or the peach that my nose keeps trying to overcome.
It’s like when you go to a farm stand and you see all these beautiful peaches- picked warm and waiting in baskets in the sun- the winds’ just right and it’s been a lovely day-
You choose your peach & pay- you can’t wait-
You rub it on your jeans- take a seat in the golden 4:30 sunlight- you take a bite….
And it’s chalky.
And that’s where it kinda sits for me right now
Like a frost in a peach’s youth rendered it deceptively chalky
It’s funny because it almost feels like a prankster little wood nymph laughing after making me choose the wrong peach-
And that makes me curious
I will come back when I discover how to make friends with this one.

(If it makes a difference: mine is a 2017 made in France… it looks like this picture with this cap)

Note For Myself: Apple Sandalwood Vanilla Musk

Such a great fragrance
I adore this perfume. It’s comforting like a raincoat. It’s fresh like the garden after the rain. It’s soft and understated. It’s my classic.

This was a blind buy. The peach is at the front! Very sweet peach. Cloying vanilla. A somewhat aged smell. I agree with someone here that referenced a sweaty toddler with cotton candy. I got this cos I like moss, and on me it doesn't come through at all sadly :-(
..

This fragrance was the warmth and tenderness of curling up with a book and fruit tea in a cedar cabin. The new formulation (or should I say gross dilution) is a ghost of its former glory. Pathetic really. Enough to make an all time lover feel devastated by loss. Scared to use my only remaining bottle because I'll never have it back.

Ah I got a recent one.. a shadow of it's former glory. Gutted. God I loved this, it's in my all time top five. I feel like wailing a flamenco mourning song AAIIIEEEEE NO ME ENCANTA EL NUEVO!! vuelve mi viejo mejor amigo, POR FAVOUR MI AMOR!!!! Or something. I'm not exactly fluent, obvs XD.

You know those type of scents that you have smelled once at one particular event in your life? This was the perfume. I also saw the notes first and I do like all of them. When I finally got it, meh. Not fresh but this perfume got released in '95. I'm a person who loves gourmand and floral/fruity perfumes, this is a different genre to those who are curious. I think I would have loved this if there weren't any moss. This is the perfume I would wear if I don't know what else to put.

I have Burberry For Women EDP 100ML

This was a blind purchase a gift from my mum. I do love everything Burberry so I expected class from this one.

The box is still on display in my bedroom as well as the perfume itself, because I really do like the classic Burberry box.

The perfume bottle itself is straight to the point. It's very simple looking with its dark colour and basic design.

As soon as the perfume is applied to the skin it becomes apparent that it's quite a complicated scent with a lot to think about. The most dominant tones are peachy, fruity, with pear notes. It has a dark undertone to it which I feel may be the sandalwood. The notes compliment eachother beautifully. It is a very autumnal vibe.

When first applied it is quite strong but quickly settles close to the skin. It is not a scent that could be picked up a few feet away but someone close to you would pick this up. I feel that it's subtle and classy.

This for me personally would be something I'd wear in the daytime in autumn. The longevity is not the best, completely dissipating after about 4 hours of wear for me. However the scent is so beautiful that I would take the time to reapply throughout the day for this one.

7/10

This is the essence of Fall. Burberry knows to bottle the scent of Fall like no one else.
Burberry for Women opens with apples. Fresh, juicy, raw apple, with the bit of astringency from the unpeeled fruit. This isn't what would be considered a gourmand in 2022 though. This apple is green and tart, and is as nature made it, with no added sugar. It's green, woody and earthy like the orchard where it grew. It's humid and mossy like a cloudy day. It's fresh like the wind announcing rain. And yet at the same time it's warm and cozy. Peaceful like a Fall day at home.

Peach dominant, sweet, powdery, floral backbone. I've been on a kick trying to find the perfect peach fragrance for myself and this is the best so far.

There's not much to say except it smells exactly as I expected it to with a hair of smokiness in the dry down that I didn't anticipate (I imagine that's coming from the cedar note?) I almost want to say there's oak moss in the dry down as well.

Really enjoyable. Womanly, work appropriate, sweet but mature, fruity but not BBW or VS like. Projection leaves a bit to be desired (becomes a skin scent after 2 hours) but it lasts a long time.
I have a near to full bottle of the original formulation (angular cap), EU area, buy or swap. Send a private message if you are interested. :)

this is an every day scent for me in the colder months, it's a very cozy scent. I find it in marshalls for super cheap and i love it. its definitely not for everyone as it can be almost a little too spicy but it's a vibe for me. if you're on the fence, just buy it, the price is wonderful and the scent is good for at the very least a fun night out.
I have a full 50ml bottle of this up for swap or sale, US only.

Let me say first that I had the original when it first came out. Unfortunately, I now have a reformulated bottle in my collection but I always search for the earlier bottles. It is such a shame because longevity sucks! Sorry but it does. I smell the peach and pear and green apple it’s so pretty. Great for daytime spring scent and I’m sure you can definitely wear this in the summer with it’s soft projection. Too bad because it is pretty! 5/10

Loud overripe peach, dirty diaper jasmine (to respond to herculano, I do not mean poop, more like an impolite funky indolic floral, maybe the smell of a sweaty toddler that just woke up from a nap, but not poop, maybe I can't really explain what I mean, I don't have an expert nose-) vanilla + cedar giving a weird plasticky doll-head note, pissy cassis, green lilac, and a smidge of musk & earthy moss to add depth to the sweet notes. Basically all my favorite stuff. Loved this since 2008 & gone through multiple bottles. New formulation not as mossy as the original, which is disappointing, but to be expected. Still a great frag. Likely no one in your circle is wearing this; to me this is important.

Update: I understand the comparison to Ghost Deep Night after seeing it in the 'reminds me of' section here; they open very similarly. But in 👻 (new formula) the rich fruity amber/musk opening quickly fades, and it leaves behind a forgettable floral scent, something like the reformulated Chloé.

Lancôme Poême was a first beloved perfume for me, and while different, it's in the same family with its peach, vanilla, and cedar. Also check out Guerlain Mitsouko and Rochas Femme if you're into scents such as this.
This was horrible on me, it had a cleaning agent smell that reminded me strongly of Dow Scrubbing Bubbles bathroom cleaner! This blind buy was given away to a friend.

To me, this is an ideal fall/winter fragrance. Warm, classy, comforting & beautiful. Opens with oranges & peach pie a la mode, which keeps the vanilla heart from being too heavy, dries down to a lovely mossy, woodsy scent.
